description:
I LOVED this place. I wanted to check out the Mission District for some of their world famous taco joints and this place did not disappoint. 

We sat at the bar and started out with an order of chips, guacamole and salsa. Delicious! The bartender was great and help us pick out our cocktails. We tried the La Botánica- volcán blanco, blackberry, thyme, lime and agave, and the La Penca Verde- el silencio mezcal, pineapple, green chartreuse, lime and agave. Both were delish, but La Botanica was my favorite! 

For food we did a four street tacos platter. We tried the Baja-style pacific cod, Pastrami taco, Traditional carnitas and the Skirt steak carne asada taco. All were so tasty, but the traditional carnitas and the skirt steak were the faves. I also love that they were served with four small dishes of salsas and onions. 

I hope to go back the next time I'm in SF!
author: Emily G.

description:
The most pitiful $12 salad I've ever seen. To top it off, the "dressing" was INCREDIBLY spicy (and I like spicy) and the consistency was far from a dressing. I had to basically spread it on the lettuce. 

I hope they make tacos better than salad.
author: Julia E.

description:
Place has lost its flair.
Presentation of food is great, but the food was greatly lacking in flavor.
I had the Guac Made To Order, consistency was good overall, but it was extremely tangy.
Four street tacos for $20; carnitas and beef, also lacking in flavor.
Margarita and Michelada ($2 extra for Modelo negro) to wash all of this down... Avoid these drinks as they do not know how to prepare them.

A few years ago this would've been a great goto spot, but not any more. Prices have gone up as well.
Chips and salsa are still free.
author: Aaron C.

description:
Don't believe the hostess here. They are playing you and constantly change the estimate of wait to lure you in. 

My waiting experience: I put my name for my party on the waiting list while I was a different bar. Our party arrived and I told the hostess that there was 5 of us. She told us 45 minutes. Then I mentioned that I actually forgot but we have already been on the waiting list via Yelp. Then she changed her answer to 1 hour. 1 hour passes and she tells us 5 minutes for our table to be cleaned. We end up waiting another 20 minutes. 

Food: the bar next door has way better quality meat and food. It is quite sad how Tacolicious represents themselves as a Hispanic restaurant but nothing about it is authentically Hispanic. Tacos are masked with sauce to hide how crappy the actual meat is.
author: Carleen C.

description:
Got four street tacos (2 chicken, 1 Baja fish, 1 mushroom $20) and a Bloody Maria ($12). Brunch tacos for one $40+ ouch. However...

Have you ever had a Bloody Maria with fresh juice? You'd know because it doesn't look like a typical Bloody Mary. It's orange. It's also [string of expletives deleted] delicious and I'd pay $12 for it any and every day of the week. This experience was worth it just to know where to get the solid Bloody Maria hookup. 

The tacos were delivered beautifully on a long plate with three sauces: chipotle, habanero, and a green avocado-y one, with pickled onions. Next time, it's three fish, one mushroom. The chicken needed a lot of sauce. The mushroom was phenomenal and the Baja fish was (while maybe a little over breaded) absolute happiness in my mouth. 

I sat at the bar. The bartender and my bar sitting neighbors were a lively bunch. Had a lovely experience. It's a lot, but it's a great spot I'm glad to have given a chance. Definitely will be back.
author: Mari H.

description:
You know that person that people in grade school told you not to like for whatever petty reason...

Then you have that person in a class or meet them somewhere and you're like ...Hey this person isn't that bad afterall...they're actually kind of cool. 

That's how I feel about Tacolicious after visiting for the first time. I didn't want to like it because it's a chain and it's not authentic food truck food that I so adore. 

But I must admit that it is pretty darn tasty. 

I had the carnitas and the baja style pacific cod tacos. Pricey at $4.95 a pop however. The chips and salsa however were solid and the service was above average as well. Not a huge meal but enough to get me to come back and try some other things as wel..

The world needs a San Francisco Taco ranking...so I'm here to provide my humble list/rankings. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top) is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. If you're curious, I have rankings for Boba, Bakeries and Ramen , Chicken and Waffles as well (random right?)  Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews.  I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.  

Rod's SF Taco Rankings:

1 El Gallo Giro Taco truck
2 Garajito
3 Belmar La Gallinita Meat Market
4 La Corneta
5 Chisme
6 El Norteno Taco Truck
7 Taqueria Los Mayas 
8 Tacolicious
9 Garaje
10 Taqueria Vallarta
11 Little Taqueria
12 La Taqueria
13 Taqueria Castillo
14 El Farolito
15 Pancho Villa Taqueria 
16 Taqueria el Buen Sabor
17 Panuchos
18 Taqueria Guadalajara
19 La Palma Mexicatessen
20 El Tonayense
21 Tropisueno
22 La Espiga de Oro
23 Papito Hayes
24 Tacos San Buena
25 Los Compadres Taco Truck
26 Cochinita Mayan Cuisine
27 El Taco Loco
28 Gordo Taqueria
29 Nick's Crispy Tacos

Below is my top 10 for the Bay Area in case you were curious.
1 El Gallo Giro Taco truck
2 El Jaliciense
3 Taqueria Sinaloa
4 Garajito
5 Belmar La Gallinita Meat Market
6 Belly
7 La Corneta
8 Chisme
9 El Norteno Taco Truck
10 Taqueria Los Mayas
author: Rod M.

description:
Let's cut to the chase. Their beef braised taco deserves a shiny gold trophy. It's so tender and juicy, I tried to catch the drippings of the meat  before it fell down to my chin but it was impossible. My napkin did not do justice for my lips, hands, chin, and of course my sway pants. 

However, I did manage to finish my 4 tacos the three sauces provided on the side.

Last, the agave shots I read on their menu, after contemplating it sounded appealing so I gave it a try. My all time favorite hint of dark chocolate vanilla and cinnamon. Really smooth! 

Then the other two flavors Bazooka Bubble (a little bit stronger) 

The last one is mostly fresh herbs and mints with crystal sweet agave.
author: Elijajuan F.

description:
Pastrami Tacos. They are $5 each but sooo good! 
I did some research on "Pete's Pastrami" because I couldn't believe how good it was. Apparently Pete is "Peter Temkin (the man behind Foreign Cinema's charcuterie), and his method includes brining brisket for two weeks, rubbing it down with pepper and coriander, and smoking it with fruit woods." (Found this in a 7x7 article) 

Service: I've been to this Tacolicious location twice - both on weekends for lunch. They have been busy both times, and both times service was painfully slow. This is based on wait time from being seated to greeted by server (over 5 mins), asking the bussers for water and chips after 5 mins w/o service, then drinks come out with the food because the bar is slammed too. Then getting the check is another whole process. Server was nice/friendly but that's not enough to make up for the wait times. Adding another bartender and server during peak times would fix this. 

But you come here for the food and drinks. And the drinks are on point with a huge tequila collection. Overall, there are much less expensive taco joints in the Mission, but if you want to treat yourself to upscale/gourmet/$$ Mexican food, this is where to do it.
author: Eric N.

description:
Came here Thursday June 6, 2018 about 3:00pm and say at the bar. I really wanted to like this place because I just moved to the city from Los Angeles.

The reason for the 2 stars (I was debating between 1 or 2 stars)

PROS:
- tasty trio dip with chips
- margaritas were tasty
- pastrami taco was F$&@ing amazing!!
- older gentleman that played "hostess" was super nice and tried to find a shady spot outside. There wasn't one so we took 2 spots at the bar. Totally fine, it wasn't packed at all

CONS:
- bartender sucked--we had 1 drink because the entire hour we were there she didn't ask if we wanted another because she was too busy taking shots herself and socializing with co-workers and some dude at the bar
- bartender had an attitude like she was annoyed we were even there. Sorry u had a rough day and took it out on us. 
- chicken taco was awful, pure salt
- don't know where the name of the restaurant was hiding outside
author: Krystal A.

description:
Good tacos.  We had carnitas, fish, and pastrami.  The carnitas and pastrami were better than the fish - which was a bit bland.  We also had the queso dip.  It was ok - but would have preferred some spicy kick to it.
Lots of choices in the Mission district for "tacos and burritos".  We probably won't rush back to this one.
author: Lewis C.

description:
Tacolicious is a super trendy Mexican spot. I came here on Cinco de Mayo but I'm assuming this place is always packed and always loud. This probably isn't the place for you if you want somewhere intimate and quiet. 

The service is a little slow but I'm assuming it's because it was so busy for Cinco de Mayo. 

The food though is excellent. In our group we had over 6 different tacos and every one was fantastic. We also got a pitcher of margaritas and it was delicious. I'm not a fan of super sweet margaritas and these were just the way I like them. 

I'll definitely be back to try out different flavors of tacos!
author: Matt M.

description:
I really liked this place. We came to this location today because it was Cinco de Mayo and there was a street festival outside so that was nice to enjoy while we waited. 

The inside is loud and busy so if you don't wanna stand that, I would go somewhere else. The margaritas are great! If you're gonna have more than 2, get a pitcher ($42) because it's a better deal. They give you free chips and salsa which is nice and not seen much at trendy upscale Mexican places so that's a plus if you like that sort of thing. 

We got the platter of 10 tacos and all chose 2-3 (includes carnitas, fried avocado, cod, Chile chicken, beef) and they were all so good; wonderful flavor and great size! The sauces they serve with them are very good as well. 

The service was slow and it did take a long time to eat but I'm not gonna hold that against them because it was a busy holiday and I get it for sure!
author: Bethany M.

description:
Had an marvelous time at Tacolicious! Was seated pretty quickly, and the tacos are super high quality and the location is a big plus.

Below are the tacos our group ate:
- baja-style pacific cod: great, light, enjoyable
- chicken chile verde: best taco I've had in a long time 
- fried avocado: very rich, and didn't feel like you were just eating avocado
- traditional carnitas: a little bit too much, a little oily but still good. didn't feel like traditional carnitas and more of like a fusion-upscale carnitas
- guajillo-braised beef: the beef was very dense and rich, and a very enjoyable taco

Overall, had a great time and would definitely come back when I'm in this area of SF.
author: Waleed S.

description:
3.5 stars

Pricey whitewashed, I mean, fusion tacos in the mission, BUT still a fun place to hang out for HH.  I'm just saying, it's not the kind of street tacos you'd expect from this hood

TACOS
Cod
Carnitas
Hanger steak

All pretty deli$h.  I'd come for the ambiance and yes tasty food, but not for cheap grubbing.
author: Lyn C.

description:
I came here with my folks for a quick lunch before continuing on. We lucked out with a table right away. There was quickly a wait behind us. 

The food was generally very good. Started with some delicious guacamole and salsas. The brussel sprouts were awesome. Had a bunch of tacos. I suggest 4. All pretty good, especially the carnitas. For dessert we had the churros with chocolate. Sooo good. Reasonably priced and delicious.
author: J. Karim A.

description:
3.5 STARS

I've been a bottomless pit lately. For our weekly office lunches, we get to choose from three restaurants. As long as we stay under $20, we can order from as many restaurants as we want. Last week, I decided to order from all three. Lunch part two came from Tacolicious. Our delivery order arrived via Caviar on Friday, January 26th around 12:15pm.

I got a Single Taco: Traditional Carnitas ($4.95). There was a good amount of meat for one lonely taco. But for the price, I would hope so. I did ask for a bunch of spicy salsa on the side as I adore my tacos with a sh*tload of salsa. I did find the texture of the carnitas a bit softer than I like. I prefer mine a little crispy as I like the taste and texture when it's finished and fried in hot oil. Otherwise, nice flavor overall.

I wasn't impressed with Tacolicious when I first went to the Marina location. The tacos seemed very Americanized to me at the time. (I like my taco truck tacos with lengua, cabeza, tripitas, etc.) Even though I won't find any offal here, Tacolicious has slowly been growing on me. When I'm in the mood for good, but slightly fancy tacos, they will do the trick!
author: Elena N.

description: Simply put, this restaurant is way overpriced and inauthentic. Came in here one night hoping to have a couple margaritas and shared chips with some friends. Spent $65 on 3 margaritas, chips, salsa, guacamole and queso- all of which tasted like it came out of a jar or can. The margaritas were OK but not worth $12-14. They also stop serving alcohol at midnight but the kitchen stays open until 1...not sure the reasoning behind that. Basically go to one of the other hundred Mexican restaurants in the neighborhood.
author: Cece J.

description: Tacos are my #1.  This place does a great job with a unique gourmet version of street tacos.   I had the Carne Asada and fried avocado.  Loved the avocado taco.  A bit pricey for tacos is my only complaint but they clearly do a great business. I'll be back.
author: R R.

description:
Nice restaurant but it was kinda dark and hard to see.  Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Drinks were amazing!  I had the Pasión and it has to be the best cocktail I've ever had!

The pozole was the best I've ever had, but I've only ever had it in Hawaii so anything would probably be better.  LoL.  We had 3 different tacos.  They were pretty good.  I didn't care much for the pastrami one.

The churros were the worst churros I've had.  Very oily and kinda soggy so they fell apart when you tried to grab it and waaaaaaaaay too much sugar on it.  Maybe it was late and the oil was not hot enough or something.
author: Ayshen T.

description:
I think its difficult, because living in San Diego, I have high expectations for Mexican food... But we came here on a Monday night and it is nice that they make the waitlist available on Yelp. The service was ok... we didn't see much of our waitress, but she did check on us once or twice through out the night. The food is what I was most disappointed about.... the flavors were really flat in the tacos, everything tasted really dry, the chips tasted stale, and the guacamole didn't taste like they used many avocados.... The one thing I can appreciate is the veggie taco options but even the fried avocado needed salt and the mushroom one was really dry...
Oh and the worst part was finding a bug crawling on the table mid way through dinner. I had trouble catching and killing it, but I am really hoping it was only a cricket  but even so it was really a gross part of the overall experience.
author: Karen G.

description:
***Strollers take note: there's room for you here, complete with ramp access and even a changing station in the bathroom!***

Stumbled upon this little gem while strolling the streets of the Mission. The smell of food lured us in, and the great customer service made us stay. So many choices, for both carnivores and herbivores alike! I especially like the tequila pairings. If I wasn't nursing, I would totally partake (and yet another reason for me to check this place out again).

Overall, the food was pretty delicious. I think the salsa/queso/guac was one of my favorites, along with veggie taco and hot sauce trio, which you can pair with any of your tacos. This place serves family-style, so everything comes out with sharing in mind (which is great for those wanting to indulge without packing on the pounds). The drinks are also pretty good, and they can make some pretty awesome non-alcoholic drinks as well.

We also ordered the churros however weren't particularly impressed with them (I'm used to churros from Costa Rica). The chocolate sauce that was paired with it was a bit bitter and not to my liking, and we actually thought it tasted burnt until the waitress explained the smoky flavor was on purchase (and still took it off our bill because we weren't satisfied- talk about awesome customer service!!)

I love that this place is great for a group of friends or family night out (for those with children that are a little older or wee babies that love to spend their days sleeping away). Take note that this isn't the best place if you have a light sleeper, so be forewarned!
author: Tracy T.

description: Los tacos no son buenos aquí.  it's a no Gino place.  If you are looking for good California tacos.  Aqui es not good.
author: Joshua V.

description:
The menu keeps changing and not for the better. Gone are the days when there were yummy, served warm alternative starter items to tacos you could order like empanadas.

And whatever happened to the marvelous chorizo and potato taco?!

Today decided I will likely never come back here after having the greasiest batch of tacos I've had in my life; gross. No joke, 3 tacos - chile verde which should not be greasy, carnitas and carne asada and my plate was swimming in it. Rivers of grease came out of each taco when tipped downwards...clearly they did not drain the meat before plating. My stomach burped pretty much the rest of the day from too much grease and I don't even usually have a heartburn issue.

It seems strange to me that a Tacolicious would do so well in the Mission when there are so many better tacos spots for less in the hood. The margaritas are a draw, maybe business lunch meetings and date nights must be keeping them busy. It's rather disappointing the food quality having gone down at Tacolicious over the years. Support one of the smaller family-run taquerias by real Mexicans and then pop into a local bar like Casanova for margaritas instead!
author: Alita M.

description:
The last two times I stopped by during non peak hours the service was pretty terrible. The food is still great but I won't waste my time to be treated like I am bothering the servers here - there are so many places to eat in SF it's not even worth the time.

A quote from our server last week:

"Do you want to order anything from the happy hour menu ? I need to put it in now." Completely monotone and annoyed that he had to even be in our vicinity. Would it have killed him to say, "Hey guys can I get you anything else today - happy hour is just about over." We had been waiting to order but he didn't ever come back to ask until that point. We had already ordered dip + drinks, and had our chips refilled by someone else because that's how long he was away.

As if that wasn't bad enough, instead of stopping to ask how our food was he would just come and stand at our table and stare at one of us.

I realize it's pretty common for servers to dislike happy hour and the patrons who participate but it's literally your only job to serve the customer and be kind - get over yourselves or get a new job. I'm a generous tipper when it's deserved but not when treated as if I'm a problem in your afternoon.

A side note, they changed the salsa recipe in the last month according to my very rude server who didn't care to elaborate on the topic. It's less sweet, just okay tasting.
author: Penny H.

description:
In a nutshell: tacos were tasty, ambiance is hip (great for a nugget out with friends) and prices are slightly in the higher side, but not terrible. 

[The restaurant] 
I came here with some of my roomies to grab some dinner and to check out the Mission nightlife before heading back home to LA for the weekend. 
We came by here, based on a recommendation. It was pretty busy, but they have both indoor and outdoor seating. The outdoor seating area has heat lamps. 

The vibe is pretty chill and service was friendly. They give some bomb complimentary chips and salsa. The spicy salsa is spicy and very yellow!

[The food] 
Tacos: we got the 10 tacos for 40 bucks. Not bad. They had ample amounts of meat and a double corn tortilla, so in essence they were extremely filling. 
I got this pineapple coconut drink and it was pretty refreshing. (Non-alcoholic) since the last thing I would want would be to puke on the bus ride back to LA...haha... 

Overall, I thought this place was pretty good, but there are also so many different food places in Mission. I can't wait to try them all!
author: Emily T.

description:
Decided to try this spot out after it was referred to by a friend on Taco Tuesday. 

Pretty hip / lively neighborhood . Street parking only. As anywhere in the city, parking can be tough. We parked a few blocks down but it was a nice walk pass the other bars, jazz spots and other people walking. 

On a Tuesday night , it was relatively busy. Checked in with the hostess who said it would take about 25mins. Outdoor seating is available , however already closed by the time we got there. 

Very nice vibe inside. Low lit , high table seating with bar counter seating available as well. Good selections on the menu. Decided to go with the assorted taco plate of choice . Very good tacos, very filling but a little expensive TBH. Not your average street taco price but still good. 

I also ordered a horchata to drink and it was very refreshing a delicious ! 

Service was good and professional . 

Overall good experience , good tacos, very hip , chill vibes , a bit expensive for tacos.
author: Eddy P.

description: This is one of our favorite restaurants in SF and the one in the Mission is the best. It's a great place for brunch, lunch or dinner. The tacos are super fresh and delicious, not to mention the 154 different kinds of tequila!  This is s great place to bring the kids, too. We even brought a group of 10 kids here after soccer practice!  They have a great back room for a private party.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
So I just realized I mistakenly reviewed this location the last time I went to Tacolicious instead of the one I actually visited - which was the Chestnut Street location. 

Regardless, this location was just as amazing, if not more. I had been craving these tacos for what seemed like ages. I visit SF at least once a year but hadn't been to Tacolicious in about three. My aunt and uncle made it a point to take me here for lunch one day since I had been eagerly awaiting them. 

These tacos are some of the best tacos I've ever had in my life. And trust me, I've had a lot of them. I'm pretty big on tacos. They probably make up my top food group on my personal pyramid. 

We went on a random weekday for lunch and opted to sit outside since the weather was nice. They gave us complimentary salsa and chips which we devoured and we loved all the different kind of salsas. We also got an order of the guacamole which was delicious. 

I ordered the pasion as my drink because I remembered it from three years back at the chestnut street location. Just as delicious. 

For tacos, I ordered the baja fish and barbacoa taco - which was a special taco on their menu. OH MY GOD, they were just as heavenly as I remembered. The baja fish was perfectly crisp and the barbacoa was so tender and flavorful. I loved these tacos so much. I seriously wish they had Tacolicious in NYC, but it would be seriously detrimental to my healthy diet. 

I'm truly jealous of all SF dwellers because they have this gem of a place to chow down at. Go here and have a taco for me. I'll be daydreaming about them until my next visit...
author: Sargam B.

description: Try all the tacos... all the margaritas... 3 micheladas and you're done... great for a group and outdoor seating.
author: Nathan D.

description:
I came here with a group of 8 on a Saturday night and waited around 45 minutes for a table. The ambiance in the restaurant is nice but a bit too dim for my liking. Parking could be a bit hard especially around dinner time. 

We shared 20 soft shell tacos, 6 hard shell tacos, and 2 orders of guacamole. We got a variation of the chicken, beef, pork, and fish tacos. They were all STUFFED with meat. I'm glad because they were pretty pricy anyways... My personal favorite was the beef. I felt like the chicken lacked flavor, but I just added some salsa to give it a bit of a kick. The hard shell tacos were okay. I prefer to eat them at the end because I don't like shells that are too crunchy. The guacamole was good. I think it only had avocados, onions and salt in it. Very simple. 

We were all super stuffed by the end! I would come here again only if I want a nice ambiance and tacos!
author: Joyce S.

description: Came here for a quick solo bite to eat. Service is horrible here. I was one person and ordered chips and guacamole. I wanted to order one taco afterwards, took about 20/30 min for someone to even come and ask if anything is needed. I got up at one point asked the greeter in the front if anyone is available. It was a slower morning, wasn't super busy and service shouldn't be like this. It took another 15 min for my bill to come. I won't be coming back.
author: Nessa H.

description: Ok so I previously posted a review that wasn't so nice. I was just frustrated with the customer service and wait time on the food. I do acknowledge that I probably caught them on a bad day.Someone  from the team reached out to me and that made all the difference. It really shows how much they actually care about their customers. I will definitely be going back soon!
author: Sammy V.

description:
Tacolicious is as hip & trendy as they come. Cool decor, dim lighting, good music, and lots of people. Really liked the space, just wished the food and service lived up as well.

Friday night and at 7pm there was a 30-45 minute wait. Decided to wait at the bar and grab drinks and appetizers. Decided on the grapefruit margarita and it was delicious! Split amongst 2 people, it was more than enough and around $42. We saw everyone was getting chips and salsa and after 15 minutes of not getting them we kindly asked our bartender for them but had to ask another time about 10 minutes later. I guess it was worth the wait since they were some damn good chips and salsa. Also got rice and beans (re fried) which were so good but overpriced.

Once our table finally opened up we tried to close out and it took our bartender quite some time to do so. We didn't mind waiting, but he snapped at us when asked him the first time saying "when I have some time". Oh....

Anyways, we moved on to the main course of the meal which was the tacos!!!! $42 for 10 tacos, not toooooo shabby of a deal. They have great vegetarian options!!! My favorite taco was the fish tacos and it came with some pickled onion on the side. The avocado would've been a top contender but holy cow was that spicy. It was DOUSED in chili powder. The top of it was bright red from all that seasoning. I legit could not breathe for a second after eating it.  

Overall Impression: I think I'd definitely return for a hang out spot and margarita carafes before a night of going out. I'll be asking for very easy on the chili powder next time lol
author: Courtney N.

description:
This place was fun! Came here on a Tuesday night and there's definitely a fun/cool vibe, 90% packed which is perfect (crowded but not too much!).

Got the queso and guac. And many rounds of sangria.

Service was good. I'll definitely be back for HH again!
author: Cal C.

description: A good outing is a visit to Dandelion chocolate and a stop at Tacalicious. They have outside seating which is nice. Got the special bacon chorizo which came with 3 sauces varying spice level which was good. Kale salad was good too. This is a nice hipster spot.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Came here on 8pm on a Thursday night, we ended up eating at the bar because the restaurant was so packed.  This restaurant is a chain so they have a few other locations in the bay area now. 

The bartender is super friendly, and explained the menu to us well. We ordered 4 tacos, the queso dip, an horchata and a spicy margarita.  

Drinks came out super fast since we were sitting at the bar, the tacos took about 10 min to come.  Free chips and salsa, although they werent that good at refilling chips.  The tacos were so good!!!! I dont really eat tacos, but the meat was so well seasoned and delicious.  My favorite was the mushroom, and the carnitas taco. 

The queso was chunky and thick, very cheesey and had a great home made quality. I forgot to take this to go, we had so much left.  Prices are higher than average but rents are high.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
Our waitress literally yelled at us today. Never experienced anything like it. I get it was crowded and she was probably overwhelmed but it felt terrible and ruined lunch. 

Please remember that taking stress out on customers has a ripple affect. Her stress became my stress... which then became my husbands' stress. We won't be back.
author: K T.

description: I give this place three stars because it's simply average. I do love that they give a free bowl of chips and salsa, but I don't see what the hype is about. There's many better places in SF for tacos to be honest.
author: Angela L.

description: Pretty decent taco options. Yummy house margarita that doesn't taste like nasty Walmart mixer. Prices not too bad considering we are in SF. My friends and I stopped in with our luggage, fresh off the air plane and weren't disappointed. Granted I do believe it's hard to mess up a taco. Also, the waitress was awesome. Took her time to write us a hotspot lust of places in Oakland, abd talked us into churros... very good as well.
author: A A.

description: Nice place to hang out very welcoming but it can get crowded so come early. The tacos are good I chose several to feel my way around but the chips and salsa OMG it was so on point we had two servings.  I did have one concern where I saw one of the servers wipe his face and nose and kept serving. We did mention it to one of the managers where he said he would talk to him. Otherwise the place have a great vibe and I may revisit but hopefully the wash their hand after touching their faces.
author: RICHARD J.

description: Tacolicious was the first place my boyfriend and I ate the first time either of us had ever been in California, thanks to my friend's recommendation. We were so grateful for the recommendation, because, omg, the food was terrific! We arrived during happy hour, so of course we had to try some of the food on the happy hour menu, and we were not disappointed. We both ordered the house margarita, and it was better than most house margaritas I've had before! We also ordered the Holy Trinity (chile queso, guacamole, and refried bean dip).. all 3 were heavenly! My boyfriend ordered the clown tacos which were to die for  I had a fried avocado taco and a mushroom taco; both were super tasty and unique. We brought our dog, and she loved the outside porch area. The staff was very welcoming, and the vibe was really fun and relaxed. If we lived in San Fransisco, this would be one of our go to's!!
author: Danielle L.

description: Staff really good. Late night. Great vibe. Good music. Noisy. Tasty tacos but expensive. Salsa and chips great. Chips can be better.
author: Arjan N.

description:
Customer service needs work. Food was TASTY and fresh, but no spice- even with hot sauce.

Customer service severely lacking. Wasn't seated or greeted and when they finally came to us, they ask us to move. I get it the menus are already on the table, but mentioning something special about the place or something would be nice. Had to flag down workers for EVERYTHING- menu question, ordering, requesting hot sauce, more water, the bill. Not once did they check back on us- or the 3 tables next to us. Oh yeah- the guy gave me an almost empty hot sauce when I asked for sauce. WTF? He saw me struggling to get the inkling left and didn't offer another one. Ugh! Only 1 girl was helpful and friendly- too bad I saw her only 1 time.

Food: pricier than tacos should be- but acceptable considering stiff is like humanely raised and all that. Had the lone star tacos. TASTY, very filling and not spicy at all (which makes it great for those who can't deal with any spicy at all like- like my mom). I put a TON of hot sauce- gave flavor but no spice :(
author: Sofia R.

description:
When did the quality of this place go downhill? I have come several times the past few years and now it seems like everything has changed for the worse. 

First off, this used to be my go-to place for a spicy margarita and the Pasion was my favorite; I always ordered it asking for it to be not too sweet and in a carafe so that I could share with several friends and we'd have a couple rounds. This past time, I asked not too sweet and the waiter was confused on how that could be made, nonetheless less he put in my order and it came out so wrong. It basically tasted like a screwdriver; all orange juice and no passion fruit, absolutely no spice, and one carafe only gave me and two of my friends one round - it would have been cheaper to order three drinks separately! If the taste wasn't bad enough, the value really drew the last straw. 

In terms of food, the menu seems to change items each time I go, so I can't count on there being something I wanted to try last time as still on the menu to order. They do keep some classics, but it's still annoying especially when it's not considered a produce-based seasonal item. I would consider coming back for food since what they do have is usually pretty food, but they have really disappointed me in the drink department.
author: Samira I.

description:
We went there for a work event. Here's the pros and cons:
Pros:
Ambience - awesome decor and location 
Guac, chips and salsa are super yummy!!
Horchata - my favorite !

Cons:
Service was a little rough- we asked for clean plates for the tacos since we used ours for apps and we were pointed to our dirty plates and then brought 2 plates for a group of 10
I ate the mushroom and fried avocado tacos they were okay
author: Diane G.

description:
Tacolicious has been one of my favorite places to visit for some time. Recently, I brought my cousin here as we saw their happy hour menu and wanted a drink and tacos. 

The hostess took us to a table towards the back and my cousin asked if we could be seated more towards the front instead due to those seats having a cushion on the bench vs no cushion where we were being directed to. Hostess told us no bc it was a table for 4. Then my cousin asked about another table in the same area, and again, "no bc it's for 4". Please note that they were set up for 4 people, but there were actually two tables that could be split to seat 2 different parties (of 2).

When asked why the tables couldn't be separated to accommodate our request due to wanting a more comfortable seat, hostess  was irritated and finally gave in. Meanwhile, our to-be server came over during half the exchange and just watched the last bit of this. My cousin was literally asking for comfort and being in the restaurant industry herself,  was very confused as to why the hostess was making her request so difficult and didn't care to be accommodating, especially after saying that her back was bothering her and the non-cushioned seats would make it worse. 

Well long story short, our server couldn't have been more rude. We had absolutely no qualms with her (and actually, non with the hostess either - my cousin was just stating she didn't want to be uncomfortable). When I asked for straws, she rolled her eyes and gave us a fake smile. I was shocked especially since I'd been quiet throughout pretty much the whole time. She comes back HOLDING THE TIPS OF THE STRAWS in her fingers. She did not bother grabbing a napkin. That is disgusting bc I'm expected to put that in my mouth or in my drink? Then she forgot to add in an order because when we asked, she said it was coming and clearly it was not because it was an appetizer and we were already eating our main dishes. 

Now, at this point I thought she was being rude to only us because of what she saw earlier. That is until the couple next to me tried to get her attention and she rudely snapped back. The lady next to me looked at me shocked and I said, oh so apparently you are also having trouble getting good  service today? She and I then started talking about how crappy it feels to go to an overpriced taco joint and have to practically beg to be serviced. 

I did not care much for my drink, but it was happy hour and it's alcohol, so I drank it. The food was fine. But when you have a sour experience like this, it's difficult to enjoy your meal. I wanted to leave several times while seated and trying to enjoy my time with cousin. 

This is the last time I visit this place. It has unfortunately become overly pretentious for my taste. And it's always embarrassing to bring someone to a favorite spot just to be thoroughly disappointed.
author: Karen G.

description:
Have you heard of breakfast tacos? I haven't either until my friend brought me to Tacolicious. While the idea of breakfast tacos certainly sound interesting, I didn't find myself loving it. For breakfast/brunch, it was definitely too greasy for me. Two tacos come in an order, by the time I finished my first taco, the remaining tortilla was drenched in oil already, aye aye aye, no bueno. 

The horchata coffee was refreshing but (a bit) too sweet. I had to dilute mine with water. Not to mention it was $6! I get that coffee cost a lot in SF, but $6 for a creative coffee drink is a bit way too much. 

I do like the ambience tho and have been here for HH before (it's a good crowd). I'd come back for happy hour, but prob not for brunch or dinner.
author: Dana Z.

description:
I came here for holiday party where we hadprivate room in the back ranted out, and it was pretty great. 

I have heard many people say Tacolicious is the best Mexican food in San Francisco, i don't think its necessary true. Its not bad, don't get me wrong, but its not THE best either. I had vegetarian tacos since i don't eat meat, and i thought that it was pretty dry, it didn't really have amazing flavors but it wasn't bad.
I think Tacolicious has great margaritas, that was very delicious but their tacos were alright.

The spot is super loud, just an FYI and crowded. 
I gave 4 stars because i want to shoutout to people who work there. costumer service is amazing and very accommodating. They hear you and they want to please your needs, which i thought was amazing!
author: Galya T.

description: Loved the food, service was prompt and courteous. Everything you need on a Sunday morning!
author: Alina S.

description:
The last two times I stopped by during non peak hours the service was pretty terrible. The food is still great but I won't waste my time to be treated like I am bothering the servers here - there are so many places to eat in SF it's not even worth the time.

A quote from our server last week:

"Do you want to order anything from the happy hour menu ? I need to put it in now." Completely monotone and annoyed that he had to even be in our vicinity. Would it have killed him to say, "Hey guys can I get you anything else today - happy hour is just about over." We had been waiting to order but he didn't ever come back to ask until that point. We had already ordered dip + drinks, and had our chips refilled by someone else because that's how long he was away.

As if that wasn't bad enough, instead of stopping to ask how our food was he would just come and stand at our table and stare at one of us.

I realize it's pretty common for servers to dislike happy hour and the patrons who participate but it's literally your only job to serve the customer and be kind - get over yourselves or get a new job. I'm a generous tipper when it's deserved but not when treated as if I'm a problem in your afternoon.

A side note, they changed the salsa recipe in the last month according to my very rude server who didn't care to elaborate on the topic. It's less sweet, just okay tasting.
author: Britt C.

description:
Tacolicious is a good place to go for a quick flavorful bite when you are in either the Mission or outlying areas of SF.  Some consider it a chain; however, I see this location as a stand alone because of their service!  I typically sit at the bar which generally provides for the best way to get a quick drink and eats.
The special was beef cheek taco and it was worth the $5 for a single taco.  The meat was perfectly cooked and flavor was spot on!  Went with a co-worker and we both enjoyed the food and service which led us to ask ourselves "Why don't we come here more often?"
author: Aaron H.

description: Sooooooooooo good! The name of the place says enough...tacos that are delicious! There are a handful of locations around the city so you definitely check any of 'em out. I do love the one in the Mission though! I love the outdoor areas you can eat in. Grab a whole bunch of tacos and just dig the f' in.
author: Alicia C.

description:
Fish Tacooooo Fish Tacooooo !!! 
Well need less to say the Fish Taco is my favorite dish here !! 
*Atmosphere:  is low key low lighting gives off a chill vibe. 
*Full bar : has cocktail menu with specialty drinks and has fresh garnishes to go along with them. 
*Food: menu gives good selection of pork, steak , and fish with options on size ordering. The carnitas are bomb . Take it light on the yellow sauce cuz it gots a bite !!! 
*Service: service is good for the most part, got the best service sitting at the bar with the bartenders. My last time I got a seating by the door and felt kinda out of the way. 
One of my favorite SF mission taco shops frequent here when I need good drink and a good taco.
author: Salvador V.

description: Tried for the first time via door dash today. Prices are way too high for what you get. Thought I was ordering carne asada like the menu listed but it was actually a taco with 10 pieces of meat. Flan appeared way smaller than the pics and the caramel was too bitter.
author: Christina A.

description: Tacolicious makes me feel old. it might be the young hip clientele. It could be it's location in the heart of the Mission. I'm not sure, but still have s soft spot for this place, which is good because I'm just not sure how  I feel about pastrami tacos. Or taco labs. I guess I like things fairly traditional, at least when it comes to Mexican fare. When I first started coming here it was because everything was delicious AND they mixed it up (think really crazy margaritas/tequila cocktails and fried avocado tacos). But were not too far out there (at least from what I remember). There was always a mix of new and traditional and there were always offerings to keep meat eaters and vegetarians alike happy. That part (a spectrum of offerings) is still true. The potato taco looked incredibly delicious and my mushroom (and fried avocado!!!) were delicious. The y still make a fine margarita and the holy trinity dip sampler (with guacamole, chile con queso, and refried beans) is also very good. They do guacamole particularly well. I also like the house salsa. It's on the thicker side (which I love) and has a nice smoky flavor. Everything was fine and I enjoyed it, but nothing seems to stand out much anymore. I'm not sure I should fault them for not being as exciting as they used to be. On the upside, the service is pretty good (at least until you are ready to leave. It can take a while). They also get bonus points for good people watching. This is a good bet for happy hour with friends or a light bite when you happen to be nearby..
author: Nicole M.

description:
Service was great but prices are ridiculous 
$4.50 for a 2 bite taco, $44 for a pitcher of house margaritas - the wife and I went through 2 pitchers and only had a hint of a buzz afterwards

We only came here because Puerto Allegre down the street was closed
author: Bumble B.

description:
This place is BOMB.COM!

Seriously good eats right here!

The atmosphere is lively, and everything from the complimentary chips and salsa to the tacos and the sauces for the tacos are spot on! The taco is really spot on. I've been eating tacos pretty much every day this week and this is probably the best or next best taco I've had in the mission.

Also deserving of its own mention is the cauliflower carnitas, cauliflower that is grilled and then cooked in a thick pork sauce. It's warm, light, yet hearty and savory in a way that makes me want more.

This place is a little pricier for tacos but it's also a pretty nice spot to dine at. (They use premium napkins...haha) 

This place also gets very crowded most weekdays after work hours and on weekends.

Overall, I think it's an excellent spot and solid place to go to. It's on my list as a place I'd pretty much go to with with anyone visiting for food or drinks. It's also located in a great spot of town with tons of other food, bars, and dessert areas nearby.
author: Mike L.

description:
HOUSE MADE CORN TORTILLAS.

All ya need to know to check this place out.

 Being Hispanic, going to Mexican restaurants with store-bought flour/corn tortillas is a huge letdown. Sometimes you can find house made flour tortillas but finding house made CORN TORTILLAS is the most beautiful thing! 

I ordered hanger steak taco, nopales cojita cheese taco and the taco of the week (chorizo/bacon). The taco is wrapped in two freshly made/soft corn tortillas. The hanger steak taco is what you'd expect, hanger steak in a taco with some pickled onions. Nothing crazy but good-cooked hanger steak. The taco of the week was good as well. A lot going on with the flavors, very different with the hanger steak. My absolute favorite was the nopales and cojita cheese. I'm a huuuuuge fan of nopales and these didn't disappoint. The cojita cheese was fried and the nopales were wrapped in it. It was not what I was expecting but I was pleasantly surprised!

We went on cinco de mayo so there was a long wait so FYI if you plan on coming here. I'm sure on a normal day it's a bit more of a tolerable wait. Enjoy a margarita while to wait. 

I'm looking forward to coming back to try more tacos!
author: Marcie A.

description:
I do truly love this little gem of a restaurant. The food is delicious, unique, served pretty late at night and it's pretty. I'm also loving the soundtrack they always have playing. It's a great Saturday night vibe.
I'm a huge fan of the Baja fish tacos with cabbage. Just perfection. The chips could be on the menu all by themselves, they're that hot, crispy and delicious.
So why do I give them four stars? Because they only have one variety of white wine and they served it to me in a juice glass. Total experience killer as far as the wine goes. PLEASE invest in some stemwear and I'd happily give you another star!
author: Rachel L.

description: Great tacos and exceptional service. It is a bit overpriced but I would come back for the quality and the service. The beers and cocktails are also very good.
author: Reham B.

description:
Shout out to our waitress - Nikki - perfect service and was too much fun - if I lived in your "hood" I'd come by every day to have you cheer me up!

My first time here a few days ago and liked it ALOT.  Food was excellent and different - check out the humorous menu!  

Made to order quac was yum!  lovely fresh home made chips and a lovely not-too-hot salsa too.
We had the raw tuna tostadas - they look a bit odd but tasted REALLY good.
Califlower at pastor - super yum.
Roasted butternut squash tacos - also yum,

Excellent house margaritas and lucky us - we were there for happy hour!

A great place - check it out!
author: Tina O.

description:
Always excellent exotic tacos options - including many vegetarian ones! Tonight's fried avocado, tapas de papa and the asparagus and potatoes were tasty.
Kids friendly, especially on Mondays when they have their fundraising night. 
They have a nice side terrace with heaters, decorated by an impressive mural of the city skyline view from Dolores Park.
author: Pierre-Luc B.

description:
Pretty simple fellow Yelpers 
Ten Tacos = 10 reasons to run to this joint!!!
You'll understand when you see the menu!!
Did I mention great people watching?
author: Brad P.

description:
This is one of our favorite spots to snack at when we come up to SF. 
10 assorted tacos and a pair of picante Margaritas hits the spot every time!
Friendly staff always happy to answer questions & make fantastic suggestions. If you like tacos & great drink, this is a must try when your in the area. 

Also, they have a few different locations, so if your in the marina, mission, or even in Palo Alto, your covered. They also gave a taco stand on the pier near fisherman's warf
author: Andy K.

description: After 30 mins waiting I was just told that all the available seats were being kept empty because the kitchen couldn't keep up. Poor hostessing or kitchen? I don't know, but regardless of the food, I won't be eating here again.
author: Andrew B.

description:
Tacolicious is that trendy restaurant that screams SF. I actually enjoyed Tacolicious! It has a fun environment (although a bit loud inside) but a great place to grab dinner with friends. I loved the marina girl salad even though I'm not a huge fan of the name. Haha. Can't we all like salads?

Keep in mind the food is pricier than any other taco place in the Mission, but you are paying the environment and its hip-ness. This is place is always happenin' so be sure to come early to snag a table! We came here around 5 on a weekend and had no problem getting a table... Also, I wouldn't plan on being super full here. My friend ordered a trio of tacos and they were baby sized.
author: Janet H.

description:
I went on Sunday night with a party of 7, surprisingly the wait was only about 15-20 minutes for such a bigger party so props to them for that! This location has both outdoor and indoor seatings, which is also convenient. Once we were seated, the waiter patiently waited until our entire party to arrive to take our orders, and constantly our complimentary chips and salsa! Needless to say, their customer service was exceptional. So please tip them generously! 

I went here for tacos so here is my recommended taco menu (I didn't try their vegetarian option unfortunately):
- Baja Style Pacific Cod (deep fried cod)
- Braised Beef
- Traditional Carnitas
Their tacos come with two corn tortillas, and the taco is PACKED with meat, like mega packed! So I usually make one taco into two! With that said, if you don't eat too much, two tacos fill you up pretty decently.

These are the pricing for their tacos:
- 1 taco $4.95
- 4 tacos $17.95
- 10 tacos $39.95
I know some people like their tacos come in three, but like I mentioned earlier, their tacos are more packed with meat compared to other places. So I recommend you share 4 tacos with a friend and split 2 and 2 :). OR! if you have a big party, 10 tacos is always the cheaper option!

Parking are street, I recommend ubering/lyfting/bussing here. Cheers!
author: Inge C.

description: If you like Panda Express then I would suggest eating here. The restaurant is clean but these are not authentic tacos. I could probably make these at home with my store bought tortillas
author: Fatty A.

description:
If you get the tequila flight share it! I was white girl wasted by the end because I didn't have this insight.  It was delicious and I thought well priced for the large portions.  

I appreciated their innovative vegetarian tacos for my lady date. She loved the fried avocado taco and tbh I was super jealous. 

I loved the salsas they served with the tacos as well as the roasted tomato salsa Rojas they served with fresh made tortilla chips. 

The service was great and ambiance even lovelier. 

While you shouldn't pay $4 something for a taco because that's gouging in my opinion, it was a fun experience if you ever have time to kill and benjamins to burn to eat bougie Mexican, do it. 

Would never eat here if I had to wait to get in. If you see hipsters waiting to eat it's probably stupid expensive and ok. This lived above my low expectations.
author: Gina G.

description:
This place was great. I exchanged emails with Malia on setting up a 15 person group after my sister's proposal. We wanted a place to gather and have some small bites and drinks. Tacolicious is one of the few places still opened around 10 that we ended the show.
Malia couldn't accommodate the group at the usual private area but she was helpful in explaining our options. She even made a note to the staff that day so we would hopefully not wait long. I want to also give a shout out to the hostess last Saturday evening who helped us out. We came to Tacolicious after putting down my name on the Yelp list (which is so great!). Most of the space was free expect for 1 table, so she asked the guest if they can move down a bit, which they were nice enough to do. We order 3 trays of 15 tacos, 3 types of meat and drinks. These tacos are big, I could only finish 2. So good. The meat was flavorful, portions are great. The horchata was sweet and had a lot of cinnamon flavor which other places skip on. Overall, thanks Tacolicious for a great end to our super happy night.
author: francis c.

description: Yes, it's a chain, but damn if it isn't delicious! The queso dip is a must if you come here, and you'll even have enough to take home with you, if you so please (if you don't, I'm sorry, what's wrong with you?). I also had a carnitas taco which was really flavorful and not too messy. For drinks, I got the Pasiòn Margarita and, what I think was a prickly pear margarita. Both were bomb and they do NOT skimp on the alcohol! I highly recommend this place if you're looking for good food and drinks.
author: Pooja C.

description:
Had a friend in from Texas so decided to take her to Santana Row for shopping and eating. 

Went to Tacolicious and both had the Tacos Dorados. Fantastic as usual! Messy, drippy and oh so tasty !!!!!! Best thing on the menu I believe!

Chocolate churros topped off the meal. This is the go-to place for consistently fresh Mexican food!

Servers are always great and price is very good. Will be back again and again!
author: Karen G.

description:
Not a bad place to meet up with friends for a drink & taco during happy hour - but don't expect to get your authentic taco fix here.

Environment is cool and the service is not bad.

I ordered the Baja fish taco & the braised beef taco and they both were delicious, although the tortillas were a bit thick. They're served with a trio of sauces.

Yummy place, but mission district worthy? Nah...
author: Monica H.

description: Tacolicious, one of the best quality tacos I have ever ate! Their drinks are just as good too. The staff there is very knowledgeable in helping  me decide what to order, cuz everything on the menu sounds soooo good. Chicken, carne asada, al pastor were all so good! I will definitely go back for tacos and drinks again!
author: Christine A.

description: The food was amazing. A friend recommended this place to me and I loved it. I haven't had good Mexican food in 3 years because I live in Hawaii. This restaurant has several locations. I really recommend the tacos. The guacamole was super fresh and I enjoyed the salsa that they served. Atmosphere was nice and fun.
author: Jennifer E.

description:
Authentic? ....who CARES. This place is delicious. 

I LOVE TACOLICIOUS.

Tacos - Omfg SO GOOD. First lets get the cost out of the way. Yes, each taco is $4.95 each. Yes, for a taco. Should you care? ...NO. Just do it. Just allow yourself to drift slowly into taco heaven and think about the bill later. 

My favorite tacos:
Chicken chile verde
Carnitas
Guajillo-braised beef (probably #1)
Skirt steak carne asada
(they are all good - but the meat is just so good I usually stick to these)

Salsa - they have 3 homemade salsas they give you (red, green and habanero. I am obsessed with the habanero. It's not burn your face off hot or anything but it is slightly sweet and brings a considerable amount of heat. 

Salad - GET THE MARINA GIRL SALAD. It's in the top 5 salads I've ever eaten in my life. The homemade vinaigrette they put on it is out of this world. You can get it either with chicken or without. If I'm having only a salad I'll get chicken, but I've you're doing tacos I would skip the chicken. The salad is so delicious you won't miss the chicken.  

Margaritas - just as good as the tacos. Every single cocktail on the menu is to die for. I usually do get a pitcher of the house margaritas and keep it simple but I've tried all of the other cocktails and they are all delicious. They are made with top quality ingredients and you can taste the difference. 

Atmosphere - there is a cute patio that holds maybe 30 people? It has an amazing mural of the entire Mission that is beautiful to have in the background. The inside is really cute and extremely well decorated. Even the dishes and utensils are trendy and beautiful. I believe the owner handpicks all of the decor and utensils,etc. 

Local tips - there is a sister bar called Mosto that is adjoined to the restaurant that also serves tacos, but they only have one kind. If the restaurant is too busy, you can pop next door and grab a cocktail or have a tequila flight while you wait for your table. They have a large selection of tequila. Another tip that I'm hiding at the bottom of my review because I don't want to be banned from taco heaven is that I usually cheat and get two tacos and turn them into 4 tacos. Each taco comes with a ton of meat and two tortillas so I usually just quickly shuffle them around into 4 tacos. 

The best part is there are multiple Tacolicious locations so I can run all over San Francisco and not go tacolicious-less.
author: Juliet S.

description: The portions seemed fine to me- also who doesn't love receiving a overflowing bowl of tortilla chips with salsa moments after being seated?! Attentive but not overly so, staff.
author: elizabeth m.

description:
Overpriced. Tacos- ordered the special (chorizo & potato) and there was no potato and they were $6 and small. Guac was supposedly "made to order"...no way. It was also $11 and real small. 

La Taqueria & Vallarta is where it's at.
author: Jenna P.

description: Service so slow and inattentive I entered as a young man and left as a weathered, sad old soul desperate for a second round and later the bill, with only the second being seen to (eventually). Staff up.
author: Stuart T.

description:
I would usually come for my favorite dessert item on the menu (pan con chocolaté) and have a few tacos, as well. Man, was I disappointed to see they got rid of the pan con chocolaté! I haven't eaten here for some time, so I don't know how long it's been since they made the change. I asked one of the bartenders about when it was removed and his tone was a bit condescending: "Well...let's see...I've been here for about 5-6 years sooo...hmm...some time ago!". Thanks, BRO! I've made quite a few visits to your joint during that time frame and have seen it on the menu sooo...yeah. 

Regardless, I decided to order some tacos and gave their churros a try. The tacos were solid, but the churro dessert just didn't do it for me. Maybe this was due to my heart being set on the pan con chocolaté, but still...it wasn't anything special.

Aside from being disappointed in the churros, the service was a little lagging, as well. This was a Tuesday evening and I was sitting at the bar with about 3-4 empty seats around me, so it wasn't like the bar was hella busy. My water was empty and it seemed like the bartender(s) looked my way a couple times without offering a refill. Finally, I got a refill after asking. 

Once I was finished with everything, I sat there for about 10 minutes without any acknowledgement or even an offer to take anything away. Mind you, the bartenders were both behind the bar cleaning up and taking drink orders from other folks who were arriving. Basically, I felt forgotten about and had to flag someone down for a check. 

No need for a visit any time soon.
author: Kevin G.

description:
First time here
10 tacos mix choices 
Not bad, skin was very soft 

Chips with avocado mix
Quality chips

Dessert, churros and chocolate dipping sauce 
So far this is the best churro I ever had! 

Parking was a little difficult to find, pretty cold sitting outside. Heater was not warm enough.
author: Mack A.

description:
Ordered 4 of their meat tacos and a pitcher of their el campo margaritas. The tacos weren't too flavorful, but the salsa were really good. The margaritas were definitely strong and was a good amount enough for two of us.

Come for the drinks, but apart from that I would suggest you go to a different Mexican place, as there are such amazing restaurants in the Mission.
author: Nimeela D.

description:
POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE, and not a unique product (tacos in CA)!!!

Came with 6 co-workers on a Thursday at lunch time and just wanted to move ONE TABLE on the patio (Mission location) to accommodate 7 people (two tables) sitting together. No one else sitting on the patio. They were "confused" that anyone should be trying to move a small table - gasp! - and wanted to DICTATE that we had to sit in two groups of 4 and not all together. They claimed it was a "fire hazard" though it wouldn't have blocked off the entire patio. We were fine to move the tables to be parallel (facing the side wall of the patio, to take up less room) instead of parallel to the street, which would have taken up more room. BUT NO! GASP! Hipster restaurant cannot be questioned, the customer is never right in SF, right? Since they were being such a pain in the butt about it, we decided to leave and give them ZERO business. Very smart business plan to be assholes, not try to accommodate your customers, and lose the business of 7 people. And, not just losing our business THAT day, but PERMANENTLY, as we are all locals and were really disgusted by the attitude and discussed how no one wants to patronize them in the future. (BTW, you know how many TACO restaurants are in the Mission, let alone SF????)

So I messaged the restaurant's Facebook page, and while I will say they did message me back, it was only to re-argue that they could not accommodate our table-moving request. "I'm afraid we have neighbors above us who call the fire department every time we are in the slightest violation when it comes to our fire codes. So it was not that we didn't want to accommodate your party, it was truly because we could lose the rights to our patio. I hope you understand that our staff wasn't being "boneheaded" but following orders."

So, to RECAP: 
1.) EMPTY PATIO AT LUNCHTIME.
2.) CUSTOMERS WANTED TO MOVE ONE SMALL SQUARE TABLE.
3.) B.S. RESPONSE (above) that their neighbors would call the fire department on them if ONE table was moved????!!! 
Maybe some of the passive, dumb hipsters here would believe that excuse, but I bet I could get a fireman out there to call B.S. on them.

A million taco restaurants in SF, and you choose to be crappy to people trying to patronize your establishment.
author: Rebecca W.

description: Best part about this spot was the drinks- they were awesome. Customer service was strong- multiple people checked on us several times throughout our meal for chip refills, more drinks, clearing our food, etc. Taco's were tasty. We ate here for lunch and it was definitely a fun atmosphere... It was a little louder than my family had been hoping for as tourists to the area (couldn't hear each other)-- however it was still a great experience and a lively lunch!
author: Emily P.

description:
Just went to Tacolicious for the first time and was pleasantly surprised. The staff we friendly and helpful and the food was great. Out of the two tacos I had, the pastrami was my favourite but the chicken was also great! 
Overall I would highly recommend and the service was great and the food was even better!
author: Mia P.

description: It's too expensive for the quality but is also in San Francisco so not generally surprising. It's a cute spot with pretty good tacos. Definitely not the place you go when you need a street taco fix but when you want a trendy taco a drink and some chill hop look no further.
author: Cal J.

description: Great spot for drinks and tacos. The boyfriend and I enjoyed the vibe and culture. The pastrami tacos are a MUST, we've never had anything like it and highly recommend. The different salsas were also really good. The service was quick and efficient. Would definitely come back for a late night bite and a cocktail
author: Kanani S.

description: When I asked our waitress a question about ingredients due to food allergies her response was smug and incomplete. When I tried to ask again she was aggravated and simply repeated herself. I stated we could not eat there given she couldn't answer the questions and she basically ripped the menus from us and stated we needed to pay immediately for our guacamole and leave, she needed the table (there were empty tables and no line). When a place gets so trendy that you can not accommodate simple questions, BYE! Go to a local place that cares like Lolo down the street.
author: Jacquelene G.

description: Best fish taco ever. Skip the soup. Just get fish tacos. A+ for the red "make America Mexico again" hat.
author: Zelda H.

description: Enjoyed a house margarita ($6) and the sampler of queso, beans, and guacamole ($4) during Happy Hour. Not on the HH menu, I also got the carnitas taco ($5)--which was fantastic--and the fried pacific cod taco ($5)--also good but a little too much batter on the fish for my preference. Tacos came with a lovely trio of different salsas and some pickled veggies. Free chips and house salsa also provided.
author: Ailien V.

description:
Finally we managed to try this famous Tacolicious.
Is it really worth all the fuss that surrounded this place for the last several years?
Personally, I don't think so. After all, we are talking about tacos, man!
Yes, these ones are definitely good, well made, more refined than many other more traditional taco places and I am positive they use excellent ingredients.
But is it worth waiting in line or drive all the way to get to this place? Definitely not. 
So, if you are close to one of the many locations of this little chain (yes, it is a little chain by now), and you get a table right away, definitely go for it.
Any fuss beyond that is already way too much.
author: Luca R.

description: Meh, really hyped. I was expecting much more, they try to go traditional which is fine, but then they really have no edge. Towards the food.
author: Robby S.

description:
Tacolicious was just ok. 

This was mainly due to the service. Our server did not seem interested in our presence. It stinks when this happens because it kind of puts a damper on the entire experience. The tacos we had were good, maybe a little expensive.

Only other note was that we closed the large window that was behind us and were told not to do that. Just make note that patrons can't do that on their own and should request for this to be done, if it can be done at all.
author: Rawlins R.

description:
This place was less than okay. The food was very pricey, at $5 per taco and $10 for guacamole. Also the lighting was very dim, making it hard to see! Who wants to eat and dine in pure darkness? I don't.... and the staff was a little rude, and didn't understand how to split the bill. This is the absolute epitome of a hipster restaurant, with bad service, dim lighting and over priced tiny portions. 

I will not be returning.
author: Vincent R.

description:
Took away our waters without asking and when we weren't looking

Taco Tuesday deal: $15 for 6 tacos: small bowl of lettuce, small bowl of tomato, 6 cheap hard shell tacos, and some ground beef. The beef and taco sauce were super spicy.

Otherwise the service was good. But I can make tacos that are better than that... And I could make Mexican rice to go with it too... 

Would not try this Taco Tuesday again
author: Trang V.

description:
I do not get this place. 

Chips were nice but salsa was not good. Tacos were okay and expensive. Something about the queso tasted weird. I will definitely not come back.
author: Peter M.

description: I'll be honest this place is good but at about an hour before close they started playing hard rock to kick everyone out. After $150 on tacos it definitely wasn't how I would have wanted to end my night.
author: Brett W.

description: Use to work off 16th and frequented this establishment on a regular occasion.... was up in the city this last Sunday and decided to pay a visit. We decided to sit up at the bar which I really wished we would of just been sat at table because the female bar tender was not happy to be serving us? Had the whole stink face and was extremely rude. I'm sorry but customer service is everything an attitude adjustment is what she needs or find a job you don't have to deal with the general public. Ill take my business some where else from now on..... The server who brought us our food was extremely sweet tho.
author: Sherry T.

description:
This is a note to self (because I keep forgetting [or i keep hoping] and go back every 4-6 months) that the tacos are not good (not flavored, not interesting, way overpriced), $10 for a small bowl of OK guac. Please, future me, don't make the same mistake again. 

This may be a better bar with a side of restaurant.
author: Vicki T.

description: Tacolicious is alright! Their food isn't spectacular, but it's good! They give you free chips and salsa which is always a plus in my book! However, the price is a lil steep. Even coming here for taco Tuesday to try the 10 taco deal was not cheap. It's about $3-4 a taco, which doesn't seem like a lot, but these tacos are pretty small, your typical street taco. The nice thing is that there's a bunch of options for meats. Margaritas are about $12-14 each and were alright. All in all, it's a decent place, but I would only come back for the taco deal. I wouldn't necessarily go out of my way for it, I've had better tacos in the city, for cheaper.
author: Eva C.

description:
Foo foo shi shi tacos in the mission?  If that's what youre looking for then this is your place.

We ordered the 4 tacos for $17.95 and got a combination of tamarind chicken, chicken mole, brisket, and fried fish tacos.  Tamarind chicken was super sweet, chicken mole was good, shredded brisket and fish tacos were our favorite.  The tacos were a bit larger than normal but IMHO definitely not worth the price.  

Empanadas were strangely on the menu.  Last I checked, empanadas weren't of mexican origin.  The mushroom and cheese were in a very flaky light crust and drizzled with salsa verde.  It was surprisingly good.

Guacamole was pretty standard.  The chips and salsa were very good though.  The salsa was the just right chunkiness and I think it had some mint in it which gave it a refreshing twist.  I'd come back for just a Pacifo, chips, and salsa for sure!

Don't be fooled by the $$ rating on yelp.  Expect more like $$$+, a good ambience and loud crowd, and fancy mexican food.

Oh, and thumbs up for DOG FRIENDLY!
author: Seung Eun C.

description:
I would give zero stars if that was possible because I've eaten at this location of Tacolicious twice and each time I got food poisoning. The first time wasn't so bad, but the second time was this weekend and I was so sick I ended up in the hospital. Sorry if TMI, but I was vomiting consistently for 12 hours. I'm still recovering - and I'm pissed. Now I'm going to be left with an expensive medical bill, and for what? Because this restaurant is dirty and unsafe? That's not cool at all. I'm a vegetarian so I don't see how this is not a contamination issue. Plus I've had a few friends tell me that they've gotten sick from eating here as well after I told them what happened to me. 
In short - there are better restaurants out there that won't send you to the ER!
author: Shawn A.

description:
When I first walked by I almost missed the place because I didn't notice the tiny sign on the bottom corner of the window with an orange sign with a white half circle. In retrospect I think that was the hipster indication of a taco. LOL! 

Anyways, ambiance and decor was really modern, hipster, and very clean and organized. I loved the open windows, open concept of the kitchen so you can see them prepare and cook the food. I also liked the nice touch of the glass water jugs and thick, soft napkins. Def a 5/5 for decor, ambiance, and utensils/table decor. 

As soon as we were seated we were given menus and upon ordering We had a generous size of mild salsa and chips for us to snack on. The chips and salsa were ok, nice crisp to the chip, but overall pretty standard, but nice touch. We ordered 4 tacos for $17.95, which I originally thought was pretty pricy. I had the "Baja style" pacific cod tacos and braised beef short ribs. Our tacos came with 3 different salsas mild, medium, hot. I wish I had remembered what was in it, but all of them had their own distinct flavor, all very tasty as it complemented the tacos well. Note the hot is not that spicy. 

- Baja style pacific cod: overall it was lightly battered, moist, and very flavorful. It wasn't as crispy as I like my fried fish tacos, but maybe it was because I waited too long after I squeezed my line over it prior to my first bite. Despite that the crunch of the slaw with the magical sauce they used made this taco very tasty. 

-braised beef short ribs: I wasn't sure how I would feel about this one, but after my first bite I knew I was in love. The meat was moist, tender, and very flavorful. I really enjoyed it. 

This hipster joint has done something right, with the great ambiance, fresh and delicious food, along with great service. Cost is definitely up there as it is not cheap, in fact it's quite expensive. However, the ambiance, house chips/salsa, and great service makes-up for it. Would definitely come back again, but maybe not on a regular basis as my wallet won't be very happy.
author: Melissa N.

description:
Mezcal and a bacon taco? Please and thank you.

Whether you're on the Mosto side or the Tacolicious side, you'll be getting solid tacos and solid tequila/mezcal drinks. The Tacolicious side is definitely more restaurant, with outdoor seating, but the bar at either is also worthwhile to sit at. 

For food, there is a plethora of snacks and tacos - including the taco of the week. Last time I went, it was a BLT Taco and was delicious. The chorizo is also really good. From the snacks, hard to turn down a hamachi crudo. And I really want to try the squid a la plancha. Though their chips and salsa are on point, and I'd splurge on the queso and quac.

I'd like to point out that when I ordered the BLT Taco, I got 3 sauce samples to use - one was a decent heat, one had heat and flavor, and one really brought the heat.

Whether you need a spot for a nice bite, grabbing drinks with friends, or want a casual date spot, I highly recommend Tacolicious in the Mission.
author: Michael C.

description:
Meh.  Just ate here the other night and I have no idea why this place is so popular.  Everything I had was mediocre at best.  I keep seeing this over and over in SF, high ratings for restaurants that are nothing special. It seems our standards have really slipped.  

The service was pretty good, staff were all very nice and friendly.  The seats were all uncomfortable and they had the doors open so a lot of cold air was blowing in the entire time.

The Chardonnay they were serving by the glass was quite good.

I won't be back, could not possibly recommend this place to anyone.
author: m b.

description:
Before my first visit, I was a little confused about why this place was so popular, especially in Mission where you're surrounded by cheap tacos at countless taquerias. I'm happy that my boyfriend and I decided to give it a shot!

First of all, yes, it's true--It is pricey for tacos compared to many other tacos in the area. That's undeniable. However, I didn't think the price was unreasonable considering the quality and quantity of the meat. My favorites were the cod (very crispy) and the beef braised short rib, and my boyfriend enjoyed the chorizo. All the tacos went great with the three types of salsas they provided, though I thought that the yellow one they called the "spicy" wasn't all that spicy. The carnitas taco could have been more moist, but overall, everything tasted great.

A big plus that I thought offset the higher cost of the tacos is the unlimited fresh chips and salsa! The chips were warm and tasted fresh from the fryer, and the salsa was fresh and flavorful too (I used it on the tacos too). We probably refilled the chips and salsa about 3 times, but we never had to ask for it first. Service was pretty attentive and friendly.

I thought the restaurant itself looked very pretty, trendy, and clean. The patio had a painted mural of the view from Dolores Park. Definitely not your hole-in-the-wall taqueria decor.

I'm still loyal to Taqueria Cancun in Mission, but in the end, we enjoyed our meal and didn't leave hungry or bitter at the cost of the tacos like we thought we might.
author: Sara L.

description:
If I can give a zero star I would. I'm sorry but my first time experience is pretty horrible. People in front the beautiful ladies greeted me and my guest fine. We got seated pretty quick me and my brother. 
But it's actually the person a lady who was our servant that took our order was just not messing with us. There's two parties that came in after us on the left and right side table of us. They got their food and drinks before we did. We had to ask some other servant serving another party for her to bring us water. She never came back to check in on us or anything. She just took our order and left and never came back. She said she is gonna be our servant but never followed through. All we ordered was just taco Tuesday which is not a hard or difficult. Someone else served us our food. Still no sign of our waitress and our water. It was ridiculous plus it was even that busy. We had to ask another lady for our bill and she was working at a way different section of the restaurant. I don't wanna pull the race card or the appearance but was it because I'm dark skinned or dressed in shorts and black hoodie not looking like the other customers? Thinking in her head like We're not gonna pay or something? I'm sorry but I'm really upset that this has happen like this. I'll probably never return or ever recommend this place to anyone from our experience. It was pretty harsh to be treated so foul like this. 
But hope business goes well and keeps going.
author: Sokthy M.

description:
Yay! I'm getting the hang of this Taco malarkey, kindly recommended by the team at HQ Milton - I enjoyed Taco's al fresco - and thoroughly decent taco's they were too.
