I'd first tried 'Horchita' at an elite event in NY the week before, and can safely say it's a firm fav of mine too also...this was lush, creamy and refreshing.
The guac (get me with ism) was really fresh, zingy and tasty too.
It's a cool spot, I'm starting to 'get' Taco's....
author: John B.

description: Love the location and ambience of the restaurant, especially the outside seating with the lights at night. The tacos were alright, but that was because I was comparing them to taco stands in SD. Service was amazing. The server was bubbling and personable. The drink (the Paśion?) was recommended by our server, and it was delicious but a bit too hot for me. She was kind enough to continue checking up on our table and making sure I had plenty of water so that I did not die.
author: Vivian C.

description:
I can tell Karen G. why the wait staff was reluctant to split that table for 4 into two pairs -- they apparently did that for me tonight, as they initially delivered my guac & salad to the couple seated right beside us, and later completely lost track of my taco order while said couple got their meal in full. 

When warned our order was still half-pending, waiter used the interruption to push additional drink orders on us. Apparently it caught him off guard that we wanted our tacos, not more beers. By the time the folks next to us were being offered to-go boxes, we were ready to jet.

I'm sure a software malfunction or understaffing were the underlying causes, but not my concern -- plenty of corner taquerias around that are 95% as good, cost half as much and know better than to screw up table service.

Guac remains on point, at least. I might come back with a larger crew, but definitely not for a quick couples meal.
author: Khalil B.

description: Food taste so much better when your server have such a good vibes and always with a smile. Thanks for It server food and drinks recommendations we had a awesome lunch even though we wasn't really hungry. Anyway great place for nice lunch I think her name was Sasha...look for the girl with the smile.
author: Inon T.

description:
I love taco trucks, don't get me wrong, but sometimes it's nice to be able to enjoy a taco while sitting down. Tacolicious does not disappoint when it comes to flavors and variety. I thoroughly enjoyed every bite and wished I ordered more! 

This is also a cocktail bar, so a great choice for a date night or happy hour with friends. The indoor vibe is chill--super dark inside with good music playing. There's also an outdoor area with cute string lights at night. 

The drink menu looked really good, and has a ton of delicious options. We tried the Pasíon as recommended by our waiter which sounded really good - passionfruit, habenero, and tequila. But....wow...the habenero just really crept up on me and made each sip incredibly difficult. Would definitely go for a different, more refreshing drink next time. 

I also tried two different tacos. Fish taco was amazing, very light and crispy with fresh salsa and pico de gallo. The potato chorizo taco was my favorite though, I could probably eat a million of those.

The tacos also came with three different dipping sauces/salsas to sample which I really enjoyed. This place doesn't disappoint when it comes to fresh ingredients and flavors. 

Will definitely be coming back here or trying out another location whenever I'm nearby a tacolicious! :)
author: Sara S.

description:
Their Tacos are delicious and stuffed. 
Ambience is pretty good.
They give free chips and salsas if you get drinks. 
Get a platter of 10 tacos and you can try all kinds of tacos. My favorite are Churizo Taco and Bahnmese chicken taco
author: Ajay P.

description: Came here after a recommendation from some friends in SF and I can see why now. The wait was definitely long but the food was worth it. Good service for it being a busy night too. I will return here next time I am in town.
author: Ryan O.

description:
I wasn't very impressed with Tacolicious. There are too many good Mexican food spots in this city to waste any time having an average experience, so I likely won't be back. 
The food was good, but not great. Nothing foodwise stands out to me when thinking back on the experience. In fact, I couldn't even tell you which tacos I ordered, which goes to show how forgettable they were. 
But what really made the experience lackluster was that our waitress acted like she didn't want to be there. She'd come by and only wait on one table at a time and ignore the rest, so we were left sitting with empty drinks throughout the meal and had to wait 20 minutes before being able to order. I'm always annoyed when I have to flag down a server. You're nearby checking on a table, why not look around and check on the others while you're there? (I understand being busy, but that's just time management. Help me help you, Jerry.)
That being said, margs on point! A+
author: Traci A.

description: Great spot to grab some tacos and in the perfect neighborhood to walk around after and maybe head to Delores Park. Service, food and ambiance are all great. The only thing I didn't give 5 stars is because one of the tacos we ordered were just not to my liking and the portion size was a bit smaller than I expected, but otherwise the quality of food was great.
author: Paul H.

description: This review is from an event-planner & executor's POV. I was looking forward to working with Tacolicious in The Mission as I had done a few events with the location in Palo Alto and I was not let down! If anything, they exceeded my expectations. Everyone was very easy to communicate with, the food looked gorgeous and tasted amazing, the service staff (Nicole and Mitchell!) were on-point, professional, and so helpful. I look forward to working with Tacolicious in The Mission again... and also eating some more of their fish tacos. YUM. Thank you so much, TL, I love doing my game wrap-ups with you!
author: C M.

description: Came here for a post-wedding brunch for a large party and rented out the entire back room. It was a great space - brightly lit, plenty of room, and nicely decorated and perfect for a private party. The food was solid (there was a pre-chosen selection of tacos which everybody seemed very happy with, along with sides) and a very nice selection of drinks, with a bartender keeping an eye out that everybody had what they wanted. I really like the artwork, and the staff was attentive and friendly.
author: Peggy C.

description: The ambiance was cute....... why were the tacos so small! Paid 15$ for snack sized meal. I was shocked when the waiter handed me my food which wouldn't even fill up a child. It was such a bummer because I had heard great things about Tacolicious and the decor made the restaurant seem really nice. However, this does not mean they can rob people of their money. Such a shame!
author: Allison C.

description:
Bad service: from the hostess to the waitress, they treat you like an annoyance, not a customer.

Overpriced food: go to literally any other Mexican restaurant in the Mission for better tacos at a third of the price.

Take note that the owners don't respond to bad reviews. They know this place is terrible, and they are just banking on their prime location to allow them to coast to pay day.
author: Matt L.

description:
I recently wrote a review saying that SF needs more taco shops.
Well, Tacolicious is a taco shop and like usual, I listen to Yelpers and y'all told me this was the spot to go!

I also heard about this place because Lyft also told me that this was the #1 restaurant destination in SF. INTERESTING....

I walk in and the first thing I notice is their $10 Taco+Shot+Beer special. Tempting.

I ordered their 2 veggie tacos and made them vegan-friendly by omitting the cheese.

**Nopales taco: Cactus was cooked well, but could have used [way] more seasoning. This one fell flat for me
**Butternut Squash & Kale taco: Sounds super delicious, but alas did not do the job. The Butternut Squash was way undercooked and actually was tough to bite into. Kale was cooked well. Overall every component needed more seasoning.

I'm just theorizing here, but perhaps the lack of seasoning is due to the fact that the salsa was supposed to make up for lack of flavor on the actual tacos itself? Because those sauces were BOMB. The yellow one was my absolute favorite-spicy and full of flavor! The brown one had a delightful smokey flavor and the green one had great texture and freshness.

The oversized side of chips with salsa & guacamole also had redeeming qualities. Fresh, seasoned well, and just really good.

So...the name may not be true in my case. The Tacos weren't very delicious. But everything was. Maybe I'll start calling it "Salsalicious" or " Guacalicious" instead.

Or maybe I really needed that shot + beer with the taco!
author: Lanie L.

description:
Bomb ass tacos!

Lately I've had the craziest cravings for some tacos, and I was so glad to have come here. Yeah tacos in SF are pretty pricey compared to taco truck tacos, but the quality and taste can't be beat. Came here with a friend around 6pm Thursday night, and I gotta say, Valencia Street is poppin'. I wasn't exactly sure where the front entrance was though since there was an outdoor gate leading to the patio and a building door on the side. We were immediately seated, and split 10 tacos for $40. Pricey I know. Let me just say that they don't skimp out on portion size. Most of the tacos were juicy, filling, and packed with lot of meat. Most of the meats were soaked and dripping with sauce.

10 Tacos (5 kinds) + 1 Nopal 

1) Guajillo Braised Beef Short Rib: (5/5) YES, one of the favorites (tied w/ the Braised Chicken).
2) Traditional Carnitas: (4/5) This tasted really good as well, but there was this subtle taste in the meat juices that I wasn't fully in favor of.
3) House-made Chorizo and Potatoes: (3/5) Okay, I don't personally like the taste of chorizo. This one tasted kind of dry compared to the rest of the tacos.
4) Fried Pacific Cod: (5/5) YES, the fish cod was fried to a perfect crisp, and the red cabbage topping was a nice addition to the appearance.
5) Shot-and-a-beer Braised Chicken: (5/5) YES, one of the favorites (tied w/ the Braised Beef).

Nopal was flavorful, and the tequila in it was strong.

I highly recommend this place!
author: Kevin S.

description:
I love Tacolicious. It is delicious. But here is what $90 just bought me. I ordered a "taco 4-pack" to go, and the $10 guacamole. Here is how little food I received.  Pay attention to the laughably small portion of guacamole. 

Taste: 5/5
Value: -4/5
Result: 1/5
author: Nevin M.

description:
I could eat here every day and never get tired of it! This is by no means traditional Mexican food - it's more of a Cali twist with fresh produce, small farm meats, etc. Plenty of vegetarian options, of course, and typical SF prices. (If you want a cheap, authentic taco, go to a taco truck.)

The margaritas are tasty - I recommend the Mucho Gusto which includes coconut water (for hydration, of course!). Their tequila list is massive and impressive. 

Tacos are great with the menu changing seasonally, and there is always a special Taco of the Week. And they are large enough to really be 2 tacos. The queso is my idea of heaven - who doesn't love hot cheese?!

And their weekend brunch is also legit. While Tacolicious tends to be pretty crowded during the week, it's usually easy to get a table for brunch without a wait.
author: Rachel R.

description:
When your food is mediocre, you should probably maybe at least have good service. 

So we dined here on a Saturday, busier than usual granted it was Cinco de Mayo. I didn't mind the wait, we arrived at 11,  thinking it'd be a great place to grab drinks and late night dinner. The hostess says nothing, there seem to be 3 of them, three people doing the same job poorly. 
 
Eventually we get seated, ready to eat and grab some drinks to start the night. Around 10-15 minutes later the waiter arrives to greet us with "So you know the bar did last call already yes?" 
Uh no, the 3 hosts failed to mention that MINOR detail during our wait. And you're JUST now conveniently arriving after the fact.  He proceeds to take our order and I tell him we need another minute or so. At this point we are kind of  wondering why the hell we would do $40 tacos for two here if we can't even get a damn drink to go with it. Could easily go to one of the 20 taquerias in the surrounding area for better tasting food. 

So I look up online that their next door bar is still open and ask the waiter about it. He tells us yeah we can bring the drinks over so I think okay we'll stay.(why did he not mention this before) 

So we barely make it to last call, get drinks over, waiter comes back it's like 11:40 at this point and he's  like "cheers! you got drinks! Just so you know I have to take the drinks away from everyone at midnight" 

???? 
So now we are chugging our drinks, through brain freeze, starvation and annoyance we wait for our tacos to arrive. The food is fine. Mediocre overpriced New Age San Francisco style tacos. 

Our remaining drinks are promptly snatched at 11:59pm. We finish up eating and ask for the bill. It takes FOREVER. At this point there are exactly 6 people in the restaurant still dining including us 2. He brings us the bill finally, disappears and we put the credit card down. After it's been about 10 minutes I look around for him and notice he's been engaged in deep philosophical convo with another guy dining for over 10 minutes. At no point  does it cross his mind I guess to do his job and then finish the conversation. But we wait patiently for several minutes while he has his deep life changing conversation on the clock. 

When he FINALLY collects the check, we've barely gathered our things and called our ride when the other host or whoever, a blond dude in glasses comes over to our table and says "I'm sorry guys but I'm gonna have to ask you to leave now"

As IF we've been sitting here after dining for 20 minutes FOR FUN! As if we were drinking our drinks, chatting it up and hanging out! As if their entire staff is competing to see who could offer the worst customer service experience! Laughing out loud as he mentions something about seeing us next time I'm thinking y'all really think I'm coming back!? Like?? I'll take my $60 to Pancho Villa up the block and treat the whole damn family but thanks!
author: J W.

description:
Gracious Tacolicious for being open late at night.
My bf was in the area last night for an event and around 1130pm found ourselves searching for food and was craving tacos on a Sunday night. Tacolicious so happened to be 1 block away. 
Walked in right before midnight ordered the hamachi crudo and 2 different types of tacos.
We left full and happy.
I'm giving this spot 5 stars for being open late, quick turn around service and yummy food. Def recommended for late night eats.
author: Jewelyn T.

description:
came here for midnight munchies - a decent modern mexican spot that's still open at 1230am. service was good, although the waiter somehow missed the extra shrimp on our salad, which was later served separately when we asked.

fresh salsa with nachos before our food was a nice touch, although the salsa was a bit warm. we also enjoyed the selection of salsas served with our baja fish tacos - spicy yellow, barbecue picante, and a green mild sauce. 

overall pleasant experience, although we were the last to leave they were nice enough not to kick us out. would come back again at odd hours...
author: Fiona F.

description:
I had visited this place along with my cousin who was visiting town and we both liked it. The place is amazingly great and good hangout spot after work or meeting friends over the weekend. This place suits all celebrations. 

The only thing you wouldn't have is music. The hospitality is great. Nachos are awesome. 

Now coming to the food, Tacos are Crazily the best, filled with flavor. A  must try. Both of us have tried a mix of beef and chicken and we had called for 2 more portions. 

We enjoyed the place and would definitely hit it again.
author: Anurag K.

description: Beer and guac are out-of-this-world INCREDIBLE. Whoever gave this place less than 5 stars must've been on some bad crack. The service, tacos, and ambiance all get an A++.
author: Tanedys G.

description:
5 stars for sure. I'm not a taco person, but this place won me over!! I'm a vegetarian, and I was blown away by the butternut squash tacos. SO DELICIOUS. I wish I had tried the margs but I went the day after NYE and there was no way I could even look at alcohol lmao. 

I also got the horchata and the guac, which were both very flavorful. Honestly I like my guac salty lol so I added the extra salt, but you can tell that the avocados are very fresh. 

It was definitely pretty busy, but I also think the reason for that is that because it was a weekend and also the day after NYE, so lots of out of town ppl (like me lol). We ended up sitting at the bar cause we were too hungry to wait for a table. 

There is street parking but honestly just uber it if you can!
author: Malvika T.

description:
Tacolicious recently catered my wedding and I can not say enough good things about the process and the final execution.  Brielle was a delight to work with and her team pulled off the event without a hitch.  The food was incredible, the presentation looked great, and the servers kept everything moving.

We would be thrilled to use them again for any kind of an event or catering situation.
author: Matt D.

description: First time trying tacolicious and probably the last. I don't know what possessed me to eat here when there are sooo many authentic Mexican eateries in the Mission. Maybe because I wanted to try overhyped and over priced tacos lol. I ordered the Chile con queso which I really enjoyed. It's cheese fondue, what's not to love? However, the chips that came with the salsa were extreeeemely salty. Then I ordered two chicken tacos which again happened to be extremely salty. After eating them my stomach was not feeling all that great...possibly too much salt intake. But I gave three stars because our waiter was attentive and really sweet.
author: Sonia R.

description: Niko the bartender was amazing. Very welcoming and made us a great seasonal drink and was very personable. There was a very drunk gal at the bar who stumbled out and he checked up on her and brought her water, a true gentleman and such class. Thank you Tacolicious for amazing staff and cocktails!
author: Danielle C.

description:
Really great experience here with a large group! We rented out the private space in the back and had a variety of appetizer (all delicious) and mixed tacos. Everyone was so full at the end + we had 3 types of margaritas!! Strongly recommend the spicy one that was great. 

Great options - veggie empanadas, beef tacos, churros!! 

Staff was also really helpful even with our large group, which can be difficult at times. Thank you!!
author: Caley Z.

description:
Thoroughly annoyed by the service at this place. We ordered two plates of the grilled corn (because it's usually delicious, and how do you eff up grilled corn anyway?) The version at Tacolicious turned out to be covered in this overly burnt, super salty sauce - pretty much inedible. When we asked the waitress about it this was literally her response: "Well, he ate it, and she ate it." 

Wtf?! First of all, no, we didn't finish the corn after taking our first bites, and secondly, what kind of a response is that?! Your corn is disgusting, and the only appropriate response is to say sorry and remove the remaining charred salty untouched corn from our table. After saying "I'll talk to my manager" and some serious eye rolling, she ignored us and only after we called her back over did she say "I was gonna tell you at the end of the meal, we're going to take off one order of the corn." 

I will give them this: the drinks were good, and the cod tacos were great. But I won't be returning. $60+ is too much to be paying for unsolicited sass from a rude waitress.
author: Joyce Y.

description: Food is average but service is very disappointing!  I placed a small takeout order at the bar area as instructed and was promised it should take approx 10 min.  As I was standing in the reception waiting area, at least two waitresses told me at one point or another that they would inform me when my order is ready, possibly because they don't want me to clutter the area.  I therefore stepped outside of the front entrance.  Twenty minutes were gone by, nobody came to me.  I went back inside to the guy who took my order.  He said the order went to the kitchen, it's really not his business, didn't really care.  I then went to the kitchen area, where somebody suggested I should check back at the reception area.  Sure enough my order has been sitting there who knows for how long.  I was too trusting the two waitresses, ended up wasting my time.
author: Guy C.

description:
Tacolicious- your tacos are not good enough to have such rude employees. I'll stick to Mezcalito and Don Pistos.

To make matters worse, it looks like poor or rude service is a recurring issue from other reviews. 

I came here after a show to grab a quick bite. I asked a couple employees when I walked in (after seeing other customers dining there) if the kitchen was still open and if was ok to order. I got the gracious OK from the bartenders and proceeded to order from an obviously reluctant waitress - aside from direct comments, she'd made loud side remarks to another employee seated next to us after taking our order about letting them wait for our order. She proceeded to turn the lights off in the dining area. Off! 

I've never been treated so rudely at a restaurant before. I worked in the industry for many years and never would have done that to a customer. If you're open you're open. If you don't want to serve, you say the kitchen is closed. I didn't want to dine in the dark or be made to feel so badly about eating there so I let her know we'd leave since she obviously wanted us to - to which she just laughed.
author: Molly M.

description:
What happened to this place?!?

We used to come here all the time, but moved a little farther away and hadn't been back in about a year. Boy, has it gone downhill.

Two words: operational nightmare
author: Russ S.

description:
Service 6 STARS 
Bartenders 6 STARS
DRINKS - 6 stars 
Food - TASTE - 5 stars 
healthy wise (4 stars) - the peppers (I know they were fried has more oil than what I would consider healthy)

But all in all - I have been to Tacolicious 6 times in the last 3 months and have not been disappointed even once...Only problem I always face- Finding a table without reservation on EVEN RANDOM Thursday night (@10 PM) means a 30-45 min wait - They are that good. NEVER EVER CHANGE, Please!!!
author: Amit K.

description: This place served delicious, authentic Mexican tacos! Had an awesome environment and feel with great tunes. The salsa was perfect for chips and as a taco topper. Also, this place serves vegan tacos that are tasty! The mushroom carnitas taco was great. We will be back if ever in this part of town.
author: Blondie B.

description: Rude service. My friends and I went here to eat and the waiter was already rude with us the minute he talked to us. I and one other friend felt like he didn't want to serve us. I don't know if it's because we're 18/19 and look younger or if that's just his personality, but either way it's no way to treat a customer. He checked up on us ONCE, and it took him 15 minutes after we finished our food for him to come and ask if we wanted anything else. My car got a ticket because he took so long. Food was good, but pricey.
author: Cailee E.

description:
Door Dash and/or Tacolicious owes me $221.00 and won't pay up. 

On Dec 10, I ordered 4 "platters"of 10 tacos each, 40 tacos, from Tacolicious in the Mission, San Francisco. They charged me for 40 and delivered 8. They were squished into syrofoam boxes, with no identifiers as to which were which, important info when you have vegetarians. The presentation was amateurish and unappetizing. 

This was my annual holiday party. I had 2 days and spent many $$$ on food, liquor and tableware. I made spanish rice, black beans, quac, salads apps, desserts, etc etc. The tables were set with poinsettias, candles, etc. 

There was a one hour cocktail hour planned, to be followed by dinner. The 8 tacos arrived...for 15 guests.Then followed a mad scramble to find their number...couldn't. Got on their Chat, where they apologized, and offered to send the rest of the tacos and send a full refund. 

1 1/2 hours after that, the rest of the tacos arrived. The mood of the party was irretrievably broken. Some folks started to drift off in search of food. The food that I had made, was dry and overcooked from being in the warming oven too long. I was very excited about this party and ended up crying in the kitchen. 

Have had over 40 annoying voicemails, tweets and emails with various staff from both Door Dash and Tacolicious. Door Dash now refuses the refund that they had offered bc they "delivered everything I ordered". Kory Cogdill, Tacolicious PR, says there is nothing they can do, as they have "no power" in this situation. What utter nonsense. 

N.E.V.E.R. A.G.A.I.N.
author: Vicki F.

description: The tacos were pretty solid, but for the price you can definitely find better in the city. The guacamole was probably one of the best guacs I've ever had! But you pay for the environment which is a lot of fun. They have good drinks and good service!
author: Nicklaus N.

description:
Carnitas taco is super juicy.

Free chips and salsa(isn't spicy).

Water comes in clear, recycled alcoholic glass.

Also have vegetarian mushroom taco option.

Service is really nice and friendly.

Will text you if there is a wait so you can explore and take a look around the neighborhood.

Restaurant is clean and inviting. Also has a lot of outdoor seating options.
author: Jennifer C.

description: I went here for lunch with coworkers and the atmosphere was great. The food was also great. We ordered 10 tacos for $39.95 and marina girl salad for $13.25.
author: Michael D.

description:
Terribly disappointed on two fronts:

1. Lack of vegetarian/ vegan choices - there was like maybe two vegan choices on the menu

2. Service - so I ordered a vegan taco. When the taco was served it was served family style with other meat based tacos with the beef from the adjacent tacos flowing into mine. 

I asked why the tacos were served together as I couldn't have my taco with meat in it. The server said I should have told her to serve the taco separately sooner as they serve their tacos family style. So I asked to see their menu again and went through it with a fine toothed comb - and NOWHERE does it mention that tacos will be served family style. Server eventually comped a separate taco but the attitude didn't help.

I don't think we're coming back!
author: Rakesh L.

description:
Say NO to this trash of restaurant, owned by corporations from overseas. 
Say YES to other Mexican restaurants owned by locals 
(if you want that cool vibe, I recommend "lolo" (Mission), or "Colibri" in Union Square)

This restaurant had to pay $900,000 in court settlements because they abused their workers. 
They were denied meal and rest breaks and had their wages improperly withheld

I have a heart, and I understand the importance I have as a consumer to help sustain or end abuse so I will not be eating here again, and I recommend others don't as well.
author: Sara J.

description: Simply delicious! We tried the Chicken Verde taco, carnitas and Carne Asada tacos. All were amazing. Highly recommend
author: Andrea G.

description: I've always loved Tacolicious, especially going to their happy hour. However I was misled by them on Presidents' Day when I called in to ask if they still had happy hour that day, to which the gentleman replied with a yes - however this was not true and we found this out after ordered full priced items and asking to see the rest of the happy hour menu when our waiter informed us there wasn't one due to the holiday.
author: Alex G.

description: Kind of pricey at $17.95/4 tacos, but it's downtown Palo Alto. Two tacos were plenty filling (had beef brisket and pacific cod, tasty enough). Horchata was good but $5! Really enjoyed the free chips with the various salsas. Nice servers, nice ambiance, would come again during happy hour next time.
author: Ann C.

description: Service excellent. Appreciated the murals of the mission. Have been to other locations of tacolicous and this location doesn't disappoint. Was encouraged to try del otono by our server and was so good. Like a colder version of a hot toddy. Not overly sweet with a smokey aftertaste. Tacos always good. Try out their cocktail menu- uniquely inviting.
author: Linda H.

description:
Tacolicious, I've been here a few times and I'm giving this place 4 stars just on the fact that you can get a beer, a shot and a chicken taco for 10 bucks.  What a deal!!!

Great place to get the night going with that $10 deal, as far as the tacos go this is another hipster taco joint which a lot of their tacos have their own twist.  In my opinion however, even though I would come back, these tacos are overpriced, sure they're ok however  they're inconsistent, I've got them too rich (in terms of saltiness) or I've also got them slightly dry.

Servers often give different info, last time I was able to get a different taco instead of the chicken one with the beer shot and taco deal for a few bucks more, while yesterday chicken was the only taco I could get.

I would go back, however there's plenty of places with better tacos in the mission.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: I was told about this place from numerous people and for being a HUGE Mexican food fan from Miami, I was very disappointed. I ordered a tamale and taco al pastor. Both were terrible. The taco was dry and the tamale was not authentic.
author: Laura D.

description:
Tacolicious undoubtedly lives up to it's name. It is indeed a step above Tacokay. Far from Tacorrible. 

Tacolicious serves several different types of tacos with a variety of fillings, ranging from beef brisket to nopales (which is cactus!). You can mix up the taco types in your order to create a diverse tacophony of flavors.Taco-bout choices! 

Typically an order of four tacos will fill me up. Perhaps I could consume more tacos in a sitting if I didn't fill up on chips and salsa before my meal? Hard to say. The world may never know.
author: Chris G.

description:
Came here on a random whim.  We had guac, fish tacos and carnitas.  The guac was meh. We actually added a bit of salt to brighten up the taste a bit. The fish tacos were excellent, crispy outside, delicate and flakey inside.  The carnitas were very tasty and had a nice citrus flavor to them. The tortillas were excellent. The three salsas (habanero, chipotle, and tomitilo) they brought out were all good and very fresh. We also had the house margaritas. You can always tell when they use fresh juice and this one was not a mix for sure, a nice balance of tart and sweet.  Overall, we would come again, just no guac and go straight to the tacos. A bit pricy, but I guess that is the city ($90 for guac,
4 tacos and 4 margaritas).
author: Brian T.

description: Delicious tacos + guacamole and fantastic ambiance.
author: Mara H.

description:
Let me start this by saying, I've probably eaten at Tacolicious upwards of 30 times. The food is consistently good and the cocktails are amazing.

That being said, the last two times I walked in there to get lunch (this past Saturday and Sunday afternoons), I left without even sitting down because of the complete rudeness of the hostesses. My walking into the restaurant to ask for a table was apparently a huge inconvenience to them, and they had some of the worst attitudes I have ever seen in a customer service position. 

Such a bummer that the people who should be the friendliest and most inviting in the restaurant are turning people away with their completely off-putting, frankly revolting demeanor. We will think twice before returning to T-lish.
author: Al E.

description:
Horrible food. Horrible price. $5/6 single tacos. 
Dry meat.

Ordered 5 different tacos...
-chicken
-beef brisket
-steak
-chorizo
-special banh mi

ALL TASTED THE SAME

Best thing about this place?
The napkins. Nice and thick..great absorbing cloth. 

Won't ever come back for the food...
but I will for the napkins
author: Wilson H.

description: Spend $50 on 12 chicken tacos and they won't even put them together... I rarely write Yelp reviews but damn this is bad.
author: Dylan J.

description: Very good food and fast, courteous service. Get the avocado taco, the cod and the chorizo. Stay away from the beef. The music is loid enough to listen but low enough to have a conversation.
author: Abiud A.

description:
I don't live in San Francisco but my brother and sister in-law do. Tacolicious is within walking distance so we usually go here when visiting them. We wanted to pick at some good stuff after being in Napa all day and this did the trick. Its been pretty busy every visit Ive made but somehow we got 4 seats at the bar which was just fine for us. At one end there was a small group that was there with a guy who was getting married the next day and they were having a good time. We sent them over the margarita frescas chupitos which is a group of 4 shots, which are really small versions of the margarita. They seemed to enjoy those as they broke into song not long after. Fun vibe on a Thursday! The bartender made a killer margarita and paloma which I like as much as a margarita. I had the regular 'rita and the Fillmore paloma. 
To eat we all shared the chili con queso, chicken tacos, dorados al charo, cauliflower side, fried plantains side and the Marina Girl salad, which is listed under snacks but not sure why. I think that salad was my favorite which was the thing I ordered and mostly ate. It was big enough for a meal for sure. The mains are a bit better than the sides but there is so much variety that you really cant help but get a good meal if you know what you want. 
Open for lunch through late.
author: Emily P.

description:
Great selection of tequila and really good tacos. The place always seems crowded, so they must be doing things right. Since I normally shit at the bar, it's hard to assess the service, but today's service is mixed at best. It's lunch time on a Friday and the place is hopping, so I'll cut then some slack. 

If you're looking for a lively place to get good tequila cocktails and inventive tacos, then Tacolicious in the Mission is for you!
author: Scott L.

description: For the money, it's not worth it. Could name a good handful of Mexican places costing MUCH less that would put this fancy menu to shame. Thrown together haphazardly, I regretted ordering the minute I unpacked it. I also asked for a side of hot sauce, the ONLY thing I asked for, and they didn't even do that for me..... colossal waste...
author: Laura H.

description: What a fantastic place! The staff here is very attentive, courteous & thoughtful. Not to mention how delicious everything was. We had tacos; I had Carnitas & she had fish taco. Fish was over battered a little for her taste. But she still enjoyed the   fish inside. Carnitas taco was full of tender, moist pork. Well flavored. They keep serving you salsa w/chips as needed. They go fast at our table! We closed our lunch w/Tahitian vanilla ice cream. Wow! Found out it is "Humphrey's" ice cream. Delicious ending! I took 1 star away due to customer's loudness. Not Tacolicious' fault. I just thought I should put it in the review that it is very loud. At least on a Saturday. Might not be a romantic Hideaway, you have to shout to be heard. If you're going with friends and you want to shout - then this would be a wonderful place to go ;-)
author: Van H.

description:
Around 6PM on a Sunday the wait for a group of 8 was 40 minutes. They have wifi so that eased the wait. I loved how their tables had hooks underneath to hang bags/coats. They also have outdoor seating and a mural looking out. 

We ordered 20 tacos for $80, guac and queso $9 each, and two pitchers of mucho gusto $36 each. 

- Short rib: tasty and juicy, not my favorite but all the guys loved it
- Carnitas: flavorful with good texture and not dry, my favorite but the guys did not love it
- Chorizo: heard it was dry but flavorful
- Fish: tasty with a big piece of fried fish but it wasn't amazing because it didn't hit that umami flavor with the sauces

Tacos came with pickled veggies, lime wedges, and mild, medium, and hot salsa. 

The mucho gusto was weak sauce and only tasted of lemon. The guac had too much cumin in it but the queso was great!

Great service and clean bathrooms. The food was great but it wasn't amazing. It's a safe choice and you can't go wrong with complimentary chips and salsa.
author: Nancy H.

description:
I tried every single taco on the list here. TACO REVIEW: We enjoyed all of them except for the filet mignon (the meat was fine albeit a bit chewy, but it was just not a great combo to wrap it in a tortilla) and the buffalo chicken (the flavor was a lot saltier/stronger than I expected). The braised short rib, carnitas, and pacific cod tacos were our favorites out of the bunch. 

The servers were friendly and helpful, and great explaining all the tacos we ordered as well as the three awesome sauces they provided: salsa verde (with avocado), yellow habanero salsa (spicy!), and red salsa. 

Besides tacos, there's a great selection of delicious and creative cocktails. Plus free chips and (awesome) salsa. Expensive, but for the hip intimate ambience (think typical SF hipster bar) the pricing was expected. 

For the convenient location (19th/Valencia), helpful staff, and trendy atmosphere... I'll be back!
author: Christine L.

description:
This would have been 3 stars a few years ago when they opened. But these days the food is bland, the drinks expensive, the cultural appropriation strong, AND they just settled a class action lawsuit for not paying their employees. You are better than this. Really.

 Unless you vote Republican, in which case: 5 stars!
author: Terry L.

description:
Nauseous is the word that comes to mind as I reflect upon our meal this afternoon. 

We stumbled upon the restaurant, recalled hearing the name a few times in recent history, so we were excited to try it. The restaurant is cute, small, and in keeping with a similar vibe/feel of other restaurants around Valencia. Our waitress was polite, informative and patient enough when we took a little longer to decide what we wanted.

Our teenage boys ordered chilaquiles based on the recommendation of their mother (me). My husband ordered ___?___, and I ordered the Baja style fish tacos.

At first glance, the chilaquiles looked like a plate of nachos sans cheese with a fried egg on top. My boys weren't complaining but mom was a bit judgy over their interpretation of chilaquiles. The only saving grace about those nach--chilaquiles, were the tasty chips...but we had already gone through a basket and a half of those, so no one was too excited over the bed of chips that arrived masquerading as a meal.

My husband's meal was much smaller but took the form of orange and green spice mush. He couldn't even get through his soupy, non-textured food. He grabbed a few chips from my boys' plates, since there was much to spare, but still, so disappointing.

Then, after about a five minute wait after my kids' and husband's meal arrived, came my beautiful fish tacos! They were pleasing to the eye but that is about the only thing they were pleasing to. I've never known a taco to be gag-worthy, but these were. First, the crema that is typically served on a fish taco, had no more flavor than a spoonful of mayonnaise. Second, and worst of all, the batter that was used to batter the fish, was similar to a donut or funnel cake batter. You wouldn't think that would make a huge difference but it did and without the presence of any other flavors but mayonnaise and funnel cake batter, my instant reaction was gag. I tried to dress it up with lime and the lovely platter of salsa and sauces that accompanied the tacos, but nothing helped--the batter aftertaste was so dominant, it left me nauseous. I ordered two but only managed to get through one. I HATE wasting food but I couldn't stomach the rest, nor could I even bring myself to pass it off to a homeless friend on the street. 

So disappointing. If you're looking for good tacos or some semblance of Mexican, choose one of the other longstanding spots here in the mission. There is no shortage of them and you'd likely be guaranteeing a future for those restaurants that the Mission is so loved for.
author: Crystal M.

description:
How to Appease The Hangry:

1)  Find a place without a line.  (aka Tacolicious @ 4pm on Sat. Really?)

2)  Hit the complimentary chips and awesome tomato salsa ASAP.

3)  Add guac.  The Hangry loves guac but Tacolicious' made to order version was a bit bland.  #GarlicPlease

4) Add a summery beverage.  The Silas was cool and citrusy but whoa sugar overload!  A water chaser would have helped but alas no one to refill the water glass.  

5) Add tacos!  They come with a trio of sauces but they couldn't compete with the fresh tomato salsa provided earlier. The Fried Rock Cod taco is the usual fave but the unique Chicken Mole one was indeed TACOLICIOUS. 

Crisis Averted.  (For now anyway.)
author: Amy C.

description:
This place was bomb. They start you off with chips and salsa (so on point). My friend and I ordered 4 tacos for 17.95 and also the taco of the week. The taco of the week was a shrimp taco with pineapple pico de gallo. This taco was unbeatable. Absolute love. My other favorite taco was the beef short rib. Honestly, I'm getting hungry as I'm thinking of all this. With the tacos, they accompany you with three salsas. The yellow one is the spiciest, but to me it's the best. This place is such a win in my books!

-Kristen

5 stars from Kristen, Edmund wasn't here to rate.
author: Kristen L.

description:
The tacos are great and full of flavor! We ordered the shot-and-beer braised chicken, carnitas, chicken en red mole sauce and the brisket. 

Now as for service it seems like it's a hit or miss. Our first time we got great customer service and our waiter was always checking in on us to make sure everything was ok. As for this time around we were a little pressed for time so we were trying to get our servers attention but she seemed all over the place and only checked in on certain tables. When we asked for our bill it took awhile to get which we were ok with but by this time 10 minutes had passed and then the table next to us asked for there's and got it in a matter of seconds and even got to pay before us. We were quite upset since we've been waiting for awhile. So I got up and asked a different server for our bill and he apologized for the inconvenience. Just felt like we weren't as important as her other tables she was waiting on and that's not the type of vibe you want to get when dining in. 

Overall, food and drinks are great. Customer service can use a little work.
author: Cynthia P.

description: Hipster dive. Decor was modern and there was indoor and outdoor seating. The tacos were pricey and I could have gotten a better meal deal at a Mexican taqueria. Food was okay.
author: W A.

description: Came for Happy Hour this week and thought it was good. Margaritas are $5 a pop on their HH menu and were made really well. My coworker and I decided to also try a few of their tacos & trio dip for chips and so happy we did. Definitely check it out if your'e in the area, but just be careful.... everything really adds up in the end lol
author: Carrie L.

description: Decided to visit the mission district on a trip to San Francisco and stumbled upon Tacolicious. We walked in and we're seating right away. I love taco places and this place was pretty close to hitting the mark! Service was good, but nothing special. I think my favorite thing was their 3 different salsas.  I was able to try them all and enjoy each bite of my food!
author: Rachel M.

description:
Chupitos, Tacos, and some fine salsas. I had the pleasure of visiting Tacolicious during my recent venture to SF, and was instantly made into an enormous fan. Although quite popular these days - and certainly not hard to find, this particular bouquet of chips, salsa, tacos, and mezcal really got me. 

Making my way to the side patio, I found a relaxing vibe to be sure. This would be a perfect place to come with friends and kick it for a while - and at $12 for 4 chupitos (small shootable versions of their cocktails), you'll want comrades to share with. 

Starting out with a few habanero-infused tequila chupitos, I was happy to chomp on their very sturdy, delicious, fresh chips for some time before placing an order. I typically judge Mexican restaurants right off the bat for their quality in chips and salsa; for this, they passed the test. Then, as per suggestion by a very friendly waiter named Ryan, I ordered 4 tacos: carnitas, braised short rib, chorizo and potatoes, and fried pacific cod. All were perfectly portioned and prepared, messy, and delectable. The stand-outs here were the pacific cod and braised short rib! Finishing off my meal with some select mezcal, I left happy and sated. If you're a fan of authentic, modern, Mexican street fair dressed up as casual dining, this could be the place for you.
author: Chase T.

description: One word: delicious! I'm from San Diego where our Mexican food is the most heavenly thing known to mankind. Living in the bay for over 2 years I continue to struggle to find "good Mexican" food. I have had multiple recommendations from people and every place falls extremely short of what Mexican food should be. I saw a picture on IG of their tacos and they looked amazing. I brought my husband here and we ordered the multiple different kinds of tacos. The beer shredded chicken tacos were by far the best! They were so juicy and flavorful I couldn't get enough. I ended up returning a few days later with my mom while she was visiting and got he same tacos, sooo delicious! I'm hooked! Their horchata is super good as well!! Love this place, definitely the best tacos I've ever had in the bay.
author: Lauren F.

description:
This place is great combo of fun atmosphere, great drinks, and good food. 

The margaritas are amazing. Tasty combos of fruit juices and tequilas leave you drunk. You'll need two to get drunk, if that's what you're angling for. 

The food was mostly good. The guac is creamy and tasty perfection. The Chilaquiles (add the Carnitas) were tasty, but the sauce was a little lacking in flavor. The pozole came with all the fixin's and was a sleeper hit. And of course the tacos were good - pay extra for the Hanger steak tacos. Totally worth it. 

Will definitely be back for more!
author: Marshall P.

description:
Came here for some drunchies and they were nice to keep the kitchen open for us! The guacamole was too aqueous and only lightly seasoned, but the tacos were good from what I could tell: I thought the chorizo and potatoes were delicious! 

This is a friendly and cozy place -- I'd like to come back for a full meal sometime!
author: Julia Y.

description:
It's good food but it's definitely overpriced for the quality so I probably would go somewhere else before coming back here.

My table got a margarita pitcher to share and some guacamole and queso to start. The margarita was good but not the best I've ever had. For future reference for others - we were a table of 5 and got about 3/4 of a smallish glass each. So I would say the pitcher best splits best with 4 people. The guacamole and queso were both also good but at a ridiculous $8 a piece I would not order them again.

Now for the tacos. I got 2 carnitas tacos, and a shot and beer braised chicken taco  because it sounded interesting. Don't be fooled by the name - it's just a normal chicken taco. But it was a good chicken taco I guess - not particularly memorable. The carnitas tacos were really good. Nice moist meat and well seasoned. Also these tacos look small but they are filling for sure. I guess they better be at $4/taco.

My total for the night ended up being $18. I think that's actually not too bad for SF. But I associate tacos with cheap street food. I don't mind fancy tacos but to me these were not better quality than street tacos. Probably 3.5 star quality food but the price brings it down to 3 stars.
author: Priyanka N.

description:
I've been looking forward to checking this place out because the vibe inside looks cool through the window. But today, the combination of music and voices made for a very raucous din that forced us to sit outside, even though the wind chill felt like 50 degrees.

The chicken colorado mole taco was good -- the sweetness and tangy-ness were an interesting combination. The hangar steak taco added $2 to the cost of the taco; I'm torn on whether I would order it again. The serving was two big chunks of rare steak, which made for a clumsy mouthful. My taco tore into a mess with my first bite, so I ended up eating the rest with a fork.

I don't remember cheese on either taco. When did we stop putting cheese on tacos?

As with most Mexican restaurants, there was plenty of chips and salsa. I would have preferred a chunkier, pico-style salsa with the chips.

The waiter was good, but I'd recommend the wait staff wear aprons or something. When the waiter first approached, he had no pad or apron -- just looked like someone in t-shirt and jeans coming to interrupt my conversation.

Two tacos + tip = $16 seems kinda steep, especially when little else added to the value.
author: Tony B.

description:
I've had Tacolicious in the past in Palo Alto and it didn't leave much of an impression, but coming to this SF Mission location definitely changed my tune!

Came here with coworkers after work and it was nice to be able to enjoy the sun and nice weather in the patio area. The margaritas were delicious - got the Margarita Fresca! 

But the real stars, as the name would suggest, were the tacos. Out of the ones I tried, the traditional carnitas stood out to me. In general, I love the simplicity of street taco styled tacos because the meat becomes the flavored star. Nice sweetness and texture of the protein. Add a little lime and salsa and you're good to go. GO CARNITAS!
author: Vincent L.

description:
Of the three items I used to consistently order here, one has disappeared off the menu (the pan con chocolat dessert) & one has completely changed for the worse (guacamole is no longer buttery & full of bite & deliciousness; it now tastes plain, has a thin consistency, & doesn't appear to be freshly prepared.) The shot-and-a-beer braised chicken taco still tastes amazing. For me, there is enough shredded chicken to get two tacos out of one order! Please don't change this item or I'll have no reason to come here at all. I've already lost my go-to dessert & guac, haven't I suffered enough? 

BTW, their micheladas are really good, made completely different every single time, but always made well.
author: Fancypants X.

description: Literally EVERY dish I tasted had fantastic flavor!!!  This place is amazing.  BD sure to taste all the hot sauces ;-)
author: K C.

description:
Tacos, salsa, chips and guacamole are all excellent.  Service is great and they have a large room in the back for parties.  

Definitely would come back.
author: Chris L.

description: We ordered tacos through door dash and shared with each other at work. The prices seem hefty but the tacos are filled with massive amounts of well seasoned meat and just enough spice. 2 tacos could easily fill you up, I ate 3 because of greed lol. Yum will recommend to others!
author: Kam H.

description:
Late night tacos are life right? So of course, I had to go try some upscale tacos that all my SF based friends rave about. The only thing they didn't warn me about though was the price. 10 TACOS FOR $40?! Let me go to a taco truck really quick and get the same amount for about half the price. 

My friend and I came in around 10:30PM on Saturday night and the place was popping. All the tables were filled and the bar was completely packed so we just got our tacos to go. We ordered the baja-style pacific cod, housemade chorizo with potatoes, guajillo-braised beef brisket, and traditional carnitas. I'll admit the tacos' meats were a lot better tasting than what I thought they'd be considering the tacos I've tried at other places. I especially enjoyed the briskets and the pacific cod. It was all fresh and melt in your mouth delicious but I don't think I would come back and spend another $40 just for tacos I can get for less than $2 each at other places. 

**Although we ordered our tacos to go, we just took our to-go bag and ate it in their patio seating area.**
author: Janise Q.

description: I went here this weekend with some non-vegan friends and we all were disappointed with our food.  The vegan options were SERIOUSLY lacking this time around too. I probably won't be back any time soon, sadly.
author: Christina M.

description:
Best Compliment ever, recieved on my review for Tacolicious: Krista/Kristi R. "Get over yourself. Yelp is just a white persons way of being a b@&$ without getting hit in person."

Thanks, gurl. I appreciate the constructive criticism from someone who uses a landromat as their profile pic.
author: Tara H.

description: Baja fish taco was ON POINT (I got it grilled). Huge portion of fish. Worth the $5. Happy hour specials are good and margaritas can be ordered w/ agave on the side. Perfect.
author: Sukhmani G.

description:
Yay for tacos! Unlike some people, they might think that Tacolicious isn't as authentic or even legit enough to be a taqueria. But to me, Tacolicious is great. Even without your typical menu of tacos, the tacos here are delicious and so rich in flavor! 

I've basically tried almost all of their tacos, including the braised beef, the fish, the chorizo, the squash/kale (vegetarian), and the chicken. I thought their menu was quite creative. Plus, the tacos here are very delicious! You can't really go wrong with this menu. I also love their drinks here as well. Lots of selection and also very strong. 

Overall, I do recommend this place. Although it's a little pricey than your usually taqueria, it is more of a sit-down place with drinks and such.
author: Wendy Y.

description:
There is no one around to seat you
The Customer service skill needs to improve
We were seated by a bus boy 
And the lady who seats people said it was wrong for him 
The lady said sorry you might have to wait another 20 minutes again
I brought this to the manager 
And she told me it was their fault 
She try to correct the mistakes around here
author: Kevin H.

description: Always a great service, fresh food, menu options for everyone (including vegetarian), good drinks, good portions.
author: Diane Q.

description:
Service is really bad I went there to pick up my order 
When I got there my order is not ready yet 
So I was trying to get the seat to wait for my order 
One worker came out n told me to wait outside 
There's only one customer in the store n I was wondering like why they don't let me wait inside the store
author: Chan H.

description: The food it's ok I can 6 tacos $19 at a tacorea they charge an arm and a leg just to eat there
author: Jose R.

description:
I like tacolicious. I really do but I'm just bored of their static menu now. They need to add either more variety or change the menu with some seasonal takes. It's the same exact menu from 3 years ago. 

I like the marina girl salad, the short rib tacos and their shredded chicken tacos. They're pretty good and the marina girl is a version of Caesar which is nicely balanced by a light dressing.
author: Rohan D.

description:
If you're looking for tacos with more unconventional fillings, this is the place for you. Tacolicious has a good variety of different tacos, they let you mix and match to create your own platter, and they give you a hefty amount of filling. The Baja-style cod was the standout for me since the fish had a very light batter on it, but I found the meat tacos to be a little dry. The salsa has a mint-y note to it that I wasn't a fan of as well, though I can't really complain since chips and salsa are on the house, haha. 

Like others have said, the service is spotty here. We, along with other tables, had difficulty flagging down our waitress to order, get the bill, etc. Because of this we didn't even bother asking someone to explain the accompanying sauces to us, and we didn't even try to replace the serving scoop that was missing from one of our sauces. My take away: come here for the hip ambiance, to experience tacos with a modern twist, oh and for that pretty instagram picture of your food ;)
author: Caralisa L.

description:
Tacolicious
SF Mission
6pm Wednesday 16th April 2015
Four Stars

We tried visiting Zeitgeist but they don't allow dogs on their patio so we walked down to Tacolicious in the Mission instead. We sat on the patio on this lovely day and yet they had the heaters going. The place was pretty packed and so the wait staff seemed a bit overwhelmed. We ordered some tequila and beer and it took a long while to get. The table behind who sat after we did and got their drinks and food before us. A different waitress took our order. Then original waitress tried to take our order. The guacamole looked small in the bowl but it was actually rather large for the two of us. The chips were too wonderful. 

The rest of the food came out relatively quickly. They put my short rib taco on the same plate as Sara's fish taco so definitely some meat cross contamination. Both tacos were great and thus the four star rating. The taco themselves were simple: warm double layer of corn tortillas filled respectively with beef, onion, and cilantro & fish, cabbage, and white sauce. The beef was juicy, tender, and packed with tastiness. The fish was crunchy in the outside and flaky on the inside. The yellow habanero-like sauce was muy spicy. The red molcajete salsa was my favorite. The consistency and depth of flavor was spot on. The green tomatillo salsa was decent. It took a while to get our check and run the credit card. 


Overall, great food, fun atmosphere, but lackluster service.
author: Leonard L.

description: I absolutely love Tacolicious. The food is delicious and the people are so friendly. It's always at the top of my list when people ask me for a recommendation. I'm a fan of the fish tacos and carnitas tacos. The tuna tostada is soooooo good. And the chips are fantastic. Don't fill up too much on them so you can leave room for more yummy treats. And their Tequila bar Mosto next door has an amazing selection. Go and enjoy!!! You can thank me later
author: Josh Z.

description:
Came here because of the great reviews.

Severely disappointed.

The service was poor, even though the restaurant wasn't that busy.  We were able to be seated right away, but then had to wait forever for anyone to even come by with some water.  The food, while some of the choices were creative, is quite limited and the portions are small considering the price you have to pay.

Not sure why everyone seems to love this place.  I know I'll probably never go back.
author: Jes G.

description:
My friend and I came here on a Taco Tuesday.

6 DIY tacos for $18 and the house margarita for $6

IMO that's still pretty pricey for a Taco Tuesday but everything was delicious! Thoroughly enjoyed my drink and the tacos plus had great company.

My friend also ordered the passionfruit margarita for $12 and it was really good. It had a sweet beginning, a spicy tang/kick in the middle and great finish. 

Service is super nice and friendly too. (always a plus)
author: Mimi T.

description:
This place was great. Margaritas were amazing. Brussel sprouts appetizer was great too. 

The power went out and their receipt thing stopped working. Management comped the whole meal for us for the inconvenience. The bussers and wait staff were pretty good too.
author: Robert S.

description: Amazing tacos. I am in love. Nikki was great. Ask for her to be your server. She's awesome and funny. Service was amazing and so was the food !!!! Shout out to Nikki for real
author: Sanaz T.

description: The food is really good! The atmosphere is a little crazy. They've always got really loud, often disharmonious music playing which can be a little stressful when eating. But we keep going back becase the tacos are A+!
author: Urban S.

description: Excellent selection of gluten free items, chips were safe/not contaminated, Brussels were fantastic, tacos were my fave. Came with trio of salsas. Awesome service, sat outside under heat lamps. The Mia iced tea guava lime drink was out of this world good. Had a great time!
author: Katie B.

description: We ordered from door dash, and although occasionally we received food col, never hve we had issues with other restaurants lacking food quality and a hair in their food! Not to mention skirt steak tacos with not even a little salt and pepper!? I know noncooks that could make a better taco than this! Not to mention a hair was in one of the tacos. And the food prep was the worse I've seen. Two orders in one container and then the hair! Never have i been so diaspointed in food prep. I will be sure to tell loys of people to not order from here ever! Its not door dash fault at all. It tells me this place is only concerned with the money. Oh eait ans $7 for these tasteless tacos that i tossed!? I pay $3 for a better quality taco in my local taqueria and have never found hair in it! This is a place making a killing with people who have never eaten american mexican food from other places here who don't have a clue.
author: Lisa A.

description: Sarah is amazing! And those carnitas tacos are delectable. I will definitely come back the next time I'm in town.
author: Larry S.

description:
How have I spent YEARS of my life in the Mission and never wandered into Tacolicious? Frankly, I always thought it was attached to the pizza place next to it. Easy to walk by. But don't! Instead, venture in.

My office hosted an event here recently. Don't be fooled by the close quarters in the front of house--there's a huge back room that can accommodate something like 50 people. 

Beware--the drinks are stiff. The house marg is a great staple and the habañero marg was spicy and delicious. 

Great tacos, queso, and guac. Will definitely be back. Staff was awesome, too.

The good: great food, great space.
The bad: one of our bowls of queso was kind of off, but whatever. The second one made up for it. :D
author: Amanda B.

description: Been here a few times and it's never been great but today was exceptionally bad. We went in for a few happy hour items and sat at a table in the middle, we were "greeted" by one server who threw down the menus and then abruptly walked away. We waited for about 10 minutes for some stale bits of crushed chip to arrive from another woman, then another 5 minutes for a different server who asked if we'd been helped and then proceeded to take our order which was a couple of happy hour tacos, some guacamole and 2 margaritas. Another few minutes and the original server who greeted us comes up and asks if we're ready to order.. we replied that we already had but we were sorry if we were supposed to order from him, he said absolutely nothing, looked visibly agitated, grabbed our menus and oddly stormed away.. We shook it off as a miscommunication and continued to wait for our order. It took another 15-20 minutes for even the guacamole to make it out, no margaritas yet, then the tacos arrived and were so pitifully constructed, the generic square plastic cheese they used hadn't melted all the way. After getting through our less than satisfying tacos and half the guac we still had not received our drinks so we asked the second server if they were still coming and 5 minutes later finally received them. Though they were more of a post meal drink, they were delicious however we were in a bit of a hurry so at that point we had to basically chug them and try to flag someone down for the check. 10 minutes later we are forced to ask the original rude server bc he was the only one we could find and he once again looked obviously irritated, responded with a "sure" and abrasive lot grabbed the plates on our table without asking if we were finished. We waited another 5 to receive our check when we handed him the card preemptively and he stormed off again... I realize this is perhaps too much detail but it was a truly uncomfortable and mostly unenjoyable experience I thought I'd share..
author: Savanna B.

description:
So my wife and I are moving to Austin, TX. We decided to keep our going away party simple and have dinner here. I called on Thursday to make a reservation for a party of 15 on Sunday at 8 (post dinner rush hours). I explained that we didn't want to do their prix fixed menu, because we would prefer to order off of the main menu. The gentleman on the phone said that we could just do a walk in on Sunday and they will accommodate us. I also had an email exchange with a Brielle about us walking in, and she said "Sounds good! We look forward to having you." We show up, and almost immediately get turned away. Mind you, it's pouring rain and freezing outside, so I basically told the host to try again, because I was told otherwise. Thankfully they said they would "set us up in the back". Said back was FREEZING! They only set us up for about 10, so I ended up connecting the tables together and setting up myself. The bar was rude and never so much as acknowledged us the TWO TIMES we stood in front of them. My friends food never came out despite having told the waitress that he was skipped up. The tacos are almost $5 a piece and not at all worth it! My tortillas were cold, the meat was dry and stringy, and resembled your average street taco. I've had way better tacos for $1 out of a mom and pop food truck! We spent almost $600 and they refused to split the check not even once. No one was ever rude from my party and we ate and drank merrily in honor of our departure- without a single complaint. However, on our way out my wife and I said thank you, and I heard one of the male staff sarcastically say "Thanks for calling!" And I walked back and told them that whomever said that was extremely rude! We could've easily spent our money elsewhere, and we should've. Thankfully for my wonderful chosen family we had a great time despite the horrible service and mediocre overpriced food. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TACO DOLLARS HERE. 

One last thing... My friend who never got his food- I accommodated to the taco shop down the street, where he devoured his hot juicy tacos quickly while I watched in envy to the tune of $8. Be ashamed of yourselves. You all suck.
author: Toa T.

description:
I never thought I'd be partial to tacos, but Tacolicious has definitely changed my opinion on this popular dish. And even if you like tacos already, you can always stay for the thumping music and the framed picture of former President Barack Obama enjoying a fresh taco. Personally, I recommend the Braised Beef Short Rib taco, as well as the House-Made Chorizo and potatoes. For drinks, definitely try the Fillmore Paloma and Pasion margarita. 
This restaurant is definitely a must for native San Franciscans, tourists or anyone who just loves a fresh taco.
author: Leah C.

description: Delicious food, but a bit pricey. This is an evening hotspot that's regularly stuffed and has a wait. It gets kinda loud and the service is extremely mediocre. But, they hit hard with the food.
author: Brian B.

description:
Last week I was walking along Valencia with my friend after I got a tattoo a few blocks away at Scholar Tattoo. We were feeling rather ravenous and had planned to eat at Cha-Ya until we discovered that they were closed :( time for a backup plan! We looked across the street at Tacolicious and said hey let's check it out.

We didn't realize that the nice looking restaurant across the street was Tacolicious until we received our menus. I was very excited because I had heard great things about the food. This past summer I attempted to try the tacos at Outside Lands, but they were sold out! Sad times. Anyways, the two of us shared an order of four tacos (two each) and a kale salad. I had a butternut squash and a chicken mole, while my friend went with a butternut squash and cod. We both loved the salad and enjoyed our tacos. We agreed that our least favorite was the butternut squash, perhaps it was too spicy for our taste? I generally love squash so I was a bit surprised that it was our least favorite. We also ordered cocktails because a celebratory drink was needed (not sure if that is recommended post tattoo though haha.) Overall everything was delicious!

I'm so happy that we ended up wandering into Tacolicious. I loved the food and I will definitely return and possibly venture off to explore their other locations. They have loads of options whether you are vegan, veg, gluten free, etc. If you decide to give them a try I highly recommend the kale salad, which was my favorite dish of the evening, and chicken/cod tacos. I can't wait to return!
author: Rachel S.

description:
Obviously, internal Tacolicious issues. Please credit back the $48.00 to my debit card , Kate. Extremely poor experience.

Do not worry, I am not coming back to any locations nor to Tacolicious in general.

I will expect the CREDIT today, Day 3 of this ongoing nightmare. I am sure the owners WOULD NOT MIND reversing the charges to my credit card due to a nightmarish experience.

Michael 
SF local resident of over 35 years
author: Mickey C.

description:
3.5 stars

After reading the reviews here, I was torn on what to expect.  The photos did look very appetizing tho!

Arrived on a Saturday night for a party of 4. We wanted to wait for a table inside and the wait was probably about 20-25 minutes. We were seated towards the back. All the tables are quite close together and it is very warm and loud inside.

We started off with the free chips and salsa while trying to decide on which tacos to get.

We decided to get 2 plates of 10. (in order of preference.)
-Beef short rib (yum-o!! So tasty/flavorful and juicy)
-Traditional carnitas  (very good, not dry at all)
-House made chorizo (on the salty side)
-Pacific cod (least favorite... I guess compared to the others, there wasn't very much taste)

We also ordered the plantains and a side of beans. Didn't remember much about it.
For desert,  we tried the churros. They were just okay. The dipping sauce they came with was kinda grainy and reminded me of Nestle Quick mix. It should have been smooth and creamy, in my opinion.

Our table also went thru 3 pitchers of margaritas. It was a little on the pricey side, but after consuming all the savory meats, a cold margarita paired well with the food.

I loved the green sauce they served (as I do at any Mexican joint that serves it) and could have probably used at least a few more servings of it.

Overall, I agree with some of the reviews in that it's overpriced. Nice place for a date night though.
author: Mimie L.

description:
They really got it right with the food, but the service was really lacking. They don't have very many tables that can accommodate a large party with high chairs. So we were seated in a large booth and kind of had to trap the 2 toddlers in between adults. (No booster seats either) I understand the area is not exactly filled with families and children so I get that not every restaurant is going to have accommodations for children. 

So it takes about 5 minutes for the server to come up to us once we are seated, no big deal, large parties usually take a while to get situated. She approaches the table with a blank stare and says "what do you want to drink?" Very unfriendly and appeared to be annoyed right off the bat. After taking our order she disappears until the end of our meal. No one pre bussed the table and we had plates all over the table and I had to stop a hostess and ask her to take the stack of plates off our table before we accidentally knocked them to the ground.

The server also says they do not split checks... That's extremely annoying and incredibly presumptuous to assume someone will always pay for everyone.
I found out that they are willing to split the amount on different credit cards but they won't split the actual items on separate checks... causing the party to have to figure out prices, tax, fees, for each bill. Incredibly obnoxious because I could see they were using Aloha, a system that EASILY allows for splitting checks. So either our waitress was just lazy or they actually have a ridiculous rule that they aren't allowed to split checks for large parties even though their system allows for it...either way, bad customer service.

The food was great.  Tuna Tostada was awesome. The house salsa has mint in it, different but good. The house margarita was not too sweet- very refreshing.

If you're a party of more than 2 and you have a child with you, skip this place.

Even though the food was good, I still won't return, they don't seem to care about accommodating large parties or children.
author: Sarah L.

description: Love this place. Always my go to. I know I can get cheap tacos from any Mexican joint, but this place has a cool vibe, good drinks and I enjoy it. The chiliquiles on the weekend, is bombbbb. With a good stiff Margarita, you can't go wrong. Parking sucks though, but where doesn't it in SF...
author: Katherine R.

description: We had Tacolicious cater our wedding reception and it was absolutely perfect! We worked with Kirby and she was so wonderful and responsive throughout he whole process. Since we had our reception at a different bar in the city, Kirby met with the other manager to work out all the details and make sure everything went off without a hitch. The day of I had nothing to worry about because I knew Kirby had it covered. Our guests raved about the food, everything we picked was a hit! We couldn't be happier with our choice of caterer and how we were treated throughout the planning process. Thank you Kirby and the Tacolicious team for making our wedding reception so delicious! :)
author: Denae D.

description:
the photos of the food caught our attention. 
The pork taco was very greasy. The oil soaked through the two corn tortillas. 

The ambience I got was very off putting.

The waitresses didn't seem happy or enthused. 

And, yeah. 

Never again.
author: Lauren J.

description:
Yum! The Pacific Cod taco is one you cannot pass up. Horchata is good too. And don't leave until you have some churros con chocolate.

-1 star for the expensive prices. Other than that, it is a delicious restaurant with a very nice ambience.
author: Stephanie P.

description: I've been to this place many times. Today was so awful I had to leave a note. Ordered carne asada taco, paid extra. Meat all fat & gristle. Marina Girl salad- really? The chicken on the salad was small burnt pieces of thigh meat. Price? $17.00 Never got the side of beans so that saved $7.50. No one said "I'm sorry". Asked for adjustments to check for never-received beans and returned hunks of fat. Got the reduction and got out. Never going back.
author: Marcy F.

description:
This place is certainly Tacoooolicious from the inside to the outside. Located in the Mission along Valencia, Tacolicious is surrounded by yummy food options. My group was craving tacos so we decided to try the renowned Tacolicious to see what all the hype was about.

We waited for about 40 minutes to get our table and were finally seated at about 6:45PM ... boy were we ready for some grub! We were seated outside on the patio, which we were worried would be too cold. The hostesses, being so gracious, turned on the heaters for us and made it just perfect! 

To start, every table is served unlimited chips and salsa, which we inhaled. The nacho chips were fresh and warm and the salsa tasted just right! Being inspired by the chips and salsa, we decided to order some guacamole as well, which we all loved! For our tacos, we had the chicken taco, the braised beef and the carnitas. I had no complaints about any of them. My favorite was the carnitas! 

The reason I am not giving Tacolicious 5 stars is because of our server. The hostesses were great but our server seemed to be very very unhappy with her job. We asked for several things (ice, water, lime, diet coke) - none of which we received. We had to end up asking other servers to bring it for us. Perhaps she was just having a bad day, ill give her the benefit of the doubt because otherwise we had an enjoyable experience sitting out on the Tacolicious patio!
author: Aletta B.

description:
It was Cinco de Mayo of this year, and we were wandering around the Mission district trying to find a good taco place. All of a sudden, like a miracle, we stumble across this place. We got a table right away, the tree of is split a pitcher of margaritas and ten tacos. Their salsas and hot sauces were incredible, and their service was awesome. The atmosphere was definitely hip and fresh. I enjoyed every moment of my time there. 

My only issue, an issue I have with most places in San Fransisco, was the price. Incredibly expensive as usual but what can you expect? All in all a great place!
author: Alex C.

description: On my most recent visit to San Francisco, it seemed like I was obsessed with tacos so a visit to Tacolicious was in order. It is the sort of place on Valencia Street that I would walk by without noticing but every time that I have been there it has been packed out. I always get 3 carnitas and wash them down with the T-Lish lager, they also have unlimited chips and salsa so I come away feeling full.
author: Matt B.

description:
Hostess or Host leaves much to be desired . Service wise , it could be better , I guess with more then couple branches,  they would have had already figured out the seating arrangement of guests. We got in and looking for someone,  anyone to seek a place to eat or seat. Five minutes looking like a fish out of water , , do I grab a seat or wait to be seated . Five minutes we  waiting in the middle the space , comes in an overworked Hostess,  asking us how many we were, and I said 2, and we saw a table that was unoccupied,  however needs to be clean as plates and glasses were still there. She asks us to wait while she finds someone to clear the table
Mind you this is a Snack place , with drinks,  and tacos and bar , not a full fledged Mexican resturant.  And we were seated and less then a minutes they came to get our order., hello.. I barely had time to look at the paper menu, so we ask her to come back in few minutes.  We order a meatball on a bowl , and we kind of thought a nice size meatball would arrive,  heck no..
3 tiny meatball for the price , really..and we order 4 tacos , and I ordered steak, and Baja fish, while my guy ordered pork and chicken. 
Do we go back,  no.. I know better places for tacos for fraction of cost and more authentic,  however the steak taco was really good.
author: Liz S.

description: The food is mediocre for the price, which is on the pricy side in my opinion.
