I understand this is in the city so higher prices should be expected, but at the same time nothing sets it apart from authentic tacos aside from decor and atmosphere. You'll definitely find a more sophisticated and upscale crowd here compared to a taqueria a few blocks down, but don't expect the food to blow you away.
author: Catherine L.

description: They call it Tacolicious for a reason! The tacos are full of flavor and worth every penny. So many margs to chose from and all are great. While there might be a wait, you are in the Mission so go walk around and they will text you when your table is ready.
author: Laurisha C.

description:
First of all. The service here is GREAT. They do a great job in refilling your chips and salsa, did not once have to ask for a refill on anything. 

The tacos:
In general, the tacos are a bit pricey, 4 for $14, but it is in SF and the portion of meat was generous. 
The Braised Chicken was a bit dry, but the salsa provided was great, so it wasn't a big deal. Make sure to order the Beef Short Rib, it was FIRE! 

Appetizer:
Empanadas were really good, the texture of the bread was on point. It was 2 for $10.95. I would say just get 3 more tacos. But if you're satisfied on the tacos, definitely give this a try. 

P.S. Loud indoors, would much prefer outdoor seating if it is not cold.
author: Paul S.

description:
Nice atmosphere especially the outside seating, if you are lucky enough to get a table.  I will not sit inside when it is busy because of the cacophony of noises makes it almost impossible to hear someone sitting across the table.  
There's a bar inside with a tv, mostly tables for smaller parties.  The menu is Mexican food tailored for gringos.  Frankly, I think the tacos are overcharged, you can go to most local taquerias in the Mission and get something more satisfying to the tastebuds and wallet, but you are paying for the environment as well.  The kale salad is good and I love the empanadas. 
The margarita selection is definitely worth checking this place out.

Tip: More for a fun night out with friends, good for cocktails, casual date...not a romantic place.

On a final note, my company has had the Xmas party there the past 2 years and I have a complaint about this year.  For a group of 30 + there was only one sever for drinks and food.. there wasn't even another person to help him bring the food out, makes no sense to me.  It was hard to get his attention for request and we had to wait a long time for our food.  There were many other issues, but that was by far the most annoying.

The bottom line is this is great place for a light bite, yummy chips in a fun and lively atmosphere with mediocre semi Mexican/hipster cuisine. Better to come on the off hours.  Weekends are insane and parking is hard.
author: Molly M.

description: Very disappointing experience. Upon arrival I noticed that the restaurant wasn't that busy, still nobody working at the floor acknowledged our existence. My nieces and I just stand there for 5 minutes until we decided to sit ourselves at a dirty table. After a while somebody came to clean it up, and it took another 20 minutes for the waiter to come take our order. The only reason we stayed was because I had paid almost 10 dollars for street parking for 1 and a half hours. The food wasn't great either,  the chicken tacos were left untouched, after the first  bite. Nobody at the table wanted to eat it them. The waitress was one of the worse, super unfriendly, arrogant, and not welcoming at all. He never came to check on us, and the whole time he was acting as if he didn't want us there. I'm not sure we were treated this way, we were all very nice to him and treated him with respect,  but I guess he was too arrogant to care. I certainly do not think it was worth the money. The bill came out to be $100.00 for a few tacos, for a table of 4, and not everybody ordered drinks. I will certainly not be back. There are plenty of other places near by, that offer great quality food and will treat you with more respect than this place.
author: Juliana D.

description:
Review is for the food. It's simply bad. I've tried Chesnut and Valencia and both offered the same: $1 quality taco from a cheap taco Tuesday for high level restaurant price.
To be fair the margarita was good and service in 1 out of two occasions was fast and kind. But really, the food, just nope
Go across the street and check Bonita instead if you're in Chesnut, and if you're in Valencia just go anywhere (literally anywhere else) in the mission.
author: Mayara A.

description: Good food. Good drinks. Bad service. Came here today for lunch around 2:30pm and it was one of the HOTTEST days so far in San Francisco this year. This place was boiling hot and the restaurant is completely ill-equipped to handle hot weather. There are absolutely no fans or air conditioning inside or outside and all of the staff were hot and sweaty as was I and everyone else there. Upon entering there was no one at the front to seat us so we waited for about 5 minutes or so for someone to walk over. We asked to sit outside and were told there would be a wait because the tables needed to be cleaned even though there were 2 available empty tables outside. The girl left and we waited for another 10 minutes to be seated at one of the same tables we noticed were already empty and clean. We waited another 15 mins or so for chips/salsa and to place our orders. We had to ask for ice for the warm water that was on our table and another 30 minutes for the check after I flagged down ANOTHER waitress for it. The margaritas, braised beef and chicken tacos were very good as was the rice and refried beans we ordered.
author: Andreea M.

description:
I'm so glad me, my sister and her bf ate here for lunch the other day. I was always curious to see what Tacolicious was like? My experience was actually great!

We ordered an assortment of ten tacos with the works for about $40. It is a bit pricey but each taco really is worth it. The quality of the meat and ingredients is up there; it's fresh, colorful, clean, and tasty. My two favorites were the original carnitas and the filet mignon with grilled onions. These were no joke. The carnitas were tender, easy, and has that traditional taste. The filet mignon taco was outrageous! there had to be at least 5-6 cubes of thick steak in one taco. The steak was cooked medium rare and was super juicy.

The complimentary chips were great tasting too. I think the chips were whole grain tortillas with pinches of sea salt on top. The salsa was spicy & sweet at the same time due to the mango blend inside. 

Overall, I had a great experience. It was a sunny day in the early noon, lots of people dining in and eating outside, imported beer and taco pairing, etc.. couldn't beat it! These tacos were delicious! I'd def come back!
author: Allister D.

description:
I put our name down for a group of 6 around 6:20pm on a Friday night, expecting a 2 hour wait and planning for everyone to be there around 8pm (I live just a couple blocks away). The expected wait was 45 minutes, and I was definitely putting our name down way too early, but they told me to just check in when everyone got there so I figured it would work out well.

Well, our group started arriving at 8pm and we didn't get sat until around 8:40pm! Everyone had had at least one drink while hanging out next door at Mosto. They gave us the long table along the window at the very front, which was a table for 8 (so it was too much space). I guess the lesson is it's going to be a wait no matter what for a large group - it's a small space and seems to be mostly set up for smaller groups.

They are super busy so the service was mixed, between kind of rushing us to make an order, and when we weren't ready immediately, not taking our order for a long time. But in the end we got our dinner, our beers, and my glass of water became empty but I had other glasses at the table to pawn off. 

I tried the:
* Fried Plantains - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tacolicious-san-francisco-7?select=UCPEf4mcmkrw0fXwKP1SqA#iWAG3VdLuMbwiV-SzIq5fw
Tasty! The plantains were very soft and sweet, and the mixture of 2 layers of dip it was sitting in (I think sour cream and refried bean paste of some sort) were a great combo.

* Fish taco - 4 stars
Probably one of their best ones! You get a huge piece of cod, and the breading is very lightly crisped. The meat is chunky and hearty. Good, simple quality. 

* Potato Chorizo taco - 3 stars
I was excited to try this after gone with the veggie taco over this one last time (and regretted it). However, besides the fact that this one has meat, it's not all that amazing. There was very little meat compared to all their other tacos, and it's a bit too salty. I also found the chorizo to be overcooked and hard, almost crisped to a point that you couldn't really taste the meat itself.

Fish + Potato Chorizo tacos: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tacolicious-san-francisco-7?select=UCPEf4mcmkrw0fXwKP1SqA#UCPEf4mcmkrw0fXwKP1SqA

* Braised Beer Chicken - 3 stars
I tried a bite of this and thought it was pretty good pulled chicken, but it was drenched too much in sauce. I like really tasting the texture of the chicken so this wasn't for me!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Came here the other night for dinner with some friends. The ambiance and decor here is nice. We were greeted by the hostess who told us that the wait for a table of 5 would be 30 mins. So we left our number and just walked to kill some time. Not even 20 mins had passed and we already got a call that our table was ready. Sweet! I love how the tortilla chips and salsa are refillable but those things are soooo filling! I was so hungry, I had no shame stuffing my face with those until the tacos came. Unfortunately, I overestimated my stomach's capacity....because I got full quick. 
We definitely ordered way too much for 5 people. We ordered 20 tacos: 5 traditional carnitas, 5 pacific cod, 5 guajillo braised beef short rib, and 5 chicken en mole colorado. I was only able to finish 2 tacos there and bring the other 2 home for later....but I have to say it was delicious!!! The salsas were so good, I really liked the green one. The yellow one was so spicy that it lingered in my mouth for awhile. You don't mess with the yellow salsa...lol! 
Our server was great and she was very attentive. I would have to say this place is a little pricey though, but you do get what you pay for! The meat on all the tacos were juicy and full of flavor and they do not skimp on the portions at all! 
I'm glad that I was able to try this place out and I'll probably be back if I'm ever in the area!
author: Coco L.

description:
As an urban experience, Tacolicious is pretty terrific.  As a food and service experience, not so much.

This vibrant, bustling urban taco shop in the heart of Valencia has a beautiful interior and exterior (cafe seating) lots of attractive waitresses and clientele, sleepy urban dogs tethered outside and on average a half hour wait (you'll be told 15 minutes, but count on it being longer).  It's a Mission destination, and it's pretty hard not to want to stop here when you walk by and see the frenetic activity.  The line seems to tell you this is a spot worth waiting for.

However, we found the tacos just a-okay. The more creative offerings being their short rib taco (stewed and tender but heavy) and a homey chorizo and potato taco. While I agree, there is something perfect about a business focused on bread and meat, the thing about Tacolicious is the product doesn't really live up to expectations.  

We found the tacos small and importantly the tortillas they are served on really do not taste freshmade, which could make a big difference when a product contains so few ingredients. (The good news is that the complementary chips and salsa do, thankfully.)  The ingredients inside their various tacos (with the exception maybe of the short rib) are fairly straight forward and uninspired. For example, my special of the day shrimp taco had a nice sauce but the shrimp were small and tasted fishy. The fish taco was missing that something something, e.g. more creative toppings or the perfect sauce. All tacos are about $5, which is a bit steep for a tiny taco in the Mission, where tacos are otherwise pretty much falling from the sky. Service-wise too our experience was fairly chaotic, with several dishes not arriving, (as in "your order went into the kitchen and did not come out out alive") and a server rarely being around after something didn't show up at the table.  We had to ask to get what we needed, so we made friends with the busboys, who helped us sort out our dishes. Well, eventually.

Sure, the vibe is urban fabulous. Its a see and be scene taco spot, and there's nothing wrong with that. It's just that foodwise and service wise, it can be a bumpy ride.
author: Rachel H.

description:
I've always wanted to try this but never in the area. Finally got to try this place when my cousins from socal came to visit sf and wanted to try this place too. 

You can easily pass this restaurant since the restaurant name isn't place outside of the building, only the taco symbol. As you start walking to the door, you can see people sitting outdoor, i assume people could outdoor too. But my cousins and i just sat inside...high wooden tables and high chairs. Its has bar and can see the cookers cooking your food from where you are sitting

As i was looking, all the food choices look really good. Prices on the tacos are base on how many tacos you eat and if you go in group which are: 1 taco is $3.95, 4 tacos are $14, and 10 tacos are $33. Of course that your typical restaurant price which is a pricier than the food truck. They do give you chips and salsa before your food comes out.

Decided to get the traditional carnitas and braise bbq beef (you would definitely need a lot of napkin for the braise beef since it has a lot of sauce in the taco and a bit oily as well). The tortilla of the taco was dry. It has a lot of flavor. It can get you full depending how many tacos you get. There are three type of sauces to go with your tacos but forgot the name, only remember the color: yellow(has that tangy spiciness to), and the red and green are more sweeter and mild flavor sauce.

Friendly staff. But it took them a while to bring our food since it was busy. Since this place tend to get busy, you'll definitely have to wait. It would be better if you go with 4 people or less or else you would wait a long for a table.
author: Julie N.

description: I unabashedly LOVE this place.  We were looking for a restaurant with a private room to have a small gathering of friends, and Tacolicious far exceeded all of our expectations.  The staff is superb, the space is awesome, and the food is amazing.  The Mission location has a wonderful space in the back of the restaurant, with lots of natural light, and privacy.  I had actually considered entertaining our guests at our home, but now that I know this place exists, I will have all my parties there!  I rolled up on the morning of our party, added a few decorations, and boom, acted like a guest for the rest of the day.  All our guests complimented the tasty menu, and everyone had a blast.  Especially me, since I didn't have to stress out about a single thing!
author: Jasmine P.

description: Went for Taco Tuesday. The margaritas were very good. I am not a fan of ground beef tacos but since I had already ordered the $6 margarita, I still went with the beef tacos - 6 for $15 (the deals go hand in hand after happy hour. Otherwise you're stuck paying the full price for the drink - $11.50). Absolutely disliked the beef tacos... but not necessarily reflective of the restaurant. Even though I've had really delicious beef tacos before (Blockheads in NYC). My friend got a fish taco and that looked delicious. But their prices for tacos (about $5 for 1, $18 for 3-4) is ridiculous. So being poor af, I wasn't going to get anything but the special. Let's just I'll never do that again at tacolicious, but I'd still be willing to go back to try the rest of their menu.
author: Vanessa D.

description:
I came here last Friday with a group of 8 around 7:30pm. They said that it would be over an hour wait, but it ended up being about 40 minutes. Overall, the food and drinks were tasty, and service was great. I would definitely come here again. The tacos looked quite small, but they were actually pretty filling (lots of meat). Be sure to add some of the salsa that comes on the side!

Chile con Queso (2/5) - Pretty meh. Too salty and dense.

Short Rib Taco (4.5/5) - Perfectly tender with heaping meat portion

Carnitas Taco (3.5/5) - Nice flavor, but the meat was dry.

Buffalo Fried Chicken Taco (Taco of the week) (4/5) Spicier than I was expecting, but still good. It was a mess to eat but satisfying.

Margarita Fresca (4/5) - Fruity and refreshing

We also had another margarita that I think had hatch chilis in it, but I can't remember the name. It was an odd taste/kick in a drink for me. (3/5)
author: Cynthia M.

description:
It was OK.

There was no wait on a hot Sunday afternoon so we sat outside, which was very nice. Our server was very prompt and friendly.

Her fish taco was great. I think it was salmon and she would only share one bite. It was marvelous. She also had a pineapple drink which was excellent. If we would have both decided to get her lunch, this would be a solid four star review. Unfortunately, I decided to get something much less tasty.

I tried the Carnitas tacos which according to the hundreds of other reviews is the thing to get. Unfortunately, not for me. The meat was so dry that had it not been for the marvelous sauce it was so perfectly coated in, it would have been uneatable. 

The food here might be OK overall but I won't be rushing back because my lunch was so bad and the hipster vibe is so overwhelming. I might have been able to move beyond the bad taco and try again sooner but this is the kind of place that is too cool for it's own good. I give it five years and no one will care.
author: Justin S.

description:
If you are in the Mission area you might be overwhelmed with options for great Latin food. I chose Tacolicious due to it's Yelp rating and I was not disappointed! Amazing tacos with so much flavor. The carnitas was some of the best I've had. The guacamole was perfection and my margarita fresca was on point. I would highly recommend this as a food stop in SF.  
Its not the cheapest place but worth every penny. Go hungry! 

Seating is extremely close to other patrons so make friends.
author: Lindsey T.

description:
It's pretty pathetic when the kitchen can't prepare a to-go order of *only* queso dip chips & salsa (none of which is made to order but merely slopped into containers) 40 minutes after calling it in.

I've eaten here dozens of times but the ridiculous to-go order plus the surly-ish bartender and the very average tacos are a huge turnoff.
author: Emily T.

description:
We came here as part of our food tour with Avitol -- great little fried cod taco and two shots. The passione shot was so spicy that we were too wimpy to enjoy it. The lemonade shot was delicious! 

Solid fried fish taco, not too oily. Batter could've been a little crispier though, maybe they had been waiting for us for a little too long! I appreciate the tart purple cabbage on top, and the green salsa was a good accompaniment.
author: Dominic W.

description:
Tacos A+. Beans & Rice A. 
Hostess & seating C. 
Plastic garbage in the salsa D. 
Server B+.  Bartender/drinks B-
Ambiance was amazing. I give Tacolicious a "3" because I think they rely too heavily on their main dishes and leave much to be desired with their service & attentiveness. Side Note: 50% of their female staff have their bra showing and/or long hair down. At one point I witnessed one of their male servers running through the food line while sneezing. Hmm. I might return. TBD.
author: Jason S.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here around 7:30 on a Wednesday night thinking we would eat some yummy tacos and be out in around half an hour... WRONG! The wait was estimated to be an hour long, hahaha. I guess we knew it was a popular place, but we didn't realize it was this popular!!

Fortunately we only ended up waiting around half an hour, and got seated outside instead. The hostess seemed a little confused, which we were pretty put off by. Especially because she seated a party of 6 before our party of 2... Hmmm. 

We ordered 8 tacos (4 tacos/$17.95, so 8 tacos/$36) and the chips and salsa came out first (free refills!!!). The tacos came out after a couple minutes, presented beautifully of course!! We were excited to dig in.. and also realized how many tacos we just ordered! Good thing we didn't order 10, lol.

- 2 Baja style pacific cod: Delicious!! Although the piece of fish was rather small, this was my bf's favorite and one of mine as well. The fish was fried perfectly!
- Shot and a beer braised chicken: You can definitely taste the alcohol in this! A little too dry for me and my bf though.
- House made chorizo and potatoes: I liked the flavor from the chorizo, but this meat was also a little dry.
- Traditional carnitas: My favorite of the night!! Definitely underrated next to the braised short rib. I wondered why everyone raved about this one because it didn't seem too special, but now I see why!
- 2 Guajillo braised beef short rib: Very heavy and probably had the largest amount of meat on there! Really flavorful and the meat was tender and juicy.
- Filet mignon (add $3): Not worth it, in my bf's and my opinion. Came with 3 chewy pieces of filet mignon and we were not impressed, especially after paying an extra $3 for it.

Loved the green avocado salsa and the brown tomato-based salsa that came with the tacos, but that yellow one was crazy spicy!! I only licked the spoon and my mouth was on fire... lol!!!

It was around $50 for our whole meal, which is pretty pricey for tacos... Although we were super full and definitely in a food coma afterwards!!
author: Tara A.

description:
When it's 90 degrees outside and you want to have a casual dinner outside, there are strangely a limited number of options but Tacolicious is money in this situation. There's a "side patio" of sorts that has about 10 tables for outdoor dining but they fill up quickly. Alternatively, there are seats by the bar that open up to big windows facing the street.

I have one word for you: queso. I can't eat queso every day or even every week but sometimes, a girl just has to have her queso. The queso is delicious and the serving size is appropriate for a party of four...not two. We also wanted to get the guacamole but there was no way that was going to happen if we wanted to eat tacos also. 

I had the fish and carnitas tacos. I love love love fish tacos though am generally more partial to grilled fish (Tacolicious has deep fried fish). There was a lot of breading around the fish so the flavor of the fish got a bit lost. The taco was also on the dry side because there was a paltry amount of creamy sauce. The carnitas taco was better - tender, flavorful chunks of pork. 

Oh and margaritas. Yasss, margaritas.
author: Wendy L.

description:
4 Stars for the food and the overall experience. They do a pretty good job with their food though I would love to see more seasonal changes in the menu. Their service is OK but it's definitely not bad. I don't expect more except it would be nice to get a little more attention. 

The carnitas are great and I really like their short rib tacos which is a nice burst of flavor. The albacore tuna is also really well made and the fish is high quality and fresh. It's nice on a sunny day or when you want to keep it light. The marina girl salad is also a nice version of the Caesar salad.

All in all, I recommend this place for anyone that wants good Cali-mexican food and this place is affordable.
author: Sean K.

description:
I've been to tacolicious twice before (Chestnut & Valencia). I remembered tacolicious being frikkkkkkin amazing the first two times I've had it..

Unfortunately, I came last night with one of my girlfriends. I really hate to say that I was a quite disappointed with tacolicious and I don't think I'll be coming back anytime soon. 

Ugh, our food took forever to come. The two tables next to us got seated after we did and somehow got all of their food before us? Our server said it was a very busy night, the steak takes longer to cook, and is also taking longer because we had special requests. All we requested for was no cilantro on my friend's food because she's allergic. It can't take that much longer to NOT put cilantro on top of her tacos, can it?? I also asked for guac way in the beginning and that never came so I had to ask for it a second time. 

In all honesty, the food was just okay. It wasn't like my first two experiences.. Some of the meats were very very oily and not much flavor. It was definitely not worth 80 bucks for 10 tacos, guac, and only one drink! It's bizarre when I think about it.

The cherry on top, our server could not figure out the bill for the life of her. She was so frustrated that she had to hand it over to another worker so he can deal with it. We were charged for things that we shouldn't have been charged, etc... The guy who ended helping us with our bill comp'd a couple things but not really since we shouldn't have been charged for those things in the first place?? He was sweet but our original server needs an attitude check.
author: Michelle L.

description:
I fell in love with the Palo Alto t-lish location a while back and was excited to try one of the sf locations! 

The menu is the exact same but I think the PA location tastes a bit better. The service here felt really rushed which kind of dampened the experience. 

Things to order:
Tuna tostada
Meatballs
Churro & chocolate
author: Lauren Y.

description:
My favorite spot for Mexican tacos! It's a great place for date night but there's always a line during dinner hours. But come around any other time and you'll have an abundance of seats to choose from. 

Back to the tacos, they're absolutely delicious, if soft-shelled tacos are your thing. They're reasonably priced and the pacific cod is my all-time favorite. Their menu includes a taco of the week and it's always interesting to try something new. 

They fix a mean drink too. Strong...just the way I like it!
author: Xinhui L.

description:
This place is flavors one and DELICIOUS!! The drinks as well as the food do not disappoint. I've been here a couple times and we've ordered the 10 tacos to share. The filet minion, short ribs, & the Cod tacos are my top three favorites. The tacos come with a generously size meat portion. Each taco has two tortillas which you can easily use to split your taco in to two. The salsa's they give you adds extra flavor to your taco and makes them savory.
Drinks to try are Nopal with is a little on the sweet side and Pasion which can has a little spicy kick to it.
author: Jency D.

description:
I should hate this place, shouldn't I? The clientele was pure hipster - knitted caps that look like windsocks, Buddy Holly glasses, skinny jeans, used vintage T-shirts, neon nail polish...and this was just the guys, 20-somethings who keep talking about finding their purpose in life...to the busboy who only wants to pick up the dirty dishes, punch out and go to an authentic taqueria down the block. Atmosphere-wise, this is the exact opposite of Taqueria Cumbre or El Farolito (photo: http://bit.ly/1bv7Wvy). Joe Hargrave started his enterprise as a Ferry Building pop-up, and he's now up to four über-popular locations. I can see why. The tacos are fashion-forward good.

I came late on a weeknight after a long day at work and saw the place percolating even near 11PM. I was really in the mood for menudo, but nobody sells menudo on a weeknight unless your name is actually Menudo. I decided to fight my prejudice against all things young, modern and drunk and sit by myself at the counter. Dammit, the server was really nice and attentive despite the crowds. I was fully expecting to be ignored, but no, I got the fresh Chips and Salsa right away (photo: http://bit.ly/19sNcod). Oh good, it's the thick, crunchy kind, not the leftover Doritos I was planning to nail them about. Perusing the menu, I noticed quite a bargain, four tacos for $14 (photo: http://bit.ly/1cdwXyI).

That's almost the price tag at Pancho Villa. OK then, I'll have the Traditional Carnitas and Guajillo Braised Beef Short Rib. Those were no-brainers and quite tasty. The Shot and a Beer Braised Chicken was aptly named but a bit dry. Surprisingly, the standout turned out to be the veggie choice, the Roasted Butternut Squash, Pasilla Peppers, Chicories, and Spicy Pepitas (photo: http://bit.ly/1afBD3U). So they're smaller than the ones you get at a true Mission taqueria. So what? It's 11PM, and these lovehandles are at capacity anyway. I guess they are tacolicious. What a quandary I'm in. Maybe I can ask the emaciated guy next to me where he got his knitted cap. Oh wait, something just flew out of it.

FOOD - 4 stars...surprisingly trendy-tasty tacos with the veggie the standout
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...buzzing with the young drunk moderns
SERVICE - 4 stars...attentive and on the mark
TOTAL - 4 stars...authenticity thy name is not Tacolicious
author: Ed U.

description: I have to say the food is killer here, The drinks are great, but very over priced for the serving size. The Tacos are super epic, but I have noticed they changed the menu and the past 2 times I went, they removed my favorite chicken Mole taco, and at almost $5/taco it gets pretty pricey, pretty quick. We have noticed that the past several times I have been the actual Volume of the place was out of control loud, the music is just blasting for no reason, and the place has become literally unbearable, once or twice, we walked in, and decided to leave because it was so loud. expect to pay $60+ for 2tacos and 4 drinks, which is just out of control expensive, even for Valencia St.
author: Devon F.

description: The fish taco was delicately crafted with a tempura battered fish nestled in a bed of pickled veggies, cream sauce, and two grilled corn tortillas.  I really enjoyed it with my margarita on the rocks with a chili salted rim and side of chips and guac.  The prices are a bit steep, but you definitely pay for the ambiance and freshness of ingredients.  The service was nice and our table was well taken care of on our friend's birthday.
author: Elise G.

description: YUM. The patio was a lovely spot for lunch on a sunny Thursday. I was incredibly impressed by the plantain dish, with crema and refried beans. The tacos were obviously good, and the sauce trio offered a nice complement. Personally, I prefer my tacos to have more on them than just meat and cabbage, but this meal was satisfying and I hear their happy hour specials are not to be missed.
author: Allison W.

description:
I came to Tacolisious for the first time back in May 2015.  I had the taco carnitas and it's definitely very good (based on my taste preferences).

The serving is portioned well, but a bit on the expensive side ($40 for 10 tacos).  the chips and nachos is very good too!  

There's a lot of seating in the area, but they are very busy so there is a wait.  Also, parking can be a nightmare (unless you get lucky).  Everything in SF is metered so make sure you bring coins.  Second, you prepare to walk a few blocks.  It took me almost 20 minutes to find a parking.  If I wasn't meeting a friend, I probably would have continued driving and went somewhere else.  I would suggest that if you come to check out this place, make sure you have ample time (2 hours of so).

Having said that....it was all worth it because it's very good!
author: Steve B.

description:
Great place!

I was visiting my Best Friend who lives in Oakland and we came into the city for some shopping, drinks, and dinner! She took me here, and she has been here before and liked it. It was pretty crowded for a Thursday, we waited maybe 15 mins then two seats at the bar opened up! 

we stared with the house margaritas and they were delicious! The bartenders were very friendly! We ordered a number of different tacos/ and she's vegan so we got a few vegan options. 

All the tacos were delicious!!! I would definitely come back. The taco of the day which was the Chile Verde one was great! All the tacos come with three various hot sauces for you to try- they were all great as well! We had a few more drinks, then our first shot of Mezcal- interesting ! Lol

I would definitely come back when I'm in the city again! Thanks Tacolicious!
author: Becca H.

description:
We got kinda early to tacolicious, arround 18:00 and could be seated straight away. 
Service was nice, quick and friendly

Food: Best taco's i've had so far, will definitly go back here!
author: Martijn K.

description: I went here cause I saw it on a show on Netflix about the best Tacos in the country. Absolute FAIL. The place didn't have a visible sign. The tables were a bit small. The waiter was nice. The food was over priced. The Taco is $4.95 for one. The size is about the same as a taco truck but definitely more meat. My friend ordered the chicken, which was sugar sweet. I ordered the huskily braised beef brisket, which was salty and oily. The salsa had a minty flavor. I ordered sopa de Lima (chicken soup), which had basil. I'm not aware of any Mexican dishes that have basil or mint. They should of put cilantro instead. It is Americanized Mexican infused restaurant. Not authentic. I wanted to cross the street and order a real taco.
author: Dion R.

description:
$5 bucks for a taco...  just let that sink in. I got the carnitas - It was all I could afford! Yeah, it's meaty, but it's not that tasty. I still prefer Tacos el Tuca or La Taqueria. While the dingy taquerias on Mission don't have the cool interior design and interesting drinks, at least the tacos there are legit... These are not.

So while the tacos are meh, the service and location is on point. as are the drinks. The chips and salsa are meh as well.  

Come here to hang with friends on a nice day, but don't come for the tacos.
author: Madison W.

description:
My friends and I were looking to eat some Mexican food near Dolores Park and chose Tacolicious. It was pretty crowded when we got there which was probably around 1 but emptied out after we were seated. Service was good. The chips were rather hard (not necessarily bad) and the salsa was a little different than other salsas I've had.

Two of my friends and I decided to get the 10 tacos for $33. The cod was my favorite (as was the yellow sauce). The chicken taco and chorizo taco were decent. The rice I tried had a lot of flavor since the green chile sauce they drizzled over gave it tang and spice. You pay because all of their meats are bought hormone free. The restaurant itself is cute and clean though some of the seating is outdoors (I could imagine it might be cold during the night).

Four stars because it was good but not perfect. I would definitely come back again.
author: Erika N.

description:
Love this Tacolicious! 

The bar team is super nice and quick, not to mention they have a fantastic cocktail menu with a weekly cocktail designed by their bar manager Manny. Not to mention the giant tequila bar...yass!  It's definitely a bit pricy but the food is delicious and a nice twist to the typical burritos/taco shops the mission is known for. I have to say their Tuna Tostadas, Empanadas & Churros are by far my favorite things there! If you get there a bit early it's really easy to get a seat, but if you go after 7:30pm it's going to be a bit of a wait. Overall I've been here more times then I can count and I'll keep going back! Tacolicious is never a bad decision, and a perfect spot to start your night int he Mission.....
author: Brandi B.

description:
While the service here was fantastic, I was less than impressed with this SF mainstay. 

The fish tacos were good, but the others were meh. And the margs? Weak. Queso was fine, chips were okay.

There are better places to get tacos in this fair city, I'm sure of it. And less expensive! This was very pricey ($10 for 2 tacos).
author: Sarah G.

description:
My friend introduced me to Tacolicious and I got hooked ever since! It's a bit pricey to eat here, but the food and service is great. Upon being seated, we are served house chips and salsa and their salsa is delicious! 

My favorite item on the menu is their albacore tuna tostadas. This is so amazing and delicious that I always want more. The only thing that holds me back from placing another orer is the price; it's about $13 and you only get 2 per order. I've gotten my other friends hooked on the tostadas as well. 

I've tried the carnitas and pacific cod tacos and both are good, but I think I enjoy the carnitas more as there's more flavor. The pacific cod one is a bit bland, but adding salsa to it helps. The tacos are a bit small compared to other Mexican restaurants, but they are generous with the amount of meat offered in ratio to the size of the taco. The tacos are served with a trio of sales and all 3 of them taste great. I love using all 3 for my tacos. 

I highly suggest ordering the albacore tuna tostadas; they're just so good! Can't wait to go back for more.
author: Stephanie H.

description: Great food, bad service. This combo is all too common in SF. The bartender was slow and drunk. The server lost our entree order. But the guac and cocktails are excellent. Definitely not somewhere to go when you're hungry or in a hurry.
author: Robert H.

description: Love love LOVE these tacos!! On taco Tuesday, it's packed! They have a deal for one shot of tequila, one tecate, and a taco! I can never eat just one taco! I love this ambiance!
author: Isabella D.

description: Vibrant, lively fast paced joint in the mission w an easy vibe and phenomenal good and service to match.  Jorge behind the bar throws down creative mixes that are both familiar and adventurously different T the same time.  Most def ask for his Pasion de Jorge drink for little passion fruit spicy magic or his Jorge's secreto morning shot...
author: Anthony C.

description:
Very fulfilling tacos here. You pay for what you get. Good quality meat in the tacos. I was full after 3 tacos! 

Ordered:
1) Rock Cod Taco: 4/5 They def don't cheat you on the cod- perfect amount
2) Shot-and-a-Beer Braised Chicken Taco: 5/5 This was my favorite! The chicken was so good, it tasted like beef!
3) Short Rib Taco: 4/5 delicious!

The 3 different dipping/salsa sauces were great too! Great complement with the tacos!

Can't wait to come back!
author: Jen H.

description:
Yuck I can't decide what left a worst taste in my mouth- the $40 pitcher of virgin margaritas that are advertised as having alcohol in them, the $5 skimpy mediocre-at-best tacos the size of a silver dollar, or the horrible service.  My inability to even relate to you in a concise manner how awful this server was just answered my own pondering.  The server was the worst part.  

"Jordana".  We watched her go from table to table, each time she walked away from a table, the people would give each other either a weirded out look or an annoyed, grossed out look.  She comes up to each able in that really obnoxious way that hipstery-servers do *can be found referenced in my review for The Front Porch* where she acts all overly unenthusiastic and sarcastic over things that do no require sarcasm.  In a bored, unamused monotone: "hi. this is tacolicious have u been here.. well..we make tacos." She was so amused by herself u guys. So amused. She also did that thing where they act like u are so annoying for not being completely ready to order from their stupid annoying confusing menu the moment she gets to your table "are u ready to order no ok I'll come back" and runs off.  This is how she expected us to order: Her: "Are u ready to ord-" us: "FIVE CHICKEN TACOS THXBYE". 

The only consolation is that fact that she clearly hates her job.  So at least there's that.

Their table salsa is awesome.  

Would NEVER go back.
author: Emma H.

description:
$17+ for 4 tacos. I expected these to be crazy, awesome, delicious. I expected these to be bursting with meaty goodness. They weren't really.

They definitely packed them with meat, which explains the price, I guess, but it was all kinda bland. For being so expensive, I expected so much more. 

While the tacos were a disappointment, we also had costillas, which was a baby back ribs appetizer, and oh my were those delicious. So incredibly tender, with the sweetest and stickiest sauce. I'll also say that I was so excited that they brought out chips and salsa to the table, instead of relying on us to order the $10 guac. Because we would have.
author: Joey S.

description:
Can a taco really be life changing? I'd say no. Don't get me wrong, we enjoyed Tacolicious and would definitely return. As others have noted, the hype may have been a bit overplayed.

Kudos to the staff, start to finish, who keep this place moving like a well oiled machine. We knew to expect a wait, and I liked the system where they text you when your table is ready. It gave us a chance to stroll down Vallencia and actually have a drink elsewhere while we waited. Only "problem" is that our table was ready in 30 minutes rather than the hour we were quoted. I downed my beer when we got the good news, but my wife had to leave her's. Lesson learned.

Another newbie mistake was ordering too much. We might be used to the typical tacos served at our local "Taco Tuesdays"..cheap and tasty, but not always filling. The tacos here are different, by far.  We ordered 8 for the two of us, along with some beans and an order of guac. Granted, we had had some light appetizers elsewhere, but there was no finishing these 8 tacos between us.

Whether it was the braised short rib (my favorite) or the pacific cod, all were generously stuffed. In fact, there are two shells for each taco, so might not be bad to split into two tacos. My wife was a little put off by the cod taco, which she didn't realize was fried, and in any case was larger than expected. My filet mignon taco sounded better on paper than it tasted. Save your $3 upcharge.

I thought the real stars were the drinks (I had a spicy mango margarita - forget the name) that was outstanding and the guac was smooth and tasty.  The black beans were also great.

We walked out of there generously stuffed and waddled back to BART. Next time I'll order less (and avoid the pregame apps). I would have been satisfied with less food, and avoided the $100 taco dinner.
author: Shawn W.

description:
We went to Tacolicious. ..after hearing that it beat one of our favorite Taco restaurants  in Portland in some Taco contest 

After being told we will be waiting for 25 min, which we were ok,  we landed up waiting  for over an hour, we were waiting  in the connecting  bar and upon realizing  that after 40 min no one had called us I came back to see that other guests were being placed ahead of us. I smelt the 'R' word there, we are from SE asia.

By the time we got to sit, our hunger had decimated and we landed up wasting the highly  overrated  and expensive  tacos 
The margaritas  were surely  great.

Thanks!
author: Ruchi B.

description: Not a fan. We got the brisket and chicken tacos. They tasted almost exactly the same. Way over priced for what you get. These should be street tacos for $2 each. Instead we paid about $30. This was one of our worst eats while visiting the city.
author: Caitlin K.

description:
I came here as part of the Edible Excursions tour. We got a back table, and they served us fish and carnitas tacos, though I only got to try the carnitas ones. The tacos in general were pretty good, though I hear that there are tons of less expensive taco places nearby. The carnitas ones got kind of dry and the meat was a bit hard to chew through as you ate too many, but maybe that's why they gave us a bunch of sauces to put on our tacos.

I can see why people would come here for the vibe, though, since it's really kid friendly and trendy. Filled with a lot of families and young people. The music and conversation is really loud though, so don't expect to have any sort of meaningful conversation here.
author: Anna L.

description:
I could eat their salsa and chips all day long. The hint of mint in the salsa is such a surprise and is super delicious!

I'm working my way through every single one of their tacos.  So far the cod and chorizo are my favorite.  The carnitas aren't bad either.  

Try all the fun cheese dips, appetizers and shared plates.  You really can't go wrong with anything you order.

On a nice day, sit out on the patio!  Heat lamps make it super pleasant, and dogs are welcomed.
author: Jaching H.

description:
Taco. Beer.  Shot. $10

Brisket tacos
Queso dip.

Good vibe. Outdoor seating. Ok service.
author: Dan C.

description: Decent Mexican, and better than what you could get in NYC!
author: Shu Jin S.

description:
I love tacos. They always sound good to me. While in town, I had a hankering for tacos, so a friend suggested we meet up at Tacolicious. 

After a 45min wait, we were ravenous, and perhaps a little over-ambitious with our order.

2 people
8 tacos (short rib, fish, chorizo)
1 order of guac
1 order of queso
2 baskets of chips

My stomach hurts just thinking about it now. The tacos were larger than expected and we were definitely hurting a few tacos in. 

Moral of the story: don't over-order and be like us. It's not worth the pain.
author: Jonelle T.

description:
If you're looking for terrible service and extremely rude waiters, this place is perfect for you! 

My friend and I ordered the shot+beer+taco combo along with an extra taco- easy order, right? Apparently not. We never received our shot+beer and when brought up to the waiter he accused us of lying about the fact that we ordered that. It's not our problem that he didn't place our order properly, so you would expect him to fix the problem, but of course he didn't and then proceeded to ignore us for the rest of our meal. Instead, he was taking shots with the table next to us. 

As great as the food was, I could get better tacos else where for much cheaper from much friendlier and considerate people.
author: Ladan H.

description: This place is expensive for what it is. I got the tuna tostadas and a chorizo-potato taco, which were both awesome. Salsas are all delicious and chips, unlimited. Great patio and comfortable seating. The service was a little off, our server seemed annoyed and inattentive.
author: Hannah B.

description:
One of the hostesses forgot to seat us and didn't take ownership for the fact, but I appreciate the free guacamole and apologies from the other hostess. Good save, hostess #2. Good save.

This place does the whole modernization/reinvention of classic Mexican food well. We had 4 assorted tacos (ranging from braised pork to potato something or other), an order of tostadas, ceviche, and 4 micheladas, all of which were tasty, especially the tuna tostadas. Everything was well seasoned, fresh, and just really really good! think I might have been gushing about how much I loved the food to my dining companion because he kept pointing out that I had mentioned it a number of times in conversation (smart ass -___-). So yeah. Safe to say, it's Vi approved.

Total came out to about $60 with a doggie bag. Not breaking the bank as long as you're not broke. Will be back! Hopefully I can bump it up to 5 stars after a few more samplings of the menu and a better initial experience in service.

I like tacos. And stuff.
author: Vi T.

description:
It was great!
We got four tacos: Cod, Chicken, Short Rib and a veggie one and they were all delicious!!!
Along with the Moss drink which was good as well.
author: Natan G.

description: Screw this place. Ordered guacamole and tacos via Caviar. No chips. Missing taco. Well not missing because the tortilla was there just nothing in it. Zero salsas. 1 lime. But I have a roof over my head and clean running water so whatever right? Still though. Cmon.
author: Jordan R.

description:
I was really excited to try this place because I have heard such great things. Unfortunately, I was overwhelmed with how TERRIBLE the service was. 

Two stars is being nice because the food was good, but service was remarkably god awful. 

We waited 15 minutes before being greeted by a server and she didn't even introduce herself, she just asked if we were ready to order. We waited another 20 minutes to receive our food, all the while an item we had ordered came when we had already finished the meal. 

We saw our server a grand total of two times the whole dining experience. When she gave us our cards back she didn't even say thank you- just placed them on the table without even a glance at us. I'm not sure if returning for a second chance is even worth it.
author: Alicia S.

description:
Went to meet friends at this location for my first visit. 

For $5/taco you would expect the best tasting street tacos ever or at least great service. The chips and salsa were the best items there. You are better off finding a taco truck. The food will taste better at a fraction of the price and the service will be better.
author: Brian C.

description:
Expensive tacos? Yes.  Worth it?  Absolutely!  And that chips and salsa they give you will blow your mind away to the moon.  My wife and I kept talking about what they must put in the salsa to make it taste so good.  The mystery was not solved.  Guess we'll have to go back. ;)

I ordered the chicken, steak, and carnitas tacos.  Kass had the cactus (Oaxaca cheese) and fish tacos.  We loved everything.  I especially especially loved the steak taco.  

There was a short wait (like less than 10 minutes) to get in, so be prepared.  I could see it being longer.

Save room for dessert at the chocolate place across the street.  Oh my heck.....a perfect finish.
author: Mike K.

description:
I met up with a friend at Tacolicious. He is new to the area, and I thought he might enjoy trying some Tacos from a restaurant many regard as crowd favorite.

We split the bill, each paying our half on separate cards.

When I checked my statement a few weeks later, I was shocked to find that whoever manages the gratuity process post signature - probably the server herself - added over $10 to the final charge + manually written-in gratuity.  

I do not plan to return to Tacolicious, and urge anyone who goes to check their card statement to make sure an additional few dollars weren't "accidentally" added to their bill.
author: Laura K.

description:
There ain't nothing licious about these tacos.

Yes, I know that's a combination of bad grammar and spelling, but I don't care.

This place is such a rip off for what you truly get, that I feel like stepping onto my Yelp soap box to proclaim it.

Here's the thing, this "taco place" is located in the heart of Mission, so if you want an authentic taco, or a cheap taco, don't bother coming here.

Now if you want overpriced tacos and guacamole, than by all means, this is your place.
I tried their house-made chorizo taco, their cod fish taco, beef short rib, and steak (additional $3), so for 4 tacos it came out to something like $20! Add in the $9 guacamole and the tip and it was a little under $40 for tacos that tasted just "okay"!

For t-a-c-o-s!

For that price Salma Hayek should be serving these tacos!
author: Jack R.

description:
The first time I ate here was years ago, when they first opened. My coworkers and I, went there for a nice lunch. The food was so good! My coworkers and I spread the word to everyone at work, who eventually began using them for big corporate events.

I have since used them for catering on several occasions and have made them new fans in the process.

This review was sparked by the horrible experience I recently had at their new North Beach location. The two may have the same name, but I am never going back to the one in North Beach.
author: Ladi Da A.

description: Good guacamole; the picante margarita is awesome if you like some kick (spicy); I recommend the original carnitas for tacos.  Interesting specials (bahn mi chicken taco). Would definitely try again to see how the others are.  Waitress was friendly and accommodating and we had a child with us, too.
author: Brian B.

description:
Sat at the bar in a Sunday afternoon. Sat at the bar. Has a lively ambience, one TV in front of the bar for your sports needs. 

Had a margarita-was good, not the strongest of drinks, but refreshing still. 
The chips and salsa HIT THE SPOT. They're just right. Could have stopped with those. 

Ordered tacos-one cod and one braised short rib. Delish. Spot on. Just what I wanted. 

The people next to me ordered the albacore tuna appetizer-and I wanted to order that too..... Loos amazing, waiter said it's the best thing on the menu, inspired by a lunch spot in Mexico. 

This place. Yes. Go there if you wanna sit down and leisurely enjoy good food. For good tacos with other patrons breathing down your neck and hovering over your table, go to La Taqueria.
author: Kelsey K.

description:
This is the worst Tacolicious in the city. I went last night with my two girlfriends because we thought it would be a good choice for a group of us. For a group of 4, the hostess said it would be 2 1/2 hours. 2 1/2 hours! This isn't Dosa. I'm not waiting for a table at Tonga. In what universe would a table for four take 2 1/2 hours? The hostess was super rude about it too... but we put our name in anyway...

1 hour later I get a text message. I don't see it until 10 minutes after the text is received, so I call immediately to let the hostess know we are on our way and needed to close out our tab at Range (FYI Range's chicken liver mousse with an arugula salad is bomb). She says it's fine and to head over.

We get there and the hostess says I'm too late. I tell her I called, she looks and says, "we didn't get any missed calls from you". She asks if I want to get added back to the list. "No- I don't want to get added back to the list, I want a table. I called and you told me to head over." Another woman interjects and says a table just opened up and she can sneak us in. 

30 minutes after we order our drinks, I'm stewing in the fact that there is nothing to drink on the table and watch as our waitress get a head massage at the register. The same woman who sat us walked by and noticed we still had nothing to drink and our menu's placed in front of us. She immediately alerted our waitress and brought us our drinks. The rest of the dinner was spent with the staff trying to frantically make up for the fact that we were ignored for the first 30 minutes.... 

So it was an annoying terrible experience and basically what it comes down to is this: We live in San Francisco. There are loads of restaurants that have both good food and good service. There is no reason to return somewhere with D service and B- food.
author: Colleen F.

description:
Ambiance: 5 
Just a very appealing restaurant, from an interior design standpoint. It possesses that "cool" factor. Also, the hostess was very attractive (DON'T JUDGE ME) haha.

Food: 4
The food tastes great, I highly recommend the fish taco. My only hang up on this place is that, aside from the attractive female employees and hip ambiance, it's really not that special of a restaurant (from a food perspective). It's just a fancier taqueria. Was the experience good? Yes. Was the service great? Most definitely. Food tasty? Absolutely. But most, if not all, of the things we ordered could've been ordered at a random Mexican joint in Redwood City, for much cheaper. MAYBE you'd have a tough time finding vegetarian cactus tacos, but I don't think it's anything worth going out of your way for.

If yelp allowed half stars, I'd give it 3.5, but I can't.
author: Aaron C.

description:
Wow. Just, wow. I'd heard of this place several times, and now I know why - this is some of the best non-Mexican Mexican food I've ever had.

Why do I qualify it like that? Well, this isn't your LA-area hole-in-the-wall Mexican; it's a bit Americanized. But it IS mouth-watering, head-exploding, need-a-change-of-pants delicious.

Maybe we can follow that with my biggest complaint - the prices. It's expensive. $18 for 4 tacos, AKA lunch, is absurd. It irks me. It's offensive. I want to be able to bring my friends from out of town here, because the food is awesome! But if I do, they might complain about how expensive SF is. 

But the food, man, the food. One bite and you'll forget all about the money, and you know you're hooked. I had the cod, carnitas, short rib, and nopales and oaxaca tacos, and they were all AMAZING. I even forgot to leave off the cilantro, and the tacos were SO GOOD that I barely even noticed the offending bits of cilantro that I just couldn't get out of the tacos.

The tequila flight is pretty amazing too.

I wish you'd lower your prices, Tacolicious. But, I am hooked, regardless, and you know it :(
author: Chris S.

description: Very disappointed with the service. I was there for my daughter's bday and the servers were very rude. The food was ok. If you want to experience Mexican food in Valencia St there's another place were the service and the food is better. I won't recommend this place at all.
author: Maria P.

description:
I worked with Megan, the Special Events Manager, in planning my husband's 30th birthday party here and everything went spectacularly.  Initially, I was a little hesitant because the name "Tacolicious" just makes me think of a taqueria.  However, I'd like to say that the restaurant is perfect for parties.  The ambiance is very hip with a nice bar towards the front of the restaurant and a spacious room in the back for semi-private or private parties.

For $29 per person, we shared the room with another party but there's a big table in the middle so you don't really get in each others' way.  Menu consists of salsa, guacamole, queso, 2 appetizers, 2 tacos, and dessert.  It sounds overpriced for the food you're getting but they give you a LOT.  Each bowl of salsa, guacamole, and queso was so big that I don't think we even got through half.  Chips are fresh and frequently replenished.  

Albacore tuna tostada and meatball appetizers were my favorite items of the night; I may have liked them even more than the tacos.  Tacos were so generously piled on with meat that by the time we got them, most of us could only eat 1-2.  The favorites were probably braised beef and rock cod, although the chicken was super saucy and the carnitas were tender.  I normally love churros but I wasn't a fan of this style because it was more crispy rather than doughy.... just a personal preference.  The Mexican hot chocolate dip was delicious though.

Planning the party was really easy. I like that they print menus for each person and you can even include a customizable header.  Service was fantastic the entire night and the back room even gets their own bartender so we were never wanting for drinks.  I would highly recommend this place for a group dinner or event--all the information can be found on the website.
author: Shannon L.

description: Ordered to go from postmates. Whoever packed this bag did not do it carefully, as my food ended up piled all over in a taco heap. It was a mess and ruined. Definitely not a god experience. May I suggest using better to go containers and not putting it standing face down in the bag. Definitely ruined my first tacolicious experience, what a shame.
author: Liliana L.

description:
I want to start by saying that I am a huge fan of Tacolilcious. I typically walk away form a meal with a belly full of delicious food, a slight buzz and a smile on my face. However, yesterday it was quite the contrary. 

First, we ordered a Michelada, however they didn't give us the rest of our beer (typically the whole beer cant fit in the cup with the tomato juice). 

Second, I ordered the "taco of the week" which was Octopus. I also ordered my favorite, the Baja Cod which is fried. Myself and my 2 friends who also ordered the Octopus agreed that it was extremely overcooked and almost inedible because it was hard and rubbery. The fried Baja Cod taco appeared to be a HUGE serving but when I crushed the fried shell there was literally zero fish. 

Lastly, the service was TERRIBLE yesterday. It took us forever for our server to come to our table. When she finally did it was not very friendly at all. At the end, and after trying to flag her down for our check she came by and I could barely get a word in to give feedback on the food. I knew she was busy so said politely "when you have a spare minute could you come back because I have feedback for you" - well, she never came back so unfortunately this feedback is now on Yelp. 

I live in the Mission and don't know if ill be back to Tacolicious. West of Pecos is right across the street and I at least I get better service and food when I go. Very disappointing.
author: Kyle K.

description:
Killer service, killer cocktails, great tacos, pretty good desserts.

In a city with some delicious food, Tacolicious doesn't kill the competition, but it certainly manages to keep up with its culinary counterparts.

10 taco trough is definitely the way to go.  The taco to get is going to have a lot to do with your pallet.  The carne asada was, however decidedly forgettable, however the brisket and chorizo were quite delightful.  

I am a BIG fan of the Margaritas.  Our table of 4 shared a pitcher, and we were all too happy to do so.

Great place for a group of 4-6, I'm not sure I would go there on a date with my wife.
author: Rolf V.

description:
First off, ambience is gorgeous there. I love the line of high tables against the wooden paneled windows on the side of the restaurant. They also have a cute outdoor seating area. Tacolicious has an open kitchen layout, where you can see the cooks and staff prep you orders -- loves it!  Definitely a hot spot for Date Night or Date Day. :D

Unfortunately, the food was okay, nothing extraordinary. It can be a hit if you order the right stuff, but a miss if you don't, so choose wisely!  

HITS:
1) Beets Salad -- refreshing, light, and the cheese was amazing! Portion was small so it's good to order as an appetizer to get your stomach ready for the REAL stuff! 
2) Stir-Fried short rib taco was super tasty and hearty. It was a cooked faijita style, so all the flavors blended in nicely. It was the special of the week.
2) Braised chicken taco was also very yummy and moist. 
3) Complementary chips and salsa -- delicious and c'mon, who doesn't love free stuff?? 
4) Their tray of there sauces added a nice kick to the tacos -- sometimes a much needed kick for the dull tasting ones. 

MISS
1) Carnitas taco was really dry and bitter.
2) Fried cod taco -- the amount of batter was overwhelming and it tasted very bland. Definitely could use more flavor and seasoning. 
3) Veggie cactus taco with cheese -- interesting combo and concept, but lacking flavor. Texture was there though. The cactus gave a nice crunch. 
 
All in all, thumbs up! Prices are reasonable. The staff is friendly. Free chip and salsa to start. The food overall was decent. Great location in the heart the Mission. Judging the whole dining experience -- I would recommend and definitely come back with friends or a date day!
author: Ellen W.

description:
Tacolicious helped usher in the trend of good quality Mexican food, that had been so lacking for years in the city. I remember seeing lots reviews on Yelp a few years ago always raving about how cheap and how good the taco trucks and taquerias were. Great if that's what you enjoy, but its never been my thing. 

We have dined here many, many times, including the Palo Alto, Marina, and North Beach locations. The music is always blaring, sometimes a bit too loudly along with everyone screaming to be heard at the top of their lungs, sometimes a conversation is simply impossible.  On one of our last visits, we noticed a sign outside the front door noting, "Please use your inside voice as much as possible." Seriously this is SF, everyone thinks the world revolves around himself and all the world wants to hear about his stupid app!

The tacos are always delicious, some of our favs are carnitas, hanger steak, chorizo, as well as numerous Taco of the Weeks. Oh yeah the Albacore Tuna Tostados are to die for.  All we ask is to please bring back the Prickly Pear Margaritas!
author: Bill K.

description:
I was super excited to try this place while in town, but it was a pretty big let down. We came in late Sunday evening and got terrible service. Our waitress, Grace, was more interested in talking to the other servers than actually waiting on tables. My husband ordered a Tecate, which never came because she never told the bartender. We only ordered the Baja cod tacos because we just wanted to eat and leave. The tacos were not spectacular and the sauces that accompany the tacos also were nothing special. I was expecting a lot more flavor from a place that specializes in tacos. 

The price wasn't terrible, but also not cheap. It's $17.95 for four tacos, which I previously mentioned were mediocre. Overall, not impressed.
author: Mandy R.

description: Okay! I am not a taco or burrito fan but this place! I can not even begin to tell you how good this is! It is amazing!!
author: Alix V.

description: We rented the back room for an evening event.  Prices were reasonable. Staffing was appropriate.  The tables are at the side of the room.  There is a lot of space to mingle. If you are looking for a place for a low-key, casual event, check out this restaurant.  A few tips:  Parking is tight.  Also, there are multiple sites: so please be sure to tell the guests to make sure they show up at the correct restaurant.
author: Michael C.

description:
While visiting San Francisco, some friends from the area recommended the tacos at tacolicious. The meal did not disappoint. We were a party of four and only had to wait ~20 minutes for a table around 7:30pm on a Friday night. The outdoor patio area is pleasant. With heating lamps, the area was completely comfortable despite being a bit chilly outside. 

The service was friendly and prompt. We split the plate of 10 tacos and the guacamole. All of the tacos were tasty, but I would definitely recommend the guajillo braised beef short rib and the traditional carnitas. The guacamole was good- it advertises as "freshly made" and it does include the chunks of avocado that I love. 

We also split TWO pitchers of the "margarita de la casa." ImThis was recommended by our server as being not "too sweet." It didn't have the margarita-mixer taste that a lot of restaurant "house" margaritas have. The pitchers are pretty hefty and for four people, two pitchers was definitely more than enough.
author: Margaret K.

description: Went in on a whim during the Warriors game and the place was packed! Decided to grab dinner and drinks On the patio where we could see the game inside, but still enjoy date night. Had the awesome spicy cocktail and tacos. The meats are tender and amazing here, love the mole tacos. The free salsa is the goods. Loved the food, drinks, and service was attentive while not being annoying! The one thing is that it's not the cheapest tacos you can get in the mission, but the vibe and service are worth price. Will be back.
author: Lisa H.

description:
From what I remember, it's not open seating but when we arrived there was no one to take down our names or help us or even greet us in anyway so we just took a seat at a table since it wasn't that busy. We waited for about 5-10 mins before doing so. After we sat ourselves we had to flag down a worker to help us, which might have been our fault since they might have not seen us sit down. After they took our order we, we saw our order sitting out there waiting to be brought to the table while our server was sitting there chatting with other workers. This was around 4ish and we were having a late lunch because we just got out of class so you can only imagine how hungry we were. We were about to walk up and get it ourselves and the same thing goes with the sauces. We had to ask for it then flag her down and ask for more. So annoying that we had to keep asking for help when it wasn't even busy there. I've been to different tacolicious places during busy hours and the servers were more tentative then. 

The carnitas and short rib tacos were a bit on the salty, dry side. Wouldn't recommend. But surprisingly their shrimp taco was on point! It was sooo good and this is coming from a "non seafood" kind of person. 

And you get jipped on the horchata. They fill the glass with ice then fill in the gaps with the drink. You can get more bang for your buck and more authentic  horchata elsewhere.
author: Mariel Ashley S.

description:
I came here for brunch while visiting a few friends in San Francisco, on the outside this place looked pretty typical San Francisco brunch, hipsters every where, rustic outdoor seating etc... There wasn't really a wait which was great for us, our party of four got seated right away. Service was on par with what we would expect on busy Sunday brunch, busy area water was hard to come by but chips and salsa were plentiful.

I ordered the breakfast tacos, two tacos for about $11.95 - a bit overpriced in the Taco world - I come from a world of LA street tacos (authentic and $1). But hey its SF so I'll pay the premium to try something different. The tacos were simple but delicious, eggs, green onions, bacon bits, and some tomatoes on a tortilla. I was plenty full with the two tacos as the serving size was pretty large. 

I'd probably try a different place rather than coming back again, as the food was OK, but a bit overpriced for tacos.
author: Anna C.

description:
Maybe a little better than A -OK. I love their variations on traditional tacos. A little expensive though and its location in the Mission makes it a bit harder to swallow the prices knowing there are so many taquerias in the immediate area. I tried the Variety plate with about 4-6 different tacos (all soft tacos) and a couple of beers. 

I like the creativity and presentation, I don't like the prices.
author: Gabriel B.

description: I used to love Tacolicious. Yes, it's always been a little pricey, but it was worth it. This last time we went the food was cold when it came out, and the service was terrible. We waited over 40 minutes to get our food, and our server barely talked to us the whole time. Not sure if I'll be back.
author: Cory D.

description:
The "Taco Wine" was the perfect Syrah Blend! Smooth and flavorful, and I loved the 
"hints of white pepper"!

I ordered the Tuna Tostadas, which were good but not at all what I expected. I also order the braised beef taco which was pretty tasty. I recommend topping it with the tomatio sauce.

The place was backed and loud. There was a twenty minute wait but I think we were sat in under that time. They have a tequila bar which could be a good place to pass the time, but we didn't make inside.

The service was fast and not unfriendly, just rushed.

And the Queso.....I believe I was told by a fellow Texan that it was the best in town. They also mentioned how hard it is to find decent Queso anywhere in San Francisco =( Well, this one was sub par. It tasted like Velveta (fake) and why was there root in it??? weird.

I wouldn't trek there again for this place. There's got to be a million better options than this in the Mission.
author: Kimberly M.

description: Yummy!
author: Sheryl M.

description: Delicious tacos! Grilled squid was a huge hit tonight with our group along with the Cod! My absolute favorite was the tuna tostada - sushi on tostada! Posole was delicious as well along with the plantains served over retried beans and sour cream. Great atmosphere - notice level high. Warriors game on tonight so quite busy and noisy! Too bad we list service was good!
author: June R.

description:
Food is good. Gentrified Mexican food. Pretty much everything is made in house. Ingredients are fresh and the atmosphere is lively, hip, and clean.  I wasn't loving the prices, but for what you're getting its not over priced. If you come in midweek for just a two seater you should expect a 30 min wait. Next store is the same owner but a different style; more like a bar with some street tacos. I tried the horchata and el Diablo. Diablo was really sweet. There was a drink with grapefruit that was better and was a sour. The Horchata was whack. It tastes like cinnamon, skim milk, and some half and half for body... I had that sent back and the waitress was really cool about making sure I had a drink I liked. 
Both are worth checking out at least once.
author: Kanoa U.

description:
Ideal for a group, their taco prices really scale to a crowd.  Chicken mole taco was my fav, though all of the meat options were good.  More filling than I expected, about 2-3 would fill most people I think.

Beware the sides, they are just ok, pricy and really add up if everyone starts ordering rice and beans.

Embrace the cocktails, really good program here!  Heavy focus on tequila, which one might expect.  The Chupacabra was really excellent on a recent visit.

Not as hard to get a table as I had thought!
author: Patrick S.

description: Simple & fulfilling tacos. My favorites were the cod and carnitas! The only complaint I have is the price. We got 10 for around 40$, which is pretty pricey considering you can probably get the same tacos somewhere nearby for a lot cheaper.
author: Jia Mei F.

description:
It was pretty loud and a pretty long wait for a taco restaurant! But I would say it's worth the wait.
My friend and I went to have dinner, just before the SF Film Festival, and we had a blast dinner.

The guacamole - 5 Star. One of the best I've had.
Tacos (Chorizo + One with veggies and asparagus) - I'd say I liked the one with Chorizo better, but the one with asparagus was also flavorful and awesome!
PS. they come with three differently tasting sauces and my suggestion is to go with the white one!
Aguachile - I would say it would be 2-3 stars. It was very spicy! Like the chiles in them were extremely hot to me. But it was a great combination to the margaritas we had.
Margaritas- A bit pricey, but it was pretty good.!

Overall, it was pretty loud and I had to shout to my friend to talk even though she was right infront of me, but it's worth the wait and worth trying it! The attentativeness is an okay level, sometimes hard to get attention!
Would come back though!
author: Aya H.

description: Came here in search of a late Sunday brunch and was happy to find they offer brunch til 4. Also, always nice to get chips and salsa at a restaurant. The chips were thick cut, lightly salted with coarse salt, and served with a really mild citrusy salsa. My fish taco was well cooked with a good portion of cod. My short rib was juice, oozing with a not greasy liquid, but was a bit salty for my taste. Two tacos was very filling.
author: Christina G.

description: One of my favorite places in SF for Mexican.  Such a great spot, lively, fun, festive.  Awesome spicy margaritas and tacos.  I have seen people write about the tacos being expensive, but I actually commented to my friends that I thought they were a great value.  They're chock full of goodness, and they use very high quality ingredients.  The side salsas, the chips and salsa when you sit down, the delicious starters, and the consistently great service all add to the great night out I have had on each visit.
author: Scott H.

description:
If you remember anything from this review, it's this: MUST TRY THE FRIED COD AND/OR CARNITAS TACOS!

I really wish I had been hungrier on this Saturday night stop in.  Our wait was over an hour, but I had a cocktail to quench my thirst.  Tacolicious doesn't take reservations, and it's not a very big restaurant, so plan accordingly. 

Really, you cannot go to a place called this and not order tacos.  See first line of this review.  They also offer their drinks by the pitcher; my friends raved about the pasion cocktail. Last note: something I ate during this meal really did a number on my stomach by the end of the night. I suspect it was the sangria, but maybe it was the queso dip... or could it be, gasp, the tacos?
author: Tricia D.

description:
Used to be delicious.  Always pricey.  Tonight not so good- Carnitas were dry.  Fish taco doughy.  Margarita syrupy.

Bartender1 attentive, cordial, cool. Bartender2- totally indifferent, distant, uncool. 

Note to self- even if there are few decent Mexican restaurants in the city that serve margaritas with your taco.  Pass on T-licious, not worth the parking hassle, prices, attitude.
author: R G.

description:
I can't believe I paid $3.95 for ONE fish taco.... in the Mission!

* I think I'm turning into a hipster ... * 

Well, with al fresco dining and organic ingredients whenever possible, I just had to bite my tongue.

I'd have to say that the fried local cod was worth it. Topped with cabbage and tangy crema, it was nom nom nom! I love that the batter isn't too thick.  And the $5 grilled corn was the bomb -- nicely charred sprinkled with chili powder and lime. 

Their cocktail list, whoa Nelly! you look so yummy!  I was sold on the El Jardin by my server which was made with gin, lavender and cucumber. Why yes, I like my cocktails tasting like it just came straight out of the garden, got a problem with that?  * snaps fingers * 

Tacolicious, you got me on this one. Next time I come back, it won't be for your taco. It'll be for the 50+ bottles of tequila on your  list. Ay carumba!
author: Janice C.

description:
I really like authentic Mexican tacos. So prior to coming here with a couple buddies for dinner, I didn't know what to expect.

I looked at the menu and realized that it was the type of tacos that I don't usually order. No biggie though since I've tried similar tacos that they have here at other places before. 

I decided to get two tacos, the first being the cod fish one I believe and the second one was the chicken mole. My friend and I also decided to share the tuna tostadas because they looked amazing in the Yelp photos. 


When the food came out, it looked amazing. I was slightly excited to eat (I love to eat, obviously). The tuna tostada was pretty good but it wasn't worth $9 to be honest. Maybe pass on that and get it elsewhere. 

The tacos were a totally different story. The chicken mole was just a weird choice as an option for tacos. Maybe it's me but that just tasted weird. As for the fish once, that was probably the worst fish taco I've ever had. No seasoning in the taco or in the fish fillet thing that they gave us. It was literally just a piece of fried fish sitting between two pieces of tortilla. COME ON. ugh.

Moral of the story? Don't expect amazing authentic tacos at a restaurant that ends in  '-licious'.
author: Anna H.

description: Tuna toast was so good! Best I've tried. Tacos were great, filled with good stuff and the complementary chips and salsa are great :) That said, can't beat traditional Mexican food and tacos, don't come here for that! Good music and atmosphere. Great Mexican place for techie-taco people in the city
author: Martino P.

description:
--Variety of tacos (meat, fish, and vegetarian)
--Great guacamole and green salsa
--Good Chips
--Fresh Margaritas and lemonades
--Exciting specials
--Lovely décor and lively atmosphere 
--Indoor and outdoor seating

What more could you want from a taco restaurant?
