author: Thomas B.

description: Table for two? Expect to wait 15 minutes even though there are many open. Ridiculous. Spend your money at Taco Bell
author: Kevin L.

description:
Marguerita fresco- was ok, nothing spectacular. My friend's had the hibiscus one. They said it was too tart.  For the best price the pitcher is way to go. The flavored tequilas looked really tempting.

Appetizers:
Meatballs- ok. Kinda greasy
Guacamole- good
Plantains- tasty, naturally greasy because they're fried.

We ordered 10 tacos:
Pacific cod- yummy, eat it first. The cod was tender. FYI, the batter turns soggy if you don't eat it right away.
Chicken mole- my favorite. Needed a lil more sauce.
Short rib- the right amount of sauce. Good choice as well but a lil too greasy for me.

The hot sauces were ok, wasn't impressed with the flavor.  The salsa you dip your chips in is better.

Our service was good.  The atmosphere was busy & social.
author: Suzy Q.

description: Waitress, was a huge bitch to me and refused to accommodate my vegetarian eating needs. Despite, having drinks on the menu, they weren't available. I would suggest firing all staff, this place has really gone downhill. I regret all the money my date have spent here and won't be suggest this spot in the future. Good luck going out of business.
author: Cloey S.

description: I finally sat at a table at Tacolicious... we had terrible service. The bartenders are attentive and wonderful. I'll never have a seated meal at a table here again. Just not worth it. And he manager who I emailed about this experience said he'd try to make it up to me (requested my address) and didn't do a thing.
author: Valerie T.

description: Came in here on a Friday afternoon and grabbed a seat at the bar. The chips and salsa were a great start - fresh and tasty. We had micheladas and chatted with the bartenders. Jorge was exceptional - good conversation and knowledgeable about the many tequilas and mescals they have on the shelf. I would definitely recommend this place! I didn't try the food but the whole place smelled great.
author: Jedd B.

description: It's always a fun time at Tacolicious with your crew. You can't go wrong with their myriad of tacos and margarita pitchers. It's not cheap, but you're not either.. right?! Also, those goddamn churros con chocolate sauce are absolutely heavenly. xoxo w/ taco-flavored kisses
author: Vivian H.

description:
A great place to catch up with friends while eating delicious tacos and sharing one of the many pitchers of mixed drinks

For $33 you can get any 10
Tacos of your choice. My favorite taco is the bistec adobado 

They also have a very delicious guacamole that is made to order

You also must try the ahi tuna tostada! 

Tip: get the $10 special which includes a shot a beer and a taco.

This place is perfect for a girls night out, date night or night out with friends! Plenty of bike parking near by
author: Joanne K.

description: Tasty tacos and great guacamole/chips. Nice place with good ambience. Value ok but not great considering many options in the area.
author: Robin B.

description: To start, the hostess was not friendly, when seated we waited about 10minutes for a "server" to take our order, the chilaquiles were far from chilaquiles more like cold nachos, the server never checked in with us and was a bit of a airhead. The only good part to this review which is why I gave them a one star is that they played Le Tigre
author: Jose O.

description:
You know how we Yelpers are always saying "I really wanted to like this place, but..."?

Well, I really wanted to HATE this place! White people tacos...YAWN.

The following statement will come easy for me because I have a lot of practice admitting I'm wrong: I WAS WRONG.

I like so many things about Tacolicious:

*The thick, chunky, supremely fresh guacamole

*The varied salsas with their highly distinct flavors; in particular the smoky chipotle and the brightly-flavored salsa verde with avocado; the latter was out of this world with the carnitas

*The chips that are strong enough to stand up to the guacamole but are still crispy

*The deeply-flavored, high-quality meats (especially the carnitas with plenty of those prized charred bits)

*The churros...seriously, how do they get them that light? Unbelievable

*The tortillas...they're not homemade, but they have a really nice corn flavor. I wish I knew which brand they were!

*I even like how they repurpose their empty tequila bottles as water bottles

My only "complaint" isn't even a complaint, and that is that they put SO MUCH MEAT on each taco. I pulled out about 2/3rds from each one and still had a great taco left. They may cost more than the ones at the truck, but you are absolutely getting your money's worth.

Tacolicious nicely fills the gap between a taqueria and a "formal" sit-down Mexican restaurant. So if you're craving tacos but want something more upscale and festive than Pancho Villa, El Farolito, Cancún, etc., Tacolicious is for you.
author: Valeria R.

description:
Really crowded. Pricy even for SF standards. Margaritas were just OK. The carnitas tacos were greasy and kind of flavorless. 

My biggest issue is that the banquette along one of the long walls is not at the right height for the tables - it is incredibly uncomfortable to be seated there, and I will wait to sit at a table and not at the banquette. The seat is just too high for the table, and the cross bar support on the seat is not high enough so anyone shorter than 5'5" legs just dangle. 

With so much energy put into the design of the restaurant, it's hard to overlook one of the most important aspects which is diner comfort. If they're not comfortable, they're not going to stay, or want to come back.
author: Jordan T.

description:
This place defines the hipster scene in SF. Upbeat vibe with the best combination of crowd and all the queue and all on a Friday early evening. We left our names there but when they called 15mins later they had seats for us, we were already starting our round of beers somewhere else. 

Decided to come back again on a Wednesday and it was much better. Got seated right away at the bar. It's a criminal offense not to try the beef short rib taco. It's made perfect. I ordered a short-and-a-beer braised chicken taco too. Both were amazing. Now you'd think a skinny Asian can't eat 4 tacos. You were wrong. Seeing it costed only $14 for 4 tacos, I ordered two mores - the cod and something else I don't remember. Tried four kinds of tacos and none disappointed me. And for the same price I could probably get two tacos in Hong Kong, and they would be pretty average. 

For those who's been saying we don't have "authentic" Mexican food in Hong Kong - yeah I get your point now!
author: Kevin L.

description: Star had us seated quickly and Tina remembered our birthday and surprised us with margarita shots on the house. Excellent customer service. Go on Thursday night fasho.
author: Donte' G.

description:
Came here over the weekend to day-drink and snack on a rainy afternoon during my most recent visit to San Francisco. I had the octopus, and my boyfriend had the taco of the week. We also got the guacamole and a huge free serving of chips and salsa. The cocktails and the social interaction with friendly bartenders were a lot more memorable than the food (but the salsa that came with the chips was really nice). I had several glasses of the Flor de Jamaica (made less stiff per my request). I was a little bit obsessed. One of the bartenders gave me and my boyfriend a little education on good tequila and offered us shots of Fortaleza on the house afterwards. I've always hated tequila shots, but I liked this one! And no, they don't have Patron on the shelf -- they only stock up on high-quality tequila! Okay, I'm just pretending to be a tequila snob now.

It's a cool spot! I'll go back for drinks sometime.
author: Claudine M.

description:
I want to talk about the Marina Girl salad. The ingredients looked delicious, so even though the fact that there was a thing called 'Marina Girl' on the menu made me want to get up and go somewhere else just on principle, I decided to be an adult and order it. It was delicious. Great salad, unfortunate name. 

Everything else was great of course.
author: Rebecca H.

description: Tacos were amazing! Ordered one of each and the short rib tacos were my favorite. We ordered some drinks from the bar prior to getting a table and the bartender there was very knowledgable about tequila and incredibly helpful and friendly.  We were not a fan of the pitchers of margaritas we had later at our table, but the night was still a hit and I would definitely return and recommend this place to friends.
author: Karina B.

description: Interesting fillings on the very small tacos which are 4.95 each. The albacore tuna tostadas were 12.95 for two. Tuna was raw and pretty good. ?"$6.50 was very steep for  a small bowl of refried beans. Service was pleasant and fast.  If you just want a few tacos you can do just as well with a taqueria on missions street.
author: M D.

description:
Terrible.  

The tacos are overpriced, the beans are canned and the drinks are mediocre.  Maybe my standards are too high but if I'm paying $5 for a taco, then it better be delicious.  The service didn't make up for the overpriced, bad food either.  I had to ask for water 3 times.  Needless to say, I won't be returning or recommending this place.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
When you're in the Mission, you can afford to be picky with your tacos. There are trendy tacos, cheap tacos, choco tacos, and everything in between around the area, ready for your gullet.

Tacolicious is one of the former shops, specializing in a hip vibe to digest a taco or two. The menu has got typical items (chrorizo) alongside rarer options (duck). All are pretty good and made with care, but they are pretty small. This wouldn't be a problem, but when you're charging $4 per taco, you start to think something is amiss, especially when other taquerias have them for less than half as much. If you've got extra funds (or a large party to take advantage of their $33 for 10 deal), add a star.
author: Casey S.

description:
Came here with a group of coworkers & friends around 6pm. There were 7 of us and they seated us in the back. We mentioned that we may have more joining but they told us bluntly that they can't accommodate for that. i guess that's reasonable given it seems to be a popular place. I honestly didn't like it very much. I can see the appeal since it's a hip bar/lounge-ish feel with mexican food, but the food cannot compare to the mexican food right next door at taqueria cancun or at el farolito down the street. If you want real authentic, good mexican food go to the hole-in-the walls. 

This place has a wide selection of alcohol and it's definitely much much cleaner but also more expensive, more pretentious, and just not as yummy. I also don't like mexican food so maybe it's just based on my preferences -- despite this i still really like el farolito & taqueria cancun. =) 

If you have friends from out of town and you want to show them the awesome mexican food we have in the city -- take them elsewhere. If you want to get drunk and spend more money -- take them to tacolicious!
author: Annie Z.

description: This taco joint is great to dine at! If you are getting delivery, they sadly do not offer their daily specials which is annoying because I could have their tacos about once a week;) I've been to the one down in PA and the one in SF, both are petty good! For two people it's about $60 with one drink each!
author: Madeleine E.

description:
We went to the Mission location yesterday, beautiful, sunny & extra busy due to activities in the area, for Earth Day. 
We arrived at 2pm and were seated promptly. Our waitress was very pleasant, our order taken promptly, 3 tacos, a margarita, bubbly sangria, and a kale salad. All arrived within 10 minutes during which time we had been served delicious chips & salsa. Kale salad was a big hit. Modern Deco, Great vibe, Fast device. Good food. Just what we wanted. Pricey though. $65 incl tip.
author: AJ D.

description: Get the butternut squash taco! So tasty. We went there for lunch and got two tacos each. Perfect amount of food especially with the complimentary chips and salsa. Very reasonably priced too!
author: Kelsey S.

description: Such delectable gourmet tacos! The Pacific Cod and the Chicken Mole are to die for!
author: Roshni K.

description:
Tacolicious is delicious without the D-star rating.  This little taco hut is serving some good mood food.  4 tacos for $13 can't be beat and if you're feeling really hungry/adventurous there is a 10 for $31 deal.  The asparagus and mushroom tacos was a little bland and the chicken en mole colorado was pretty sweet but I would highly recommend the Braised beef short rib taco.  Yum yum yum!  My partner had the Chorizo special which he loved. A bit too salty for me though, but chorizo usually is.  Be careful of the 3 sauces that come out.  The yellow one may look pretty but it is spicy!

The fried sweet plantains were plentiful served with a small scoop of re-fried beans and a cream sauce - not too crispy, not too sweet.  The chili con queso was a great way to start off our meal with complimentary chips and salsa.

And of course, the drinks!  Margaritas are their specialty and once you've had a sip or two, you'll understand why.  T-lish is a great place to spend a warm afternoon with a drink in hand and small bites on your plate.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Ohhhhh Tacolicious how you've disappointed me. 

First off the first time I came here maybe 2yrs ago it was BOMB!! Delicious taco great FULL SIZE chocotaco 

Last night however was disappointing. I eat clean all week and get so excited when I can have a cheat meal. WHAT A WASTE OF CARBS AND CALORIES. 

FOOD "ZERO STARS"
-the tortillas taste uncooked and raw 
- the meat (besides the fried cod) taste so overly cooked and dry even with all the salsa it was like chewing chalky meat
- the fish was really oily 
- CHOCOTACO that use to be REGULAR size is now the size of an old school pager for $8 SERIOUSLY it's literally maybe two bites possibly one (if you have a large mouth lol) 
- the churros were ok even though my friends took one bite and put it back on the plate

 STARs for the staff they were super sweet and accommodating and the CHIPS they were about the best thing there hahah

you know it's bad when 5 hungry ass girls who went in to the restaurant wanting to eat 5 tacos each and only ate may 7-8 between all of us. Smh we each took 1-2 bites of each taco. They must just cook the meat continuously ALL DAY long that the only way I can image why every meat taste sooo freaking dry
author: Ivory R.

description:
Torn between a 3.5 and a 4.

I had 4 tacos: chorizo/potatoes, carnitas, chicken con mole, and the beef -- none of them stroke me as delicious (to my disappointment)

But the squid a la placha and camarones al Diablo were amazing! I would definitely those two appetizers! The complimentary chips were also great especially their salsa. 

We had to wait about 30 minutes on a Saturday night but good thing there was a bar next door where we could hang out while we wait for our table.
author: Nin A.

description: Absolutely amazing Tacos and cocktails ! This is our default go to joint in the city ! I would recommend everyone to defi check out this place. The bar adjoining the restaurant serves mean pastrami and cactus tacos ! YUMMY IN MY TUMMY ! :-)
author: Amit T.

description:
No tacolicious. All the trendy horn rimmed glasses, fixed gear bikes and mustache wax cannot save your poor soul.

Being 50% from Texas, and also being 50% Mexican, I've eaten my fair share of tacos. 

An HOUR later, we were seated. Thinking everything was just going to be so damn good and so tacoDELICIOUS, we ate as many chips as we could trying to avoid the fruit salad they gave us that they called salsa....

Let's start with the drinks we ordered. The Margarita was a glorified lemonade with shitty tequila. Please. And with A MILLION ice cubes and a straw? I mean is California that far removed from all that is NOT craft cocktails? Also, they put ice in my prosecco and added a straw....I can't. 

So we ordered the cod tacos (fried as hell), the carnitas, and some veggie melange bs.

We basically drenched everything in  the three sauces they brought out because let's face it my taco tasted like a tempura fish stick with cole slaw. 

I would never go here again. If you want tacos make them yourself. Buy a package of corn tortillas, a couple pounds of pork shoulder and some oranges and do yourself a favor. Also google "margarita recipe" because let's face it your better off buying yourself a nice tequila and getting drunk FAR away from the bartenders at this joint.

All of that, or just go to any city/pueblo/suburb/town in Texas where people know how to make tacos.
author: lauren g.

description:
Place is packed! Parking sucks but it's SF so it's expected.. Was seated within 5 minutes even though there was a line out the door. 

Came at night and a little dark for my preference but the food was delicious.. Their carnitas was on point! Empanadas yummy!! Their chips and salsa is worth coming here just for that!!
author: Rob C.

description: The tacos here are pretty good. I ordered the cod, carnitas, chicken, and chorizo tacos and my favorite was the chorizo. It was very flavorful and had a good portion of meat in it. All of the tacos had good portions of meat but I found there to be a little lack of seasoning in the other three. The sauces that they gave on the side were a little too spicy for me, but my favorite was the green. They gave chips with salsa before the food was served and the chips were kind of bland. Otherwise the decor is really nice and cosy. I would definitely give it a try if you're in the area.
author: Divya K.

description: so my cousin and I were on a mission for tacos and decided to give this place a try, and I must say I'm glad we did. Wayne had excellent customer service and treated us well, he is amazing and the true definition of how customer service should be delivered because of him I would be happy to return. Now the lets get to the food which was also great I tried the cod tacos both grilled and fried. even the chips and salsa which had a hit of mint was delicious. and to top it off we tried the churros. Perfect place for Taco Tuesday, mission accomplished. Thanks Wayne.
author: Addictive I.

description:
I guess it's not really fair to compare Tacolicious to a taco truck. The taco trucks produce tacos that are just as good as Tacolicious but for much less $$$. However, Tacolicious does have some interesting meats that you wouldn't normally find at a taco truck. But frankly you're just paying to eat tacos at a nice hip restaurant.

I got the braised short rib taco and it was good. It came out with a fancy serving set of 3 salsas.

I also got the chile con queso (special recipe) and it was not that great. It was okay cheese with pieces of pepper in it that didn't contribute anything to the taste. For $7.50 I was expecting more. Don't bother ordering this. Just stick with the free salsa.
author: Jean K.

description: In a place full of excellent Mexican restaurants, this is just completely overpriced and very average quality. Service was also terrible. The waitress forgot half of our order initially and then simply forgot our table altogether so that I had to get up and and get one of her colleagues to bring us the rest of our food. We ended up getting our drinks at the end of our meal with them having sat on the bar counter for 20 minutes until i went to grab them myself. Avoid this place and go somewhere else. Your money is better spent on most other places in the Mission.
author: Anna C.

description:
A lot of us held off on posting negative yelp reviews so the matter could be resolved but after days of management basically going ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ here we are. 

They have a special events/private area and a special events manager -- you'd think they would know how to coordinate special events. What kind of special events manager doesn't include basic info in their contract such as spending cap or even an outline of what the establishment agrees to provide? They only mentioned a $1500 minimum. As a result of their lameness (at best, incompetence or at worst, shadiness), my friend got screwed over royally. (And I'm not just talking about the $200+ booking fee.)

Our party was 50-60 people, Tuesday night. My friend was given the impression that the Taco Tuesday special would be served -- they did indeed serve the basic Taco Tuesday tacos but charged their fancy catering taco price. They failed to mention that last part to my friend. Sooo $30 per person for a sad, basic bitch spread of tacos (my bf and I got to eat three) and bowls of queso and salsa that went mostly uneaten because service never replenished the chips. And this was charged per person, whether you ate or not. 

On top of that, they kept on pouring their watery-ass, small (rocks glass sized) $10 (!!!!!) margaritas, racking up a crazy bar bill without my friend's consent. $6 Modelos. $3 Cokes. Places that have their shite together will include a spending cap in their contract as to avoid any unpleasant surprises like this. $4500. More than twice what my friend was thinking it'd be. PS: I am a liiiightweight and even after two, didn't feel anything. 

BOO-URNS. Large gatherings - watch out!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I have been to this restaurant a few times by habit. The tacos and drinks are good, but way too overpriced, especially with the dozens of other options around.

Most important, NEVER HOLD A PARTY OR HAPPY HOUR HERE. I attended a friend's birthday here, only to find out they way over charged our group of forty. I know it's hard to believe but the bill turned out to be $70/person for two tacos, two drinks, and chips. And that's before tax and tip! 

The restaurant didn't tell us about the obscene charges or make us sign a contract. They charged per person, when some people didn't even eat. Although we learned a lesson, their management did not handle this in good faith. I will never dine here again.
author: Richard P.

description: The vegan squash tacos were cold and in no way lived up to my expectations after having read about how good they were supposed to be. The guacamole was way too liquidy and everything was too pricey given the food we received. The place was slammed but we were able to wait it out for an hour at the bar next door which is pretentious by the way and also overpriced. Overall I'd sum my experience up with a 'meh' and next time I want amazing guacamole and vegan tacos (which is always) I'll stay home and make it myself.
author: Morgen S.

description: Great environment and service. Didn't really like the veggie or shrimp tacos. The cod taco was delicious though. I also really liked the salsa they brought out with the chips.
author: Lindsay L.

description: I really don't understand the hype behind this place. The tacos are mediocre, not every flavorful. They also have some funky salsa. We also had their grilled corn and it had wayyyy too much sauce on it. Also, the Margs have essentially no tequila in them. It's all lime juice.
author: Jacqueline M.

description:
I have been here a few times now, most recently for a friend's birthday. After they gouged us tremendously, I won't be back. The prices at this place are absurd.

I had five small, watery margaritas that had almost no alcohol in them--after 5 of them plus a beer, I wasn't even buzzed. Those weak margaritas, which the bartender was just freely refilling without even asking, turned out to be $10 each. Bottles of Modelo were $6. Diet Coke was $3. Tacos with chips and guacamole were $30 per person.

All in, I paid $110 for chips and guacamole, 3 tacos, and 5 weak margaritas. That's not including the $200+ booking fee they charged for the privilege of being ripped off. $110! For comparison, the 5 course tasting menu at Gary Danko is $117.

The cherry on top is that they charge a full 5% "city mandates" fee, which is the highest I've ever seen. You pay tax on that as well, so consider yourself warned that you'll be paying 14.2% extra in taxes and fees on top of the already-high prices, and then tipping on top of that. (To the staff's credit, the service was very good.)

Obviously their group prices are set to take advantage of giant companies who don't care what the cost is, so unless you're Google or Facebook, I'd save your and your friends' money and head somewhere reasonable.
author: Derek S.

description: I love this place! I love the menu. It's really artfully done. I love their taco and dessert options. I wish however that they would put some goddamn burritos and quesadillas on the menu because who doesn't want a burrito! I got the fried cod taco and the chorizo and potatoes taco. It comes with two soft tacos, so it's like two tacos in one serving. I know this isn't new. I also got a moss juice drink and it was wonderful. I don't drink alcohol, but love nice juice blends, so check those out! Not a cheap place to eat. Clean and modern interior. This is exactly what Valencia Street has to offer the world and I will be back.
author: Denise C.

description:
Great tacos and salsa! The service seemed off, however, and there was some mix-up with our orders. The place was busy - we got there around 5:30 on a Saturday night - and apparently they were having issues with their computers. 

We waited about 15-20 minutes between taking our seats and actually ordering our drinks.

My table of 8 ordered 4 orders of 4 tacos and everything came out on two platters. The person delivering our food could not seem to tell us what tacos were what and our waitress was very hard to get a hold of. We ended up with one taco not being what we ordered but we were happy to eat it anyway. Very tasty!

The cocktails were creative and eclectic though two of them were so spicy, they were nearly undrinkable. 

I give 4 stars for the food, 2 for the service.
author: Trish P.

description: I have been to this place 2 times with friends and my experience was just ok. They have very good cocktails, and the restaurant is very well-located with a nice ambience. However, servers could be very slow especially during rush hours. Food is just ok, nothing special about this place
author: Mina R.

description: Love the food here, kept me coming back. Service was always terrible. Last time our server was visibly very drunk. It was a sunday at about 10pm, the restaurant was almost completely open-no host, bar tender told us to sit where ever. We sat at a 2 top and the table was wobbly so we scooted over to the 4 top which was also wobbly. Server harassed us about sitting at a 4 top, and we could immediately see/smell how drunk she was. She stumbled bringing us our food, and that was the last we saw of her. ignored completely after that. had to order from a busser, and still didn't see her again. I understand working in the service industry and getting a little buzzed, but definitely don't be sloshed. Especially if your the kind of person who gets aggro when you drink.
author: Lazer W.

description:
SIGH...

I used to like this place. I don't think of this as an authentic place AT ALL, but it was hip and the drinks were tasty. 

UNTIL

I came here for a birthday party for a very dear friend. The coordinator was SO unclear about the cost, that when the bill finally came at the end of the night, it RUINED the birthday for this friend. No one gave him and estimate, he picked things off the menu because of the normal price, but instead he was charged different prices. When a place has a backroom used for private parties, they usually have staff that are dedicated to making the party and the host feel comfortable and knowledgeable about the charges. THIS DID NOT HAPPEN. Because of this gross neglect, I will never revisit this establishment.
author: Nnekay F.

description:
This newer establishment in "The Mission SF" is ATROCIOUSLY OVERPRICED and UNCLEAR, maybe even NOT TRUE in negotiating contracted prices with their clients!

Yeah, your establishment is in the more popular neighborhoods of San Francisco BUT why do you THINK you can charge as if your restaurant is in PACIFIC HEIGHTS SF?!??!?!

SUGGESTION......RE-CONSIDER your price allocations for your clientele and THEIR NEEDS not YOURS!??!  Or you'll be LOSING many, many clientele that APPRECIATE FAIR service WITHOUT HIDDEN FEES!!!!

What goes around, comes around.....is all I need to say....
author: Nan P.

description:
We waited 45 mins to 1 hour to be seated for a group of 2 on a Sunday night. No biggie. We walk around, come back, and get seated at a high table. The atmosphere was loud and dim.

They give us some tortillas and dip. Great. We order some carnitas, chicken, cod, and beef tacos. They tasted amazing, no doubt, and for such great pricing, too. The service was also amazing.

We went home later that evening and had the most painful stomach aches. I haven't experienced anything so painful and felt quite tired when having to go to work the next morning. Because of this, we're afraid to go back. It's pretty unfortunate.
author: Elisa L.

description:
The food was good, the service was good, but the portions were tiny. I feel like at this price point, there should be a bit more food.

We ordered 7 tacos as two people and it ended up being $30. The tacos were really good -- quality and ingredients were up there -- but it still felt expensive per taco.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Came here for delicious tacos for my sister's birthday lunch. A light lunch. She was so excited to finally check this place because of good the good reviews. Everyone from the hostess who seated us, to the gentleman who delivered our food and bused our table were extremely welcoming and nice.

However, our server ALEX, was kind up until we ordered. We didn't have much of an appetite but settled for the 4taco deal. We all got the impression that since we only ordered 4 tacos to share amongst us, we all sensed an attitude and bad vibes going forward.

After we place out order ALEX says "Is that it?"

Then when checking up on us ALEX  says " Is that all you want?" Very much short and clipped. 

When she drops the tab ALEXsays "don't forget about the check?" Okay, I'm not stupid. We aren't going to forget about paying the bill.

When ALEX sets the card & check back on the table she says " There you go." Not a smile. Not a thank you. Nothing sincere from her demeanor.

I asked the buser if our server was in a bad mood. He was kind in trying to apologize on her behalf but at the end of the day, they're overall customer service is dependent on their weakest link. I wish that our tip went towards everyone else but out actual server because ALEX only brought negativity to an otherwise great experience.

Fortunately, we still tipped her 20% but that's for the great cod, beef, chicken and pork tacos and the service provided by everyone BUT ALEX. 

Will return again but will not want Alex to be our server. 

Just because we only order 4 tacos, doesn't mean that we are cheap customers. 

Thank you to everyone but ALEX.
author: Angeliza L.

description: Okay tacolicious is pretty good pretty good but its kinda pricey. It's like 5 bucks per taco but hey if you eat two you can get decently full esp cause they give you unlimited chips. GAWD those chips will be the death of me. You just keep munching on them until your food comes and by then you're too full to eat your actual dish. Oh well! This place has a nice ambiance and the servers are very nice very nice. I'd come back here fsho.
author: Jane K.

description:
I love this place! My friend and I were searching all over for a sign that said "Tacolicious" but....... there is only small orange* cartoon taco sign.

To my surprise, this place was pretty awesome! My friend and I chose to be seated outdoors, there were heaters and cute little lights that strung across the hall.

The food was great and surprisingly very filling. My friend and I ordered the squid from the starters menu and four tacos for 14$. (or 1 for 3.95) We also tried out a fruity drink with pineapple, passion fruit and sparkling limonade. It was all surprisingly filling and we were struggling to finish the last few tacos. 

Definitely coming back to try out the other dishes and foooods :)
author: Mel T.

description:
Overpriced "Mexican" food. Weak wait staff. $5 dollar sub par tacos. Queso is embarrassingly bad microwaved velvetta. 

Taco special: BLT?!?! Literally a slice of bacon, thin slice of tomato, and cilantro... What a joke!
author: James W.

description:
I was here Memorial Day and it was packed. I heard this place is always busy.

I would expect more than an hour wait if you want to be seated on a table.

We decided to just order take-out and walk to Dolores Park to eat our tacos.

It's a bit odd but their take-out orders go through the bartenders. Yes, those guys that serves alcohol. I was somewhat puzzled when the host told me to tell the bartender my take-out orders at the bar. 

It actually works out pretty good. The bartender takes your order like ordering a drink then the taco bar makes the tacos for you. It took them less than 5 minutes to make 4 tacos. 

Overall the tacos are okay. It's just a hype.
author: irwin v.

description:
Its a chain but I love it!  I crave these tacos and margaritas all the time and haven't found a place in Seattle that rivals either.

I recommend the taco sampler, a house margarita, and a seat at the bar.
author: Naomi B.

description:
The only place in San Francisco with Tex-Mex style queso. (that does it right)

Pros-

+ Friendly/Attentive Staff
+ Cold beers
+ queso

Cons - 

- As with everythiing in San Francisco, parking is a nightmare near the restaurant
- Weekends are super busy and you'll probably have a wait

Pro Tip - Theres a nice outdoor section that is great when the sun is hitting it. It's a narrow area so only gets sun for a couple of hours in the middle of the day.
author: Robert B.

description:
Tacolicious has become a victim of its own success, and sadly, it is believing its own hype. I now go to Tacolicious only for lunch, and avoid it for dinner at all costs.

Their house-made salsas are top-notch, their queso dip is ridiculous, and their selection of tacos is impressive and delicious. 

But the prices continue to climb, outpacing the service, ambiance and actual food. We've been to Tacolicious well over eight or nine times, and this past trip was what brought me down from 4 stars to 3.

The Drunken Beans have gone up to $8 for a bowl - but the bowl I got wasn't even half full of beans. We had to wait over 45 minutes for a table, which is becoming standard. The volume level at dinner is so high that casual conversation is impossible. 

Dinner for a small family - 2 adults & 1 child - came out to $50. And if I'm going to spend $50+ on dinner with the family, I'd at least like to leave full and without tinnitus. 

I'll stick to T-Lish for lunch meetings, but avoid the dinner "scene" from here on out.
author: Greg Q.

description:
We attended a friend's engagement party here -- they had reserved the bright blue back room, filled with pretty plants and pop art, like a funky Latin greenhouse. It was the perfect backdrop for a festive group of 50 or so, made even better by strong drinks, saucy grub, and attentive servers. 

They set-up a mini bar in the back room for us, and served carafes of exotically flavored margaritas -- their menu has about 20 different tequila 'tails. The food was some of the best Mexican we've had, immediately demonstrated with the guacamole & salsa. It's kinda strange to wax poetic about chips, salsa & guac, but there really was something rave-worthy about Tacolicious's recipe. Later, they served big bowls of the "Marina girl" salad, and platters of their most popular tacos: the rock cod (fave!), beef short rib, and beer braised chicken. They were almost fork & knife tacos, piled high with toppings and heavy-handed on the meat. For $4, I'd come back and make a meal of these babies. 

Tacolicious has obviously earned it's SF-institution status. Good food can only get you so far, but it's the sexy-festive ambiance that really makes this a spot to crave. For girls night, date night, family dinners (maybe?) or big parties, Tacolicious is a definite crowd pleaser.
author: Nique F.

description: The tacos are filling and delicious. Great price for a great meal-first time I've had good mole in a while. For for drinks I recommend the Papi hemmingway and the Fillmore Paloma.
author: Aidan B.

description: Simply best tacos! And of course don't miss a chance to try their Spicy chili margarita ;)
author: Vlada C.

description: Atmosphere was cool, kinda loud but I liked how it was pretty chill. The service was great, I didn't get our server's name but it was this blonde girl who was super nice. Actually all the staff there were really nice lol. Despite it being busy on a Thursday night we were lucky enough to get a table right away. The food was okay, kinda expensive but I liked how they had a weekly taco special. Nice try tacolicious, maybe I'll give you another chance. Maybe I'll come back for the drinks next time lol.
author: Julla E.

description:
Would Tacolicious work in the Mission where there are so many representations of Mexican food already? Ask yourself where there's a family friendly, date friendly, and group friendly, sit down style place in the genre. Exactly. it's pretty tough. Lot's of taquerias but someplace where you can get a solid drink, snacks or a full on meal versatility? This is it. Make sure you pay attention to the special tiles imported from Mexico and the mural with special messages by Paul Madonna on the patio (which is almost finished). Things had:

-Al pastor taco
-Nopales and queso taco
-Ceviche
-Salvadorean style tamale
-4505 Meats Chicharron

Solid eats all around as was the service from the enthusiastic staff on the soft opening. Of course the ambiance and clientele are completely different from the Marina locale but the consumables are consistently good. Can't wait for the patio to open up and have the warm weather make it's way around.
author: Kim N.

description:
" Tacolicious makes the boys go loco..." 

Tacolicious is a great pre party spot! Seriously, this is the perfect place to catch the marina crowd prior to a night out. They have a decent happy hour and a decent sized tequila selection.

The guacamole and chips are very yummy, a great way to carb up before trying some of their margaritas. My favorite ritas are the Fresca and Nopal.

The tacos are yummy but different. Think dressed up street tacos. The Fried Local Rock Cod Taco is a bit too greasy. The best tacos are the Carnitas and Beef Short Rib. The Chicken and Bistec Adobado are also good.

So why minus two stars? The service here is inconsistent. I've had my order messed up and forgotten one too many times.
author: Caro S.

description:
Came here for a special event.  Have been a couple times before and the results have been spotty.  First, the margaritas were watered down -- I had 4 and could have performed brain surgery, they may have had no tequila in them at all.  The food for the special event was grossly overpriced ($40/pp for 2 tacos each).  The chips were cold, but the guacamole was pretty good.  Service overall was very good from the waitstaff, but the customer service after the experience has been atrocious.

Way overpriced, non-communicative event staff, and a rope-a-dope switcheroo leaves me not only with a bad taste in my mouth, but a question about the ethics of the people who run this joint.  There are lots of other choices in this town and you can't put out a substandard product, charge a fortune, and then treat people like crap and expect it to last.  Unless you're Zeitgeist, then it's ok.
author: Zack K.

description: Great place to meet friends, however there will always be a wait. No reservations. Also the seating is incredibly uncomfortable. The cheese dip is incredible as are the fish tacos.
author: Anastasia J.

description:
Crowded, busy, noisy, "ok" food with a lot of hipster window dressing.

With so many authentic Latino offerings in the Mission - why tacolicious? Maybe folks out there love "ambiance", I could really give a damn. If the food is not good I'm not coming.

The food is "fair", but with all the other inconveniences - long waits, sometimes rude staffs, high prices... I am not going out of my way for Tacolicious. Ever.
author: Doug R.

description:
Solid drinks and tacos in a lively space - but I wouldn't wait long for it.

My friend and I arrived later on a weeknight so only had to wait about 10 minutes to get a couple of seats at the bar. 

The bartender's dry wit wouldn't have been for everyone, but we thoroughly enjoyed it - and we all increasingly enjoyed chatting as he eavesdropped, then joined in on, on our conversations. He gave us some much appreciated recommendations as to drinks and taco filling choices - along with some other good life advice.

Drinks and food were solid. We shared 1) the charred butternut squash, braised leeks, kale, 2) traditional carnitas, 3) chicken en mole colorado, and 4) "baja style" pacific cod. The chicken mole was my favorite, while my friend was a fan of the carnitas. A decent value at 4 for $17.95. Similarly, drinks were not outrageous (~$10 per cocktail) and tasty if not super inventive. 

So why just 3 stars? Because I can't imagine waiting more than 15 minutes for this experience - and most people do. It's fine - just seems overrated for what most people go through to eat there.
author: Jessica H.

description:
Good luck. Friends from the area said great things. Arrived, put my name down for a table, and went down the street for a cocktail while we waited the 20 minutes we were told it would take to get a table. 

30 minutes later we head back to check on the table and I'm told they didn't have my name, had no idea that we were waiting, and they could add me to the current wait list. 

Gtfo. 

Worst experience in my 5 day visit to San Francisco. Love this town. Tacolicious could learn a few things from our taquerias in Texas.
author: Aaron F.

description: Love this place. Great drinks, great tacos, friendly staff. There's usually always a bit of a wait time, but enjoy a drink and some chips/salsa at the bar and the time flies by.
author: Catherine T.

description:
I have been dying to try this place for the longest time! To be honest, I have only had tacos ONCE in my life, right?! Where have I been.. and it was a fish taco. Since my boyfriend was in town, I asked him what he wanted to have for dinner before we went out to see some friends at the lounge later on a Friday night. My boyfriend is always pretty open minded when it comes to trying new things. So, we went. Parking was not the easiest to find. The location of the restaurant was somewhat hidden and we walked back a fourth from the block until we really figured it out. haha. But, we asked the lady in the front how long the wait would be and she said 30-35 minutes. Which did not make me that happy because I am impatient when i'm hungry =/  But, we stood inside since it was relatively cold. With only about 10 minutes of a wait, the waitress seated us! I was so happy. We sat down and they brought us what looked and tasted like homemade chips and salsa. IT WAS SO GOOD. The salsa had a spicy kick to it. As we were deciding on what to order, I immediately knew I wanted the made to order guacamole because I love guac, I could literally eat it on everything if I had it with me 24/7. We ordered a total of six tacos. 3 short ribs, 1 chicken, 1 cod, and 1 traditional carnita. 

We were nibbling away on the chips and salsa when the guacamole came and it was amazing. The best guacamole ever! Hands down. not too long after, our tacos came. We did not realize they were so huge and stuffed. As in STUFFED. my intentions were to only eat 2 and my boyfriend wanted 4. But, after having One. I was full. 

I would have to say my favorite was the short ribs and my boyfriend liked the traditional carnita. We will definitely be back. Although, I was not too fond of the very loud noise, but it was not too bad.
author: Audrey K.

description:
Y'alls know that you can get delicious tacos that are just as good, if not better, than Tacolicious' for half the price, right?

I'm a little salty at Tacolicious because it got me in trouble! A client wanted to lunch here. I couldn't say no. The bill for 3 of us? $130 (including tip). $130 for a TACO lunch for 3 people! I was SO pissed and the person who approves my expense report was not having it. 

Needless to say, this place is outrageously expensive. Unless these are tacos that magically give you superpowers, why would you ever pay $4+ for a street taco that you can get from a truck for more than half the price? Was it good? Yeah, it was alright. But definitely not worth the cost. I imagine this place is only frequented by those paying $5,000/month for 1-bedroom apartments at NEMA because OMG, it is so overpriced. Next time, no matter how important the client is, I'm going to draw the line at Tacolicious and their $4.50 tacos. 

Tacolicious is the new $5 toast.
author: Logan The H.

description: Hip taco spot with good but of course pricy food & cocktails. Taco of the week a fun choice & oh so tasty. Provided with a variety of different flavored & temperature hot sauces with some not very spicy but really good salsa. No lack of taco spots in the mission but this one is worth checking out.
author: Adam O.

description:
The tacos are OK, not bad. I didn't hate them. But OMG they are expensive. $5 a piece? Really?

I'm confused by this place. It's full of douchebags, the tacos are WAY overpriced, and it's in a location full of well known traditional taquerias that will gladly serve you tasty tacos for 1/2 the price. Why do you people give this place such high marks? Clearly SF's tastes have gone....way downhill.

Their drinks were OK as well, if not super weak. I had the El Diablo. Again, lots of better places to go.
author: Michael D.

description:
27-September, Friday
While the warm queso was really delicious, 
it was perhaps a tad bit over-salted. 
The house-made chips paired really well with it.

4x Taco Platter
1. Braised chicken
2. Spare rib 
3. Chorizo & potato (this one was my favorite, I thought the greasy mouth feel of the Chorizo complemented the startchy potato quite well)
4. Carne Asada

I have mixed feelings about Tacolicious, this would have been my 3rd time here and each consecutive time completely different from the last of whether something tasted agreeable or not, as well as environment.  

This night for example, they had the music deaf-ly blaring and it was difficult, if not -borderline impossible to hear any of the conversation between my friend and I. While I do like the out-door heated seating that would have equated to nearly a 90 minute wait to snag a table there.

Also I am a bit perplexed with the employees here, what's with the quick retorts and douch-y attitudes? I think everyone must be a bit handicapped from the noise to have any mental grasp on the concept of urgency, or attentive service.
author: Ty T.

description:
New spot in the Mission. No sign out front except for an avant garde  taco shell. Spacious attractive room with big windows looking out on Valencia and on the great mural of Mission High School done by the All Over Coffee guy, Paul Madonna. The mural was a draw for us as we enjoy his artwork in the Sunday Chronicle.

Tacos were good as was the house margarita. I thought the margarita pretty small for the price, but, it is San Francisco. Nothing cheap here. Really enjoyed the selection of tres hot sauces. Complimentary chips and salsa were okay. Good service.
author: Delaine Z.

description:
Amazing taco's and drinks. One of my favorite restaurants.

Get the braised short rib tacos

great drinks!
author: Benjamin L.

description:
Everything was amazing from the chips and salsa (complimentary) to the amazing tacos. I can't wait to go back and try the cocktails and churros.

We started off with the sweet plantains  which were delicious and came w/bean spread and crema. We then tried some tacos- short rib and chorizo. Life changing. The trio of salsas is also top notch. Service was friendly and food came out fast. 

I'm always skeptical of places like this in the Mission. I try to avoid hipster/techie watering holes but the food here is really good and as long as you patronize the older taquerias too, tacolicious is fine every now and then. They have this great outdoor seating in an alley as well which is nice on a sunny day (there are heaters too for chilly nights).
author: Semuteh F.

description:
My boyfriend and I actually stumbled upon this place by accident--curious about the logo and the lack of name out front, we looked it up. Once we saw churros and the picture of Obama on the wall we were sold. (Though, amusingly, we were so full that we never ended up ordering the churros, and I'm not even sure if the picture of Obama was of him at this restaurant. Oh well.)

The bf ordered 4 tacos, and I ordered the pasión margarita. He got the local rock cod, taco of the day (tortilla breaded fried chicken), the chicken mole, and the braised beef short rib. I got the guac and some chips (we had just eaten lunch...this was second lunch. We do SF hobbit style.)

The braised beef taco was perhaps the best beef taco I've ever eaten--succulent, smoky, and juicy! I didn't end up trying the others because the creamy, luxurious guac and my delicious, citrusy cocktail had me fully occupied, but I trust my boyfriend's word that all of them were delicious. They may look small, but they are surprisingly filling! The chips and salsa that came with were great, with the salsa having some note of a fruit that I couldn't figure out--perhaps papaya? At any rate, it was great. The tacos came with three more salsas--I tried the hot and it was spectacular, with a tasty start and the heat to finish.

All in all, Tacolicious was a very happy accident--one that I hope to repeat again soon.
author: Lynne S.

description:
Holy spicy margarita! 

Margarita picante....I have actually had a spicy margarita before in Chicago, but this one packed more punch. It was a good thing I ordered a taco.

I tried the taco of the week, unfortunately I can't remember what it was while I was there. I do remember it being good though. I would have probably ordered another one if I hadn't just gone for ice cream before realizing I was also right by Tacolicious.
author: Britt C.

description:
Ahh Tacolicious... T-licious, for short.

Having been unable to make reservations, we decided to try and get a seat at Tacolicious anyway. When we got in, the place was PACKED. The girls at the front were doing a great job, despite all of the chaos of impatient customers asking every two minutes when they would be up next. It was loud, and plates of tacos were flying everywhere.

We decided to put our name down anyway, and went next door to admire the revolving carnitas and absorb the atmosphere. But after some minutes, we got a little restless and decided to walk around Mission.

Now, here me out: Frankly, I don't know if I would give Tacolicious four stars if I was just plain waiting. Because the wait was SO long for Tacolicious (when we first asked, the response was 40 minutes, then when we asked again, it was an hour), we were able to walk around Mission for a little bit and even got appetizers at ANOTHER restaurant in Mission.

By the time we came around to check on where we were on the list again, there was only one party ahead of us. We only had to wait for about five minutes and we were seated.

Since we thought ten tacos between the four of us wouldn't be enough, we decided to go with 20 tacos for $66... which was both a good and bad decision. How? 

Good = The tacos were REALLY good, we left very full and even got a compliment from our waitress on how she hasn't seen anyone clear 20 tacos like we did.

Bad = $66 is a lot to pay for tacos, and we left not just very full, but EXTREMELY full.

All and all, it was really fun. The ambiance is really cool and you can't help but feel kind of trendy when you're there on a Saturday night 8) Definitely a great place to take friends, but be prepared to wait especially on a Friday/Saturday night.
author: Sara C.

description:
Craving tacos? Tacolicious it is then. 

Sadly they don't celebrate Taco Tuesday... but I'd come by for their tacos any day. Fanny W. and I were craving tacos, so we decided to check out Tacolicious. I've had Tacolicious once before at some food fest and they were pretty damn good! Anyway, we arrived around 8pm on a Tuesday and the place was PACKED. The restaurant is divided into two sections: a bar section on the left and a seating area on the right. Loved the modern decor with the dark walls and the trendy lights (I guess that makes it modern?). I thought the bar ceiling was pretty awesome, it was covered in glass jars with random little items inside. 

We went with the 4 tacos for $13 on the menu. We got a pair of the Rock Cod tacos and a pair of the Taco of the Week Alambre Taco. Rock Cod taco was bomb, super buttery rock cod with cabbage drenched in a creamy tangy sauce. The Alambre Taco was my fave and filled with beef, chorizo, caramelized onion, poblano and cheese. It was delicious. We also shared an order of the Skillet Roasted Mussels which was served with a chile, cilantro, lime butter dipping sauce. Mussels are my fave shellfish, and the chefs here didn't disappoint... I would much rather the mussels be drenched in a sauce rather than fried on a skillet, but either way will do. 

At first we were anxious and wanted to order four tacos each, but our waiter was awesome and warned us we might not be able to handle it, good looking out! Prices are alright, pretty hipster restaurant, but what do you expect from restaurants on Valencia nowadays?
author: Elaine N.

description:
Enjoyed a nice dinner here last Friday with my girlfriend. We sat inside on one of the bar tables close to the kitchen. The tacos were delicious with just the right amount of meat, but the cod tacos were a little salty but still good. Definitely try the tuna tostadas!

Very lively vibe inside and well lit with windows opening to the outdoor patio. Service was great and we always had enough water. Definitely satisfied.
author: Josh L.

description:
Wow. This was really good. I was only in San Fran for a short time and only got to the Mission for the afternoon but I'm really glad I picked this place for lunch, even if it is a chain. 

I had a margarita (with salt), the chips and salsa, the kale and butternut squash taco, the braised short rib taco and the rice-a-licious. This was the perfect amount of food for one hungry chick. I think the only thing that kept me from eating it all was the heat. I don't take spicy food well and I would say everything from the salsa to the  food had a good kick to it. It probably isn't bad at all for someone who can take it. That being said, the food was so good I looked (and ate) passed that. 

The chips were hot and fresh, the salsa was tasty, like I said, a little kick. Excellent margarita, strong but well flavored to mask the tequila somewhat, which is ideal for me. The short rib taco was packed with the braised beef, I had to eat some off to close the taco. it only includes a small garnish on top but really doesn't need anything. The meet is a little oily as you can see it staining the taco but it maximized the taste and wasn't at all too oily to eat. Adding a squirt of lime on top really eased the heat for me. The squash kale taco was so much better than I thought it would be. Still hearty though not including any meat, all the flavors went together really nicely. Sweetness of the squash, bitterness of the kale, crunch of the pumpkin seeds - absolutely delish. Lastly was the rice. The rice was good but it also had a kick to it and I would have preferred that to be my savior from the heat. It was flavorful though and had a lime sauce on top. I didn't eat all the rice but I could see it was a bit oily at the bottom of the bowl. It was good but maybe my least favorite of what I had. 

I really wanted to try their churros but I was headed to bi-rite creamery for dessert so I passed them up. Maybe next time!
author: Samantha M.

description:
The braised short rib taco is great. However...

It's generally very crowded and noisy. For me, the service has ALWAYS been inconsistent. There's only so many ways you can make a taco appealing enough to want to pay almost 5 bucks per bite. 

Humanely treated animals, no hormones, mostly gluten free, local veggies... Yawn, very San Francisco. 8 bucks for a churros?  Aye, por dios.

Alright food, blah service, and over-priced food and drinks. I don't see the value.

2 out of 4 times, our server was taking shots with the bartender. One had a beer behind the register that she continuously sipped throughout the night. They were clearly both drunk.
author: Thomas Nathan S.

description: Food is good and drinks at pretty good but expensive and small. My biggest problem is that the bartender was so busy talking to his friends that he was ignoring everyone at the bar...had to wait way too long for service especially since I was sitting right in front of him and he never seemed to care or ask me if I needed anything...rather disappointing....
author: G R.

description:
I like their drinks (especially the Pasion) and I've been a regular customer over the past year or so. However, I had a really bad experience there last week...

It was a weekday, late afternoon, less crowded than usual. Sat down at the bar for 10 minutes till I got the bartender to acknowledge me. He threw a menu my way, then went back to unloading glasses till a white, yuppie-looking guy sits down next to me. The bartender immediately shows him the menu, asks what he'd like, then makes the guy a drink while I'm just sitting there...

Normally, I wouldn't mind slow service on a busy day, but here it was blatantly obvious that the bartender was making a point of snubbing me. I walked out of there without ordering, and don't plan on going back.
author: Saul K.

description:
Amazing! First this place is hopping, at least it is during the evening rush, that said the hostess did a great job accommodating our party of five and seating us in an already busy establishment. 

Service felt a little slow for me, but I believe I was the only one in our group that noted this, otherwise they were very friendly and full of smiles. The chips and salsa were kept full without a word being said and may I also mention good. 

This was just a stop for snacks so we kept it small, but I couldn't help but to go with a couple of tacos. I asked for and received the pacific cod tacos, now while the physical menu didn't differentiate, I was told, when asked, they are prepared fried; I prefer grilled and they were accommodating enough to provide. They came as ordered street style, two tortillas, a generous piece of grilled cod on a layer of guacamole, and a layer of cabbage (pickled?) onion and cilantro. Holy salivation punch Batman! This was like Niagra Falls of the face it was so good! Every layer of flavor was absolutely amazing! I nearly forgot to mention that there was a small plate of side salsas they served with our food and I used a dab of the verde on my tacos. Interestingly, had I known how these were prepared I may have asked for some mods, but I'm glad I didn't as they were perfect as the chef intended (I'm thinking I need to start letting things happen that way and open my palate to the possibilities). I also had the pleasure of sampling my brides Albondigas, which were also nothing short of amazing; the meatballs were delicate and very tasty served in a delicious sauce and very savory. I also almost forgot the salt. My lovely wife called it fuzzy, and while I am not certain about that, it was tasty, perhaps a Himalayan pink or maybe locally harvested (knowing this is done in the South Bay) for sea salt; never the less it was tasty with a delicate mouthfeel (the same salt was on our table in a small dish we used on our chips and also served on the margarita).

They had an accommodating and reasonable selection of beer, wine, and spirits; certainly enough to please most and provide some level of happiness, including sangria. Would I return? If I lived locally, I'd be back most every day of the week and twice on Sunday's. I should've remembered pictures but didn't think snacks would be so dang good, it didn't even occur to me.
author: Drew R.

description: Is it worth the extraordinarily long wait time? Well, for me, mostly. We've been a few times - and once with a big party where we asked the waiter to pick our order, which he did with aplomb. I like the tacos and the drinks have been good too. Also love their non-alcoholic drinks & could drink them all day. If you like tacos, this is one of the best places in the city. Just be patient.
author: Fi M.

description:
Tacolicious....that's where its at! Love it....a place i will return to over & over & over & over again.

A few locations. Mission is my favorite. 

Food: everything, but my top pics: ceviche, meatball soup, marina girl salad (add shrimp), shredded tacos, & guacamole!!! 

Drinks...pasion ...oh yes...do chupitos (shots) but its so delicious you are going to want to sip & savor every bit. 


Have fun...place is yummy.
author: Priscilla N.

description:
Didn't have a good experience at all for various reasons. 
To start off , the place is ridiculously expensive and doesn't justify what you get. Extremely popular place, making it a really loud , hectic environment. Not the place to go if you are trying to have any type of long conversations , more so a place to drink I see it as. Next, the hostess was really friendly and respectful the server on the other hand was not. Besides her having a poor attitude , she brought the first beverage then took 15 mins to realize she had forgot to bring the water that we had asked for. We ended up asking to take our food to go. Not that bad of a place, I just wouldn't recommend it to anyone.
author: Vee G.

description: Only had to wait 15 min for a table for 4 which was nice. The service was good and I loved the food especially the sauces and the fish tacos.
author: Andy I.

description:
First of all, service sucks. There was about 3 tables open, but the waitress HAD to get us a 2 people table and basically took us 30 minutes to get our table. And there was OPEN tables EVERYWHERE. 
Second of all, we didn't even get water. There is about 1.5 waitress/waiter in this place... And they don't even go around. Honestly it was so frustrating that we just ordered to go.
I ordered a fish taco. It was good. It was very very good. But honestly I wouldn't go back because the service is trash. I mean why make your customer wait when there are tons of 4 people tables open. Can't we just sit there??
If service is improved, might come back, but otherwise, no.
author: Diana O.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Tacolicious in general, and this one on Valencia Street in particular.  The menu is simple, solid & reasonable priced. The cocktails are creative & tasty (get yourself one of their mezcal creations). The atmosphere is lively & fun.  If you have an event, they have a sweet room in the back for you.

If you somehow haven't been here yet, start your habit immediately.
author: Sean P.

description:
Woah. La Taqueria was closed and so we headed here instead and I have got to say that I did not miss the old Mission staple. This place is awesome on a whole other level. 

First, the Chili Con Queso was absurdly good, with a deep, cheesy flavor and unctuousness that perfectly complemented the house made chips. 

Aside from the Butternut Squash Taco, which was gross and had almost a chemical taste, everything was awesome. Our favorite by far was the House Made Chorizo and Potato taco followed very closely by the Al Pastor and Carnitas. The Chicken taco has a really overpowering beer taste but I can see how some people would like that.

The Brussels Sprout side was also very good, as was the service and the margaritas. I would have liked to have tried a dessert but after the amount of Queso/Taco we had this was an impossibility. I have to say this place lives up to the hype. Very solid.
author: Paul A.

description:
This place is awesome.

My friends and I came for some lunch on a Monday and there was hardly any wait. I was starving, but I think our eyes were bigger than our stomach. Without knowing the size portions, my boyfriend and I got the 10 tacos for $33 and a couple of sides - guacamole and Mike's cheese dip. Also we got a couple of chupitos to wash down the food. Everything was so good. I enjoyed the beef short rib and the rock cod tacos.

Damn I was stuffed. Great taco joint in the Mission.
author: Rhoda G.

description:
I'm reviewing Tacolicious after the second visit. Both times I've visited, the restaurant was packed to the max to the point where it's hard to hear what the person across from you is saying. There is a person checking people in for tables...you would think he would approach me and ask if I wanted to put my name down, this being a restaurant where customer service is of utter importance right? But no, I had to literally wave my hand at him and ask if he was checking people in for tables. Then came the 45 minute wait. I mean it's tacos y'all, you can find tacos anywhere. But we decided to wait, because their salsa is pretty bomb. Yup, the salsa was the defining factor. After a good half an hour wait, my friend and I got seated between two tables (please take into account that everyone is almost touching shoulder to shoulder in here). The group next to us was absolutely hammered. To our amusement, rather than annoyance, they spilled their chips all over the floor and one of them kept tugging at my jacket. I'm going off topic, but it was just so interesting I had to share.

Anyways, back to the restaurant. The tacos are good, yes, they are, but they're also overpriced. Kinda oily, but that satisfying oily. I got the carnitas and the chicken mole one, the carnitas was definitely on a higher scale as far as my taste buds can remember.  As far as the customer service, I thought it was just okay. There seemed to be a lot of employees walking up and down the restaurant, but it's so hard to catch their attention. To be fair, our waitress asked if I was okay once the rowdy hammered group had left, which was really nice of her. To finish this story of a review, I'd said Tacolicious is a chill spot if you have lots of time to wait and have a tolerance for yelling across the table. (It's a very hipster/trendy spot!)
author: Stefany Z.

description: If you are OK with a restaurant with a noise level so loud  you can't hear yourself think then maybe you can enjoy the food. I couldn't.
author: Steven B.

description:
Good food
Good drinks 
Good company
Goodnight!!

The tacos were spot on. The Pozole tasted as if my Grandma was back there cooking. The service was over the top. Manny makes you feel like you just stepped into his own house. He was gracious and so hospitable. I highly recommend this place. Come have a Margarita and take in the Mission vibe. 

Thanks Manny we will be back !!
author: J P.

description:
Holly fraud!!! This restaurants is very popular but I really don't know why!! Well is not a good vegetarian option maybe it is for carnivores. The sauce for chips is terrible.
I ordered a nopale's taco with Oaxaca cheese and nothing special, more bad that good! Just cactus with melted cheese!! Whaaaaaa??
Guacamole tasteless... I add a little lime and was better!!
Three options for sauce, just the habanero salsa was great!! Sorry for my gringos, not good for you.
Chips OK! Services GREAT!! Everybody really nice from the host to bussers. The best part!!
Maybe, just maybe I'll be back to try for second time!
So my hipsters and people Mission you are totally wrong.
"For us to realize that tacos don't have to be relegated to street food or a corner mom-'n'-pop" WRONG!!!!! That's mean Tacolicious really don't know nothing about the puestos de tacos!!
Street tacos and fritangas corner are the basis of the popular food!!
 I send my friends in México City to El Califas  and Contramar for their opinion!! 
Califas is wrong spelling!
author: Arturo R.

description:
Nice place to have a beer and snack on a sunny Mission day.  

We shared fish tacos and a kale salad. We were pretty happy. 
Tacos:  The fish was battered (tasted like beer batter- kind of more batter than I wanted, but hey fried food is good with me) and there were 3 good salsas that came with our order. 

Salad:  The  kale salad was pretty delicious (one odd thing was addition of tomatoes which didn't go well with the nectarines.) Cumin-Lime dressing was really good and not too much.

Service: Friendly, but not stellar. Drinks came halfway through the meal....

Overall, 3 stars and I'd go back.....
author: El B.

description:
Yum yum yummy 
I love this place as the service and food is so good 
I love the 10 taco plate and my favorite is the fish taco then second close is the short rib 
The service is good to and the portions are good 
I give this place a total thumbs up 
See soon for my next taco craving !!!
author: Darryl M.

description: The food is so good, it almost makes up for the bad service. This is not to say it's the servers' fault - the place is clearly understaffed for the number of people trying to get in late on a Friday night. We ordered guac, a selection of their tacos, and some Spanish red. I'd say pass the red for sure (a Margarita might be a more obvious choice), but come hungry for some exquis Mexican fusion, because everything, including the complimentary house salsa and chips and the additional three types of salsa that came with the tacos, was exceptional. We did wait quite a bit for the table, and then the chips, and the water, and the wine, and then the check, and some more, but our patience was easily rewarded with the food that lived up to the hype.
author: Anya P.

description:
This place is always a must when I'm in town.  I love the atmosphere and the food is amazing.  They have a great selection of different tacos that include meat, vegetarian and seafood options!  I always hit up t he side bar while I'm waiting for my table. Order up a jalapeno Margarita with a small appetizer size taco.  The sauces are all amazing and add a great kick.

If you like mussels order them up.  Very unique and great to share as an app if everyone at the table enjoys them.
author: Christine S.

description:
I wanted to NOT like Tacolicious the first time I went. This was a Marina-style restaurant that popped up in the Mission, after all. What is authentic about that?? BUT my experience at Tacolicious was great... and I've been back many a time since. 

The margaritas are tart, strong and go down with the greatest of ease. They are on the expensive side, but that's when I say 'F*CK IT' and opt for a pitcher to share with my friend. Besides, there is a lot of value in the food itself. The complimentary chips and salsa are awesome... the tacos have always been solid: fresh and delicious ingredients prepared simply - they are amazing! 

The restaurant and bar are almost always crowded, so be patient. But it's worth the wait. Tacolicious is a great spot to share with a friend, a date, your Mom... you get the point.
author: Leonie S.

description:
Yeah, I'll go with my Yelp favorites' consensus and give it a three star.

Don't get me wrong, the tacos were pretty darn good. And the squid appetizer was actually one of the highlights of the meal. But my friend and I ordered the four tacos (salt cod, beef short ribs, carnitas, and chicken) and out of those, I'd say the beef short ribs was the winner even though it was a tad on the oily side.

We also split a pitcher of sangria which was refreshing but lacking more of a wine kick. A little bit on the fruit juice side or something. And the pitcher wasn't cheap either.

One concern that I share with others is how long it takes to make these tacos. Really, tacos should be pretty quick to make. Not sure why that's the case here.

Another concern is the stool set up. I don't mind sitting on stools but these are the stools from your old high school science class. The rest of the restaurant is so cool (I especially like the outdoor mural of the view of the city from Dolores park but that famous SF artist) and to take down a notch with those not-so-elegant stools is a bit sad.

I'd come back but I'm not sure about the value you get here.
author: Art O.

description:
Drinks, Taco's and awesome music!  On my last night in San Fran (Friday) our last meal was at Tacolicious.  We put our name in and they said it would be just over an hour.  My cousin said there would be a wait so we just headed over to their large bar.  It was crowded but we managed to find a spot at the end of the bar.   We all had their house margaritas and they were fantastic. After about 45mins out table was ready.

We ordered 10 tacos of assorted varieties.  They arrive quickly and we dove right in.  They were average size and filled perfectly.  We ate 9 but couldn't finish the last one.

During our meal the music went from Dr Dre to Pink Flyod to Weezer.  I thought the vibe was awesome and will stop in again the next time I'm out west.
author: Zach V.

description: Mexican food os one of my favourite. This place is not authentic but fits Valencia street pretty well. They have a small patio where is always better to sit if the weather is good. Me and my friends usually take tacos sets. It gives you an  opportunity to try different stuff.
author: Liz P.

description: Super delicious - the short rib tacos are great. I usually divide the filling between the two shells. Very popular, especially with families.  There can be a long wait for a table.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
I use to be a huge fan of Tacolicious, especially of this location... But after frequenting this location twice in one week as well as the Palo Alto location twice in the same week (yes, 4 overpriced meals total), I unfortunately am no longer a fan of the Valencia spot. 

In the last 2 years, the service has gone WAY DOWN (along with the portion sizes), while the prices have gone up. 

In my most recent experience here, and what will be my last, we had to call over every single time we needed anything like to order actual food or drinks and I experienced a waitress bump into me multiple times and reach her scaly/flaky arms over my food and drink multiple times without even so much as an excuse me. 

With all the other wonderful options in the mission for great food AND great service there's no reason to bother coming to this location again. If I'm craving tuna tostadas (a.k.a. the only real reason to go to any Tacolicious) then I'll go to the Palo Alto location since they have slightly better service than the other 3 locations and at least have a midday happy hour.
author: Julie B.

description: I love me some tacolicious.  Really amazing tuna tostados.
author: Amanda C.

description:
My family bonds loudly. 

Tacolicious in the Mission is meant for boisterous family gatherings where laughter bounces off the patio walls, dirty jokes are repeatedly shared loudly so that everyone else on the patio laughs along, margs are ordered by the pitcher, salsa purges tears from the faint of heart, and families bond. 

TLish was the perfect place to share the love. 

I am so grateful for places like this that invite these kinds of gatherings.

Ten tacos were more than enough for five hungry folks- always a good idea to try the taco of the day, this one was buffalo chicken....beef short rib is a sure thing.
Nopal is one of my favorite drinks in the city (prickly pear/tequila/citrus).
author: Jocelyn B.

description:
$5 tacos. That's fine if the tacos are exceptional. But they are meh. I tried 5 different kinds. The cod was good.  The carnitas was ok, under seasoned, I be had better. The hanger steak was just plain bad, chewy, poor seasonings, all the juice made the taco very soggy. The ribs were the worst, greasy unseasoned mess. 
These tacos can be had at any Mexican joint for $1.50.
author: Aruna P.

description: Depeche Mode playing here was about the best I could vouch for. The food was okay. A pretty hip place, but not really mexican feel. The sampling we did was okay at best.
author: Cindy M.

description: Atrocious Tacos divorciados in their brunch menu. Eggs came semi raw, drowned in a puddle of sauces with no soft tortillas to eat them with.
author: Suzann B.

description:
Orders 4 tacos. ...and a fresca margarita. Little corn tacos. ... $40 too much.
Short  braised rib ...delicious! Cornmeal chicken breast...tasty but a bit off the hook spicy. Cod fair and pulled pork fair.  Drink was excellent .....and special shout out to the bartender who made the great drinks with out tasting. Very impressive. ..  Nice job! 
Location is modern and has indoor&outdoor space. 

 I would recommend this place. ....and I don't usually prefer Mexican food.
author: Sharine d.

description:
Tacos are delicious and the food and service is consistent. My tummy can enjoy tacos without feeling heavy and lethargic afterwards. My favorites are the cod and short rib. The guac is good too! Once you get in the door, you're set. Before that, be forewarned, it can get crazy with the line and long wait. I feel for the hostess. They get badgered up. They gotta find another way. Everytime I go here I think of Nopalito. They're the one restaurant in the city that I feel has it down when it comes to managing their waitlist. 

Also, I wouldn't recommend ordering to go. I had a couple bad experiences. One time I stood at the front waiting to be helped and was overlooked by 3 servers (at least greet someone!). When I was finally directed to go to the bar to order, I waited close to 5 minutes for someone to help me, until I decided to just leave. It wasn't even packed. I gave them another chance until they boxed the vegan tacos with the non-vegan items creating a taco disaster. Dine in it is!
author: Melanie N.

description:
TACOLICIOUS!!!! IS DELICIOUS!!!! 

What secret taco society did this place join that they got access to some delicious taco recipes? This place is just so good. I could probably repeat myself over and over. 
So if forgot how the menu worked but if I could hazily tell you, it would be that they had an option of four tacos. Basically, somehow I got four tacos lol I went with the short rib, special of the day chipotle shrimp, carnitas and filet mignon.  The short rib was to die for, the filet mignon and carnitas were just perfect. I was stuffed by the time I got to the shrimp taco so I didn't get to taste it. It looked quite delicious though, was topped off with a  mango pico. 

The service was really good. Upon arriving, we were greeted and shown where to sit within a 5 minute time frame. The waitress was polite and quick, always checked up on us to make sure we were good. The ambiance was cool too, lights were a bit dim and the music at a good level. 

I loved this place! I am looking forward to my next visit.
author: Karla Emm N.

description: If there's one thing a Mexican restaurant needs to do well then it's getting the salsa right.
