This place has weird tasting salsa (it was sweet) and the other three options were were not good either.  There's no spicy salsa!  The tacos were average and overall place was ok.  I'd go to pancho villa taqueria any day for freshness variety and taste!
author: V V.

description:
Posh taco joint. Love the setting and really appreciate the alley transformed into a quaint and comfortable outdoor patio seating in the mission district. I was quite impressed with the menu choices. Definitely a step up from the normal takeout mission street taquerias. 

Tacos1 for $3.95 OR 4 for $14 OR 10 for $33
Free chips and salsa dip.
Tacos come with three levels of salsa.

Fried Local Rock Cod - I didn't taste it, but it looked so good. It is definitely on my list for next time.
Traditional Carnitas - Not the best but not the worst. Definitely very moist.
Guajillo braised beef short rib - Also very moist and quite melt in your mouth goodness. 

Special Taco of the Week was a chicken cooked in different sauce. It was very tasty. I just wished I wrote down the listing. Oh wells. I guess I can say, DO TRY THE WEEKLY SPECIAL!!!

Overall, I loved the vibe. It is a way nicer place than the regular taquerias. It seems to be a great  place for group gatherings, family brunch, or relax date with a new bf or brunch with the girls. I did also quite enjoy their top shelf creative cocktails. Margarita Fresca, Tickle Me Telmo, and Moss (non-alcoholic) were all very delicious.
author: Janice T.

description: The tacos didn't blow my mind for some reason.  But I loved the vibe.  Tortilla soup was awesome!
author: Elle M.

description: I was waiting in line to see Dave Chapelle at the Chapel, and had ample time to grab some food. There is a bar side to this restaurant, and then a restaurant side. I went to the bar side as to be a bit on the faster side. I ordered a queso oxaca tamale 4$, and the recommended pastrami taco... $4.50. The taco was comprised of 3 sorry little pieces of pastrami thrown on a griddle with some cabbage. Definitely should not be on the menu. Tamale was small (understandable), pretty good masa, but when I finally got to the inside (half way through), it was a chicken potato tamale I didn't order. I mention that to the chef, who I placed my order with, and he put is hands up as if it to say what can I do. If there is a taco shop 1 block down the street, and a full service taco restaurant next store, shouldn't this little bar have something good/special?
author: Michael L.

description:
We love the queso here! Our last visit we ordered beer, tacos and ceviche and liked everything. This visit we ordered even more tacos (taco of the day is usually a winner), tuna tostadas, and a pitcher of the sangria. Queso both times, OF COURSE!!! The sparkling sangria came in more of a carafe than a pitcher but made about 5 drinks in low ball glasses and was delicious, I'd order it again. 

The tuna tostadas were awesome. They had a spicy sauce that gave just the perfect kick, pretty sure I could eat like 10 of those! The service has been meh both times but I'm not the kind of person that lets that lessen my overall experience when the food is truly crave-worthy. 

Parking can be tough so be prepared to parallel at a meter on nearby streets. Also, there's plenty of cool bars and shops around. So put a little extra in the meter and grab a Guinness at Phoenix and check out the boutiques!
author: Melissa R.

description: It definitely has a nice ambiance especially in the side yard on a sunny day. But the food is hit or miss. The salsas were great so was my kale salad. It had so many delicious treats inside such as pickled radishes, roasted parsnips, seeds and much more. The fish taco was a total disappointment. There was 2 times more batter than fish which means there was almost no fish. Why deep fry the fish to begin with? And it was super overpriced. Almost $5 for a small taco and almost $6 for a small side of rice (it was very delicious). The service is mediocre. We had to wait for our waitress that was never to be found and our guacamole never arrived but was on the check. We asked to take it off and they did. Overall, it's an ok place but there are many much better ones in the area so probably not a come-back-to-place for me.
author: Anat N.

description:
Haute CoTacos. I made that up and u can get those here.

Authentic? Not really but they are delicious. Place has a lively atmosphere and an open kitchen serving mission homies, tech bros ect.. really all walks of the entitled dining public are represented in here. 

Their chips and salsa set up is spectacular. If you can score a seat at the bar, do it because the service is speedy and attentive.

Every taco I've had here is v good and they frequently feature imaginative special ones.

Margaritas are delicious as well AND as seems to be the trend, they offer them busy the pitcher.
author: R B.

description:
I've been here 10 times in one month, and I'm not ashamed. 
Favorite tacos are Carnitas, and the special taco of the week,  that shrimp Poboy taco! 
When it comes to margaritas, I'm a traditionalist. Just lime juice, agave nectar, and tequila please. But ever since I started going to tacolicious, I'm getting all kinds of crazy flavored margaritas.  The Pasion margarita is amaaazing with a spicy kick.  Manager, Amanda was very helpful in helping us broaden our margarita world.  
They are so busy!  so plan on waiting, but know it's worth the wait!  
Also, get the Queso!  
Love you tacolicious, and I'm happy to have paid your lease this month!
author: Sims K.

description:
Great food and drinks! I've been here a couple of times, and while I've either had to crowd at the bar or wait ~ 1 hr for a table (they don't take reservations), it has always been worth it. For drinks I get their pasion, which is tequila, habenero, and passion fruit juice. It is slightly sweet and has a great kick!  

For food, their salsa is amazing - there is a hint of mint flavor! As for the tacos, you can't go wrong with rock cod. The cod is fried and melts in your mouth like butter! The short rib tacos are also quite amazing.  We've also got their guacamole and queso dip, which are decent but not standouts. Stick to the tacos!
author: Sungeeta A.

description:
The only delicious thing here is the ridiculous amount of money they make by charging their absurd prices while they laugh maniacally all the way to the bank!!!

I guess if you live in San Francisco, have crazy amounts disposable income,  have never had good Mexican food, and like a super loud and overcrowded experience then yeah I could see how someone would like it here.

I mean seriously, 10 dollars for a little bowl of guacamole that taste like it came it out of a can, 5 dollar tacos that DO NOT have cilantro, onions, lime, radish, or anything that would constitute a TACO; literally just tortilla and meat, Ive had 2 dollar street tacos with more flavor and substance, their "tacos" are an absolute disappointment. The $10+  salad are even worse, its like a dried wet seaweed type thing that wouldnt fill up a 4 year old but I guess its fancy since it has almonds. They have a little special where you can order 10 tacos for 36 dollars, lol think about that for a minute, please remember that these are like little 3 inch tacos with no ingredients other than meat.

Dont get me started on the alcohol, I honestly have had less expensive alcohol in places like Tokyo and Hong Kong, so why this hole in the wall thinks it can charge over double what a shot should cost is absolutely not ok.

If you eat here prepare for a mediocre experience at a price of $90+
author: Michael S.

description:
Late night eating spots with healthy options and good energy are always a good thing.

Tacolicious fills this role beautifully. 

The ambiance in here is welcoming in the afternoon and electric at night. It transforms with the mood in the air - with ease.

Tacolicious' guacamole is always fresh and made with care (though I still prefer Nopalito's) and their tacos are unique - boasting a seasonal vegetable taco, a rock cod taco, a bistec adobado one -  in addition to the more standard taco options such as  chicken, carnitas and short rib. Their 4 tacos for $13 deal which allows you to pick and choose from these mouth-watering array of delectable tacos - is an outstanding deal  - especially when paired with their beautiful cocktail list.

One of the biggest stand-outs about this particular location is their amazing outdoor space which is ideal for accommodating big groups and allows you to take advantage of the Mission's gorgeous weather.

If you're looking for a happening brunch, lunch or dinner spot in the Mission with fresh produce and flavors - Tacolicious is ideal. They have a wealth of options to satisfy any palette and the space is big enough to accommodate walk-ins well. 

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I told my friend from Mexico that I wanted him to try the amazing Carnitas tacos at "this Mexican place" and he agreed to come along. Then he found out the place was called "Tacolicious" and laughed and laughed and laughed, and called me a pinche gringa, whatever that means. He was a good sport and didn't haul-ass for a taco truck. We found parking, and he scoffed at how much parking meters cost. So far, my idea is not looking good. 

Well, fast forward to a whole bunch of tacos consumed, and he says "You know, those were really freakin' good... I'm impressed". Woo!!!!!!!!!!! I win! I mean, I know that I love everything Tacolicious does, but I'm not from Mexico. I don't go multiple times a year and eat the street food in Mexico. But my friend does, and he still gave Tacolicious' carnitas tacos two thumbs up! Yay! Not such a pinche gringa anymore, huh??
author: Liz M.

description: Food is great we absolutely loved everything. COD tacos seemed to be all the hype and they did not disappoint. The atmosphere is like a bar and super loud so if you don't know sign language, or are not skilled in the art of reading lips, then you have yell at the people 2 feet away from you to communicate. Back to the food all tacos and guac was fantastic and would definitely recommend.
author: Erik C.

description:
I went to Mission craving some good and hearty food. I happened to stumble upon this lively taco restaurant after seeing the packed house and the delicious looking tacos through the glass windows. Also I had heard that Obama had came to eat here. My theory was confirmed by a picture of him eating tacos. 

We were lucky enough to get seated right away. The hostess said that several days ago, the wait had been over 2 hours?! Anyways, we were seated on a high table in the corner of the restaurant. Menu wasn't too overwhelming and my eyes drifted to the taco part of the menu. My family ended up ordering the kale salad and 10 tacos. 
The tacos were: 
Fried local rock cod
Traditional carnitas
Guajillo braised beef short rib
Bistec adobado
and the weekly special in our case the Korean special taco

When the food came, we were already satisfied by the copious amounts of chips we, um accidentally, inhaled. ;) The chips were perfectly crisp and the salsa had a spicy tang to it, but was so addicting. Kale salad was light, refreshing, and packed with nutrients from the sliced radish, kale, and other vegetables. This was a pleasant start to my meal. Now, back to the tacos.

Best tacos we had would have to be the Korean taco and the fried rock cod. The other tacos we also good as well, but they weren't superb. The korean taco was mouth-watering and carried the succulent juices of flavor, oh so tasty. The rock cod, matched with the array of salsas, was very appetizing and delicious.  

Service was pretty good, although the waitress didn't take our order for a while (I think she was distracted) and the other servers kept refilling the salsa/chip dish numerous times. 

Tacolicious is  truly one of the wonderful bites on Valencia. I enjoyed every part of my meal and I can't wait to make a trip back to the Mission for a second round.
author: Jessica E.

description: 4 stars for really good house marg... have an array of taco selections but absolutely no veg options on the hh menu.. no option to omit the meat out of the hh tacos either bc the fill-ins come pre-mixed which was kinda weird in my opinion.  i ended up getting the butternut squash taco and it was bomb.
author: Christina G.

description:
Mexican with an upscale vibe.  If you're looking for a place to meet up and grab a relatively high end drink, then this place is for you.  I, on the other hand, was looking for a place to eat a bomb ass taco.  

We ordered a plate with all the tacos to share.  Maybe we shouldn't of eaten so many of those chips but either way there was little to no impression that was left on either of us.  

The restaurant felt more like a bar then anything.  Meh...
author: Lea M.

description: If you're looking for high-end tacos, this is the place to get them. Very creative and well thought out selection of tacos by a master taco maker. I had the carne asada and cod tacos. I'll probably order the same thing again next time since they were so damn good! Maybe I'll come real hungry and splurge $20 on 4 tacos. :)
author: Esther F.

description:
Greg and I recently went on our first triple date and headed down to Tacolicious in the Mission to a) satisfy Greg's burning desire to have tacos, b) escape the Marina version of Tacolicious, and c) mezcal.  At 6:45pm on a Friday, we were informed that the wait for a table for 6 was 2 hours.  Normally, I'm not really one to wait for a table for 2 hours, but we planted ourselves around the corner at the Phoenix to have a few drinks before going back.  Our table was by the bar area, so once we sat down, we were comfortable in our little booth, away from the rest of the crowd.  I thought that the ambiance here was good, and Tacolicious really does a good job of catering to a large group.  Rather than going for a pitcher, we all went for individual drinks.  Some of the drinks that were ordered were El Sangre, Mexican Ol' Fashioned, Michelada, and I had the Paloma.  My drink was delicious, the overwhelming taste of the tequila was matched perfectly with the elderflower and grapefruit.  I'm a sucker for elderflower, so I'm always going to have good things to say about a drink with it in it.  For the meal, Greg and I ordered separately the 4 for $14 and I ordered the following:

-1 veggie taco: Everything in this taco appealed to me, the fingerling potatoes were a little awkward in a taco, but the asparagus and green garlic were great!
-1 carnitas taco: I loved the carnitas taco in the Marina, and I loved it here
-1 short rib taco: I'm a huge fan of short rib, and I may have liked this one more than the carnitas
-1 chorizo taco: By the time I got to the chorizo taco, i had already eaten too much.  I have a really weak palate for spicy and could tell this one had a little bit of heat on it.  Like I said though, I'm one of the weakest when it comes to spice tolerance.

The tacos came out on two huge platters, so organizing whose was whose was confusing.  Once we got eating, it went quiet.  I think everyone really enjoyed their food, and there was definitely nothing that went to waste.  I was in major food coma after eating my tacos, so while I had ordered another Paloma during dinner, it took me a loooong time to down the rest of it.  Greg and his friend sipped on some tequila/mezcal after dinner while I struggled to stay awake and sitting up.  Ultimately, once dinner was over and check came, we headed on to the next place, but definitely feeling very ful.  I will agree and say that Tacolicious is pricey. But to that I say, so is San Francisco in general.  I will also say that this place is best visited with a group of people, and not as a date place.  There's something that makes this place a little bit more fun and exciting when you have a group of people to talk over tacos with, scarf down chips and salsa at an alarmingly fast rate with, and enjoy the fun environment with. Check it out if you're on Valencia!
author: Lisa I.

description: This review is for my to go order tonight. I'm a real big fan of their Kale Salad and order it almost three times a week. Tonight I decided to add some fish to jazz the salad up a bit. As my stomach is growling in anticipation to consume the deliciousness, I was shocked at the fish portion! I paid $4.95 for two measly pieces. This time the taste is disgusting as some kale pieces were not washed properly and I bit down on some dirt. Never again will I add the damn fish as it is NOT worth the value!!! Overall, this was a waste of money and I will be taking a break from Tacolicious. Buyer beware!
author: Kim N.

description: Good food, but the service was bad from the beginning.  enough to warrant this. Blonde thin female who had no respect
author: Sal R.

description:
How it all began: Sunday Streets first year - 2010-- J&I were enjoying the sun, colorful bicycles, strollers and scene. We came upon a group of people hanging out on the sidewalk outside T-lish. They were serving tacos outside. We decided to try. After my 3rd bite of a vegan taco filled with oyster mushroom, tofu, fingerling potatoes, I Fell In Love. Since that time, T-lish is my "must go" spot in the Mission. Note: I usually end up walking at least 10 to 20 blocks whenever I'm in the area. After 1-2 hours, I am Hungry. Fortunately, no matter how early or late in the afternoon, I can count on T-Lish to be open and welcoming. In the 4+ years since J and I have been patrons, T-lish has consistently given us satisfying, organic food, excellent service, comfortable seating (inside & outside) and a clean bathroom. PIcture this: within seconds of being seated, a huge basket of tortilla chips + fresh salsa (can ask for refills) appears on your table. Instant gratification while you peruse the menu filled with seasonal and organic items. Napkins and forks and knives (you have to ask for a spoon) are also on your table. 

Important fact: the servers graciously accomodate all of my dietary restrictions (no meat/no seafood/no dairy/no gluten/no soy/no processed sugar/low salt) with nary a raised eyebrow or eye roll. Example: for brunch on Carnival Sunday, I asked for asparagus to be blanched with just a little bit of salt and minus the seasonings on the menu. 5 out of 7 spears were cooked perfectly (2 spears overdone). J got the huarache con huevos and he ate every single bite. Customarily, we eat lunch here and always order my first love - their vegan tacos -- (so yummy!)-- Asparagus, oyster mushrooms, fingerling potatoes, green garlic, ancho chile recado (on the side).  When we're feeling especially hungry, we order the guacamole. 

We took a LA chef friend (Leslie P.) there and she ended up eating at T-Lish TWICE during a 4 day stay. 

Prices: I did wonder a bit at the price of my asparagus (7 spears for $9.00) but I am paying for the privilege of a comfortable dining space and someone to cook the asparagus for me. So, while prices are definitely higher than one would pay at a taqueria, they are justified based on the quality of the ingredients, service and space.
author: Grace C.

description: This place is overrated and overpriced! The service is less than exceptional and even worse, it's just another contributor to the gentrification in the beloved Mission district of my city,
author: Julia A.

description:
As much as I love Mission's many hole -in-the-wall taquerías, I was pleasantly surprised by the existence of a nice, sit-down restaurant for just as delicious tacos.

We had some friends visiting from out of town one Saturday, and Tacolicious was the perfect place for a group meal. Affordable too. There would've been an hour wait (at 4:30pm), but luckily a group before us never showed up, so we got to take their spot. 

I've had my fair share of amazing tacos, but Tacolicious brought it to another level. What we ordered:

- Fried sweet plantains ($7.50): eleven, 3-inch decently-sized plantains. Fried just enough to be crispy around the edges, but soft on the inside.  I didn't like plantains before this. These converted me. Couldn't stop eating them. 

- Tacos (10 tacos for $31 deal). Bigger than the average street taco. There are 7 fillings to choose from - we skipped out on the bistec adobado for some unknown reason. In order of preference: 

1) fried local rock cod
2) traditional carnitas
3) house-made chorizo & potatoes
4) butternut squash
5) shot-and-a-beer braised chicken
6) guajillo braised beef short rib

The braised beef was a tad too juicy/meaty, but otherwise they were all so fresh, flavorful, and wonderfully tasty. The 3 types of salsas only helped. None of that diluted stuff mind you - these were in-house, unique quality salsas. 

We shared 10 tacos per 3 people and were all surprisingly very full by the end. 

I think I'd still go to the casual joints if it's just me or 1 other person (or if I wanted something quick), but definitely recommend this place for groups/guests -- can't wait for the next occasion to come here.
author: An Y.

description:
Authentic Mexican tacos? No, but you already knew that when you walked in. Delicious? Oh, yes. One thing though, I would have liked to see more taco options. 

I loved this location with the cool venue with outdoor seating. They have a very family-friendly location (not sure I've seen that many children in any other Mission restaurant) and friendly servers to boot. 

Try not to overindulge on chips. Obviously their tacos are their specialty so you want to leave space for that and perhaps a side. I got a bit tipsy a bit too soon on their cocktails. (Oops) We capped dinner off with an order of their churros and even drank up the chocolate dipping sauce. T'was delicious!
author: Esther A.

description:
Tried this place out on a Friday night with my boyfriend. We didn't call to make reservations before and wished we had because it was extremely packed. The hostess informed us that it would be about an hour wait. We headed over to the bar for a drink while we waited but were too hungry to wait any longer so we informed the hostess that we'd be back another day. She found a small table for us outside near a heater immediately-thank you! 

I'm so glad we got a table because those tacos were amazing! We tried the fish tacos, carnitas and the carne asada tacos and inhaled them. I couldn't choose a favorite because they were all THAT good. For truly good tacos this is the place! Call before but definitely try this place. Can't wait to come back.
author: Briana G.

description:
Seems like the cool place to hang if you're a young hipster, but to me, the quality of the food is really sub-par, especially for the price.

There are SO many other Mexican places in the Mission and elsewhere in the Bay Area that serve MUCH better Mexican food.

Server and hostess were friendly, but needed much more training about the menu.

Will not be in a rush to return.
author: Jane D.

description: I was pretty underwhelmed by this hipster taco joint. The menu looked a lot tastier than it actually was. The tacos were pretty bland and the hot sauces could have used some more heat. My favorite dish was the squid a la plancha 'snack'. I recommend padrecito over tacolicious
author: Christine H.

description: Came here late night and ordered a carnitas and hanger steak taco. The carnitas had a smokey flavor and was yummy but the steak was a little chewy and dry. I wouldn't recommend getting it. Their pinto beans were delicious but are $7! Seems a bit pricey for beans... I will say, though, their salsa is worth coming back. They put mint in it, something I never thought of doing but will do from now on!
author: Sarah C.

description: Maybe I'm spoiled haven't lived in Texas for 6 years but I wasn't that impressed.  Cool vibes and nice atmosphere. I ordered the special of the day with some sort of chicken and shishitto.  The chicken had nice flavor but it was very dry.  The shishitto was undercooked and jut 1 with stem laying on top.  I also ordered the hanger steak taco.  Very disappointed.  Nice flavor but huge chunks of meat that were very tough and very difficult to eat.
author: Meredith J.

description: Definitely love this place...it's a favorite restaurant of mine in SF. The wait can be long if you're willing to wait but their tacos & cocktails are delicious.
author: Samantha S.

description: It's a little loud here.  My boyfriend and I went on a date, and it felt like I was yelling when I was talking to him.  The food is alright.  It's basically mexican food for white people, but at least you don't have to worry about getting food poisoning.
author: Cindy P.

description:
Did you know there's a Tacolicious in Palo Alto?

Ok, I am reviewing this location, but really wanted to share that bit of information.

Anyway...If a taco truck suddenly won the lottery this is what would happen. Tacolicious.
author: V B.

description:
A great place to relax, unwind and nibble.

The cuisine is essentially latin cali fusion. Their drinks are excellent - their food is delicious. The truth is however, it isn't anything unique. These kinds of fusion taco joints are popping up all around the world and Tacilicious is another one of those that serves good-cheap-nibbling-hangout-tasty-food but it isn't any different to afford it more stars.
author: Imran N.

description: Food was great.  But Beware of Political Views.  My friend and I had decided to hash out the Presidential horror that occurred the night before.  I think the Bartenders knew how visible upset we were.  We would sometimes cry, and hug, and be mad, and disappointed. I think at one time we even made a comment about it to our bartender.   It just seemed like that was the overall feeling at the bar anyways. Everyone was wearing black.  While there, the Protest March began walking by outside Tacolicious. Another Bartender jokingly tells his male counterpart, "I'm going to go out there and yell Go Trump! Go Trump!"  I tell him why would you say that? Do you know where you live? Where you work? That we are all upset here? He looks at me, with disgust and says, " I can say and do whatever I want!"  And as he approached me (not sure for what), another Bartender intercepted him and  brought him towards the back of the bar and he disappeared.  The other bartender apologized for what had happened.  I said I wanted to speak with a manager or owner and left my phone number on the receipt and said If I didn't get a call within 24 hours I would write a YELP review.
author: Letty G.

description: I wasn't able to try the tacos but I did have drinks. Great atmosphere and extensive alcohol menu.  I'll definitely com back and try some food.
author: Angelica C.

description:
Tacolicious is delicious.

but im sure you heard that many times. 

if you are looking for cheap tacos or have that dirty/authentic feel then Tacolicious is not the place for you.

its kinda hippy. modern. cool vibe. clean. 

great service.

not El Farolito

but good to try at least once.

margaritas are SUPER strong and tasty!

we had three people in our group and ordered an appetizer and 8 tacos? BOY we were stuffed but then again it could have been all the chips and salsa. 

the place was kinda pack and the only seats left were a two seater but we made room but definitely a challenge when there was so many food on the table.

overall, i had a good experience. not sure if i will come here again if im craving for tacos but i think i prefer LIttle Chihuahua. =X

i would like to try next door -- Mosto for their tequila!
author: Carol Y.

description:
Awesome food, great drinks. This place is a gem, hence I've been back a few times. The service is great and the bartenders are also very fun to chat with.  

I have had many things on the menu, but the seafood and tacos are what to try here. They come up with some very interesting combinations of flavors and concepts. This is creative Mexican at it's finest.
author: Jonah K.

description: I will definitely go back for the albacore tuna tostadas contramar-style....! A-ma-zing! However, the tacos were a bit of a bummer because we thought they were kind of dry.... But it is affordable, busy, the atmosphere is good.. and! The staff is great! They were not pushy at all (the way I am used to in the US) and they were super friendly, taking care of their guests and giving good recommendations. Thanks!
author: Christy V.

description: I've eaten here multiple times. Great tacos. Busy place. Service could be better, but definitely cool.
author: Emily H.

description: Open air bar and alley seating along an outdoor mural. Loud, happy patrons chomping on the excellent filet mignon or mole tacos. Loved the fresh lemonade, appreciated the dog-friendly service.
author: Kevin T.

description:
I tried Tacolicious last weekend when I was visiting a friend of mine in the city.

I was a bit skeptical about how good the food would be when we walked in. The place looks really swanky, and there was a pulsing house music beat emanating through the inside of the restaurant. As a result, we decided to eat in the outside dining area which was nice and quiet. 

We started with some red wine (I had the La Boca Malbec which was quite good) and some guacamole to go with our chips and salsa. The guacamole was rich and creamy, although I think they put a bit too much lime juice in it because the citrus taste definitely jumped out at me when I took my first bite.

We decided to share some tacos which were 4 for $14. We got the braised chicken, carnitas, braised short rib, and chorizo tacos. They were served like tacos you would get from a taco truck (on two corn tortillas with onion and cilantro), and they were really good. The meat was juicy and flavorful and cooked perfectly. The short rib and chicken tacos were my favorites. 

Overall, this is a great place to have a relaxed lunch on the weekend. I would definitely come here again.
author: Ravi S.

description: Last night was my first time at this delicious Taco/Bar restaurant.  We ordered the carnitas and crispy cod tacos, both equally amazing.  The serving staff was very attentive and sweet to all  our guests.  I believe our servers name was Ryan, he was a ball of energy and helped us make all of our food/drink choices with patience and his undivided attention.  We will definitely be back soon!
author: Teresa B.

description:
Amazing, amazing food. Normally not a fan of mole, but theirs is fantastic. 
Pretty good on prices, but the wait is a bit of a pain. Had to wait a good 15 for one person on a Saturday afternoon.
author: Natahlie B.

description: I've been coming to Tacolicious for the past 5 years (The Marina, PA, and Mission Locations), but after today The Mission (Valencia) location has officially won my heart. I celebrated my Birthday here with about 10 people and couldn't have asked for a smoother experience, we were seated within 15 minutes and our waitress was second to none. All you have to do is browse through any of the other reviews to know that the food is absolutely amazing but the staff here on Valencia is just perfect. Can't wait to return with a smaller group. T-lish for life!
author: Dan D.

description: I have to say this restaurant did make a good impression when I walked in. It was very modern but the music was louder than hell so I have to deduct a star for that because I could not enjoy a good conversation with the people I was with. Also our order was messed up multiple times because the waitress could not hear what we said due to the music being so loud. But when I got my tacos they were very good with a little kick to them. But I ordered plantains and we had to tell the waitress five to six times that they forgot my plantains and when I got them they were burnt and had absolutely not flavor. So the tacos are fabulous but the plantains need improvement.
author: The Yelper ..

description: I love this place. Great tacos if you don't mind paying a little extra. The line cooks are amazingly good at their job and dish out some of the best tacos in the mission. The cocktails are tremendous! I might be addicted to mezcal tho
author: Renzo G.

description:
Came in Friday night for a bite... only downside to this place is the long waits, nice that they text you when your table is ready so you can walk around and browse stores close by while you wait.

Food was awesome. The salsas are delicious. I had the "Margarita Fresca" and WOW I was surprised, strong but tasteyyy. Service was excellent as well. 

Always a 5 star expirience here! Worth the wait!
author: Alan M.

description: The food is the strong suit here, I had the fried cod tacos and the chicken mole, they were exceptional. I was a fan of the salsa they serve in the beginning with chips as well, you can tell they use fresh quality ingredients. The only complaint is the service was very, very slow. As a matter of fact; so slow that I would not return had it not been for the food; so hats off to the kitchen
author: Robert S.

description:
Wasn't sure what to expect, very hard and cold materials everywhere, very little sound absorbing materials. Absent hostess, crowd assembling behind us, some walking in past us and going to the bar. Then hostess, seated inside at 2 top, stool and banquet. 

Since this is lunch, surprised to see the bar hopping, everybody drinking boozy things. 

Got the menus and then a basket of chips and a big bowl of greenish salsa. Going in...

mira, my Latino heritage says this isn't bland White folks food as my taste buds swirl around the smoky chilliness(is that epazote I taste?) and the fresh crunchiness of the chips. Que bueno!

Very hipster crowd, it is on the new foodie drag in the Mission, lots of ink and smartphones and few flat shoes on the women.

Small plates, a whole bunch of them, and there's taco's too! Spoiled for choice!

Much hmming and hawing later, one taco special, one order nopal chupitos and 2 rock cod tacos...hard to choose, must come back.

Wonderful chicken taco, the side sauces (avocado, salsa, and habanero) add a lot of flavor. 

The chupitos were an impulse buy, a mini-celebration of my dining companion for trying someplace tres trendy and way touted. Very interesting drink...

Prices are what you'd expect for new wave Mexican in a new building, very high. 

Clearly, the bar is the money maker, and the food, albeit good, is just good, not more, and the setting and the service and the vibe demand more, as in more value for money. 

Que te pues, whatcha gonna do? For my part, I'll come back again and try some more of the offerings. 

Enjoy!
author: William M.

description:
Rating 2: The dry, not yummy tacos overrides anything.

Disclaimer: I am used to San Diego tacos.

Food: Ordered only tacos: Carnitas, fish, adobo, and shrimp. They were all so dry, flavorless, and unsatisfying.  Sure they had a good portion of meat, but they all needed much more. The salsas were good but didn't save them. I only enjoyed the never ending chips and salsa.

Environment/service: Was pleasant! I was seated immediately, the servers were great and attentive.

Notes: The Taco Tuesday deal wasn't really a deal - it was more of a build your own taco menu thing.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Great taco joint. Favorites were the brisket, cod and carnitas. Chicken was ok but others stood out. House margaritas were very fresh and tasty, as was the queso app (kids basically licked the bowl).
author: John D.

description:
More like TacoLATENESS
(3 stars)

Waited about 1hr for our tacos. Longest I've ever had to wait for "Mexican" food. I had to ask several bus boys and staff walking around "i'm hungry, we've been waiting for our food for a long time. is our order coming soon?" only to then have our waitress say she misplaced our order. We re-ordered and it quickly came out, however manager did comp our drinks - which was nice. Sitting there for 1 hr waiting, we had nothing else to do but drink and stare at each other. 

- Food, okay
- Prices, little pricier 
- Service, not sure
- Ambiance, clean, cute and loud

Your website SUCKS. Put the About/Menu links at the top of the page so we don't have to scroll down a very long website. Those should be easily accessible? Web designer should know that! Came here at a decent time with several empty tables (inside and outside). Hostess tries to seat us near the enterance door and says thats the only available tables inside or if we want to be seated outside. But I see several seats towards the back that were available and had to point them out and we then seated there. Must I be my own Hostess? We ordered only for our order to 

HEFFER-STATUS.

My friend ordered 4 tacos for $13 and his thoughts were... "it's okay". I've decided to dabble around...

CHIPS & SALSA (free) - We went through 3 baskets of chips because of the 1hr wait for food. Yup, three!!! the salasa was something to talk about. Very good and spicy.

SHOT-AND-BEER BRAISED CHICKEN (1 for $3.95) - nothing spectacular stood out. It just tasted like any shredded chicken at any Mexican joint in La Mission.

GRILLED BRUSSEL SPROUTS ($5) - enjoyed this more then the tacos. Who would say that about brussel sprouts. it was drenched in some kind of lemon/soy dressing (i think it could be the ancho recado sauce). It was good but the dressing was a bit over powering. But it was decent and I ate it up.

MICHELADA ($4) - think of a thinner "mexican" margarita. The taste was inquiring, never had anything liked it. It has tecate, lime juice, tapatio, and according to their website "other stuff" whatever that may mean. LOL.

Will I be back? NO. There are other restaurants to be tried and i can walk down teh block and have better "Mexican" food for cheaper price.

Until the next review.....
author: Jane A.

description:
Wow.  Didn't have a full dinner here, but I've added it to my food map as a permanent fixture.  Had a couple tacos (one was a carnitas? maybe?) and I'm sure they are all top quality and delicious.  Mine in particular tasted fresh with strong flavor, and had a generous amount of meat/fillings.   The chips and salsa are even something to come back for with a few margaritas and friends.  

The atmosphere is a bit crowded at the bar (what bar isnt?), but considering the reputation here, I'm surprised I wasn't waiting in line.  Bartender was a good guy and engaging everyone in conversation - exactly what you'd expect at a bar-type atmosphere in the Mission.  Bravo to the chef.  From other reviews I've seen, I didn't have a typical experience (with no waiting), so your mileage will vary.
author: Ben K.

description:
My Cali BFF is always in this place and I'm like how come I've never been here?!?

SWEET BABY JESUS!!!!!!!!!!! I died and went to taco heaven!!!!!!!!!!

Rightfully so! This place has the best street tacos off the street I've ever tasted. The flavours were so decedent. I could literally taste every grain of the spices mixed together to make one popping sensation. The chicken was succulent, the cod was inciting, and the beef was nothing shy of a tongue heart attack!

If the tacos won't get you in the door, let's talk about the tamarindo baby back ribs that were falling off the bone! I swear...shame wouldn't let me eat the bone!

I washed it down with a glass of cab because of course a girl has to keep sexy while stuffing her pie hole.

Parking sucks but it's the mission, what do you expect.

And another fyi - seems like tons of places in the mission are against putting their names on outside. Not sure why.  You will totally miss this place if you don't have the physical number address, don't recognize the little taco emblem at the top or if you blink too quick.

Tacolicious you are FABULOUSICIOUS and I will be back to try every dang on taco on the menu :)

Totally damage for two: $61 w/o tip including a killer salad and 3 tacos to go for Cali BFF's BF :)
author: Sandra S.

description: Okay so let me just start by saying that this place is by no means your typical family-run-super-authentic-taqueria. Their tacos are delicious for sure. I had to try an assortment so I got  the short rib, carnitas, chicken, and fish tacos which were really good. The only thing that gets me is that I know that I can get super authentic Mexican food for a lot cheaper throughout the city. But considering the area, its a fun little joint to enjoy some tacos with friends.
author: Ryan N.

description:
Looking around for for a yummy Mexican fix - on Memorial Day Monday - proved to be quite challenging

2 places I'd had bookmarked were closed for the holiday when lo & behold Tacolicious ( aka, 3rd time's a charm ) was open & business was booming.....so were my eardrums.  The music in there is godawful LOUD.....good thing their choices were decent

Only had to wait about 10 min for a table so we moseyed on over the Mosto next door for a drinky beforehand but before they even arrived, our table was ready

Freshly made chips & homemade salsa are devoured as we perused the menu

Made to order Guac - OMG is this the creamiest, guac-iest guac we've had.  Total avocado-flavor that isn't tainted in any way w/ other spices.  SO good!

Veggie tacos - asparagus, potatoes, mushrooms - I was completely heartbroken to find they no longer had butternut squash on their menu but squash season IS over I guess & asparagus IS in season so gotta go w/ the flow.....

They were AWESOME  ( aside from a few stringy asparagus bits ) - paired w/ their taco toppings of hot peppers, pickled things like cauliflower, onions, fresh cilantro & 3 hot sauces, we were kicking ourselves for just ordering 4.....next time, we're going for the 10!

Housemade Refried Beans - note these are their only veggie-friendly beans & extra point to note, their rice is NOT veggie.  Props to our server for letting us know beforehand!

Those beans were so creamy & savory & could have easily polished off multiple bowls.....in fact, bf was totally scraping the bowl w/ taco shells, tortillas, anything he could find, to get every last morsel.  At 1 point, I thought he was just going to stick his whole face in there

WAAAAAY too full for dessert or to sample another tempting bite, we hastily made plans to make this a repeat offense!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Came here after work at about 6 and got seated right away... I peeped the menu while I had a bit of down time at the office, so I already knew what we were gonna order... 

Started off with the Albacore Tuna Tostada... Very tasty, but I coulda swore there was a bit of a fishy aftertaste. Not that it took away from the dish or anything, don't get me wrong, it was good. Washed it out with some chips and salsa... I really liked the chips...

On to the tacos, the highlight, the reason why we came here... Had the Carnitas, Cod, Bistec and Beef Short Rib... Wasn't feeling the Bistec or Short Rib, the flavors just didn't do it for me... The Carnitas and Cod on the other hand, get the thumbs up. If I come back, I'd double up on these two... I split the tacos with my wife, and the cool part is that there's two tortillas per taco, so it made sharing nice and easy... The tacos came with 3 sauces, which I used sparingly so I could take in the flavor of the meats. Had some chips left, so I dipped them into the sauces...

Finally, we ordered Camarones, but the girl forgot to put in the order... At this point it wasn't a big deal, we were too full anyways... Some more chips woulda been nice...

We skipped alcohol this time around, but the drinks looked good... Maybe we'll come back sometime... Those chips were pretty good.
author: Barry H.

description:
The Portions are huge to the point that the food becomes unappetizing... Maybe its my San Diego bias but the food here was not all that.. I'm not sure why others have reviewed this place so highly.. 

Judge for yourself.
author: Reza M.

description:
Very strong if high end Taqueria with one of the best selections of tequila I've encountered nationally, Tacolicious puts a high end Mission district spin on classic Mexico City tacos. At least in my experience, these compare credibly. 

Short rib tacos stood out, as did the excellent chicken tacos, salsas, and phenomenal tequilas. 

A bit noisy and crowded (and perhaps that's what one expects in the Mission district or even the East Village for that matter, as this place could thrive in both) the community vibe and excellent tacos make up for it.   

One note:  delicious-looking tacos al pastor (with roasted pineapple) are served at the spot next door, not here--they're a very nice sight in the window when you pass through the door here though.
author: Seth S.

description: This place was delicious! We received a recommendation from a coworker, and that co-worker was right on! We ordered the 10 taco platter, drinks and the churros. The tacos were absolutely amazing! Meat was very tasty and fresh, very nice seasoning. We had a very attentive waitress that was greatly appreciated, and overall got service. We stopped in for a late lunch at 2 in the afternoon and had a very brief wait, but after we were seated we were surprised to see the amount of people that showed up and the line that formed. Loved the outdoor seating with the lights, overall great location and venue. Only complaint was that everything was on the pricier side.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Day 4 of our food adventures, my friend and I went to explore the Mission District and had tacos at this highly rated place. Compared to the tacos I had at Nick's Crispy Tacos, I really liked these because the protein was cooked really well! 

I had a fried local rock cod taco with cabbage and tangy crema, which was really good because I could tell that the breading on the fish was well spiced. My favorite of the two though, was the shot-and-a-beer braised chicken taco, which I could really taste the beer marinade flavor. Both of these tacos were really good for their simplicity and I am really happy we walked an hour to get there!

What I also really liked about this place, was the sauces that they served with their tacos. We had a habenero sauce, a chile verde as well as a mesquite sauce; my favorite being the chile verde!
author: Julianne Z.

description:
Really wanted to like Tacolicious after reading all the rave reviews people left... but the poor customer service deterred me from even trying the food.

Did not catch the hostess' name, but the brunette hostess working on the evening of July 14th.. you really ruined the atmosphere. Terrible attitude and can't even greet customers properly. There's no need to be a douche when customers are politely asking for a table, and confirming the wait time. 

I'm sure the food is good here, but the terrible service is way too off-putting .
author: Minna L.

description: The food is okay but way too pricey. I mean almost 5 bucks for 1 taco.
author: Gigi R.

description:
Stars are for the food only... not the sloppy, disjointed service.

This over-priced hipster hang out is not the famed Mexican food of the Mission! Buuuut the food and drinks are legit and you will not leave hungry.

On a whim I went for a late, late brunch on a sunny Saturday here with two friends and waited 15 minutes to get a table by the front window. The extremely distracted Hostess told us to hang out in the adjoining bar where we ordered three pineapple and al pastor tacos. 

The tacos took forever to come out so we got our table in the meantime. Although the Tacolicious site says that Mosto (adjoining bar recommended by the Hostess) is their bar we were not allowed to transfer the check for the 3 tacos to our table or bring them with us. We ended up taking turns scarfing them in Mosto and sitting at our highly coveted table in Tacolicious. 

Despite this we enjoyed some seriously tasty food:

- spicy Bloody Mary came with thinly sliced peppers
- plate of 4 tacos: 2 braised beef, cod, and chicken
- Dipping sauces were mango habanero, spicy avocado, and some sort of chipotle-ish sauce
- Ricealicious side was Spanish rice drizzled with cilantro pesto... trust me, not your typical awful, bland Spanish rice!
- I got the special: taco (braised beef) + beer (Tecate) + tequila shot = good choice

Our waitress was friendly but basically just there to take our order. No introduction, no recommendations, and did not explain the food... in other words no passion for the food she was selling. If Tacolicious ever fails on their food they won't be able to keep customers coming in.
author: Lorraine Y.

description:
I have now been to Tacolicious twice and am a big fan. Good service, quick food arrival and - most importantly - delicious eats!  The first time I went, I got a quick bite and it was just the tuna tostadas. They were really good and had nice kick to them. 

Last week, went for a mid-afternoon snack with friends and tried a bunch of stuff:
-complimentary chips and salsa: excellent!
-guacamole: excellent!
-fried plantains: best I've ever had. I'm used to a sweeter, more caramelized fried plantains, but this was a more savory go of things. And loved that it was served with refried pinto beans.
-tacos: we went with four. The butternut squash (decent), the braised short ribs (delicious); the chorizo and potato (decent); and the fried cod (great).

I'll be back to try more of their menu - and have more plantains!
author: David B.

description:
This is a great place to go if you're looking for the most expensive tapas you've ever paid for served by pretty white mean girls and washed down by kitschy margaritas rimmed with designer salt. (Is that enough? Don't worry the busboys are legit Latinos, and they fucking hate you.)*

They have a location in the Marina, too. I went to this one the other night with some people who had eaten at both locations before. Along the way, this guy was like, "I guess we could go to the one in the Marina just as well." And I said, "pfft. You'll get better tacos in the Mission." And his girlfriend said, "I don't know... they seem pretty consistent in either neighborhood." If you don't know what's wrong with that statement, then this is the place for you.

All that being said, goddamn those tacos were good! (But I'm never going back.)

*Dear Tacolicious Proprietor, it's not that your busboys are assholes, it's that you are. You have a Mexican restaurant in the Mission with white people in the kitchen, white people on the floor, and brown people cleaning up. You're the worst kind of Mission restaurant owner. You want to give something back to the neighborhood? Flip the script or get the fuck out.
author: Ryan W.

description: Came in just for drinks. Definitely super trendy and super busy. The hosts were great. The bat staff needs to keep up. I guess because I'm by myself I don't be offered chips and salsa like those around me.
author: Marium M.

description: For the best flavorful tacos around this is your place. Defiantly recommend  making reservations as they are always busy.  My wife loved is as it was her first time here a few nights ago. Get a tray of them, every taco we tried has been amazing.
author: Jacob K.

description: I like this place, I will go back for sure and bring out of town guests here when we are feeling some modern Mexican.  Great salsa and queso, the salsa has mint and cilantro in it and it is delicious.  My boyfriend and I shared 4 carnitas tacos and they were amazing, I highly recommend them.  We ate at the bar, there was a two hour wait for a table.
author: Sarah S.

description: It's my first time in San Fran and My friend and I wanted some bomb tacos and I found this place and when we came here we were like is it worth? Bec the prices were so expensive and we're students. But we were so hungry so we were like whatever. We got the 4 for $17.95 tacos and we got 2 of the chorizo and potatoes, 1 napole and opeux (idk) lol cheese, and the chicken en colorado i think and OMG BEST TACOS. I was so shocked on how these tacos were they're so unique but good. Usually unique tacos get gross after one bite but these were so good. And we didn't think it would fill us but it was pretty filling . I'm so happy and I would def come back. And pur waiter so so nice. I would come back if i lived here!
author: Esther R.

description:
DO NOT COME HERE WITH A LARGE GROUP!
EVER!!!

I edited my original review from two stars to three. Because my main complaint was the cost of our group dinner, along with poor service. Service I'm sure varies depending on who your server might be. So, I try to never hold it against an establishment if your service is mediocre or even poor. I started contemplating my astronomical bill and came to the conclusion that maybe it is entirely possible that my friends may be alcoholics. So three stars it is! And that's all you get!

Please enjoy my original review:
Tonight was my first time coming here. I was excited. Maybe it's ok for a small group. But, my experience for a birthday dinner with a group of 11 ladies was awful. I'm so sad. I spent $70 and came home to eat a quesadilla in my kitchen.

First off, our original reservation was for 13 and 2 could not come. They tried to charge us for 13, even though there were only 11 of us! So if you have a large group, I guess under estimate and maybe they will accommodate more?

Secondly, the staff was not terribly friendly. We sat down and were served chips, salsa, and guac. The chips & salsa were actually very good. (Hence one of the stars). We were served salad. But, nobody at our large table had a fork till, the soonest, 10 mins later (I'm not exagerating). I filled up on chips & salsa. By the time our tacos came, I had one. It was pretty good. It was a taco.

Finally our bill came. Which was truly the worst part. It was originally $710 divided by 10 people (the birthday girl was not included). Somehow we got it down to $600. I think our waitress was not happy that she did not get a 20% tip. However, she did not give us very much attention and I for one could to spend any more than I had to already.

If I had known I was going to spend $70 on one taco, I would have stayed home! I had one margarita. I think we had three pitchers dropped off at our table and that was it. I really don't understand how a $700 bill happened for 11 girls. Did they charge us $200 to bring our own cake? I'm still scratching my head. Really? Tacos? Did they charge us prime-time premium rent for sitting in the back room for so long. And if the service hadn't taken so long we could have cut back on rent. Do restaurants charge rent? 

Not cheap. Not good for a large party. Chachacha's is my choice for group dinners. If you have money to burn on good tacos then do it up! If you want cheap, than this is not the place. If you want to pay hipster prices for tacos in a mecca of delicious and low cost Mexican food then by all means. Personally I feel like I could have eaten at a nicer restaurant for $70!
author: Heather B.

description: Great tacos. Steak taco is wonderful . Also liked there veggie which was potatos asparagus green garlic and mushrooms. Def would come back.
author: Rjay D.

description: Customer Service is horrible specially the bartender. He wasn't helpful or friendly at all. First and last time eating here. Food was good but because of the service I will not return.
author: Edlin G.

description:
I love a place where the kitchen is open behind the bar and you can witness the heat and energy going on.  The aroma of corn tortillas and meat and spices and peppers will seduce you.  Yes, you have arrived.  

After being seated at one of the bench-plus-stool two-tops, I ordered a Paloma, a tequila-laced grapefruit cocktail, rimmed with pink sugar and topped with a slice of pink grapefruit. It was a little sweet for my palette, but not enough to keep me from finishing it.  I mean, that was good tequila. 

Yes, I was in a taco joint.  Yes, the tacos sounded and looked great.  But they had me at posole.  Out came a beautiful, steaming bowl of flavorful, colorful pork/hominy soup with a side plate of texture and flavor accoutrements. Boy, oh boy, did it hit the spot.

Service was fast and friendly. Prices were totally reasonable. I would definitely go back to try some of the less-sweet cocktails.  And...the tacos!
author: Bobbi W.

description:
Went in at 6pm on a Wednesday evening and got seated right away on their heated patio! Great atmosphere and mouth watering menu! 3 of us got the 10 tacos to share and can honestly say all of them were delicious! I think the cod was probably my favorite! Guacamole was awesome but I think that salsa's could use some flavor change. Overall a great experience and I think the prices on the food were about right. Although I think some of the beverage choices are slightly over priced. 
Would definitely come back!
author: Jodi E.

description: I finally got to try this place for dinner last night and was sorely disappointed. I love Yelp & if you look at my review history it's mostly 5 star reviews. But this place was a real shocker. The flavor, food portions, staff service & drinks were all equally disappointing. The horchata was thick, gooey and sour. Our table ordered 6 horchatas and had to return them because they tasted rotten. The ($5 a piece) tacos finally came out and everyone agreed they were bland, small & not worth the price. Our party was never rude & tipped well even though the staff was rude and forgot orders. We all work in the service industry as waiters, bartenders, club managers & cooks, so we know how awful it is to deal with difficult customers. We wanted to keep the good vibes going for our friend that we were celebrating. Now we know that we'll never return to this restaurant ever again. Huge disappointment and the epitome of everything that's going wrong in The Mission these days. Signed, a sad SF native who realllly loves tacos.
author: Regina E.

description:
This isn't for a hardcore taqueria / taco-truck experience; it's for hip tacos and tequila drinks in a bustling sit down restaurant.

Do order:  
Palomas (sometimes a little too sweet)
Albacore tostadas 
Short rib tacos 
Anything you might use to dip the house tortilla chips

Don't bother with:
Margarita picante (vinegar was not a good idea here)
Vegetable tacos (sweet, bland, and mushy)
Drunken beans (startlingly bland and pointless)

I can see why people like this place.
author: William B.

description:
Once upon a time, we enjoyed dining at The Big Taco. Granted, reservations are hard to get, but we never minded waiting for a table. But now, entry to this exclusive party with a VIP list seems to require a secret password. The ever evasive and rude, yet smiling, hostess gives you the sense that you are not truly welcome. 

ME: How long for two?
HOST: Is your party here?
ME: He just parked the car.
HOST: Let us know when he arrives.
ME: He's walking up the sidewalk, right now.
HOST: Let us know when gets here. (Big toothy smile).

So, we went next door to Mosto. Quickly got a seat, great drinks and food. Oh, and the waitress rocks!
author: Brian P.

description: Best fried brussel sprouts and veggie tacos I have had. I go back here often. Love it.
author: Vybs B.

description:
Friends have always raved about how awesome Tacolicious is but I just wasn't feelin' it. Maybe I came on a bad day...

The hostess didn't seem to enjoy her job and was annoyed that I wanted to look at the menu as I was waiting for a table. Got seated 15 minutes later and was given chips and salsa. Ok, so far so good. My friend ordered the sangria while I got the margarita fresca... let's just say we both agreed we should've taken shots instead. 

Got the guacamole which had more avocado than anything. Nothing a little lime, onion, or cilantro couldn't fix. We each ordered four tacos which was four tacos too much! I had two beef, one carnitas, and one chicken. The taste of everything was just mediocre and at upwards of $30 a meal I'd rather have street tacos over this joint any day.
author: Kriz K.

description: Sat at the bar and had a few tacos, the squid appetizer and some drinks. Everything tastes really really good, and the bartender was super helpful and nice.
author: Natalie R.

description: Far from authentic! Overly priced. And the absolute worse customer service. Our waiter was no where to be found for over 15 mins. So I asked another employee (who was goofing off, distracting the kitchen crew) for a water refill, his response..."You can ask your server!" RUDE!
author: Jenelle A.

description: The tacos here are soo good! definitely more on the artisan side and less authentic but still so good. I shared a plate of 4 tacos with my friend for lunch and it was just perfect. I did think one of the fish tacos was too bready on the fish but that's just my preference. we sat outside on a nice warm day and had a great lunch. would definitely love to come here again
author: Vonny C.

description: As a vegetarian, I was disappointed. I found their guac was meh. Didn't have much flavor. Their veggie taco seemed lazy. Some cooked veggie wrapped in tortilla - bland and uninspired.
author: Sonya J.

description:
MARY KATE, MARY KATE, MARY KATE........I. JUST. CAN'T. I purposely remembered her name to direct my review towards her. Worst sever/waitress at tacolicious. 

If you want service with a smile DON'T come here. 

As for the food: delicious. If it wasn't for the good food I would definitely not come here.
author: Yedid G.

description: The tacos were very good. But my favorite is their guacamole and the verde rice. I just mixed the two and it was so good couldn't  even finish my tacos. The guacamole is different than any I have had and Its fantastic. The short rib was a bit too salty for my taste, but still very good.
author: Bahar S.

description:
Nothing special in my dictionary. I have been to this place 3 times: once during lunch hours and rest during dinner to late hours. Because they always seemed busy, I wanted to give them several tries before leaving this review. Tacos are OK, but for the price you have to pay for each one (b/w $4 to 5), they definitely felt overpriced.

The chips and the salsa that came complimentary were nice. Salad plates were more memorable than the tacos themselves. Service was better during lunch hours, and spotty during dinner. The drink selection was good, but the amount of alcohol were inconsistent each time.

Would I go back to them? Maybe, and only if my friends who haven't been to this place yet want to go, but other wise, there are more choices on Valencia, or on Mission...
author: Justin S.

description:
*This is not a review about the quality of food or service at Tacolicious.*


Went here to meet friends.  After my friends finished their meals, saw a huge ass rat right in front of the restaurant.  Just chilling... hanging out.  Like he was at home.  That little MFer didn't even care there were people passing by.  He was very at home and chubby hanging out by the front door of this eating establishment.
author: Rachelle G.

description: Delish- what a score! The guac, salsa and chips are amazing. Highly recommend the chicken and carnitas tacos! Will be back the next time we are in the area!
author: Rachel R.

description: Pricey but worth it! This place has the best pozole  and sopes. The only down side of this place for us was the tacos, they didn't have enough flavor and were too dry, except the carnitas one that was delicious. Spacious place with an outdoor seating and nice staff. Margaritas are a must here.
author: Suzy R.

description: Love this place. Been here twice for lunch with the toddler and friends. The drinks are amazing, as are the salsas and tacos. The side patio is great for kids and dogs.
author: Josh M.

description:
I don't consider this place a Mexican restaurant but it is pretty much the best place to have tacos. Also the only place that has only tacos as an entree. 

Home made guacamole is overpriced but rest is reasonable. Among the ones I have tried, here is a summary of the tacos:

"Beef" is better than "Carnitas" which is better than "Steak" which is better than "Chicken" which is better than "Cod".
author: Gokhan T.

description:
I'm knocking off one star because the guac wasn't THAT great and I was really surprised at how little they gave you for $9. It was basically just mashed up avocado. I was looking for some salt, citrus, and cilantro. I've made guac at home plenty of times and I think it was equivalent to like one avocado. This is the first time I've ever ordered guac somewhere and it didn't disappear in 30 seconds. In fact, we barely ate it and there was more than half leftover.

Okay, rant out of the way. 

The chips and salsa they give you were REALLY good. I would've paid $9 for those. 

The tacos were fine. I mean, it's kind of like an American flare on tacos. It's definitely not authentic but for what it is it's good. If you're looking for something authentic, don't come here. 

We got the carnitas, short ribs, cod, and the special taco of the week which I think was some variation of carnitas. I think I liked the short ribs the best. 

All in all, given the vast amount of delicious food in SF, I don't think I'd come back here.... As I write this review, I'm having a hard time remembering what the tacos tasted like. I guess the food isn't that memorable.
author: Francis C.

description: Needed a quick lunch with family. Certainly tacolicious is not the appropriate restaurant for this purpose, which is fine. Very noisy. Bad place for kids given seating. The tacos were great but not transformative 4 out of five. The waitress was super rude. At first I thought it was because she had to deal with a table with two young kids, but I saw that her ennuie extended beyond to service of other clients.
author: Gabriel B.

description:
The best thing about going to a concert at The Chapel on a Tuesday night is that when you leave the show drunk and starving, you realize that it is Taco Tuesday and Tacolicious is not a far walk away.

Build your own 6 tacos for $12 (I think it was $12)... you can't go wrong with that!
author: Stephanie P.

description: Great atmosphere, great food, great service. If you're looking for a spot to hang with friends and snack on some solid Mexican food (shout out for the Baja style cod taco) - look no further!
author: Shany A.

description:
*** THIS REVIEW IS FOR THOSE WHO DO NOT PARTICULARLY LIKE MEXICAN/TACO FOOD BUT EVERYONE IN THEIR GROUP OF FRIENDS DOES ***

I kept an open mind with this place. Didn't come expecting much. The place was awesome from the jump. It was a great atmosphere and the wait wasn't too long when we got there at around 1pm on Saturday. Could have had something at the bar, but I wasn't drinking that day. 

The wait was about 30mins. 

The location is great because you can literally walk up and down the block while you wait for your table.

We were seated outdoors. It was pretty hot this day, so some of us wasn't feeling the sun. Luckily, I had my shades. 

TIP: They don't give you ice for your water. For a hot day like this, request ice. The water was luke warm lol.

Looked at the menu and searched for any meat entree that wasnt a taco. Not too much to pick from, but there was the Costillas and this Meat dish. I ended getting the meat dish. Steak, eggs, beans, and rice. Substituted beans for more rice.

I was pleasantly surprised. It was amazing! For someone who's not particularly fond of Mexcian food, this was a pleasant meal. I wanna try the Costillas next time. I was happy with my order.

It was about $10 bucks, which was a decent price. 

Would I come back? I actually would - pretty chill place.

Looked like everyone in my group enjoyed the tacos so if you like tacos this is the spot. Tasted some of the drinks - pretty good.
author: Joaquin A.

description:
You really should be able to give 0 stars. 

I was here last month for a good friend's birthday party. He had it set up in the back room, and there was a good number of people there to celebrate him. They included an open bar, that wasn't requested, and continued to send in $40 pitchers, without informing my friend of the cost. He asked for the Taco Tuesday special (it was a Tuesday!), and they charged him regular price per person for the tacos. Imagine his surprise when he was presented with a bill for over $4000. There was a $1500 minimum agreed upon price. Why would they not alert him to the rising cost of the food and drink? To make more money and to take advantage of him. I wouldn't have a large gathering here after this experience. I won't be returning for a casual dinner on my own, and I will tell people about this. The tacos weren't that great, and if the service is like that with a large group, they definitely wouldn't care about me as an individual.
author: jaime n.

description: Company comes here every week. Service is always attentive and gets our orders streamlined to the kitchen. Pretty much tried every single taco on the menu. The short rib and chicken are on point. The rest taste good but are more of an individual preference. The drinks are fun and some are surprisingly very fruity. Aside from being a good place for small groups, I would still prefer the neighborhood taqueria for my taco tuesday fix.
author: Thomas L.

description:
While "Tacolicious" is perhaps the most ridiculous name for a Mexican restaurant I've ever heard, the solid experience makes up for it.

My friend decidedly wanted to patronize this establishment because he'd tried the Mexican food at every local taqueria in the Mission, and was overly excited about "a place with a more modern ambiance." The restaurant is actually quite lovely. There's a large outdoor patio, a dine-in bar with rows of glittering tequila bottles, neatly organized tables, and a giant room in the back (birthday party, anyone?). 

I was admittedly disappointed that there were no burritos on the menu, but WAKE UP! It's a taco joint. So I had the chicken enchiladas instead :). They come with salsa ranchera, oaxaca and cotija cheese, cumin crema, avocado and cilantro, and are a perfectly-sized portion. They were delicious down to the last bite, and I savored every one. My friend ordered a medley of the tacos, which I tried - my favorite was the chicken mole taco, his was the guajillo braised beef short rib. We both agreed that the food was awesome.

Crayons for the kids (I admit it, I was jealous), a healthy portion of chips and fresh salsa fo' free, and super reasonable prices make this a great stop for lunch or dinner any day of the week.
author: Ray J.

description:
First time here yesterday.

Service was good and we got seated right away.

The ambiance was alright and the setup was pretty cool.

I ordered the cod taco and it was good but nothing special.

The most disappointing thing about this place besides the hipsters was the fact that they do not have a happy hour menu--this would explain why we got seated immediately and the place was half empty when we left. I ordered a margarita which was literally a half of a glass of sour juice and bad tequila; to boot, it was $10. I am not cheap in any way but I do go out enough to know that if I'm going to pay $10 for a margarita, it better be good and in a full size glass! 

They have this generic taco special thing that my friend got and she said it was nothing to brag about. 

This place is overpriced for medicore food, bad drinks and horrible music.

I don't think I will be going back
author: This Is M E.

description:
I've been to this place a couple of times and the food has been delicious. Their taco selection is creative and the margaritas are fantastic. The venue is hip, clean and well designed. Love how the kitchen is open to the entire seating space. 

The service, on the other hand,  was absolutely awful. Both the hostess and waitress treated our party like cattle, seemed irritated to be working at the establishment, demanded our orders, and didn't even know what ingredients were being used. We even confronted them about it and they seemed completely unfazed. Also, the music was extremely loud and obnoxious. 

It feels like this place doesn't know what it is. Is it a restaurant, a bar, a club, a place to get yelled at by pretentious wait staff? Maybe my expectations were off?
author: Joey B.

description:
Avoid this place like the plague. 

The tacos here are so bad your tongue is going to need psychotherapy to ever trust your judgment again.

There was so much grease on the short rib taco, it was making the tortilla soggy. 

I don't understand how this place is successful even the cocktails are mediocre.  Do people who eat on Valencia really enjoy over priced garbage served with a cold attitude? 

Never coming back, never suggesting, always deterring.
author: Jacklyn H.

description:
Not the best tacos in the world but definitely tasty. 

The tacos are small, two were not enough and 4 was too many.....I had a butternut squash, peppers, swiss chard, nopales, spicy pepitas ancho chile recado taco, a traditional carnitas taco, a guajillo braised beef short rib taco and a bistec adobado pickled onions (add $1)taco.  

My least favorite was the the butternut squash taco, tasted bitter.  My favorite was a toss up between the short rib an the bistec adobado with pickled onions.

And the drinks, they were eh.  Tried one of the house drinks the El Rey - brugal rum, manzano peppers, guava, lime, pom juice  ($9.50 ), the El Rey was funky but good.  Then ordered a Sapphire and tonic....WHAT????? No Sapphire?  The super nice and attentive bartender made me a G&T with some gin that I had never heard of and it was awful, not sure if it was the gin that tasted funny or their tonic water.....

This place was incredibly busy on a Saturday night at 8:30/9:00 and were quoted a 2 hour wait, luckily we found some spots at the bar and were able to chow on some chips and salsa to tide us over.  

I think this place is a little overrated.......the company was was way better than the food!
author: Heather K.

description:
Service: Really spotty. We were seated rather quickly on a Saturday evening at 5ish with a party of 8, including 5 kids - good news, yes? Hmm, not so fast. We were seated at a table for 6, even though along with our party of 8 - PLUS, we also had a stroller with a sleeping baby in it. When a table for 8 right next to ours opened up - just after we'd been seated - we were told we would not be accommodated. As a result, we were pretty crunched for space: after our tacos arrived - served family-style - my spouse had no room for a plate for him to eat his dinner.

Each of the 5 kids at our table ordered kid's meals, which I thought was a great value - $7 for one taco, rice, beans, drink & ice cream. However, our waitress forgot all of the kid's drinks. When I brought it to her attention that the kids had not received their drinks long after the kids had received their taco dinners, instead of apologizing, the waitress simply asked, "Oh, did they want those?" Um, yes - kids *do* like drinks, especially when it's ordered as part of their meal. The wait staff took quite a while to take our orders. Once our order was placed, the waitress forgot to bring my spouse his beer. It also took a long time to get any wait staff member's attention so we could ask for our bill.

Food: The chips placed on the table after we sat down were fresh and the salsa was positively divine! I was told the ceviche was also great. The grilled corn was flavorful. My fish tacos were more heavily battered than I would have liked, but the cabbage slaw on top was fresh. My daughter's chicken taco was too spicy for her - had the kid's menu said the chicken tacos were spicy, we could've ordered her the non-spicy fish tacos instead. Thankfully, I'd ordered enough o I could share my fish tacos with her.

Conclusion: With so many great options on Valencia Street, I probably wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again.
author: Susan L.

description:
I completely forgot our servers name, but he was great! 

We ordered 4 tacos and some of those drunken beans! Which were drunker than us because we decided to stick to water. 
 I was obsessed with the chorizo and potato taco, and my friend loves the carne asada taco. We also order the beef and the chicken.

Chorizo is always a plus ;)

Will be back!
author: Chrissy C.

description:
I would have done 4 stars, but 5 just because I'm in a good mood :)

This place has always been packed every time I've been here.  There's not that much seating, but then again, it's San Francisco, and restaurants are tiny.

I heard that there was a hot guy that worked here, and that I would know who he was when I saw him - check!  Saw him.  That was easy.

I'm usually pretty picky about tacos because I lived in San Diego for four years, but I definitely like these so far out of all the other places I've tried in SF.  To be fair, I haven't tried many places in SF besides Nick's Crispy Tacos and San Jose Taqueria?  Taqueria San Jose?  in the Mission, though.  I think I liked Tacolicious the most because they had some cool salsas that came with their tacos.

I'd probably come more if it were not so crowded :)  Great place to bring friends to hang out in the day time if you can get a table though!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I'm a bit perplexed by the need for a Tacolicious location in this part of town. I know Valencia is known for its amazing dining options, but in the Mission you can't walk a block without stumbling onto a delicious, cheap, authentic taqueria, so why do we need a fancied up version?

Well, I guess the Tacolicious folks know business better than me because when I met some friends here in the middle of the week it was packed. I guess getting chips in a plastic basket (or thrown into a plastic grocery bag) just isn't everyone's cup of tea. 

The decor is definitely very cute and perfect for a casual dinner that's still stylish-feeling. I loved the colorful tile all over the place!

And though of course it's at a much higher price point than the real-deal taquerias in the area, I do have to admit the food is very tasty. I had the fish and chicken mole tacos and both were flavorful and well cooked. My friends had the short rib and pork belly varieties and said it was a bit sauce-heavy but still good. 

So though I still scratch my head at this location choice, from the full tables to the happy bellies I suppose they made the right decision moving into the neighborhood!
author: Christina P.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night and the wait was 45 minutes. 45 minutes!!! For tacos!!! In the Mission, where every other restaurant is a Mexican one! I was floored. But my coworker had never been to a Tacolicious, and I insisted that we try.

The hostess wasn't lying -- the wait really was 45 minutes. And we had to sit outside in the cold, but luckily the heat lamps worked well enough. This restaurant is pretty dimly lit. 

The food is the same as any other Tacolicious, which is good. You get to stuff yourself with chips and salsa while you wait for your food. Obviously the cod taco's the best. Sometimes I like to switch it up and get a Carne Asada, but I always just wish I got all cod instead. The Taco of the Week was a Calamari taco, but it was too much batter and not enough substance.  We got guac and ($8.25) and 10 tacos ($33) for 4 people, which worked because the tacos are really big. And they come on two tortillas so you can actually split a taco into two smaller ones. As always, love the salsas. Stuffing myself with the chips and salsa in the beginning probably helped too.

If you haven't already, check them out for Happy Hour for great deals ($5 items, 2 tacos for $5)!
author: Cynthia W.

description:
