WOW, this place blew me away!  Gotta come back here!  Loved the food, the ambiance, and the liveliness.

Came here for a late light lunch.  We started off with the Albondigas Guisadas (beef & pork meatballs).  It came with 3 meatballs and the roasted tomato chipotle sauce was just delicious!  Reminded me of some flavors I tasted at XOCO in Chicago.  I could have eaten that as a main dish!  

Definitely came for the tacos.  I had the Fried Local Rock Cod and the Carnitas one Both were very tasty and very satisfying!  I only had two, but since they were street style tacos, I could have easily eaten three if it wasn't for early dinner plans we had in a couple of hours.  They brought out some trio of sauces for the tacos too.  The fresh chips and salsa were addicting as well.

Great service.  Decent food wait.  Next time, I'll definitely have to try the churros with the Mexican hot chocolate!
author: Erica S.

description: Sooo good! I love their fish tacos, and the tostada appetizer.
author: Asha V.

description:
Came here on 3 separate occasions, the first two the wait was over an hour long and we tried for both a week night and a weekend night, finally got in on the third try during lunch period.

Tacos were okay, kinda over priced especially for their sizes. Their meats were also a little off, some were too bland while the others were too salty.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
I had been to the Tacolicious in the Marina a couple times on drunken rampages to take advantage of the taco-beer-shot special, but given the circumstances didn't have really much to go by when judging it.

A group of us came to this location recently when we were looking for a new taco/marg spot, and I really liked it! I mean, yeah...it's definitely "fancier" than most (okay, ALL) tacquerias you'll find in the Mission, but I kind of like that it offers a different experience. 

The menu has a lot to offer, with a good variety of tacos and appetizer-type-things to choose from. I had two tacos. A braised short rib & a carnitas, and both were excellent. The meat was tender, and there was a good amount of it on both tacos. Everyone who I was with seemed to enjoy the tacos they had as well (several of them got the fish tacos and really liked them). 

We also had some guacamole, which was good. Nothing about it really stood out, but it was still good. we also ordered the queso dip, and I thought THIS was excellent! I mean, I love cheese dip, and I'm not picky about it unless it's really bad, but this dip was REALLY good! It tasted like CHEESE (which, might sound odd, but lets be honest...often times queso dip has that fake/cheesy taste to it). 

Tacolicious was packed when we got there (this was on a Tuesday), and it took us close to an hour to get seated, but our waitress was very attentive with drinks, and chips & salsa (Ohhh...this place has good salsa as well!).

I LOVE the cheap tacquerias in the Mission, but this Tacolicious is a good option every now and then when you wanna get "fancy."
author: George A.

description: I suppose i may have had to high of an expectation going here, based on pictures and reviews. I went here for lunch today and was sadly disappointed.  I had the 4 tacos, the carnitas where the best, followed up by the chicken mole, the short rip taco was greasy as hell. I could not even eat it. And the salsa is just wrong,  its got a hint of pickle. What is that? I wanted to some much to love it here. Also they charge almost $9 for guacamole,  i couldn't bring myself to order it. There are plenty of other delicious places to eat in the mission.
author: Jmarania M.

description:
This is one of my favorite Mexican spots in the city. I love the salsa, taco selection, they have great ceviche and the drinks are also really good. Great atmosphere for a weekend night out.
This isnt authentic Mexican, so if you like that then this is right up your alley.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
Eh...I was expecting this location to be better than the Marina one, but the chips were stale. Service was mediocre and drinks were meh.

It wasn't necessarily bad, but a bit underwhelming.

My fish taco was yummy, but standard. Nothing to go crazy about. They came out literally 2-3 minutes after we ordered them... Not sure to be excited about that or..confused. Were they fresh? Were they sitting around? The helpings were a little on the smaller end. Tacos I've had at Marina location are overflowing usually...
Chips were very disappointing and usually I go ham on those things here! I love the salsa here! (usually...) 
Ordered a Mad Koala cocktail - it was alright.

Service wise - they were nice for sure. But sometimes either under attentive or over attentive. Not quite sure how to put my finger on it! My date and I finished our meal quickly and jetted over to Mosto for the cocktails over there :P (Mosto and T-licious are connected! )
author: Selina W.

description:
5 stars for Jacob!!

Seriously. I could learn so much about tequila (and mezcal) from him. The man is a genius, and a sweetheart to boot.

Oh, and the food is pretty good too.
author: Bunny F.

description: The vibe and atmosphere of this place is amazing! Staff is really attentive and nice as well. Guacamole is great. The tacos, however, really lacked in taste. We were expecting so much more reading all the reviews. They were literally tasteless. If the tacos would improve, this would def be a great spot. For a place that is called tacolicious, we expected way more...
author: Caro E.

description:
I really enjoy Tacolicious and, especially, this location. The staff has always been exceedingly friendly and efficient. The food is consistently top-notch (the cod taco is the best I have had) and the drinks are killer as well.

I really like the space for dining, the bar, and the outside space as well. It can get busy here so be prepared to wait a few minutes. I suggest you come in early and grab a drink at the bar before you eat.

You won't be disappointed!
author: Shaun T.

description:
I came with three friends around 7 on a Wednesday and it was suuuper busy. We left our name and number and were told we'd be texted in about 30 min when our table was ready. We came back after 40ish min to ask about the status of our table only to find out that it was ready, even though we never got a text (so it's a good thing we checked). Anyway, my first impression of the place is that it's dark (if you get a seat inside, of course) and loud, which is to be expected I guess with the size of the inside seating/bar area and the number of people in it. 
We were seated and handed menus and it took quite a while for us to be able to flag down a waiter. I'm not sure why a waiter never came by to check on us or introduce themselves like at most restaurants, but that's okay, I guess. The chips and salsa were delicious too! We also started with fried plantains, which were perfectly rich and sweet, as opposed to most fried plantains like that that would usually be overwhelmingly so. We ended up getting the 10-taco plate with 5 of the baja style pacific cod, 2 traditional carnitas, 1 shot-and-a-beer braised chicken, 1 chicken en mole colorado, and 1 vegetarian one with the romano beans (i don't remember everything that was in it because it was the only one i didn't try, oops). Oh my goodness, these were some of the best tacos I've ever had in my life. They were PACKED. And when I say packed, I mean that we were able to split a single tacos between two people using just one tortilla each and they were still bigger than your average taco. They also come with three different salsa with three different levels of spicyness. I highly recommend eating your tacos with the salsa, even though they're just as yummy without. The cod was perfectly crispy and was complemented well by the cabbage cumin crema. The carnitas taco was amazing as well, probably the most packed of the tacos, with lots of juicy carnitas. I loved that one and wished we had ordered more. The chicken en mole had a sort of sweet taste, which I preferred over the shot-and-a-beer one that had more of a salty/spicy taste. All the tacos were amazing though.
Overall, I loved Tacolicious. It was fresh and gourmet, while still tasting very authentic. The quality of everything was just top-notch. My only complaint really would be the service. We had to approach the bar to get more water because it was so difficult to get the attention of the waiters. We even had to walk up to the lady taking reservations and ask her if we could get our check as we faced the same difficult calling over a waiter. For this reason, I give Tacolicious only 4 stars, even though the food alone deserves 6. Will definitely be coming back again!
author: Corinna S.

description: Really yummy tacos! Good kale salad too. Margaritas delicious. Prepare for a long wait, but the hostess will text you when your table is ready, so it's nice to get a drink nearby to pass the time. I recommend the vestry (attached toThe Chapel). I spent $50 total on three tacos, half a salad, and half a pitcher of margaritas. So not cheap, but also much nicer ambience and healthier choices than a true taqueria.
author: Carolyn N.

description:
My order is pretty vanilla when I come to Tacolicious, but I always leave satisfied.  I straight up go for one of their house margaritas and braised beef/carnitas tacos.  Both meets are tender, the salsas are delicious, and the atmosphere is great.  

The only downsides are the long waits during dinner time and possibly the price.  As delicious  as the 10 for $33 tacos are, I do consider it on the pricey end.  It may not warrant the drop of a point, but as an overall experience, I think these need to be taken into consideration. 

That being said, the Taco presentation, flavor, and tender meat are enough to bring me back!
author: Jobu C.

description: I love tacolicious, when I can get in.  The wait can be horrendous for the one in the mission but there is a bar nearby where you can get a drink and wait.   If you get there mon or tues it may be less crazy.   Food however is fantastic.  Best guacamole ever!  Margaritas are yum and their fish as well as veggie tacos are very well done and quite tasty.    It's often the first place I pick if I feel like having mexican food that's fresh, california style and non-greasy.
author: Hema P.

description:
8/14/12 Lunch

Stopped by here for some tacos. I wasn't thrilled to come at first because the place looks too touched-up, especially this particular block of Valencia (between 18th and 19th) has been taken over by new restaurants/eateries that are style-over-substance. Puerto Allegro wasn't open yet so I decided to give Tacolicious a try. The inside is dim like the Hollister store and music was blaring so I chose to sit in the patio.

I didn't have time to linger so I made my order quick. They have 4 tacos for $12 but I got 3 because the waitress said 3 were plenty.  

The shot-and-a-beer braised chicken was a perfection. I should have ordered two of those because they are way better than the rock cod ones, which are tasty but forgettable. Batter was a bit too thick. The tacos were only made better with their excellent salsas, which had a tinge of mint. Food came with three sauces: salsa verde, chipotle, and yellow harbanero. They were all good but yellow was the spicest.

Service was okay. I finished all my food and the soda before she came check on me. She got distracted by parties coming in with strollers and toddlers---who kept on rearranging their tables. Poor waitress! Tasty food otherwise. 

Three tacos and soda for $16.60
author: Matt Y.

description: So on my trip in San fran, me and some friends stumbled in this place after a terrible experience across the street. We were traumatized but still hungry so we came in here because it was the closest to where we already were. To my surprise, we were seated right away on a Saturday night and it was busy. The atmosphere was nice and warm. Very Upstate New York woody look. My friends had tacos and I got a taste of a couple, they were very good. I would recommend any and you should not be disappointed. The service wasn't the best, after our waitress took our order, she did not come back to the table till we asked for the check, other people brought our drinks, food, condiments, ect. So that wasn't so great, but over all, it was a good experience.
author: Chevonne W.

description: I still enjoy coming to Tacolicious from time to time, but the tacos just are not as good as they once were. I think the quality has gone down since they are always slammed with customers. I also find the noise level in the restaurant to be absolutely deafening. It is nearly impossible to have a conversation with your dining companions without shouting at the top of your lungs. Now if we get seated inside, we spend our meal playing on our phones instead of talking since it is just so loud in there.
author: Gianna S.

description:
Pretty good food and margaritas.  Okay service.  Nothing extraordinary.  My husband is a vegetarian and he enjoyed the fish taco. 

Great for people watching; we sat in the front window and really enjoy that part of the restaurant

It's a bit overpriced and would I go back?  Probably not.
author: David F.

description: Love this place! Amazing bar, great service, food and atmosphere! Looking forward to it tonight!  Salute!
author: Paul R.

description: Love this place, I've probably been here close to 100 times. You sit down and they bring you delicious salsa, tacos are great (2 is more than enough for me). We sometimes get a kale salad as well, haven't touched most of the rest of the menu more than once. Always a wait if you don't get there super early but at least they call you.
author: Ben K.

description: Great atmosphere, not crowded on Sundays! The carnitas tacos are my favorite. They have good chips and salsa too ;)
author: Tara B.

description: I love coming here! Just started reviewing and I have to give this place 5 stars! Best Mexican Tacos! Love coming here with my family!
author: Anabell W.

description:
I've heard great things about Tacolicious, so I must have gone on an off night. I mean, for the most part, the food isn't horrible, but it really just wasn't that good either. We went on a Thursday night around 10:30pm and it was still fairly lively -- I definitely loved the vibe and how the place was centered around the long, open kitchen. It has all of the components for an awesome, alcohol-filled Mexican joint... 

...except for the food.

-------------------------------
FOOD:

Ceviche = 
This has got to be one of the worst ceviche renditions I've ever had. It had the texture of recently-thawed fish that had been in the freezer for months; the flavors were... well... there really weren't many flavors going on; and it just didn't appear very appetizing. It was completely void of freshness, citrus, and kick. Absolutely disgusting.

Guacamole =
There needs to be WAY more flavor in this guacamole. It tasted like a bowl of only avocado -- it was missing any other flavor. Needs more onion, needs more lime, needs more jalapeno, needs more cilantro, needs more everything. Especially for $8.50, this guac was just way too bland.

Albacore Tuna Tostada =
The tuna was okay, but the tostada was spread with this cheap-tasting aioli that completely overpowered the fish. This was like the complete opposite of the ceviche and guacamole -- there was way too much of that pink cream sauce on this tostada that it made it pretty tough to enjoy.

Short Rib Tacos =
The short rib tacos had a pretty good flavor, so I actually enjoyed this. It's a fairly gargantuan taco (with tons of short rib meat), so it can be pretty heavy, but I can't really complain about them giving too much meat. Adding on the habanero salsa and the salsa verde made this taco pretty delicious.

Fried Cod Tacos =
These were okay. The cod was a little too fishy (clear sign that cod isn't very fresh) and the fried batter got soggy very quickly. 

-------------------------------

They do have a pretty extensive drink list, which I can always appreciate, so it's a pretty awesome place to have a few drinks with chips/salsa. We tried the Pineapple Coconut Chupito which tasted like they just poured straight-up margarita mix into a glass, so that was pretty nasty. 

All in all, Tacolicious just doesn't have the food to really make it stand out as a good Mexican restaurant in SF, especially since there are so many incredible Mexican options in the Mission. But if all you want is to kick back some tequila shots and munch on some free chips, though, Tacolicious may fill that void.
author: Roy C.

description: Tacolicious is the bomb diggity. I was impressed from the start because the waitresses knew so much about each item, and the chips and salsa served from the beginning were incredibly tasty! I ordered the empanadas with my friend to start and we could not have made a better decision. They are packed with so much flavor and the tacos themselves are the REAL deal. I'm still remembering the delights of their goodness 6 hours later. Highly recommend the carnitas and the shrimp tacos! You will not be disappointed! If I were vegetarian I would eat meat again for these tacos. Service was impeccable and beer was flowing! I am for sure coming back. Love love.
author: Talia S.

description: I can finally cross this place off my SF list after living here for 4+ years. The tacos are definitely delicious -- I had the braised short rib (yum) and the fried calamari taco of the week (double yum). Service was great, too. Also: one of the rare Mission/SF patio spaces -- great for those warm Mission days
author: Mel G.

description:
We needed to refuel after climbing at Mission Cliffs and the hubby suggested Tacolicious.  Prior to getting here, he made a disclaimer to not blame him if it was not up to my standards as it was a rec from his co-worker.  I am soooo glad he trusted his co-worker because the tacos were delish!  

We ordered the 10 tacos for $33 and split them between 3 people.  I got the rock cod, carnitas and beer chicken.  All 3 meats did not disappoint.  Each item was perfectly cooked, tender and seasoned.  The cod had a crispy batter and moist, flaky insides.  The chicken was outstanding.  You could really taste the beer infused into the chicken.  My favorite though would be the cod.  

The tacos came with 3 salsas, spicy (habanero), medium and mild.  There is also complimentary fresh chips and salsa.  I'm a fan of their chips and salsa.  I could eat that alone.  

Service was good and we didn't have to wait for a table.  Definitely coming back here again without the reason to refuel.  Great place to stuff my face!
author: Amy L.

description: Got food poisoning from this place last night. Ordered the chicken, pulled pork, carnitas and cod tacos. Buyers beware.
author: Kalena K.

description:
I think the Mission needs another taco place like it needs more Hipsters!

That being said, Tacolicious is more than just, er, Taco-centric.

The menu has a nice variety of extremely well done food including the best Pozole that I've had in a restaurant, killer Tuna tostadas, and savory mussels that you won't find elsewhere.  Even at Fritz up the street.

The 350+ tequilas are also top of the line, though I didn't see your dorm room pal, Jose Cuervo.

This is definitely going to be my mid afternoon-late night taco and a tequila place!
author: Michael M.

description:
Came here couple months ago but could not make it because the wait time was over a hour.  So my friend and I went to other taco place around the corner.  Luckily this time, we did not need to wait for a table........

My friend and I got the 4 tacos ($13).  We picked rock cod, veggie, chicken and carnitas.  The tacos were ok.  The meats were flavorful but the tortilla were little bit too thick.  

We also got the Chupitos (8 for $22).  The drinks was ok, nothing special.  

The service was just ok too, kinda slow.

Overall, it was just an OK experience.
author: Liza T.

description:
This place is a solid choice for good tacos and the like. Like being able to easily get an assortment of tacos to share. The queso might be laced with rock. 

Music is loud rawk, which is great,  just may take away if you wanted a date place
author: Scott F.

description:
Holy Mole! Best Mole Taco I've ever had. 
Got a tip from our ace pitcher Tim Lincecum that the tacos here were better than his fastball so I decided to give it a shot. 
I know what your thinking.... mission..., tacos...., whats new right?
One thing I noticed besides the higher price points is that their ingredients are definitely top notch. The chips are strong so you can mound the salsa on without fear of breakage. The house salsa gives a perfect kick without  burning the palate. The meat in their tacos are so juicy/tender that they give you a double layer of tortilla  to hold it together. Good call. 
The tequila list is so large I get dizzy just looking at it but if that's your poison of choice this is your heaven. 
Definitely not the authentic hole in the wall joints that I've become accustomed to in the Mission district but unique enough to brush away any thoughts of "chipotle"   from my mind as well. I'm glad they opened up shop here to show they can contend with the mission taco heavyweights even if they pack a bigger punch to my wallet. 

I would definitely go here for the Mole taco but so far this is the only place I'll order a vegetarian taco and not be dissapointed that I did.

P.S. Props to my buddy Lim for making me try out this location. Much better than their food stand counterparts in the downtown area.
author: Norris T.

description: Had the chicken mole and chicken shot-and-a-beer tacos and they were superb!  Went well with some refried beans and a couple of drinks!  Highly recommended stop!
author: Matt E.

description: We love this place, great tacos, good salads, amazing drinks! The decor is lovely and festive. Definitely a higher end taco place though, so be prepared to pay higher end prices!
author: Emily P.

description: This place is super small but hey, its SF. when I walke in I was very surprised. It  a bar, seating, and a patio. The services was very friendly and on top of things. The place was very clean up I loved the decor. Yet it was a casual place. little pricey. $34 for 3 of us. 4 tacos and 3 regular drinks.
author: Heather L.

description: I've been here a few times and it's pretty okay. It's also a bit too expensive for the amount of food you can get. The carnitas tacos are my favorite, but the rest of the tacos aren't great. I would much prefer all of the other Taquerias in the Mission.
author: Alex K.

description: Voted by the customers of Lyft as the best casual restaurant in SF. This place rocks. The food is ultra high quality and fresh. Order the four taco plate and share with your companion. The guacamole is also excellent as are the three salsas they serve with your tacos.
author: Michael Y.

description: The salsa and chips at Tacolicious are TO DIE FOR!! Absolutely love! Margaritas (just the basic one), is great...as for apps we did the Guac (not great, needed salt and more flavor), and the Queso (yum, highly recommend). We finished with the Churros which were very disappointing (though our server said she recommended them)...they were too salty, not enough cinnamon/sugar, and they were fried/cooked on too high of a temp as the outside was like a rock and the inside was under cooked. But, their salsa and chips?? Yum.
author: Mac C.

description:
Soooo yummy!

Just visited this great little place in Mission. The taco platters were the best deal and the tequila menu was fantastic. The carnitas and short rib tacos were the best of the lot with the squid not having as much taste. There also were some great side pepper sauces to add to the tacos, making them even better! All are served with corn tortillas so gluten-free people are pretty safe at this wonderful little place. 

Definitely make sure you hit up this place if you are in and around Dolores Park.
author: Jenn M.

description:
Taco-rip-off

Very nice wait staff.  HOWEVER, the place is a rip off. 

Our fault, we were catching up -  talking too much to notice the crime being committed.  

Chopped kale salad with indiscernible additional ingredients for $12 plus a few small shrimp thrown in $5 resulting in $17 for a salad that was really rather tasteless?  $4 for a bottle of soda pop,  $9 for a bowl of guacamole?  Worsening the crime, they are imposing the "city mandates" charge onto customers.   The manager said that it's legal, which it isn't. 

See below:

From the government site:

http://sfgsa.org/index.aspx?page=6112

"1. Q: What is a health care surcharge?

A: Some San Francisco businesses have elected to impose a surcharge (i.e. an extra fee or cost) on the goods or services they sell to customers to cover, in whole or in part, the expense of complying with the Health Care Security Ordinance.
 
2. Q: Does the City of San Francisco require employers to impose surcharges? Or prohibit employers from doing so?

A: Neither. Employers impose such surcharges at their discretion. The City neither requires nor prohibits them."
author: Barbara A.

description:
My boyfriend and I had such a good dinner here on Saturday night! We had been wandering around the mission, decided we were hungry and Yelped this place, so without a reservation we wandered in to see if they had anything available. Table for 2, no problem! Right away they brought out chips and salsa for us to snack on. The chips are really delicious. I'm not sure if they are extra thick or extra crispy, but I could probably have just eaten those for dinner!

We started with the house margaritas and boy are they strong! The tequila menu is really cool as well, but unfortunately, 1 margarita is about all this girl can handle!

We ordered the 4 for $13 tacos which was plenty of food for 2 people. Here's what we had:
- Braised short ribs
- Rock cod
- Chicken mole
- Cochinita pibil (slow roasted pork)

Everything was just delicious. It would be impossible for me to pick a favorite. Ok fine, it might have been the shortribs. But that's if I absolutely HAD to choose.

They brought out 3 salsas for the tacos: mild, medium, and hot. These are definitely "Americanized" for our taste buds. Even I could handle the hot salsa and I am a huge spice wimp.

Really phenomenal dinner, can't wait to go back!
author: Rachel E.

description: Totally a fan of tacos and first time  I came here I meet a great bartender that made fabulous hot spicy margaritas. Sad to return and he was no longer here. Ive been here a couple of times and this time drinks were not in my taste.  on the other hand ive always order short ribs, steak and pork tacos but this time we order the fish taco it was amazing totally win my taste will return for more fish tacos. Good vibe, wait time can be long but if you come after 5pm you can wait next door at mosto and enjoy $2 tacos and drinks while you wait to be seated at tacolicious.
author: Linda B.

description:
I've been here twice so far--once for a private party, and once for a regular dinner with a friend from NYC. That second time, 5 stars for top-notch service, and 5 stars on all counts for delicious food and strong margaritas.

Get the braised short rib taco. It's going to change your life. Pair it with a paloma.

It's also a small restaurant, so prepare for a wait, or be willing to sit outside (as long as there's no chance of rain that day!), but it's worth it. When I was having dinner with that NYC buddy, we got rained out 5 minutes after sitting down, and the servers and host immediately took us into the back room, where we were seated and our chips replaced immediately. The couple next to us had a lot of delays in getting their food; one of the chefs came out to apologize personally and to offer them a free order of churros, since they had children with them. It wasn't even our table, but I admire this sort of customer service, and it's why I want this restaurant to succeed.
author: Sharon L.

description: Came here on a Friday night. The hostess was rude and seemed like she didn't know how to work a hostess job. She said the wait was 40 mins. That's fine, but when tables opened up and no one was sitting there for 15 plus minutes she wouldn't seat us saying that people were ahead of us and she texted them. Lol ok? And if someone doesn't show up for 10 plus minutes why would you hold the table for them ? Aren't they suppose to get skipped ? She seemed annoyed every time id ask her if that table is available and had a really bad attitude. I rather get tacos at a not so overpriced spot !
author: Josie M.

description: I love to hit up this spot with friends as it's a tasty, fun place to in the Mission and I usually don't have an issue getting a table (had to wait one time but it wasn't long and there is so much other stuff to check out in the area while you wait). Would give it 5-stars if I felt the flavor of the tacos was more consistent...of all the ones I have tried the carnitas is still my top choice! Their salsas, refried beans, and margaritas are awesome! During my visit previous my most recent visit (last Saturday) the waitress didn't return to take our drink order and after quite a wait I decided to just go up to the bar and pay separately for some margaritas but the bar tender told me to go sit down...maybe I broke some rule...
author: Sara S.

description:
I'm just obsessed with Tacolicious carnitas!  I can't explain it.  Well I can sort of explain it: it's delicious, flavorful, moist, and just the right amount of greasy.  But really, it's pretty rich and pretty darn good.  

This place was packed on a Sunday night.  Who knew so many San Franciscans eat out on work nights?  Oh wait, that's not unusual at all.  

Guacamole was a little bland and lackluster, and my chicken and lime soup was a little off this time, but that carnitas taco brings Tacolicious back to 4 and 5 star territory.  And the salsa is quite good...we went through a number of bowls of the stuff.  

It's cold to sit outside even with the space heaters when we're experiencing an unseasonably cold winter, just FYI.  

So do yourself a favor, head over to T-Lish (their abbrev, not mine) and order yourself a heaping plate of tacos (obvi carnitas, but throw in some other flavors if you're so inclined), avoid the guac, but go to town on that salsa and enjoy the desserts too.
author: Anne Marie B.

description:
went around 1130am on a Sunday and were seated right away. the service was fast until they got busy and our waitress was stretched pretty thin and finally disappeared onto the patio. finally had to ask the busser for the check since we had an appointment that wouldn't wait. 

the guajillo braised short rib taco was delicious! i thought the fish with chimichurri taco was too fishy so my friend ate it. 

the kale salad was a good idea but it needed a bit more dressing, fruit and nuts. eating it was a hot mess but it tasted good. 

their sangria wasn't sangria but a strong cocktail. not a fan as i like my sangria to taste like sangria and be made from wine. 

by the time we left an hour later, the line was growing. moral of the story, get there early. i personally do not feel the need to go back however.
author: Tera K.

description:
Sat at the bar on a busy Saturday night.  Great atmosphere, loud and lively but not obnoxiously so.  The mucho gusto marg was the clear winner with its pineapple twist.  The caliente wasn't too far behind if you like a little heat.

Guacamole was fresh and creamy and each salsa we tried was unique and flavorful.  Split four tacos - girlfriend loved the carnitas but I thought the short rib was even better.  Both were super tender.

The bartender was attentive and friendly.   Will def be back when I feel like stepping up from the usual taqueria!
author: Rich L.

description:
Great. 

The short rib tacos were amazing! Really really really good. 

Love the party atmosphere here - so fun and lively! 

Great place to drink some serious beverages as well!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
$100+ for 3 people at a Mexican restaurant does not make sense.

A salad named, "Marina Girl Salad," in a Mexican restaurant found in the heart of the Mission district does not make sense.

The salsa tasting more tart and sweet than savory with a hint of lime does not make sense.  

I get it, it's $13 for a dish because it is Mexican FUSION.  I guess adding unnecessary garnish on top of the tacos and throwing in 3 mediocre tart flavored salsa on the side is worth increasing the prices.  

...Actually, I don't get it.  

+2 for the beautiful venue and polite service.
author: Jacquelynne S.

description:
Good tacos - love the fish taco - but this place is SO loud you might as well go alone because there is no way you're having a nice dinner conversation. Plus it is so crammed that the table next to you will be practically sitting on your lap.

I've gone about 4 times now just because the fish tacos are that good, but I've vowed not to go again. The ambiance is just too obnoxious.
author: Jocelyn S.

description: I've been here twice and I love this place!!! Both times service was excellent, food was great and I have to say the drinks are perfect with the meal! I'm glad I found this place.
author: Kelli C.

description: I stopped in today for lunch and ordered the Carne Asada taco and it was very tasty. The portion is small but I only ordered 1 order. The chips and salsa were fresh and really yummy. I also ordered a drink. It was like a pear margarita and it was refreshing and made with fresh pear juice. It was a good meal and it was packed for lunch. I would say it is a bit pricey for the portion but the quality was good.
author: Rori B.

description: Great food. Mix of authentic mexican with a modern twist. There is a variety of cocktails to choose from, all with flavors that are different then I have ever seen...all amazing! The restraunt was packed full...we sat ourside with the heaters and it was very enjoyable. If youre looking to have an intimate date sit outside as inside was pretty loud. Great food and drinks...we would definitely do a repeat visit (make sure to also visit their tequila bar next door called "Mosto").
author: LittleMrs I.

description:
What a nice find in the mission!  

As a self-proclaimed (and self-certified) fish taco expert, my stomach feel in love with their fish tacos.  The carnitas was also quite good!  Just be aware that this is a trendier take on tacos and is not your classic street taco.  

The price is moderate, but don't over order.  Their tacos are filling and an order of queso is a great sidekick to their 4 taco platter.  

Enjoy!
author: Jeremy R.

description:
I've been to Tacolicious twice. And so far, I absolutely love it! I'm a huge fan of tacos and being in the Mission district, it's obviously the best place to get authentic Mexican food. But good luck finding parking. Remember, this is in the city, so it's notorious for its lack of parking spaces. 

The atmosphere is very urban casual and welcoming. It has a very unpretentious look to the exterior and interior of the restaurant. Normally, this place is pretty packed around lunch time, but the staff does an excellent job at trying to get people seated as quick as possible.

Their menu changes every now and then. So, what I tried the first time was not available on the menu the second time, but nonetheless, it was still absolutely delicious! But also, the taco wraps were soft, but not too soft so that they fell apart everywhere, which is what normally happens to me when I eat tacos. 

SAUCES
-What I love is that they provided an array of various sauces for you to add to your food. I believe it ranged from mild, medium, and spicy. But for those who can handle spicy food and love eating spicy food, none of the sauces are really THAT spicy to make you pant or have your sinuses act up.

FRIED PACIFIC COD TACOS
-I loved it! The fish was fried lightly to a beautiful golden brown. Perfect amount of vegetables with a generous amount of fish.
-Rating: 5/5

SHOT-AND-A-BEER BRAISED CHICKEN TACOS
-Just as good as the pacific cod tacos! The meat was juicy and full of flavor. Not too saucy or juicy so that the juices spilled everywhere and made a mess of things.
-Rating: 4/5

SUMMER SQUASH, PASILLA PEPPERS, BELL PEPPERS, BRENTWOOD CORN TACOS
-Super delicious! Right amount of vegetables to get a very well-balanced taste of all its ingredients. No one ingredient overpowered the other. 
-Rating: 4/5

If you're craving tacos and looking for a more-than-decent taco joint, this place is your best bet. Super amazing tacos with wonderful variety on their menu! Great atmosphere to dress casually and just chill. Noise level varies, but it's the city, so I didn't find it too much of a bother. Highly recommend trying this place out!
author: Jessica X.

description: Straight up, these are my fave tacos in town. I think it has to do with the home made corn tortillas and the little trio of mild, medium and spicy salsas that come with them. Did I mention that the secret ingredient in their guac is mint? Yea, the waitress told us the other day and it all makes sense now. Mind blown. Their margaritas are just the right amount of sweet and sour and alcoholic. I also heard that they have happy hour at their Marina and North Beach shops where the margaritas are only $6 from 3:30-5:30. At the Mission location there is sweet outdoor sitting in a skinny alley with murals down the walls and sunshine in the afternoons. They have cool music, hot waitresses and a picture of obama eating a taco on the wall. It's perfection.
author: Jasmine W.

description: Taco terrible.  Taco boring. I just feel like it was trying toooooo hard and failed so terribly.  Had the guac and chips to start.  Bland and uninspiring. I could have mashed the avocados up myself and placed them in a bowl.  Ordered baja style fish tacos.  So basically a piece of bland beer battered fried cod on a tortilla with way too much flavorless garnish.  Essentially, a piece of fish and bread.  Boo.  The carnitas in my second taco was chewy and stringy.  I guess they left it in the sow cooker too long.  I don't get the hype but everyone is always jumping to get on some new ish.  Very gringo Mexican.  So so sad.
author: Y. C.

description:
There are a few things you should know about their tacos before you come here. First, they're not authentic Mexican tacos. Second, they cost twice as much as authentic Mexican tacos. Third, they're pretty damn good. 

Rock cod, beef short rib, duck, chorizo and potatoes -- all of them delicious and filling. The corn tortillas are thick, and while I appreciate the fact that they don't break easily, I found them to be a little *too* thick. The tacos are served with three different sauces of varying heat. Green is for mild. Red is for medium. Yellow is for hot hot hot. It's a little counter-intuitive, but try and remember it anyway. Depending on your tolerance for spicy, it could save you a lot of trouble.

Their tuna tostada is on one of 7x7's The Big Eat lists. I don't always agree with that list, but they were pretty spot on with this one. Melt-in-your-mouth tuna sashimi with avocado, leeks and mayo on a crispy tortilla -- a wonderful play of flavors and texture that you really do need to try before you die.

Top off your hipster taqueria experience with a couple of margaritas, which are always good here. The margaritas are strong and never too sweet or too limey -- perfect for washing away your Mission-gentrification guilt.
author: Racquel N.

description:
Delicious and food is served quickly once you order.

But the hostesses and bartenders are atrocious. They obviously get a ton of business so they feel like there is no pressure to provide good service.

So with plenty of nearby options that are tasty and more professional, this place gets three stars.
author: Cisco R.

description:
Went here on a date. Albacore Tuna Tostada was delicous-- the salsa/marinade had a kick to it. As did the Pasion Margaritas! AWESOME. I would go back just for those. Silver tequila, passion fruit, and habaneros!

I didn't even see the platanos on the menu so I'll have to check that out next time.
But I'm telling you, get the Pasion Margarita. And get a pitcher.
author: Rob W.

description: I told the waitress to surprise me and she brought me some of the most delicious tacos on the face of the earth.
author: Vincent B.

description:
DO NOT GO. NOT WORTH IT. 

This place is the worst and overpriced Mexican food I've ever had. 
I'm not a foodie, nor really all that critical on food but, this place takes the cockroach in bad tacos. 
Cons:
-The queso dip tasted like cheap velvetta cheese.  (the cost is worth the price of a  3 blocks of velvetta)
- the squash,the bahn mi and the chorizo tacos are awful 
- tacos are the size of "street" tacos but 3x the price
- margarita pitcher overpriced
- horrible salsa (odd mint flavor)
Pros: 
- fast and attentive service
- nice space and ambience
- carnitas taco is good
- strong and good margaritas pitcher
- way overpriced

Overall there are so many other better and cheaper Mexican places in the Mission. It's basically white hipster Mexican to a whole new level. It's a Chipotle x SF hipster mission spin on Mexican and I am not a fan. The high yelp ratings are mistaken.
author: Marina S.

description:
Tacolicious is definitely a great place to go for great tacos and an upscale vibe. The meats are always super juicy and tender, the toppings fresh, and the sauces give em the perfect kick or variety of flavor to give your palette a surprisingly new experience!

This is a pretty popular place though so expect to wait a bit if you are going on a weekend. The staff was attentive and courteous and always do their best to get us seated as quickly as possible. 

I haven't tried the drinks here but have heard they are pretty decent.

Overall, if you're in the Mission, you have to check out Tacolicious at least once if not once a week (depending on the level of your taco addiction... :)
author: Giordan P.

description:
Possibly the douchiest place in "the mish".  The only Latinos you'll find here is the crew, this is a overpriced Hipster taco shop like papalote. So if you prefer the typical ambience of a mission taqueria don't come here.  

Now onto the food - it's good.  I've never been one to eat healthy. So I got tacos - the beef cheek , the cochinita pibil, the fried Cod ,and while you'd expect these all to be greasy, it was as if they scooped extra grease when filling the tacos . It completely soaked both tortillas of the taco and leaked all over the plate. I had to use paper napkins to soak it up, and I usually like a nice greasy taco. This was just too much.
author: Gmo G.

description: We found it best to order ten tacos to share with the table. My two favorite tacos are Shot-and-a-beer Braised Chicken and House-made Chorizo And Potatoes. I love the chips and salsa here. The salsa has this sweet fruit like flavor. This is a really fun place to do with a group.
author: Paul D.

description:
- I'm quite addicted to the guacamole there. 
-The taco's are great, I am usually disappointed from their taco of the week, it always sounded awesome but then I feel they taste a bit all over the place. Stick with the "classics"
- Sides they were all nice and fresh, But nothing made me crave for more
- Their salsa's and chips are great.
- Open quite late
- Drinks are good
- It's fast!
author: Dor L.

description: The tacos are great here, unique and always tasty. But the real reason to visit Tacolicious is the margaritas, specifically the prickly pear. The drinks are sweet, salty and strong. The mood is loud and it can be hard to get a table even on a week night. The staff feels genuinely friendly, but tonight the service was slow (tonight is a Monday). Overall this is an awesome place, just like its sister in the Marina, and I will be visiting again soon to get my taco & marg fix.
author: Megan M.

description:
Basically, this is a Marina transplant in the mission offering upscale, overpriced tequilas, great refreshing agua frescos, and decent, fresh "Mexican" food.

The good:  decor and atmosphere are fun, trendy.  The food is good, veggie forward, and not too pricey.  Best dishes: kale salad, pulled pork taco, and calamari.  Most servers are friendly, accommodating, and efficient.  Great neighborhood spot and two people can try a few apps and tacos for $25/pop.

The bad:  it's way too loud--you can barely carry a conversation.  They have no reservation system and it gets really busy, mostly with annoying bridge and tunnel folk or pretentious techies.  So if that's not your scene, steer clear.

The ugly: some hosts/staff are young, apathetic, and rude.  The hosts general have no clue what's going on and there is no reservation system.  Even as someone who frequents this place, I'll still get ignore/treated rudely.  And it's busy, so expect to wait.
author: Steven S.

description: I came to San Fran for a vaca and this was the first stop we made. I fid myself still craving this place! They have an awesome menu, Amazing fish tacos and their menu is very reasonable in price. You can order several dishes and split it!
author: Katie M.

description: I enjoyed the tacos. My favourites were the chorizo and potatoes, which were a bit spicy, and the fish cod.
author: Tiffany B.

description: They started as a stand at the Ferry building. This was the second restaurant after the Marina location. Why go to this bourgeois taco joint in a neighborhood with so many taquerias? Because the food is good. Only difference between here and a taqueria is you will pay for table service, besides the tip the prices are comparable to the "new improved' Mission prices. Try a sampler of fish, chicken, beef and carnitas. They have meatballs as well. Carnitas can't compare with the ones at a real Mexican place, so I would order the fish, chicken and some veggie ones for the non meat eaters in your group. Drinks are good too.
author: Kevin S.

description: Not worth it. Prices higher than what it's worth. The tacos weren't that tasty either. I had about four different types and they tasted like a $1.50 taco not a 4 for $17.95 nonsense. Take your money and go anywhere else.
author: Sim T.

description:
LOVE! 

Came here with 2 friends last weekend for lunch. 

We were seated immediately, although the place was packed inside & out. It was VERY loud in there with music playing and people talking. Seating was a little tight, but the food more than made up for it. 

Loved the fish and carnitas tacos! The salsa was so fresh tasting, almost like there was a touch of mint in it. Chips were warm. Water was in a cute jug. Sangria was the perfect amount of alcohol. 

Just loved this place & can't wait to go back.
author: Kelli H.

description: It's a nice vibe, but the food was a hit and miss. I liked the chicken mole taco. Braised ribs were too dry..and the shrimp dishes were incredibly spicy. Service was nice, but coerced. Decent place overall to check out, but probably better options in the area.
author: Howe L.

description:
Everyone loves tacos and I eat tacos at least once a week. Tacolicious has a good variety of menus for tacos. My friend and I got 4 tacos (for $14). I actually like the vegetarian tacos with buttternut squash, poblano peppers and roasted pepitas. What a brilliant combination!

Churros are a bit disappointing. Although they are crispy, hot and tasty from the outside, the inside is very mushy (a texture I've never seen before). I left half of the plate there. The server was very understanding, so she did not charge for the dish.
author: Saran R.

description: Some of the best carnitas tacos I've had!  Chips appeared fresh made but were too stale for my liking...  and gauc was meeeeh.
author: Sara R.

description:
You might be thinking I'm in the mission why but I got a tacolious, because you're too hip duh. When I went to service wasn't all that great. I think it took about 15 minutes for someone to bring us water, our server repeatedly avoided us. 

But the food thou, too legit. I really enjoyed all the veggie tacos and the chickens are really good to. We got a large picture of my great I would chat about four glasses so between two people it's a good deal. And the ambience is amazing we sat on the outdoor patio, I was transported to LA. Altogether we paid $43 a person for a combined 8 tacos and a Margarita pitcher.  While tacolicious get three stars for bad service I would definitely come here again.
author: Simonne K.

description:
The Marina Girl salad is absolutely delicious! The tacos are very good. I gave it a 4 star only because of price. I think it's a little too pricey.

Great atmosphere and the service was great!
author: Pam S.

description: Overall a great meal! The salsa is one of the best I've had, not too spicy and more mint flavor than usual. The tacos are also delicious, my favorite was the braised short rib. If you like the chips and salsa as much as I did would recommend only getting two tacos, they're substantial, I got four and took two home. My only complaint is that it's a little spendy ($4.95 per taco) relative to other options in the Mission.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Tip: The place is pretty hard to find as the signage isn't too evident (or maybe I'm completely clueless). There's a taco on the door of the place. Once you get inside, motion to get someone's attention because it's usually a madhouse.

I mean, the atmosphere is pretty great if you like the full hipster mission experience... Or at least, as mainstream of a hipster experience as you can possibly get in the mission, from the wood table to the menu to the prices.

However, then the food comes, and you realize that you paid $5 for a tiny street taco... despite the fact that it tastes quite delicious, especially the cod taco, you realize that $5 for a taco is quite a steep price.. (Even when you do the ten-taco deal, it only drops the price to $4 for one taco).

In the mission, we have a ton of great choices for food. Just a few streets over you can experience what it's like to eat tacos where a full meat market is practically attached to the taco shop, with the most succulent beef placed upon a tortilla that provides a terrific melt-in-your-mouth experience. But that's there, not here. If the atmosphere is not worth 75% of the price to you, coming here is a mistake. (Unless you really really like cod tacos, in which case it *might* be worth it).

Tl;dr: Go somewhere else for tacos unless it's a night out with some classy company that doesn't mind paying out the nose for atmosphere.
author: Alexander L.

description:
I must say that I was disappointed by the fish tacos.  While waiting for over 30 minutes for a table I saw so many of them go by, looking delicious that I had to order one.  What a flavor-less let down. 

The pulled beef tacos were GREAT!  Chicken was good, but paled in comparison to the beef.  The pork was very nice and tasty.  Beef was better.
author: Joshua G.

description: Food is good here, not really authentic mexican. But the meat in the tacos are high end, hence it being pricier. I liked the short rib taco the best and the beets salad. A lot of tequila cocktails here, however I felt the cocktails were just ok, not the best. Definitely come here to hang out with friends. Place does get crowded, so get here early for a seat.
author: Lisa T.

description: Parking is a nightmare around 6pm on a Friday (my fault for trying to not pay for it that night), but the food is pretty good. We had a ton of tacos (the highlights being the calamari and short rib), and queso and chips. The dipping sauces that came with the tacos were really good too. Just be weary of your wallet: price adds up fast. Also the tequila I had (definitely not a mezcal or reposado), was definitely not as smooth as Ray Liotta and Michael Imperioli make it look on tv; it tasted like gasoline. Will put hair on your chest, methinks. Very busy around dinner time but we were able to secure seats. Surprisingly, this place has other alcohols like whiskey, at the bar, and not exclusively tequila.
author: Dan M.

description: Amazing customer service! The staff is SO friendly and helping and attentive. I got a vegetarian taco which had mushrooms, asparagus, potatoes and more. I wasn't a fan of it. I thought it was quite bland for a taco. My other friends got a bunch of other tacos and they seemed like they liked it! The guacamole is delicious and I liked how they serve chips & salsa. My friend got the kale salad and wasn't a fan of it either. Overall, fantastic customer service and pretty good food.
author: Kim P.

description:
Happened to be here on Taco Tuesday and was very impressed by the deal! Just $12 for a DIY platter of six tacos (perfect for sharing with 1-2 people), with the option of ordering two margaritas for a discounted $5 each. The taco shells come with ground beef, cheese, lettuce and spicy sauce -- kind of reminded me of a premium version of Taco Bell's tacos (a good thing, in my book). 

Sticking with these tacos from now on. Must upgrade my rating to 4 stars!
author: Tiffany W.

description:
This place is so hipster it doesn't need a sign to say "Tacolicious" outside. Yup, almost walked right passed it while looking for it. The atmosphere inside is full of energy, which I LOVE! I would definitely be back here to eat and drink with friends. The wait can be ridiculous, so be prepared for that!

DRINK
-Margarita Fresca ($10): Good drink, not much to say except that it goes great with tacos.

SNACKS
-Nachos and Salsa Dip (complimentary): Standard chips and dip.

-Fried Sweet Plantains ($7.50): The plantains have a soft and sweet inside, and a crunchy and salty outside. I enjoyed the grounded heirloom beans as a spread on the side (reminds me of hummus). After a while, it gets a little too starchy to keep eating, so I recommend sharing this with 3+ people.

TACOS (4 for $14)
-Fried Local Rock Cod Taco: Eek, very disappoint. The fish was not fresh, and kind of stale. It looked good though? If that counts.

-Guajillo Braised Beef Short Rib Taco: Yum! Flavorful sauce and moist shredded beef. Goes great with a drink and tons of fresh lime juice.

SERVICE
Friendly but very, very slow. I probably was there the last 5-6 innings of the Giants game showing on TV. But hey, at least I got to see Timmy throw a no-hitter :P
author: Celia G.

description: The food is amazing here. I specifically like eating at the bar. Benny was out bartender and server and he was great!
author: Sam S.

description: If you love carnitas try the braised beef. Absolutely hands down the best taco.  I tried all of them and they were all amazing.  I swear by this place.  I go to tj for some amazing tacos.  The salsa was out of this world.  I wish they were here in San Diego.  :( I will definitely go back again.
author: Laura S.

description: Tasty salsa and chips as soon as you sit down.  Some of the best guac around.  The house magarita is nice and clean.  The 4 tacos for $18 is where its at and plently of options to choose from.  The beer can marintated pulled chicken is BEST taco I've EVER had!  Once seated, service has always been very attentive and the kitchen is super fast - this is a regular spot for me.
author: Brian G.

description:
i've been to the Marina location a bunch, but never to this one in the Mission, and I LOVE the layout/vibe of the restaurant. I came here for brunch for a friend's birthday on Sunday, June 30 - the same day as the gay pride parade. This place was hustling and bustling, and despite the large amounts of people who were flowing in post the parade, the staff did an excellent job at serving everybody. 

I'm writing this review for those of you who are looking for a good group place for 20+ people. My friend is super organized, and she rented out the back room for us ahead of time - a lot of people don't even know that this exists, but it does!!! You can rent it out and have to set up a fixed menu ahead of time. The backroom is very well-lit and is open and spacious and is AMAZING, basically. The menu she had set up for us included chips, salsa, guac, pancakes, veggie scramble, and pork scramble with tortillas so people could make tacos. 

The waitress came to the back room multiple times to take our drink orders, and she was super on top of it. If you wanted to order something not part of the fixed menu, that was doable too.  

Without drinks, the bill ended up being ~$23 each after tip/tax. Not sure how much drinks were because someone else took care of that in our group as a gift to the bday girl. 

Another bonus point: you could play your own music on your iPod back here! I'm not sure if someone in our group bought the iPod jambox thingie, but that was AWESOME. I highly recommend this to anyone who needs a space for a big party!
author: Priya G.

description: I'd like to update my review. The manager promptly emailed me about the service/hostessing issue and apologized and told me that they're working on it. I really appreciate his professionalism and for caring about his business. I will still continue to frequent here and have noticed an improvement in service. This is strictly a review about their service, the tacos are out of this world good! Addictive actually.
author: Stacy M.

description:
This place has the dubious honor of being permanently associated with the gentrification of the Mission. I recently spoke with someone who said, "And let's avoid all the d-bags at Tacolicious. No offense." (I'm not sure which piece of that I should be more offended at.)

In short, this place is...well, fairly, everything the Mission shouldn't be. Long waits, wealthy Silicon Valley crowd, overpriced and sub-par Mexican food (the tacos are small and bland), but copious margaritas. It's not bad, it just feels out of place. 

If you want a social scene with your Mexican food, or a place to rent for the launch party of your new app, this is probably your spot. It's for people who want to go to the Mission, but don't want to be in the Mission.
author: Kevin B.

description:
3/5 can't decide if i prefer just the booth

maybe it's my memory of having it when i used to work by the ferry building, or maybe it's how i like tacos from sinaloa, but this brick and mortar felt a little sterile. the service was great and the food is good, but there was something a little missing. i dunno. when it's a great day opt for outside, and we came right before a lunch rush and still had a comfortable meal. the drunken beans were interesting, but i'd probably opt for plain next time.

cool collab that meals on mondays go towards education, in case you ever can't decide when to set that lunch date :)
author: Alvin D.

description:
Great food (can't think better carnitas soft tacos that I've had), good service unfortunately brought down by terrible hostesses, who decided that only one table in the whole place could accommodate 6 people and let us wait more than an hour.  We showed up around 5:30, so it wasn't like there were reservations to accommodate, and there were plenty of open tables that could have been combined.  Not very nice either.

10/26/15 - adding another star based in subsequent positive experiences.
author: Paul M.

description: Tacolicious is phenomenal. I'm from Santa Ana, ca so I know my tacos and tacolicious takes it to the next level. I recommend the beer and shot braised chicken taco with the Baja- style pacific cod second. Getting the margarita de la casa is not optional! The mucho gusto margarita is also sinfully delicious with pineapple and coconut water. Definitely a must- hit spot in the mission.
author: Keila M.

description: This is the best taco place I've ever been to. Definitely get the carnitas it is amazing. The guac and chips are also really good. Lots of types of margaritas (a little pricey but delicious). Show up early, because there's usually a wait.
author: Rachel C.

description: The food that they offer tastes good, its just very very small portions and expensive. You would need to order like 5 tacos to feel like you ate a meal. and they are around like 4 or 5 bucks each depending on the types that you order. There is a nice atmosphere and my wife likes their drinks but I could do without this place honestly.
author: Chris H.

description: Overpriced but its still good....we ordered takeout and I wish they would label which taco was which cuz it was a little hard to tell apart all the meat ones...the chorizo and cod ones were good though, as well the chips.
author: Sonia V.

description: Their chips and salsa are seriously the BEST! I get a craving for them frequently and could eat the salsa with a spoon! Great margaritas, love the fried fish tacos and the carnitas tacos. My go to dishes are the queso dip, guacamole, a fish taco and a carnitas tacos - along with more than my fair share of chips and salsa - yum!
author: Kelly C.

description: Telmo Faria's creativity was evident in the bite he created tonight at the Good Food Awards reception. A mexican style meatball tossed in habenero jelly atop pureed black bean with a few greens on the side. OMG! I'd love to see more of this at Tacolicious.
author: Joanna T.

description:
My first experience here was great. I came here with my daughter (2.5) and a friend. I was told the wait would be about 30 minutes, but was sat in less than ten. We sat inside next to a large window. We were greeted quickly and brought water and chips/salsa. Our server was prompt, friendly, and approachable. 

We ordered 4 tacos and a marina girl salad to share. The tacos were two carnitas, chorizo/potatoes and a cod one. They were all tasty, especially the chorizo! The salad was fantastic, I never thought of pumpkin seeds in a salad, but it was a good addition. My girlfriend ordered a strawberry type of margarita, and then another one, so it had to be good.

The kids menu was good. Not too much food, a nice selection.

Overall, I enjoyed my experience here and would recommend it to friends....and tag along with them :)
author: JoBeth B.

description:
The short rib and rock cod tacos were money!

As a soCal native, I was a little skeptical about waiting 1.5 hours for $4 tacos. To me, tacos always meant $2 tacos off the local cart/restaurant from the cart/restaurant down the street (albeit questionable in the health department). When the hostess told us the wait time, I was ready to leave.... but I'm glad I didn't. 

The hostess told us that we could head to the bar next door and start drinking, and that she'd get us when our table was ready. It was 8pm and drinks were in order, so we headed to the bar and ordered the first round of drinks. It took us about 25 minutes for us to actually get the drinks because it was packed, but the drinks were great. I had a Mexican Old Fashioned (tequila, orange rind, chocolate bitters, sugar) that was pretty awesome. Before we knew it, our table was ready.

We settled for 10 tacos for $31 bucks to try every kind of taco they had. I was a bit surprised when the tacos came out because they were HUGE. Probably 2x or 3x the amount of meat that you'd get in a regular taco, which probably makes the expensive price tag worth it. Moreover, the tacos were juicy and delicious. I was told the Fried Cod was the most popular, and I have to agree that it was really good. The short rib was also juicy and flavorful. The chicken tacos, although a bit dry, where pretty good but I'd prefer the ones from my local taco stand over those.

As a side, we had the fried plantains. They were thin cut like french fries and were awesome. It was definitely one of those appetizers that I couldn't stop eating! 

All in all, great environment, drinks, and food. Skip your local taco stand for once and splurge on Tacolicious!
author: Andrew N.

description:
I didn't come away too impressed by Tacolicious. Just seemed to me like your average Mexican fusion restaurant, nothing too special. 

The tacos themselves are tasty enough, but they double up on the corn tortillas. This  leads to the tortilla really overpowering the taste of the taco fillings. I'd recommend chucking the outer tortilla. As for the fillings themselves, my favorite was the short rib, although the sight of how much grease drips onto your plate might make you queasy. My friends seemed to like the cod, but I thought it was a little bland. 

Chips and salsa were pretty good. They also have someone working there who looks almost exactly like Sergio Romo, so if you've ever wanted to live out your fantasy of being served tacos made by the Giants closer, this is your place. Prices are higher than your average taqueria, but pretty on par for the Mission.
author: Jason C.

description:
I came here on a Thursday night, and boy was it packed!

Our table of 6 ordered two of the 10 tacos for $31. We tried every taco available. Split between 3 people, those 10 tacos seemed to multiply. I cut the tacos into halves so that we could all try a little of each, and it seemed like each time I cut, more taco would appear. Enough to feed the masses, for sure. My favorites were the fish taco and the chorizo taco.

We also got an order of queso to share. Delicious.

This isn't my favorite place for tacos, but I would come back.
author: Emily T.

description: I got the albacore tuna tostadas and was VERY pleasantly surprised! The carnitas tacos were also DELIcious.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
i love this place! the flavors, presentation, atmosphere, service clicks on all cylindersI  I need to get out to the Mission more and this will definitely be stop # 1 or 2.
three guys shared a taco platter of roasted pork, beef, chicken, fish.  so difficult to pick a favorite. they were all "true to themselves and made it their own."
did that sound enough like trite American Idol judges rants?
except this time, i am not judging. not complimenting.
JYW is a fan!
author: Jeff W.

description:
My friend and I were craving Mexican food so we decided to grab a late dinner at Tacolicious. Just to be clear, Tacolicious isn't authentic Mexican food - if that's what you're looking for, go elsewhere!

After about a 20 minute wait at Mosto, the tequila bar next door, my friend and I were seated. The seating is sort of awkward - it's way too cramped and crowded for a restaurant. I liked the overall ambiance of Tacolicious, very casual yet dimly-lit, but it definitely caters to a more hipster crowd.

We started off with some chips and salsa, which are free, and we also ordered a side of guacamole ($8.25). We knew we wanted tacos, so we ordered:
-Traditional carnitas 
-Guajillo braised beef short ribs

Out of the two types of tacos we tried, the carnitas were my favorite. They were very tender, juicy, and we were given generous portions. The braised short ribs had tons of flavor but I'm a fan of more traditional tacos. While the tacos were delicious, I don't feel like they were worth the prices - 1 taco ($3.95), 4 tacos ($14), and 10 tacos ($33). Definitely not typical prices for Mexican food in the Mission! 

Service was okay - our server was nice but she didn't check on us very much. We had other random servers refill our water and chips. 

I might try Tacolicious out again but with other more affordable, and more authentic, Mexican places in the neighborhood, it's not highly likely.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
It's a nice little joint. Very cool hole in the wall style Mexican cafe, with a separate bar on the other side.

NOISY NOISY NOISY, especially at dinner time. Very popular and they have a TV for sports.

Chips and salsa were very good as was the guacamole. All tasted fresh. We got tacos (duh). We tried the fried cod, the carnitas, braised short rib and bistec adobado [sp?], the bistec was my personal favorite, followed by the fish, all very tender and well  seasoned, they were a joy to eat and those would be my go-tos next time. The others were good too. Carnitas was pretty juicey, but braised short rib was a little tough for my liking.

It's a little on the pricey side, the service was decent, looks cool and hip atmosphere, but very loud. Food was very good, not quite for what you're paying tho. I liked it. I will be back.
author: David B.

description: Delicious. Service is awesome.  Indoor and outdoor areas available. Chorizo tacos are my favorites. Definitely coming back again, and again, and again.....i got there right at opening time so i  didn't have to wait for a table
author: Gabriel G.

description:
Definitely not an easy place to get a table on the fly, especially on the weekends where a 1 hour wait can turn into a 2 hour wait, but it makes you think that they're doing something right. So the question of the day is...was it really worth the wait?

You've reached Tacolicious when you see the round orange sign with a half circle. Trendy, shall I say? Our group of 5 checked in at 8 PM on a Saturday evening and told that it was a 1.5 hour wait. Thank goodness Tacolicious isn't out in the boonies. Situated in the heart of the Mission there's lots you can do while you wait. We ended up having drinks next door at Chapel in their outdoor patio. After an hour and a half we checked in and waited another 30 minutes until our name was finally called at 10 PM *angel voices sing*

Famished, we munched on the chips and salsa right away. We also ordered fried plantains which were served hot and delicious. As far as tacos go, you can't go wrong with any of the selections. Be forewarned, they come fully loaded and are quite the hearty meal. Two tacos can go a long way. I ended up having the fish taco which was served crisp to perfection as well as the carnitas tacos which were warm and juicy. All served with a nice selection of salsas.

Definitely worth the wait, but next time I'll likely opt for not going with a big group of 5 or choose to dine earlier. Until we meet again Tacolicious, taco on!
author: Andrew S.

description:
Finally made it to Tacolicious after moving in down the street 6 months ago.  My friend and I got 4 tacos between the two of us, made-to-order guacamole, and chips and tasty homemade salsa (which every table gets!).  Our waitress recommended that we get two tacos each, which was perfect for us. We got the shrimp po boy special and the butternut squash tacos.  The tacos were awesome.  I can't wait to try some more! 

The guacamole was good but not the best I've ever had; it could have done with a little more salt or a kick.
author: Laura H.

description: Yes, we had just eaten, but spending a short weekend in San Francisco and having tried no Latin American food just seemed a fault we needed to correct. "I know a place and it's on the way," our friend and guide eagerly exclaimed, fully supporting our food-ventures. Tacolicious, hyped up as a place we should try for the their tacos alone was the destination, and though we could surely go for some pozole or a chupito, a taco was meant to be. A taco trio was our perfect end and with sauces aplenty, our Tacas a la Carnitas, Braised Short Rib, and Fried Cod were nothing short of a flavor fusion. Patting our bellies and looking at the time, we left this colorful atmosphere to begin the trek back home
author: Andrew Y.

description: Good, but not great. Much better taqueria places nearby. This was expensive for being simple. The flavors were just OK and the spiciest salsa was just spicy, not flavorful. This may be the hip place, but I guess I am more traditional.
author: Samuel F.

description:
Having lived in the Mission district for over 20 years, food joints like Tacolicious (I really hated typing that word) tend to turn my stomach. Fancy simple food cooked up for affluent (or soon to be) young folks who want the taste of culture but not the full immersion. That's what I thought before I ate there and is still true to a certain extent...b, b, but.....the tacos are really really good! All of them! I'm not about to break down each thing I ate but let's just say we tried about everything and were delighted with all of it. Real specific, huh? 

Yeah, this place is hipster gentrifier hell in a way. But it's also a place were you can get good (not necessarily authentic) tacos with delicious margaritas. And honestly, if this is the direction the city is going, at least everyone eating and working there was cute. A bit central casting-ish but made for good people watching regardless. It's kind of expensive compared to real Mexican taco joints but this really isn't what Tacolicious is about. It was also super busy and noisy inside but I didn't find that surprising given the location. Once seated, it was actually fun, loud conversations and all. And finally, the wait time was less than they quoted so that was nice. 

If I can figure out a time when it isn't so damn crowded, I see myself going in and ordering the 4 for $14 Taco plate (all short rib) and a margarita and choking down my gentrifier guilt with pure deliciousness.
author: Johnny H.

description: OVERPRICED!! Finally got the chance to visit. But, the prices are ridiculous!!! The margaritas were delicious! The meat was tender and delicious. The guacamole was on point! Dessert was blah could've eaten another taco instead! Didn't want to give this place more then 2 stars because of the prices. 100 bucks for 2 people, mind blowing it's just tacos!!! Nice to come and check it out but not a place to dine out regularly at least for me.
author: Patricia G.

description: We decided to take Taco Tuesday out to the mission from all the good things we've heard about Tacolicious. Overall, this place was decent but I would go to a place closer to home for a much cheaper price and quality. My bf and I ordered the 4 x4 taco special, ceviche, and salsa & chips. Anyways, we ordered a couple drinks (cocktails & wine) and they were excellent. Along with our waiter who checked up on us every so often to see if we needed anything. Salsa & chips were okay, ceviche was okay (could've totally gone to place that served more for the same price), and for the tacos... it was decent. The waiter gave us a tip which I will hand over to all the yelpers reading this: if you decide to share on the taco specials, you can use the second tortilla and just split the food! It's a genius idea which my bf and I thought was helpful since we were planning to just split the tacos in half, but we ended up having our own little mini tacos. Thank you awesome waiter. The tacos I enjoyed were the cod and the potato & chorizo.
author: Victoria K.

description: Yum, this place is very good and very busy so you're gonna most likely have to wait. That's ok, you can do just that next door at hip Mosto bar. First, let me say their stone-ground tortilla chips and quality homemade grandma salsa will break just about anyone's will power who swore of these demonishly good Mexican standards. (We had about four bowls of the salsa.) As for our dinner, you really can't go wrong with the tacos. I highly suggest mixing it up and have at least one Baja-style fish taco. Another great option is the chicken mole taco. And of course you probably can't go wrong with the asada beef or carnitas, but that's almost cheating. Beer menu here is different from Mosto but the service is just as good. Special note to check out the very cool floor tiles. Reminiscent of floor tiles found in colonial-era Malaysian and Singapore buildings, these were actually made on request in Mexico! Awesome!
author: Brian J.

description:
Strolling in for a mid day drink sit down and even for just drinks they give you chips. The salsa is lime heavy and off the hook. 
The smells are making me salivate and I already ate lunch I will be back later for tostadas and ceviche. 
The open lunch kitchen keeps the place feeling clean and professional, and the outside seating (which is always full when I've walked by on the weekends or evenings) looks wonderful. 
Finally anyone able to throw vinegar into a tequila cocktail and make it refreshing enough to enjoy a place on their cocktail list deserves praise. 
Nummy!
author: Justin T.

description:
Hipster central! I kind of got a Tex Mex feel about this place, it's cute and small, the food was decent, but I'm not itching to come back. It is definitely a place to try at least once though.

We had a party of four, walked in at 10pm and there was a 30 minute wait. Not a problem, they have a tequila  bar next door that you could wait at. The drinks next door were delicious, and when our names were called we closed our tabs and they allowed us to take our drinks with us to Tacolicious, that alone was pretty awesome :)

Free chips and salsa! The salsa was delicious and the chips were the thick and warm kind, we were pretty hungry and we plowed through the first basket of chips pretty quickly. 

We ordered the 10 tacos for $33. A combination of chorizo and potatoes, chicken, short ribs, fish tacos. Everything was pleasantly spicy and well seasoned. The fish was a tad bland to me, but it could have just been a bad batch. 

We also ordered the fresh guacamole appetizer for the table, it was extremely basic, nothing to really say about it. 

Next were the shooters. There's five selections and we chose the 4 for $12 option, the only downside was that they all had to be the same flavors. We chose the passion fruit one which may have been a mistake. It was a bit too tart for some of the people at the table, but at the end there was a little spice kick that was interesting. I may come back just to try the other interesting flavors. 

All in all, probably not a place I would avidly recommend for visitors, although it's a fun hang out spot if you're in the area. But unfortunately with all the great food in the Mission and the even more AMAZING authentic Mexican food pretty close by, it may be a while before I venture in here again.
author: Mindy T.

description: Tacos on tacos on tacos!!! Tacos galore! The only reason it didn't get a 4 or a 5 star revue was because the service wasn't that great. We literally stood there for like 5 minutes and no one even greeted us and to find out the hostess was standing in front of the TV. Their ceviche was horrible so stay away from that but the tacos were good. Especially the beer bottle chicken
author: Heather S.

description: Holy balls the food was good. We shared the beer and a shot chicken tacos and that chicken was literally the tastiest thing I've had. So good that I looked for the recipe online and intend to make it at home. Agh, so good
author: JB D.

description:
I came here on Valentine's Day with a large group of friends and we all had a really great time. We came for the tacos and were not disappointed at all. Each one was just as good as another and I would head back there if I were up in San Francisco again.

The waitress was really kind and tended to our every need. Other appetizers were well worth it as well and their margaritas, which were nice and strong.

The overall service was awesome and the atmosphere was as well. I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone who enjoys quality mexican food and quality time with a fun group of friends.
author: Justin R.

description:
Ambience: 4/5... Outside patios just do it for me.  This place had great vibe! It was a Saturday night so it was busy.  It was also pretty chilly and we moved tables to get closes to the heating lamps.  I would recommend them place another one out there.  Bring a jacket if going in the evening. I guess this goes without saying in San Fran.
