Service: 2/5 Service was above average.  I order my flight of tequila and didn't receive it until halfway through my meal. I wasn't too pleased with that.  Our server was so so.... Nothing really special here at all actually.  There were a few friendly smiles and greetings and our water stayed full. That's about as good as it gets. 

Food: 4/5 WOW!!!! The braised short rib tacos were to die for.  My girlfriend got the veggie tacos and loved them as well.   I was extremely impressed.  Good chips and salsa as well which is always a big plus. 

Price:  Surprisingly not as expensive as I was expecting.   

Overall: 3/5... I would come back here only for the tacos and another flight of amazing tequila service was sub par and a disappointment.  I am a stickler when it comes to that.
author: Terrance H.

description:
Tacolicious is delicious! I enjoy the atmosphere of this place a lot. The staff is friendly and welcoming and the food tastes great. It's not a "taqueria", even though it's got "taco" in the name and "Mission" in its neighborhood, so don't be disappointed.

It's inexpensive, it's filling, it's delish. I recommend the short rib and the bistec tacos. The mint salsa's one of the highlights of my day.
author: Richard K.

description:
It's a really good place to hang out and they have very good variety of delicious tacos!

The restaurant is new and with modern design. We like it.
author: Ricki Y.

description:
Terrrrible food, horrendous service. 

The fried fish tacos were disgusting- all you could taste was fried batter which was too sweet. The $8+ guac was all avocado and garlic (no tomato and not enough acidity). The salsa was good, but the sauces that came with the tacos were not flavorful enough. 

The servers and hostess had attitude and service was non-existent. My drink was overly sweet. I've never waited 2+ for any place, so you can imagine how annoyed I was when the food turned out to be so bad.
author: Pria P.

description: Tasty margaritas with creative and unusual flavors. Some of the best tacos I've ever had. The nopale tacos are surprisingly good
author: Amar R.

description:
Rented out the back room for a team development event for our company. Overall was a good experience. The food was a little slow to come out and some people had to leave before they could even eat! Food was yummy and served family style which was fine, except our vegetarian friends could not eat anything since the meat tacos were overflowing to the veggie ones. Probably my bad and would ask those to be separated next time. We ended up having way too much food left over since so many people left early, but they provided to-go boxes for us which was nice. 

Overall a good event and a good place to have it. Fun drinks, nice area to stand and mingle as well as sit down and eat. Would suggest only half the room for a party of 30ish though.
author: Amanda S.

description:
After living in Tucson, AZ for over 20 years, lets just say my Mexican food cravings were always well satisfied.  

With that being said, when I received the plate of tacos, I was surprised by the soggy tortillas that comprised the disks they called 'tacos'...

This was my first time ordering tacos in San Francisco and my friend told me this is how tacos are enjoyed here, 'street style', compared to the deep fried, Sonoran-style taco that ive grown up loving in AZ.  So it is not to say the tacos were bad here, but they were a bit overpriced and the wait was rather long for a meal I could typically order from any food cart in downtown Tucson.

Despite my issue w/ the shells, I was nevertheless impressed by the quality of meat and seafood choices they offered in their 'tacos'.
author: J L.

description:
I've seen reviews about this place and I finally had a free Friday to give it a try. First of all, the interior design set up inside is pretty chill. The tables were a bit close to each other, so if you're thinking of having a private conversation over dinner, this won't be the ideal place for that. 

Now for the food. I got the cod, carnitas and beef thing. My favorite one was the cod, it was well cooked and seasoned. I didn't enjoy the carnitas and beef as much though. It tasted a bit dry and a little salty for me, but it was still well marinated. They give you chips and salsa when you're party is seated as well as 3 different hot sauces - mild, medium and hot.

The ambience is nice. The place is well lit and a good hangout for late 20s - early 30s hipsters.
author: Patrick B.

description:
Tacolicious is Tacoeverything. I absolutely love this place, especially on Tuesdays. 

You will have to wait. And they don't make anything convenient about it. My mini rant will be limited to how awful the Valencia food corridor is getting at customer service. It is becoming a "we do you a favor by being here, so you're welcome".  There is no OpenTable reservations, the host can't even call you when the wait is up to an hour, so you're left wandering around the neighborhood hoping they aren't giving your spot away. Step up the game, man. 

ANYWAY, the food here is wonderful. I love the home-style tacos and you have to get the cheese dip. It is everything. The service is usually cheerful once you are seated and the salsa and chips are endless. You will leave feeling full and paying maybe 15-16 dollars a person. It is totally kind on your wallet. The seating is cantina style, so don't expect a lot of privacy unless you snag a patio spot. And while you're sitting on the patio, ponder your existence with the mural that is on the wall, it is worth about 16 instagram photos. 

If you are feeling adventurous, check out the tequila bar on the other side of the normal venue.  It is everything!
author: Jeremy R.

description: YUM. We did the shot, beer and taco deal. Fish taco is where it's attttt and the salsas that accompany it are dank. The chips and salsa is really tasty. Solid service at the table and bar! The shot is generous, too! That's all we had, but I hear great things about their other food. Oh and I tried a smokey mezcal marg too- yum but acquired taste for sure.
author: Juls M.

description: There is nothing special about this place. Being in the heart of the mission with so many options for Mexican food, this place does not do its part. The food is expensive for tacos!! The service is whatever and the drinks are okay. You can go anywhere else in  a three block radius and get tacos for half the price with better taste and better service.
author: Chiara M.

description: Great spot for tacos and drinks. Came here on a Monday night and there was a crowd, a clear sign the meal would be great. There was a little bit of a wait so I went to mosto next door for drinks. The drinks chef whipped us up some yummy cocktails and we brought them to tacolicious when our table was ready. The tacos were great! I recommend the baja. The churros were also AMAZING! They were so rich with chocolate sauce. I would definitely return!
author: Ashley I.

description: Good service. Waiter was straight to the point and polite. The environment is full of energy and tacos were great. I love restaurants that you're able to see them cook. Pricey but it's the city. What do you expect? Anyways I would and will come here again.
author: Alex S.

description: I finally got to try this spot after hearing so much about it - it was great!  Very good drinks and very good food...I tried 5 different tacos and my favorites were the short ribs, carnitas and fried cod - everything was flavorful and I enjoyed my experience.
author: Ken G.

description: This Tacolious location has not disappointed. We've eaten here 4 times in the last 3 months. We like fresh, nicely presented, creatively made food from sustainable sources and organic as much as possible. Tacolious fits that description We always get a salad, our fav is the beet & citrus salad. Amazing. I never ate beets until I got married about 6 yrs ago. The beet salad here is top notch. I think there are 7 taco varieties and we've eaten them all. My favorite is the bistec adobo and the shot-and-a-beer braised chicken. Easy access to BART is a major bonus.
author: Al G.

description: Are the tacos tasty? Yes. Are they overpriced? Absolutely. The reason why I continue to come here is because it's a fun, lively atmosphere and the bartender Manny is, well, the man! He makes excellent drinks both on and off the menu and is a super fun guy to spend your happy hour, dinner or late night snack with.
author: Amy Y.

description:
So my friend convinced me to go here and I was pleasantly surprised on a Tuesday night how packed it was.... We waited about 20 mins for a table but was able to have a drink outside which was nice. The Tequila menu is insane... If i liked tequila it would of been fabulous... the 2 tacos I had were delish.. A chicken mole one and a beer and shot one... Very good. 

I'm not a huge fan of the chips but that's just me...

It was also ridiculously noisy... But it is SF
author: danielle s.

description:
I hope I dont get accused of being a taco-hater, but I just cant get terribly excited about this place.

The food is good. Ingredients all seem fresh. I would go back. But my brain doesn't orgasm when these delicacies make contact with my taste buds. So, just doesnt do it enough for me to give more than 3 stars.

Get me off, and you get a better review. Its just how life works.
author: David K.

description: The vibe was awesome,  service was on point,  and food / drinks were incredibly tasty.  But the prices were so ridiculous. They're is no reason 4 grown ass men need to spend $120 on tiny margaritas and 3 skimpy tacos each. They were incredible but this is straight robbery. They're just fu*kin tacos
author: Brandon N.

description: Chips and salsa? Asked the second 24 year old cute boy bartender. Happy so far with my margarita....
author: C. D.

description:
Mneeeehhhh. Came here with my girls on a Tuesday evening after work around 6 with an open mind after reading all the Yelp reviews. There was already a waitlist with us being number one. We waited for maybe 10 minutes and were seated at a high table with the hot ass sun in our eyes. Tacolicious, you should definitely think about putting shades on the highest parts of your windows. We were sweating from the heat and were really considering looking like those douchebags wearing their sunglasses indoors.

Although the tacos are stuffed with a nice hefty amount of meat, we just weren't impressed. We ordered the 10 tacos for $33 and skipped the crispy taco tuesday special. All tacos were dripping with oil with the exception of the fish tacos, so we let the oil drip out before eating them. We got one chorizo and potato, 3 cod, 3 carne asada, and 3 beef ribs. I think we enjoyed the chips and salsa more than the tacos.
author: Cheryl Q.

description: Went here for a girls night. Prices are pretty steep, but I like really tart/sour margaritas and this joint quenched my thirst for that. The food was ok, not the best tacos I've had. Probably won't go back because I can get equal or better quality for less and with no wait. The server was not attentive, we had to flag her down for everything and the hostess was irritable. Eh, it's the mission, go down a few blocks for better.
author: Zara S.

description: I went here for happy hour with my boyfriend,the place was super busy so we decided to sit at the bar. Bar service was not the best the first 15mins, but once the bartender realized we were there things went great. The tacos are very tasty and the micheladas are delicious. This is a great place to eat and hang out.
author: Nia L.

description:
What is the big deal about this place. The drinks are atrocious: the bloody mary had some kind of molasses in it and it was downright nasty. They get all creative with the cocktails and it's kind of a mess.
The tacos are hit or miss and the best one was the chorizo. I get that it's somewhat trendy and plays upbeat music, but the food and drinks really aren't great.
author: Nasrin M.

description: I've been here almost 4 times now. Great place to eat. I've brought family and friends here and they are always satisfied. Plus there are gluten free as well as vegetarian options which is a big plus. Personally, I've found that 2 tacos is enough for me, as an average sized male. Very filling and satisfying.
author: Anmol S.

description: Food is decent but to-go service is lousy - it's slow, they don't give honest estimates (10-15 mins is what they say, no matter what the situation is in the kitchen), and interaction with a surly bartender is thrown into the bargain.  I've tried multiple times hoping this won't happen.  But it does every time.
author: O W.

description:
This place is awful. The vibe, the service, and the food.  

The hostess was the rudest person I've ever met and should not be working in the service industry. 

If you want good Mexican food, go to Taqueria Cancun around the corner.
author: Trey D.

description: First time visiting and had the pleasure of having Ryan as our server. He's a gem! Definitely ask for him as your server if you want a kind, passionate, friendly man with fabulous drink and food pairing recommendations. I will certainly be asking to be seated in his sections next time!
author: Alaina K.

description:
My man friend & I tried to go to the North Beach location, but the power was out. Determined, we headed over to the Mission. The quoted wait for a table was 45 mins. We were lucky to steal seats at the bar. 

Bartender seemed super green. I saw him pull a 'Cocktail' bottle-flip-move, and he almost lost it, but was proud of himself for catching it. Not a particularly friendly guy, but he impressed us with his memorization skills--just when we thought he wasn't listening to us order. Maybe he was bummed he couldn't do more cocktail tricks since we just had a spicy beer & michelada? Which btw, they were only $4.50? Is that right? Can you even get a Pabst anywhere for that price? 

Chips & salsa were amazing. That salsa is magic! Excuse me? Is there mint in there? Only prob, no one asked if we wanted more of either. Bartender never asked us if we wanted more drinks.

Tacos were just alright: Summer squash, beef, chicken, cod, carnitas. They were big, we did not leave hungry. Okay and what are the sauces that showed up? No one explained. Mystery sauces. They were blah blah.

Overall a cheap date. 2 drinks, 6 big tacos, chips & salsa $36 bucks. That's amazing for San Francisco.
author: Jen J.

description: Absolutely love the food at this Mexican restaurant in the Mission. Even if you are early, be prepared to queue! Another option is to head to the bar next door if there's room, drink some tequila and order selected bites that are made in the Tacolicious kitchen.
author: Claire T.

description:
After an intense dance class at Dance Mission, we walked the 6 blocks to get to Tacolicious, and of course by the time we got there, we were starving!!!

Surprisingly, even though the place seemed pretty busy at 2pm, we got seated right away, a great 4 person table perfect for people watching.  Well, people were definitely watching us from the bar, giving us the stank eye for taking our sweet time, and having a great table.  Imagine 4 dancers in sweats CHOWING DOWN like it was our last meal.  That being said, make sure you wear more than sweats when you come here.  But at the time, we didn't care.

Needless to say, we were highly satisfied.  16 tacos, guacamole, and a pitcher of pomegranate margaritas later, we were STUFFED.  We even had to take a lot of it home.  Well, not the margaritas. :-)

The fish tacos are seriously amazing, and our 2nd favorite was definitely the shredded chicken.

They lose one star for how pricey it is.  I mean, this is the MISSION.  And there are so many other affordable taquerias around (obviously).  Our bill for 4 people was $117 excluding tax.  A bit much in our opinion.  If you chose this place, you're paying for the ambiance.  Upscale hipster taco realness, for sure.

DELISH, nevertheless!
author: Vince S.

description: One of my favorite places to take friends when we're hanging around the Mission Dolores area. To start, I want to give great regards to the service at this place - what a friendly and accomodating wait staff. It was already packed with a heavy waitlist when we got here at 7 on a Tuesday night. We decided to grab some drinks at the sidebar - what a selection of margaritas! However, I tried a beer and ordered the Victoria (lager) and wow truly delicious! Hardly any malt- aftertaste existent. Instead the aftertaste boasts a strong flavor of lime...wonderful with tacos. Now for the actual food - we got the guacamole platter (guac till I die) and to be honest it was alright... They provide ample portions. However the flavor fell flat.. Could probably use several cups of Tapito sauce. I got the bbq taco and one taco is already plenty of food, rich in sauce and flavor. The side hot sauces were fun to play around with, though I did find myself needing more like slices and several spoons of the side sauce to achieve my desired flavor level.
author: Grace O.

description: Service was adequate. Food was tasty. Portions were a bit on the light side. Drinks were expensive.
author: Russ O.

description:
By far one of the best places to eat tacos besides at a real taqueria or food truck. Tacolicous not only has the best tasting tacos but they have the best drinks as well. My girls and I always come here Thursday night to start off the weekend. I know its a little early, but hey YOLO. haha jk. 

The tacos also come at a really reasonable prices so you can order a variety and share amongst your group. The carnitas, beef, and fish tacos are the three that I usually get when I am there. I havent tried anything else but the tacos but I would not doubt that the other items on the menus arent good. 

Drink wise- GET THE PASION. Its the most delicious drink there you can have. There are a couple more there but i forget the name. And if you want to try the drinks and see which flavor you like; check out the shooters were you can mix different flavors. 

One major downside to this place is that the wait is FOREVER. and I mean like FOREVER there is just no exaggeration to it. Come Early or else you will be looking at a 45min wait depending on how large your party is.
author: Allie B.

description: Fun, fabulous, and delicious!  I went to this lovely establishment with my two brothers and had the 10 tacos and two pitchers of margaritas.  The meat was tender and yummy and the margaritas were smooth too. Great ambiance and fantastic service!!!!
author: Michelle P.

description:
The albacore tuna tostadas are the best! :)
I could eat those all day! So much tuna and avocado!

We went to the Mission location on Valencia. I love the open kitchen and layout of inside. There is a patio outside, but we sat inside where it was a bit cooler. Easy access from transit. It can be hard to find, you have to look for the taco sign! 

We had several tacos as well as those awesome tostadas, with churros for dessert.
Love Tacolicious, will definitely visit again when in San Francisco!
author: Tim S.

description:
Poor customer service, chubby meats & yummy chips.

Service (ehhh): We sat down at an open table after seeing that there were no bar seats when meeting up with a group. The hostess came by and asked if we wanted to sit at that table or somewhere else, and we told her the table was fine and she disappeared off. She popped back up 10 minutes later to inform us the table we were sitting at was only for those ordering food. Well... duh...How am I suppose to order food if you never gave me a menu?! I informed her we were waiting for a menu and with no apologies on her part, but at least she disappeared and sent us a waitress. 

Atmosphere: LOUD. Don't expect to have a conversation here cause you won't be able to hear each other. The decor is def. nicer than your average mexican restaurant or taco shop... modern with hints of "Mission". 

Food: complimentary chips are always a plus and yummy. Tacos are more expensive then I'm used to at about $3 a pop and are small, BUT they do give a generous amount of meat... def more than your typical servings. They had 3 diff sauces for you to put on your tacos and I like the yellow mildly spicy one. The pulled pork taco was good and filling.

Overall.. the place is alright but service put me off.
author: Emily C.

description: Margarita + tacos = happy tummy. Fish taco was my favorite. I will go again for it's taco Tuesday!
author: Sophia H.

description:
The Margaritas here are some of the best in the city, IMO.  None of that watered down, syrupy crap you get at other places.  This is the real deal, and even though it's $8-10, you're gonna be feeling good after a glass of these bad boys.  

The tacos are good, a bit overpriced, but nonetheless delectable.  10 tacos were plenty for 3 of us.  My personal favorite was the BLT taco.  Very original.  I went at around 5:15 on a Thursday, and was seated immediately.  However, by the time we left, at around 6:30, it seemed as though there was a long wait.  So get there early! Or if you're in Palo Alto, head to Emerson- that one never has a wait!
author: Meli M.

description: Yes, the food and Margaritas are excellent but I wanted to write this review to alert you that this place has the best kale salad ever! You wouldn't necessarily think it would but it does. I now have a craving for that particular kale salad. This is the sort of kale salad that will turn non-kale eaters. It's that good.
author: LadyJ M.

description:
The two stars are for the chips and salsa, respectively.

Service- this is where you lose me. I have never been made to feel so small for having a question about the menu. I served tables for a long time, so I get how irritating your job can become, but why would you take that out on us?! And to feel that you have the right to belittle someone for asking for a drink recommendation?! I.JUST.DON'T.GET.IT.
Sure, maybe he was having a rough night but I'd rather not risk another encounter with that guy.  GEEZ.
author: Emi K.

description: Good margaritas, good tacos. Especially loved the beer braised chicken. Service is good. And closer than Tommy's!
author: Heather R.

description:
Customer Beware.  Ordered two vegetable tacos last week and pulled a long hair about five inches in length out of my taco.  Had to wait a while before I could get our server's attention.  When I showed it to her she just shrugged and said she would replace the tacos.  
What she should have done is apologized, got the Manager to come to our table and at the very least my tacos should have been comped.  So much for customer service!
author: Kathryn L.

description: Go-to taco place with out-of-town guests. Love their guacamole and tacos. Fun vibe before a night out!
author: Jillian P.

description:
The first time I came here (evening and on a weekend), the wait was 2 hours long. So I went on lunch with my co-workers and loved it! I think shelling our 12 bucks for 3-4 pieces of yummy taco is pretty worth it (if you love eating!). 

Service may be slow sometimes, but servers are friendly!
author: Kevin Roger T.

description:
The food was delicious but unfortunately the hostesses running the show almost ruined the entire experience if it weren't for the fact that we got liquored up at Mosto while waiting for a table.

I'll start with the good. When we finally got seated, the waitress and food was 5 stars all the way around. I think they put crack or heaps of butter in their rice... TDF. All of the tacos were muy delicioso as well. It's really hard to go wrong with the food here.

And now the bad and the ugly. We knew it was going to be a long wait on a Saturday night so we had planned accordingly. Our group of 5 arrived at 7pm with the idea of putting our names down and then drinking at Mosto next door till our table was ready. Upon arrival, I found a petite blonde hostess running around with a paper notepad writing down names. For a busy restaurant, why do they not have a computer system?

We ordered drinks at Mosto, and every time we ordered another round of the same drinks, they somehow always forgot my drink order, WTF? Just me, nobody else.

A different hostess came around to see if we wanted a table outside which we politely refused because it was freezing outdoors. She said a table inside would be another 20 minutes which we didn't mind. Cut to 40 minutes later, still no table. I went in to check and the blonde hostess lied straight to my face that they couldn't find us (even though we did not move from our original place at Mosto) and they gave our table to another party. Later on, the original hostess who came to find us confirmed that her colleague literally just lied straight up. They also kept telling us we were the next table to be seated, which apparently they had a habit of doing for everyone waiting for tables.

Seriously Tacolicious, you have delicious food. Don't let your front of house staff ruin the experience for everyone!
author: Melissa L.

description:
I wanted to hate this place or at least exhibit some kind of righteous indignation given my black belt in Mexican food and tacquerias... but I really liked it.

Came in for lunch and made the mistake of ordering four tacos. If I try that again then I will plan ahead and wear something with an elastic waist. I had:

Butternut squash/poblano
Fried cod
Braised chicken
Shortrib tacos
+ complementary chips and salsa 

All were quite good and the portions were generous.
author: Easwud C.

description:
what an awesome morning. a nice walking in the mission and lunch at tacolicious! trying to keep my growing heft to a minimum, i ordered the fish tacos which come either pan seared or deep fried. my boyfriend's order comes with our drinks, and shortly thereafter my plate is presented. i politely confirm what clearly looks like deep fried and let the guy know i ordered pan seared. he apologizes and leaves as we continue our conversation and enjoy the delicious drinks and chips and salsa. yet another server comes and delivers a fresh plate of two more deep fried fish tacos. while i wait for my dish, i help my boyfriend devour his plate and my tacos arrive. our adorable server came to acknowledge the mistakes and brought over three shots for us all to enjoy. what a lovely morning and experience despite the mistakes.

all restaurants make mistakes. acknowledge them and perhaps a small token and i'll be forever thankful and understanding.
author: Torrpedo T.

description:
The food is delicious. The salsa is my favorite...the secret is that they out mint in there and it is amazing.  The spicy margarita beyond words.
The reason I dont love tacolicious (any of their locations) is that the ambiance is hipster-annoying and the service sucks. And it is way too expensive for mexican food...just because it is gentrified...

So while the food is great, I would rather pay 1/5 of the price for some actually authentic mexican food at one of the many hole in the wall mexican places in the mission with some friendly service.
author: Nilu r.

description: I really wanted to hate this place, but the tacos are delicious, salsa and chips are divine. Easy and fast service if you get their early.
author: dk h.

description:
Service Meh.

I usually visit this place while in town and although I understand busy and mistakes I do not get the treatment of my tab this past weekend.

I give the bartender my card and start a tab, after we find a table(of 4pp) I tell the waitress I have a tab at the bar.. she proceeds to put food from a large group of people some of which I have never met and are not sitting with or speaking to on my tab. I'm told they asked her to(they deny this).. either way shouldn't she confirm that with me? 

The bartender says he has served us 6 shots, there are 5 on my tab yet I've only received 2?? 

A server brings my food to a friend and confirms with her that it's her vegetarian dish despite it being my fish. After she spits the raw fish back on the plate she explains the situation they send out another but charge me for both.. our waitress says "well someone ate it"

To be really fair I did like the Pescado Del Dia..
author: Anna S.

description:
I was pretty excited to try this place and went there with some out of town guests last night. 
Unfortunatley we were greeted with ridiculous attitude and rudeness from their hostess that had us turn on our heal faster than a revolving door would have us spun us out on the street.

They won't see me again in any of their locations.
author: john b.

description:
They were very accommodating with kids in tow, pulling tables and what looks to be old high school shop class stools.  Crayons are certainly not a prerequisite for dining choices with a 3 and 7 year old, but always a plus if offered.  

It's beautifully decorated and well laid out dining area.  Still looks to be somewhat a work in progess as we listened to drilling and hammering during the meal.  Perhaps this is why the music was on 11.  A bit distracting, but not a deal breaker.  

Service starts with chips and salsa, a definite prerequisite for a decent sit down Mexican establishment.  Salsa was very fresh and relatively mild.  A bit sweet though, most likely from roasting the vegetables before blending? 

We started with the chili con queso, Shrimp a la diabla, alboldingas and a pitcher of house margs. The cheese dip is what it is, a guilty pleasure of processed cheese tomatoes and peppers.  The meatballs were super tender cooked in a rich, savory tomato broth.  The shrimp were smaller than anticipated but very succulent with just enough heat.  Ritas were refreshing, not too sweet with that perfect sourness.

Then on to the tacos.  Four of us shared 10 tacos: (4) Rock cod, braised chicken, (2) carnitas, braised beef, chicken colorado and chicken suiza (wkly special).  I didn't try the carnitas, which is usually my litmus test for a Mexican joint. Everything else was great.  Really deep favors that are not always traditional, but have that comfort food familiarity.  Portions, by the way, are more than adequate.  The salsas served with the entrees are also notable.  A trio of mild avocado, chunky chipolte, and bright beatiful habanero.  I like it hot but sometimes a habanero salsa can be over the top.  Not this one, good heat with that nice tropical piquancy.

Bottom line, we'll be back for more when in the area.  Service was great, fun atmosphere and there are more tacos and margaritas to try!
author: Adam B.

description:
This review is like... 2 months late, but this review is because Tacolicious saved my NYE!

To be honest, I've never had any of their food, but awesome service and a salvaged NYE warrants a good rating!

Had a couple of friends who were adamant about "bar hopping" through the city on NYE. The boyfriend and I already knew that wasn't going to happen, but figured we'd humor them and tag along. Lo and behold, lines were long and tickets were sold out everywhere! Not to mention we were trying to find a place at 11:30pm and I wasn't about to go into a bar with a $35 cover charge for a measly hour. 

The friends passed up Tacolicious, but the bf and I recognized a gem on NYE.... a relatively unpacked bar with seating! Eventually persuaded said friends to "go in for a drink" and I proceeded to order a bottle of bubbly minutes before the countdown. Got our drinks on, counted to 10, celebrated the NYE in an awesome little restaurant bar with amazing service staff that was more than happy to ring in the new year with us. 

Our server. I forgot her name, but she's blonde and she's awesome. Thank you for finishing the bottle of bubbly with me!
author: Karen N.

description: Literally the perfect place for tacos. AWesome ambience. I was so happy and satisfied with evry single aspect of EVERYTHING here
author: Em L.

description: The salsa and chips are worth the trip. A nice place to grab a bite with friends if you're looking for posh atmosphere with a larger drink menu than the other 40+ taco places in the mission.
author: Theresa D.

description:
We slipped in to Tacolicious through the back door. The first thing that hits you is the smell. SO GOOD!!! 

We heard a lot of good things about the Bloody Marias. They were a little tangy and had a hint of stomach bile. Plus it gave us an immediate heart burn. But the tacos, the tacos were....they were solid. 

Velvet Hammer out.

(nailed it)
author: Velvet H.

description: I've been here like 20 times. They have a respectable Tequila menu. Chips and salsa are good. Bartenders are good. It's a SUPER BUSY place. Food is good but everything is ala carte. Fairly loud, music, people, etc. Mosto next door can also be good but I think the cocktails (while delicious) are mixed weak.
author: Will D.

description:
Pretty good tacos, decent prices for this strip of Valencia.

The greeters are clearly sick to death of entitled hipsters. I'm sure they are harried, but would nice if they tried to smile.
author: Mark P.

description: I mean how can I say no to gourmet tacos? The cocktails are delicious. I mean you can get great tacos for waaaay cheaper but it's the experience and the ingredients they use which makes it good. They have unlimited chips and salsa as well. The only taco I didn't like was the Nopales and I like Nopales. It is pricey but it is worth going to least once.
author: Yvonne O.

description:
A friend  and I accidentally ate here - we were going to the bar part but ended up in the restaurant. We were just going to have drinks but since we were seated in the restaurant we decided to order some food. 

So the good: Margaritas, they were killer. So good. 

The bad: Food - everything we had. We started out with the guacamole. Personally I am a big fan of the avocado. It looked good, but it was so salty - practically inedible. We didn't finish it and kept trying to mix it with salsa to cut the salt but it didn't help. I have never left guacamole on the table. I also went for it and ordered the plantains which were advertised as sweet plantain. I am pretty sure they don't know how to prepare or buy plantains because they were not sweet plantains. They were tough and they had actually put sugar on them. They were practically banana chips. We also ordered the fish ceviche, which was really pico de gallo with one or two small pieces of fish. 

The service was excellent however. We weren't going to complain but we didn't eat much and our server noticed so she asked and we gave her the details. She didn't charge us for a few of the food items which was really nice. 

I would definitely go back for a drink but would steer clear of the appetizers.
author: Alex T.

description:
What a great stop on the SF food crawl.

Wonderful, extensive tequila menu. A sippers fancy.

Salsa and chips just about my dream combo. Fresh, perfect consistency salsa with an intricate balance of flavors - possibly best salsa I've ever had. Not chunky, and not soupy. You know, perfect. Chips thin and crisp, and fresh.

Tacos looked great, but didn't get the chance to have any.

Tequila was terrific. Detailed - sometimes amusingly so - menu descriptions that really helped us choose some delicious sipping tequilas. Some peppery. Some sweeter. Really an educational experience that we enjoyed very much.
author: Eric B.

description: 10 pack and a michelada.  Ask for the fish taco served two ways - fried and grilled.  You know what I'm talking about.
author: Jim S.

description:
I've been here a few times but most recently last Wednesday. In general I've really enjoyed the tacos here and specifically I've been really impressed with the veggie tacos. I'm trying to eat more veggie stuff and it's sometimes it's tough to find a combination of delicious-ness with vegetarian. The other great taco was the carnitas, I felt like the short-rib and chicken were just OK. In the past the margaritas have been good but the last time were a bit on the sour side. Also forgot the other bonus of delicious fresh salsa at your table.

I would love this place more if; it weren't so busy all the time and things were a bit less pricy.
author: Ben R.

description:
Decided to try it out since all my friends are raving about it. I'm not really a fan of mexican food. I know I love in SF how can I not? My bf does tho! But, I think I like taco trucks better. Lol

What i ordered: 
My bf and I ordered 4 tacos for $18.75
-2 pacific cod: the batter gets very soggy if you wait too long to eat it. Wish it was grilled instead. 
-2 braised short rib: had a lot of flavor but it was too greasy.

The regular, mild, and spicy salsa were mediocre. The Salsa that was served with chips are better. The queso is pretty good too, but not worth $8.

I was hoping to order a jalapeno margarita but they didn't have it. I settled for the habanero margarita and it had a kick it to but I barely tasted any tequila.

Overall, I think it's pretty overhyped and overpriced. I   barely ate any food and I feel stuffed. I think the greasy braised short rib makes me feel sort of sick and tired. But I give it 3 stars for the service and everything was alright. Probably won't return since I don't really eat Mexican food. But I'm glad i tried it and I know I'm not missing anything.
author: Connie K.

description:
Amidst the bustle of Valencia street, a branch off a small chain of the ever growing Tacolicious stands steady. An evening with friends, we came in to the dark setting. The wait would be 30-45 minutes, she hostess said. Very laid back, with a smile, I could tell she had very good positive control of the flow of the restaurant that night. 
We went to the back, which is the bar. Red house wine served chilled in an 1/8 clear house wine glass. Much earlier than the ETA, we were seated.
The chips and salsa flow is never-ending. The Salsa is mild and has a quick kick to your buds. Very good. The short rib taco is good. The taco of the day was the bahn mi taco. good too. The guacamole was so thick and light. 
Service is fun. They're chill. Good hangout place.
author: Jacqueline L.

description:
Tacos and tequila? Yes and Yes! Love the side by side concept.

Was Tacolicious the best place I have ever had tacos? No. Cheap? No. Would I go again? Yes. 

If you want authentic and cheap there are plenty of places in the Mission. The tacos here are a "fancier" take on the traditional with their own spin and rotation of creations to choose from with a place with a good vibe and atmosphere.

Mind-blowing? No. Pretty damn good? Yes. And let's be honest...by the time you get your food you may have a bit of a buzz from the tequila tasting, margaritas or cervezas that you really don't care if they are the best you have ever had but you will be satisfied.
author: Keren R.

description: as you can imagine, that tacos are great! I also enjoy sitting outside when the weather is nice. Plus I can bring my dog when I sit outside which is a nice plus.
author: Adrian A.

description:
SO CONFLICTED because I want to give four stars.  But the host is making me change my mind...

I've been here abour 5x.  There are THREE tacos that are a stand out: barbacoa, fish, and nopales - for me.  As a person of Mexican decent (for what ever its worth) their  tacos are awesome.  I also LOVE their meatballs, which they call Albonigas.  They are not REAL Albonigas because real albonidgas a part of a soup - nonetheless my favorite item on the menu. The availability of tequila and mezcal is why i appreciate Tacolicious.   I LOVE Mezcal (and from experience know that their the mark up is a bit ridiculous). Nonetheless, I dig the vibe and eating options.  During our last visit, our server was awesome!  HOWEVER..the  host needs an attitude adjustment.  Just because the sacred Mission has turned into a the place to be, doesn't mean you should treat potential customers like SHIT.  Not cute.  No bueno cabrona.  I won't go into details other than to say that if I can objectively appreciate the food and drink here, I can have an honest opinion about their welcome - which SUCKED.  She was a bitch.  Her seating process was clearly subjective.  Not Cool.  Fix it...please.
author: Adrian N.

description:
I really wanted to like this place. That being said, I didn't. 

I'm getting a little overwhelmed with all these Nuevo Mexican restaurants that are trying to be "hipster" so to fit into the new Valencia scene. It's like you are the new kid at school so you dress up extra fancy, grab whatever "cool" accessories you can find and pile it on so people will like you. Be real. Be authentic. That compliments anything. Just because you put cotija on everything doesn't make it Mexican or good.

Overpriced? check. Hipster decor? check. Cool tattooed, pierced wait staff? check. Extensive drink menu? check. Okay so you have all that, but the food was boring and bland in my opinion. If I have to sit next to a sea of neon tight pants, fedora hats, bohemian bags, scarf wraps and ray-bans...then please feed me something good!

The "patio" is a long hallway outside with tables and no shade so beware. It was cute but definitely needed an awning of some sort. We ordered off the appetizer menu and shared the ribs (way too much sauce that was extremely salty) beet salad (okay but nothing special), ceviche (bland), and nopales (good - would recommend)...Oh and of course margaritas. We left full, but not satisfied.

Since the bar looked nice and the drink menu was so long it got it's own page, I would recommend as a cool spot for drinks.
author: Jocelyn J.

description:
I know that this is a "chain" restaurant because there is more than three of them but God Damn do they do a bang up job!  Lovely drinks and always excellent service match the fresh and delightful food.  The carnitas might be the best in the city -- it's up there.  Clean, friendly and definitely not your typical taqueria.

I usually go during lunch and do find myself wishing they had some lunch specials / prices -- it would make it a five star.  As is, I'm signing off with four stars.  Plus, they often show international soccer matches at the bar with their ONE television (I bold ONE television because there was some unwritten law in the past two years that said every restaurant had to have enormous televisions all over the place - weird right - and I respect that this television is tactfully placed and unobtrusive).  

Well done Tacolicious!
author: Anthony V.

description: Ok... 5 for food. 2 for service. They place is super popular (because the food is really tasty and not overpriced), but it is notoriously understaffed. So, if you're up for a night out and hanging out with nowhere to go, this is a great place for you. You may wait for 40 min for a table on a Wednesday, and then another 20 minutes before your drink comes. Having said that, the salsa is completely delicious. The tacos are reliably scrumptious, and they have great variety tacos on the menu. It's a big and noisy place so pretty fun, but maybe not good for an intimate date.
author: Fran B.

description:
These tacos are super legit but they are way overpriced... I know it is San Francisco but a part of me dies when I look at the menu. 

Tacos should never be this expensive. 

However - the tequila and mezcal menu is off the charts worth it. I described a mezcal I tried in a back alley of Oaxaca years ago (home brewed) to the bartender and he gave me something sooooo similar and delicious. 

If the tacos were a practical price I'd add another star or two.
author: Alex W.

description:
I heard good things about this place so I wanted to try it even though the idea of a high-end taco place in the Mission killed me. Well, not surprisingly, the tacos here are pretty average and 2-3X the price of a street taco from any other Mission taqueria.

If you love authentic street tacos like at Taqueria Vallarta, then DON'T EAT HERE. If you are a yuppy hipster who loves crappy tacos like at Taqueria Cancun and you are  too scared to mix it up with the non-hipster Mission locals, then this place is for you.
author: Alex P.

description:
The bar was cool, def for peeps that want to make the scene, but...

There was nothing "licious" about the taco platter we ordered. STRAIGHT UP BLAND.

If I'm going to grab some delicious Mex in the Mission, I'll stick to Papalote instead.
author: M. A.

description: Tacolicious is truly may favorite restaurant in the Mission District, if not all of San Francisco.  I can smell the absolutely delicious food just thinking about it!  The Carnitas have the best slow-cooked pulled pork and the spices used are on point. You absolutely MUST try the butternut squash tacos!  The dipping sauces are unique and delicious.  What initially brought me to Tacolicious were the artisan drinks they make with south of the border flare.  My personal favorites are the Sangria Roja and the El Sangre.  I love the quaint yet super bustling atmosphere.  The wait staff treat you like family and they do not miss one detail.  Your trip to the Mission District is not complete until you have enjoyed the cuisine and artisan drinks at Tacolicious!
author: Timothy W.

description: I have never written a bad review. Never reslly felt a need. Just now i had one of the most disappointing experiences in a restaurant in the city. The people behind me and my mom in line were seated first.  I watched as people that were seated after us were tended to with water and chips while had not even been offered that. I sat on my hands, done perusing the menu. Waited 10 more minutes before our server sauntered over.
author: Jason D.

description: It's like that fish taco was made by Jesus himself...
author: David S.

description:
Always so amazing!!! 

The Tacos: Cod, "Special of the week/day" Chicken, and the Chorizo one.

The drinks: Margarita Fresca, Paloma, Tickle me Telmo. 

If you're getting the Pasion drink, be prepared for it to be REALLY spicy!!! 

I 've been to both locations and both are just amazing!!
author: Ezequiel R.

description:
Just so all of you know... Do NOT order the pitchers of cocktails! They do not use the same liquor as listed on the menu & they use bottom shelf liquor! We just complained & management says "that's how it is". I'm sorry but when I order off what's listed on the menu... That's what I expect to get!!!

And then that all makes you wonder about the food they serve?! The chile con queso... taste like it was out of a jar.
author: C H.

description:
Me= Mexican food snob. Now that thats out of the way on to Tacolicious.

If you can get past $4.95 street tacos, yoga pants and tennis rackets EVERYWHERE and sitting on a short stool (like the ones you had in kindergarten) Tacolicious is actually a pretty decent place to get a gentrified taco. They are actually pretty good. Really.

I am one of those people who is generally very rough on these kind of places. A little hipster (more like Gen Xers who are clinging to cool, read: me), expensive, not a Latino in sight (except for behind the grill, thank god). However I do have to say I like the tacos and even ordered a kale salad (Yes I know, hypocrite). I liked that damn salad so much I looked up the recipe online and made it for my Super Bowl party (yes, I know I am that guy).

Why the 4 stars you ask? The only thing I can say in the not so positive about this place is 2 fold: The cocktails on the Tacolicious bar side are lacking, sweet or too tart (Mosto next door, totally different story) AND the absolute STANK of their fried fish tacos. So stanky that I actually moved tables once because the person next to me had one and I thought I was going to vomit. So I moved. Fresh fish tacos should have ZERO stank PERIOD.

Other than that I have found myself here on many a lunch hour at eating a taco or two at the bar and shelling out 20 bucks for some tacos and a beer, because yes they are Tacolicious.
author: dude m.

description:
This place is a very casual type of venue and all the tables were high up with bar stools for seating.

The tacos we tried were all delicious with my favorite being the potato and chorizo.  We also had the braised pork which was the special of the day, the beer/shot chicken, braised short rib, and something else but I forgot what. All tacos were good and meats were flavorful.

The chips were good too and I loved the mint in their salsa.

The fried plantains were tasty but nothing special. A little on the mushier side.

I also really enjoyed the salsa trio they gave us with their tacos.

I think I definitely want to come here with a bigger group of friends next timefor some drinks/chips/ and more tacoes!
author: Em F.

description:
Good tacos. I had the carnitas and the rock cod. My complaint with the cod was that the fish was so big I could hardly fit it in my tortilla.  I know what you are thinking...there are certainly worse problems to have than having too MUCH food. I hear ya. Concurred.  Hence the 4 stars.

And I love the fact that the complimentary chips and salsa are not throw-aways. In fact, I wanted to drink the salsa.  Possibly the best I've ever had--yes, better than Papalote's.
author: Emille L.

description:
Oh that's some good lovin'. The tacos are rocking... one cod, and one carnitas was brilliant. The 3 salsa they give you for the tacos are perfect. I'm partial to the one that is like a salsa verde with some avocado tecture (just like Farolitas makes!!!), but the habanero is really good too... all the flavor without too much spice.

Worth the 45 minute wait... be prepared for that and you'll be good.
author: Tomes G.

description:
I am so glad I got to try this place out.  
We arrived around 7:30 on a Saturday and there was a 1-2 hour wait, but we stalked some people at the bar and got to sit about 30 minutes later.  This place is busy for a reason...it's really good!
We tried a couple of different margaritas and both were prepared well, not too sweet and not overpowered with tequila.
For dinner, we had the appetizer queso (yum) and a combo of tacos (chorizo, chicken, cod, carnitas).  The chicken was my top choice, but all were tasty.  The 3 different hot sauces that come with the meal are all, for the most part, pretty mild.  If you want something super spicy, you'll probably have to ask for it.
Give this place a try, but don't expect to get a table quickly on a busy Friday or Saturday night.
author: Lynn T.

description:
I was initially weirded out by this place. I was expecting a corporate-hipster defamation of the classic Mission taqueria. Well, that turned out to be 100% true  - but bottom line, the tacos and salsas here are excellent. So, kudos.

Don't be lured in by the short rib tacos. They sound good on paper, but in practice they don't have the crispy fattiness that you actually like about short ribs. That was the only bummer on the menu.

The fish and chicken tacos were my favorites. And the salsas were also fantastic (it's worth repeating).
author: Munaf A.

description:
My cousin was visiting from Salt Lake City this week and a friend of his had told him to go to Tacolicious.  I'm new here from NYC and always on the hunt for good restaurants so I was game. 

 When we arrived at prime time on a Wednesday night we were told the wait was at least an hour.  However, the incredibly friendly and lovely hostess Grace encouraged us to go next door to their bar/taqueria to have a couple cocktails and she said she'd see what she could do to expedite our wait for a table.  Though crowded we found a table in the bar.  I wasn't sure if it there was a wait service or just bar service and I asked a gal who looked like she could be a waiter if there was table service.  Though lovely on the eyes her demeanor was sullen and disdainful bordering on  rude.  We quickly found two stools at the bar as to avoid her, we wanted to have a fun night.  She was the only blight on an otherwise stellar experience.  Bartenders Danny and Harrison made great cocktails and happily obliged us with what must be the most obnoxious question they get asked by patrons these days, "will you take a picture of us?"    We enjoyed a couple of cocktails and al pastor tacos (with pineapple which is what I'm used to from my joint in East Harlem) and before we knew it (maybe 30 minutes) Grace came and told us our table was ready!  More fantastic service from the lovely Nena.  She gave us great recommendations and didn't try to sell us on the most expensive items on the menu. 

 The food was super tasty, Grace, Nena, Danny and Harrison were welcoming and the epitome of excellent service.  The only reason for four, not five stars, was the surly waitress at the bar.  We will definitely be coming back the next time my cousin comes to town!
author: Lesli B.

description: Be VERY careful if you engage with these people on private events-- or you might end up with a surprise open bar and $4500 tab. Shady.
author: Aaron S.

description: What a nice surprise!  Walking down the street in the Mission and you find an trendy, organic taco joint!  More than just early good tacos... They have some unque drink selections as well!  Mix it up and choose 4 different tacos....  I enjoyed the crowd, the service was good... And the space was open and felt "hip"...
author: Patrick B.

description:
My friends wanted some gooood food and I went to be social keep them company.  I am trying to lose weight and this is where the trouble started. . .
  Our waitress Brandy, whose beauty is intoxicating but not as intoxicating as the things she brought to the table.  The salsa brought with the chips is so delicious with its mixture of mint an cilantro.  In addition, the consistency is such that a hefty amount is held by the chips.  Our table quickly dispatched the chips and salsa and I thought if I did not eat anymore my calorie intake would be saved, but Brandy, that intoxicant kept replenishing the chips and salsa and this started our doom.
  Along with generously giving us chips, she brought this cheesy concoction that was NOT organic NOR made with sustainably raised materials.
  Lastly, she kept replenishing these magenta prickly pair margaritas which lead to ingesting even more aforementioned salsa and chips.

  Do not be fooled but Brandy's sweet attentiveness -- she is a black widow to dieters. . . If you are looking to lose weight, this is the WRONG place and you will be left with the need to raise your Fitbit goal.  MAJOR FAIL!!
author: Richard H.

description:
Waited 45 minutes for a table after being told we were next on the list" for a four top. Then watched the hostess sit a group of four that had only been there for 10 minutes. Left annoyed. 

Food is good, but front end needs to get organized.
author: Matt H.

description:
I trekked over here during a long enough break in my conference activities that I could justify trekking over to the Mission for food, bringing some colleagues along.  Good stuff!

We had no wait and a corner table/bench-booth. Our tacos were more-or-less as I had expected, and service was reasonably timely. My vegetable taco was a little bitter, but I think intentionally so. If I were in the area again, I'd definitely be willing to give Tacolicious a second whirl.
author: Bria D.

description:
This place has one of the best tacos around. I have always wanted to go but since I can never get around to going out to the Marina, I had never tried them.  I am glad that they finally opened a place in the Mission.  If you want great tacos, try them, however if you don't like to wait, then I would recommend going during the week between 2-4PM before people get out of work and after the lunch rush. 

Chicken Mole Tacos are great, Carnitas are always juicy, and the Bistec is the best (in my opinion) although my partner thinks the Chicken Mole are better.  If you are around the Mission late at night, I believe they are open pretty late so give them a try, you will not regret it.
author: Mario I.

description:
We tried this place out to pre-game NYE. Brief wait while drinking fabulous margarita concoctions, super friendly service. Our table ordered the ceviche which I felt lacked in flavor compared to other ceviches I've had. We also had carnitas, short rib, fish and chicken tacos. All good, nothing spectacular, again lacking a little in flavor and just not memorable.  My favorite dish of the night were my Brussels sprouts! Lightly grilled in lemon juice, they were outstanding. 

Basically nice clean place, great service, and solid food but don't expect to be blown away
author: Abby S.

description:
Hi, my name is Flor and I am a taco addict. First step is to admit it right?
Tacolicious is so deli...I won't say it.  It's muy delisioso.

Parking is tough, but it's the mission.  
The space is urban chic meets industrial hip. 
Food was exotic, but unpretentious.  
By exotic, I mean different and non standard.  Where are you going to find stuff like butternut squash, peppers, swiss chard, nopales, spicy pepitas?

My girlfriend had her birthday party here and we were seated in the backroom. We sampled:

appetizers:
guacamole-made to order, fresh, and addicting.
chips with salsa-you can't just eat 1, try if you will. 
chili con queso-ummm, yeah it's cheese folks. 
albacore tuna tostadas-the crispy leeks, mayo, and tuna were a refreshing touch.

2 tortilla tacos:
carnitas
beef short rib
beer braised chicken
carne asada
Even the next day, they were good.  Street food done right, even if it's not your run of the mill taco shop.  

Flavorful, lick your fingers good.  I suggest you go here.  Oh yeah, I didn't even get to the tequila menu, but I guess I'll save you the trouble of more reading and tell you it's extensive.  Order booze, get a cab.
author: Flor D.

description:
This place is way pricey considering the considerable Mexican food competition in the area but there is plenty of tasty meat in their tacos. There's also a full bar which is a rarity alongside the enjoyment of tacos in the area.

Their wine specialties have been a bit disappointing, however.
author: Pierre B.

description:
I love a good taco. You know what I love more? A platter of tacos and a pitcher of sangria. 

Tacolicious stands out as somewhere fancy you want to hang out in the Mission. There. I said it. I want my tacos without a side of food-born illness fears. 

We had a platter of tacos including the seasonal veggies (delish) and cod (reportedly good), chicken (very messy looking). The star in my min was the guacamole. Although a little pricey, it was super flavorful and a perfect addition to the free chips and salsa. 

The service was also exceptional from the minute we walked in the door. We'll definitely be back to try the tacos we missed and the salads! They looked amazing.
author: Gretchen S.

description: Very crowded place but the food was worth the crowdedness. the GUACAMOLE WAS AMAZING and the drinks were a bit pricey but strong and tasty. My girlfriend and I over-ordered because we wanted to try all the tacos we thought sounded good. Really pricey but again, it's worth it.
author: Ashley D.

description: Expensive, expensive, long wait, and average food. There are plenty of places to have amazing tacos for half the price in half the time--or less.
author: adam b.

description:
I look at Tacolicious through the lens of Mission gentrification, and preference for the more "trying" or "exotic" palettes that Valencia St. can offer. Tacolicious is not one of them.

The name itself may be as repulsive as the crowd - is it just I who is sick of start-up tech dweebs munching loudly on overpriced tacos? Graceless waitresses who neglect to ask me if I'd like another margarita? I'd rather my tongue be delicately tickled by something else than your "picante" margarita, miss.

Never again will I fall victim to such petty ploys.
author: Peter H.

description:
Yes, I've had better. Way better, and definitely way cheaper. 

One pitcher of margarita was about $30. And it was mostly ice. Guacamole, salsa and chips were delicious, the cheviche tostadas were meh, and the tacos were not something to write home about. 

Overall, the experience was lacking. I really wanted to like this place! Oh well.
author: Ezekiel G.

description: I hate the fact that I like this place. I'm more of a cheap street taco stand, hole in the wall taqueria, no frills pozole from a mom and pop shop type of gal when it comes to mexican food. This place is what is becoming the typical hipster mission restaurant norm, with lots of "elevated" overpriced dishes and fancy lighting. It kills me to say this because I truly do feel loyal to all the long time family owned local mexican places, but yes, Tacolicious has delicious food. I love love love their watermelon salad and fish tacos. Their tacos are pretty filling -- try a few different types and share with friends! Again, it hurts me to say this, but this Marina transplant makes delicious food!
author: Michelle K.

description:
First time at Tacolicious last night. Bottom line: TRY IT! Don't let the "working really hard to over-hipsterfy everything like every other place in the Mission" vibe put you off if you usually hate that stuff -- it was tasty, fun, and excellently priced!

Now, on to the details:

Being an admirer of simple and endearing graphic design, I was initially pleased to see the adorable orange sign outside announcing Tacolicious with a taco icon in lieu of any actual text. I must say that given that I was navigating by street directions rather than an actual address, this initially caused me to pause and verify that I was indeed at the right spot, but my instincts proved to be right as this was in fact the elusive Tacolicious.

Despite being initially impressed by the aforementioned endearing graphic design, I was subsequently quickly put off from this otherwise promising place by the hostess's unfortunate response of "a little over an hour" to my inquiry of how long the wait would be for a table for three. The questions and skepticism very rapidly crept into my mind and swiftly became disgust. More than an hour? For three people? On a Monday night??? You have got to be kidding me. There's not even any line outside! Now I remember why I hate the Mission! ...

Fortunately, despite my instinctual impulse to pull an immediate 180 and find another place for dinner because of my long list of previous experiences with restaurants that were COMPLETELY overrated once you took into account the more-than-an-hour wait, I was able to stop the runaway train of "WTF!!?!" going on in my head for long enough to at least politely agree to put my name on the list and wait in the adjacent bar (which I would soon learn to be Musto) in the meanwhile.

While waiting in the bar, we decided to order a couple of appetizers from the bar menu to tide us over. Yum! We got three different things. I don't remember exactly what each of them were named. But all you need to know is that they were a) FAST, b) well-presented, c) tasty, and d) AT MOST, $3 each! In fact, I think that one was like $1.50. A dollar-fifty! You have got to be kidding me!

Fast forward, friends arrive (turns out we actually have a party of five people instead of three), seating time ends up being shortened considerably for both the initial party of three and the actual party of five (ends up being maybe a half-hour at most), we sit down, talk about how excited we are to get some grub, and order some food!

First round: queso (yum!), guac (yum!). I also really liked the salsa -- lots of tasty mint in there that gives it a great, distinctive flavor. Next round: tacos! We ordered a batch of ten, with each of the five of us choosing two from their selection of ten different types. I got the braised short rib (yum!) and another meatasaurus one I don't remember the name of (also yum!).

Fast forward, we have a great time, server is fun, attentive, and friendly. Food was excellent, prices were fantastic, and the overall bill was a very pleasant surprise to all of us. Tacolicious, well done, I will be back!

Pros:
* Tasty food
* Cheap prices
* Stylish digs
* Wait not nearly as long as initially estimated
* Adjacent to a tequila bar (you don't even have to step outside since the places are, like Stereo MCs, connected)

Cons:
* No text on the sign outside
* Probably risky if an earthquake of any magnitude hits while you're in the Mosto section, since the ceiling of that place is lined with small glass jars glued or epoxied to it, which certainly makes the place look cool, but is probably a death trap (but then again, I guess that describes a lot of the decor in the Mission)

(Hopefully you note the sarcasm in these cons and realize that Tacolicious is a great place and that you should go there, like, soon!)

Thanks, Tacolicious!
author: Alison N.

description: A colleague told me to visit this place. What a great experience. All the staff were great. Ambiance? Fun! The food to die for. Then my ultimate test? The restrooms. Guess what? Immaculate. I can't say enough about this place. And I've shared my story w LOTS of people. Bravo.
author: Eric K.

description: This place is just steps away from our house, so luckily we can walk over and put our name in and go home (since the wait is an insane 40-60min anywhere near dinner times) and then come back and wait just 5-10min more.  It's a bit of a pain, but worth it since the tacos are usually big enough to split each into two and the fillings are high quality.  There's no better deal in the mission than the 10 tacos for $30 here.  It's a bit on the loud side in here, but a little quieter if you can get the back room or a seat on the side outdoor patio where there's heat lamps.  We go here all the time and will continue to.
author: Aaron W.

description: Great food and drinks. Always super crowded so I recommend reservations. The menu is hilarious! Funny descriptions about all of the food and drinks. Definitely give the taco combination a try- I had carne asada and it was soooooo good.
author: Marina D.

description:
The food here was amazing, the salsa is GREAT, extremely flavorful and unique.  I had the chicken enchiladas, again great flavor.  The reason they get one star, if the food is so fantastic?  There was a COCKROACH on the wall.  It was completely disgusting.  But seriously, the food was so good that we still managed to enjoy our meal with it running around on the wall behind my friends.  

Also, I'm sure the health department has approved it, but it seemed a little weird to have the bathroom located IN the kitchen.
author: LD C.

description:
Yes the tacos are good. Yes the environment is 'cool.' But the wait is too damn long. I went here with a group of four and we had to wait almost two hours for a table, 40 minutes longer than what the maître d' originally said.

When we got our tacos I was more than pleased by some and underwhelmed by others. The mole tacos were awesome but the carnitas taco was too salty and too chewy. The drink I order, recommended by the waitress, wasn't very good and overall everything was just too pricey... for Mexican food... in the Mission. 

I might go back for one or two tacos but probably on a Monday night, at 5 pm, when I have the whole place to myself.
author: Eduardo R.

description:
I had the pleasure of going to Tacolicious this weekend and I was pretty good. 
I had the chicken mole and the braised beef tacos. 

The only bad thing of the meal was the lackluster mole taco,  it seems like it was prepared for a convalescent home being bland, mushy, and dull.  The enchilada that my friend had seem like it was prepared by the same chef for the same people. 

The braised beef was really good. It was tender and had several layers of flavor, smoky, sweet, and spicy. 

The nopal chupitos was delicate, but refreshing with hints of pear and citrus.

The highlight of the meal, I got to admit, it was the cheese sauce... I'll take shots of it with a back of guacamole, please! 

I'll definitively come back for more! 

Follow me at Twitter: AngelaLRomero
author: Angela R.

description:
Don't order the tuna tostada. 

 I want all of them available to me at all times. As I sit here typing, thinking about the crunchy tortilla with fresh albacore tuna, chipotle mayo and crispy leeks, I am worried that I will never be as excited about anything as I am about this incredible palm-sized concoction of everything that is good.

So please, don't order it. If I ever walk into Tacolicious and they are out of this item, my next Yelp review will be for local anger management facilities.
author: Abby M.

description:
third time I went to tacolicious and was told that the wait is over an hour.
I heard good things but wasn't able to try it...
author: Adam N.

description:
I've attempted to love Tacolicious a few times now, and with my apologies, I guess I just don't get this place.  All my friends seem to love Tacolicious, and yet I felt the tacos were kind of boring -- especially compared to the fresh, inexpensive, diverse, authentic Mexican food that can be found throughout the Mission.  I'm not sure what role expensive, Americanized tacos can play in the Mission eatery ecosystem.  So why bother?

The best thing I have to say about this place is that the tequila selection is outstanding -- though the neighborhood has no shortage of great bars, either.
author: jonathan m.

description:
Ok, taqueria aficionados, don't berate me, but these are pretty much the best tacos I've ever eaten.  Are they affordable?  Not if you want to eat ten.  That will set you back $31.00.  

But I had every version of taco they offered and every single one was outstanding.  The carnitas made my head spin...either that, or it was the excruciatingly loud music and the ridiculous number of people talking at the same time.  This place is not hurting for business.  

Make sure you're fairly young or young at heart when attempting to melt into the hip-ish crowds here.  You will surely feel like the frumpiest ragamuffinville country bumpkin on this side of the equator if you are like me, a sleep-deprived mother of two who thinks she has clean clothes on, but isn't really sure.  

But I'm more than willing to walk into this cooler-than-me place for these delicious tacos.  Stare at me all you want, beautiful people.  Yes, that's a cheerio stuck to my cheek.  I smell like spit-up and lost youth?  Extra salsa, please!

When I return home, the kids are asleep while my husband and I go feral and hunch over the table.  The conversation goes a little something like this:

HUB: Oh my God, these Tacolicious tacos are so good they're making me ugly-eat. 

ME: Math question...there are ten Tacolicious tacos. Now there is only one. How many did I eat? The answer is SHUT UP DON'T JUDGE ME.

Oh, and don't go here on a date...if you want a second date.
author: Kristina R.

description:
When the Matrix had salsa nights, this is THE place to get some food after a few hours of dancing. Great staff and wonderful tasting tacos at decent prices. Granted, they're not taco truck prices but what taco truck has "shot and a beer chicken" tacos? 

Get the braised short rib tacos and finish it with a corona. Haven't tried the desserts yet, but I will next time. Both locations in the Marina and the Mission are both awesome.
author: Roth E.

description:
Great restaurant that delivers a delightful experience for a  good value.

The drinks are amazing - try the margarita and paloma.
Tacos always filled with flavor
Atmosphere - energetic, good music, trendy, but not too trendy
Staff - super friendly, down to earth

A great mexican restaurant
author: Jeffrey E.

description: I really liked this place! It was pricey, but the food was delicious and the bartenders give great service!
author: Cat M.

description:
It's OK. I like social with food, so this is a good place to see and be seen by 'young professionals" slumming it in the Mission. The service was friendly, we got our food fast (though admittedly we didn't order anything complex). 
But the wait was long, limited veggie options, salsa was OK, prices were kinda high for what we got.
Try the chupitos though... Those shooters pack a punch.
Will I be back? Maybe, when I feel like getting Mexican food with a social scene.
author: What's in a nam e.

description: Used tacolicious for catering a friend's surprise birthday.  Food was great and service was even better.  They showed up early, helped us set up the taco bar and made sure we had everything we needed.  Was even surprised by how much the non-vegetarians loved the vegetarian option.  What I'd suggest is if you cater, get the vegetarian tacos as separate on the side so there's enough to add to the tacos the non-vegetarian folks make with the meat.  Big hit!
author: Vijay N.

description: Pretty darn good for tacos......will come back.  I had the carnitas and beef ribs tacos and they were delicious.... it's a busy joint so plan on a wait.
author: Blake J.

description: Love this place; it's pretty consistent whether you're at the Mission or Marina location. Kale salad is excellent. Service is great. Grilled squid is spicy but tasty. Every type of taco is delicious and they have  a nice variety of cocktails.
author: Xteethx B.

description: Mmm really yummy tacos and chips/salsa.
author: Jen B.

description:
The food was OK, but I've eaten better tacos elsewhere. It was not possible talking to each other due to the high noise level, therefor we asked to be seated outside instead of inside. The waitress was not really helpful and we felt neglected when we saw several tables get cleared outside and new guests take the places while she was lying saing there were no places available (it's not possible to book a table either so the tables couldn't been reserved). Also it took a long time to get any service.
A restaurant really not worth its good reputation, I'm really disappointed...
author: Julia S.

description:
Reviews and others write about the great beef short rib taco and bistec tacos. I came here for a corporate event and had the entire back room to ourselves. The plain carnitas, pollo and veggie tacos we tried were to be honest, boring and definitely not worth $3.50 each or so.

The drinks on the other hand were great. I went with $12 for 4 large shots of passion fruit habanero tequila and it was AMAZING! If i'm back in the Mission area, I'll be back for that drink most definitely. Spicy tequila with fresh fruit, oh my.

I'll give the fancier tacos another chance too.
author: Chuck N.

description:
My (4th?) review of T-Lish and this place is still the family go-to. 
They brought back beef (adding pork) to the albondigas, which was a huge improvement over the pavo, which wasn't bad, but this was REALLY good. One of the good things is that they treat kids great. The food comes out ahead of the adults' food and they politely ask before serving the complimentary ice cream.  My daughter lives the carnitas tacos, and for good reason. 
AND...reasonably priced and excellent micheladas. 
Love this place.
author: Jubilee D.

description: Tried Tacolicious for lunch the other day.  We sat outside on the side patio and loved it.  I love how it's not on the street where strangers and homeless can bother us, but on the side of the building where we can still sit outside and have the experience.  We tried the albondigas and they were really good.  I definitely recommend getting those.  The tacos, however, were underwhelming.  I had the "Taco of the week" and some pulled pork thing.  They weren't bad, but they lacked the spice and flavor the menu implied.  I forget the drink names we ordered, but we enjoyed them and would order them again.  I like the ambiance and general design and style of the place.  I did think the prices were a bit on the high side.  I think our bill was like $60+ for an appetizer, 2 drinks, and 4 tacos.  That's quite a bit.  I'd go back, but not sure if I'd seek it out on my own.  If friends were dead set on going, then sure I'd go.
author: Shaun W.

description: I was around the mission yesterday and was trying to find a New Mexican place to eat at. So I yelped to see what was around and TACOLICIOUS popped up. I saw the reviews and decided to give it a try. I already knew this place was not going to be authentic buttt I heard good things about it so decided to go with that. I first walked in and you can see that there was no seating and there would be a bit of a wait. So the lady in front took my name down and said it would be at least a 15-20 min wait for 2. Ok that didn't sound too bad so we waited. literately as we walked in there was a massive of people who came storming in right after us. It was crazy because all of a sudden it got super busy. Anyway we were still waiting and I got a little impatient as I saw the group of 18 get seated. how the hell did they get seated and we got here way before they did. But oh well. Still waiting. so I had my girlfriend go ask how long the wait was going to be for a seat. She said another 15-20 min. Girrrrl you said that the first time. So we have been waiting for at least 30-40 min now. That's why I am giving this place 4 stars for the wait. I understand this place is popular and they have so many people to cater to but if there is a list that you put me on GO BY THAT LIST. Mind you this was at night time around 7-8pm. anyway we finally got seated outside. The waiter brought some chips and salsa out. OMG that salsa and chips was on point. The salsa tasted so fresh and so good. you can tell it was house made. Not spicy at all but had a hint of right zest. I love cilantro and you can taste the extractions of cilantros in the salsa. Mmmm we ordered the beef short rib taco and traditional carnitas tacos. 4 for $16. A little pricey but worth every taste for what it was. So much flavor in the meat. I liked the fact that when the tacos were brought out there was 3 types of salsas that came with it as well. Mild guac, medium, and habanero. I love choices and condiments. That's a plus everytime I have choices. We also had the queso cheese dip. that was also very delicious. Very creamy and thick full of peppers and veggies mixed in. Could not finish it since there was only two and it came in a bowl. We also ordered a pitcher of SANGRIA. $30 for a pitcher which will be 4 cups in total. one cup of sangria is about 9.50. So your at least getting one sangria free by ordering the pitcher that is if you will drink two cups each. At first I wasn't so sure how to feel about the sangria. I thought it was ok at first but the more I drank it I actually realllllly liked it. No that's not the alcohol just kicking it. It was actually this taste I didn't realize it had until a few sips later. it has a tad bit pico de gallo chili mixed in with a tiny hint of sweet but of course the wine was still there to overpower. Chili and sweet is something I am all for. Finished both glasses. I can't forget about our waitress. I loved her customer service. She was very attentive and came around when she needed to. I can tell by her body language that she was trying to check up on us but not interrupt our conversation we were having. I liked that because that shows she was being courteous as well in a shuttle way. anyway, I liked her patience in packing the left overs we had. I not only asked her once but twice to do it since we weren't done with our queso. but she seemed gladly to do it and came back with extra chips. I feel like that's how customer service should be. I had a good experience and I would reccomend this place to anyone only if you have time to wait a little.
author: Myphan L.

description:
Consistently some of the best tacos I've had in all of SF.
