We came with a big group a few of days before NYE so it was not crowded and there was only a 10 min wait. We sat in the back room which was really spacious and had cool prints of kitch mexican food on the walls.

Drinks: 
"Margarita de la casa" is made with fresh lime juice and agave nectar (really good!). My friends ordered glass after glass of the Sangria which they loved. My husband got the Tequila "flight of the month" and was really impressed. (he liked 2 of them so much he had the waitperson write their names down).

Food we loved: 
+ tuna tosadas
+ tacos: butternut squash + veg
+ tacos: beer braised chicken

(chips, salsa and guac was also good)

Everything was really fresh and flavorful. Wish I had room to try other types of their tacos - I think I ate too many chips!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
So glad that they opened a new location closer than the original one that's in Marina. 
The tacos is always delicious and the line was bearable when we came here last week. We were seated right away! The only complaint I have is that some tables are very awkwardly situated that one of the chairs is literally in the walkway into the Mosto, so you are constantly hovered over by annoyed customers who cannot get a table and instead go to a bar to drink and wait.

We got 5 tacos - short ribs, 2 cod tacos, buck and beer taco, and the monthly special chicken taco. All the tacos were good, but the cods ones were definitely the best.
author: Karina A.

description:
A true taco establishment must be judged by the quality of its fish taco, which is the food of the chosen ones.

Tacolicious delivers a fine offering here--just the right amount of cabbage and fish that was neither overpowering nor lacking in taste.

The carnitas tacos were excellent also, as was the buffalo chicken choice.
author: Jack K.

description:
OK, I'll let you all in on a little secret. If you don't want to wait forever for a table, just make sure 1) it's a chilly night 2) you're dressed warmly 3) you say you don't mind sitting outside. Instant gratification! Seriously though. The boyfriend and I didn't need to wait long using this method, the service is just as good and friendly outside and you can actually hear yourself think and your companion talk. Win win!
Now on to the food. It's fantastic. But that's a given. It's right in their name. All they sell are tacos.....and they're delicious. Ta da!
author: Allie F.

description:
I like the fact that this place has a cute little patio and an extensive tequila and mescal menu.  Now, onto the food: the tacos are tiny but tasty so I recommend ordering 10!  The chips and salsa were yummy too...the salsa had a lime tang to it.  Service was pretty bad, they brought my drink after I already got my food and I waited days for the check.  The salads and other dishes people were ordering looked really yummy though.
I would come back here on a weekend for margies and chillax.
author: anne m.

description: I used Tacolovious' catering services for my big company party. They arrived early, were super on top of things (caterers can be stressful, these guys were not!), had the food ready perfectly on time and made my event great. The food was delicious and all of my guests left happy. I left even happier because I had leftovers. Thanks!
author: Ashley E.

description: I am a newbie when it comes to Mexican but among all the taco places I've tried in the Bay area, this is by far the best. Their canitas taco was fantastic but my favourite was the Albacore Tuna Tostada - The tuna was so fresh and just right amount of sauce on crunchy tacos. It was OMG good! Highly recommended. Sit at the bar to maximise your experience and to avoid the queue. Bartenders will provide excellent recommendations as well!
author: Bomin K.

description:
Just average.

Food's ok. Drinks are meh. Service is friendly, but they try to churn as many tables as possible. 

If you are a larger group you can book the back room, but the fixed price will be on par with much nicer restaurants. 

Some people love it. I think it's over hyped. For the money there are much better options just down the street.
author: Eric S.

description: Consistently delicious!! Nothing beats the short rib tacos in my opinion but it's always nice to try other seasonal tacos. Tonight was special because, for the first time, I actually had room for dessert. Don't even think about it - go for the Pan con Chocolate!! Perfect ending with a savory twist. One of the few places in willing to wait to get in and eat.
author: Stephen S.

description: Overpriced and pretentious just like most of the eateries in the new mission. Head east of mssion and grab some great authentic tacos, I think even more flavorful then this, for only $2. Also get a bit more of the rich culture that was the old mission
author: Joumana J.

description: This place has very good drinks and decent Mexican food. Unfortunately I can't say the same for the service. Every time I go, I have to wait about 10 minutes after I sit down for a waiter to come over and give me water or even take a drink order. There have been a few times when I counted at least 5 servers that walked right past and didn't even make eye contact ...
author: Marissa K.

description: This restaurant is definitely bigger than the one in Marina. Food is still great, service is great and the whole place is spacious. They even have a huge back room that you can rent out.  Tried the meatballs and Churros for the first time besides their tacos and it was amazing. The Churros were so crunchy and hot , it reminded me of the ones I bought in Cozumel from a Mexican street vendor.  The meat balls were big and good enough for sharing.  Definitely would come here instead of the one in Marina.
author: Claudine V.

description: American-washed hipster tacos.  A bit on the blander side.  I prefer the authentic Mexican hole in the walls in the Mission.
author: Laq Y.

description: Had one night in town and am very glad we spent party of it here with Jacob behind the bar. The BEST skinny margarita I've has in a long time, and a delicious prickly pear shot from our skilled barkeep. Chorizo taco for the win. Great atmosphere on a Friday night.
author: Jeanette D.

description: Been here three times and each time the tacos and app that I order are spot on!
author: Richard H.

description:
Being used to your very typical taqueria food, I am always mildly skeptical about eating at sit down Mexican restaurants, since I can usually get stellar quality Mexican food for a much cheaper than the sit down restaurants.

My worries were put to rest upon seeing the menu and reading the other dishes which are not frequently found at a taqueria, or even at other Mexican restaurants for that matter. I was pleasantly surprised to find that they even had albondigas on the menu. You see this dish in some restaurants, but to make it well is something else. Using my grandmother's cooking as a standard to go by, I decided to order them and see how they came out. To say that I was satisfied with the dish would be an understatement. The meat was nice, and well seasoned. They infused a bit of spearmint into the meatball, which always makes for good flavour, and is sometimes overlooked. The only thing that was different (not in a bad way though) was that they used a tomato sauce to cover the albondigas, instead of making it into a soup. 

A bonus: They also have a great tequila and mezcal selection. The descriptions they give are pretty spot on, so it's a good guide to go by.

Definitely plan to follow the orange and white taco and go back one of these days.
author: Victor R.

description:
Stopped by here with a friend after "Big Time Timmy Jim" threw in a few good words on an interview I watched, and this place did not disappoint. As I walked in I envisioned a completely different restaurant, you know your typical taqueria. Instead I got a sit down restaurant, dim lights with a huge bar table in place of your typical food station.  

They start you off with their complimentary chips, crisp and salted perfectly to go with their awesome chunky salsa. I wanted to try all of their tacos, saw 4 for $13 option, but ahhh what the hell, let's order all 8 for $26. Came out to be the best decision because each taco was "the Freak-in-licious." Not a veggie person, but even my least favorite of the bunch, the butternut squash was still tasty. My taco of choice of course is the "chicken en mole colorado," soft tender chicken mole with crumbled cheese on top. Let's not forget the 3 levels of hot sauce with the hottest sauce being a late creeper, you'll see what I'm talking about. In general I can confidently say you won't be disappointed in any taco you really order, trust me I had all 8 on one order so I know. Thanks FreeeaaaKKKKKKK.
author: Limuel G.

description: Delicious meats served right off the bone!  Spare rib, barbacoa, cod, etc.  It's literally a small flour tortilla, 1-2 oz of meat and a bit of cilantro.  Easy to share the 10 taco platter with 2 others!  The brussel sprouts were a great add as there aren't any veggies in the tacos themselves.  Finished every bite with a sip of Mexican Coke and it tasted like heaven in my mouth.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
My friends really hyped this place up for me, so I went in with no expectations.

Yes, it is a fancied Mexican establishment, and you will likely get an overpriced taco in exchange for fun drinks, people watching, and a unique variety of salsa.

Will I go back? Yes. Their drinks are amazing and their food is decent. Sharing guac is a must, and if you can score a seat outside on a nice day, you are golden.
author: Annie L.

description: Where can I start with this review... Well this was my first time at the actual location I have only tastes their food at events or outside venues. It is situated at a nice place in Valencia and the great thing that it has a nice patio outside of the restaurant. Their menu is simple but gives a lot of varieties on what to eat. The best thing was to have a bunch of tacos and be able to mix and match them. My girlfriend and me ordered the 10 tacos for $33 which was well worth it we got our moneys worth and be able to take it home what we could not finish. The carnitas is always good and the chicken beer marinated was good as well it had such a unique taste. I also liked the display that they had when our order of tacos came out and told us the difference between the three salsas they had for the tacos. The beer selection is also great as well. We both had a very good time and will probably come more often!
author: David U.

description:
5 Stars to whomever designed this space.  It is gorgeous!  The wood paneling, the light fixtures, tile floor, and mural are all just beautiful.  Too bad the name of the place isn't as classy as it's decor.

The food, I was less impressed by.  I mean I live in the neighborhood, and I guess I could see coming here again if the lighting at Papalote just isn't romantic enough for me, or the line at my taco window at Haltun is too long, or at the Toyanese truck, or something happens to all the taquerias on Mission, OR I guess if I am just feeling fancy!  But seriously folks, if you're traveling to the Mission to have a taco, you should have a Mission taco, not a Valencia taco.

That said, I was actually not super impressed by my taco.  It was good, but the least good part of the meal.  I am a vegetarian so I'll just assume that all the meat tacos are much more delicious.  The chips and salsa are really good though, as are the empanadas.  We also had the plaintains, which were a little dry, but the cumin crema was delish, though I object to the fancy smear of beans on the plate - not visually appealing to me.  The blueberry agua fresca wasn't as exciting as it sounded either.

The service was lovely though.
author: Linda L.

description:
I went here after watching a football game (wait no, I was being forced to watch a football game). My boyfriend and I  literally stumbled onto this place. With hungry belly's and beer coma setting in the tacoliciosity was just what we needed. 

Pork tacos had so much flavor and the queso appetizer was yummy. I was so into this queso that when the waitress came to take our plates away I asked for a to go box for it (not even realizing there was no more than 2 tablespoons left). Now that's love. 

If you are in the mission and craving Mexican with a modern decor, hit this place up stat!
author: Heather T.

description:
Really good tacos, pretty good house drinks. Plus, they keep the chips and salsa coming while you wait.

Weird music choices - and it gets LOUD, and you're really crammed in next to each other, as far as seating goes. 

That said, it was a pleasant experience for being in the Mission (where amazing, and authentic Mexican can be had at every corner) and my expectations for a restaurant with SUUUUCH a gimmicky name weren't too high.
author: Megan S.

description:
Came here on a Friday evening with the co-workers after a long day and even a longer week. Nice atmosphere, totally has the City feel to it. We arrived and were seated immediately. I think we were lucky and beat the crowd as I noticed people that came in after us had to wait for over 30 minutes (unfortunately, they don't take reservations). They a nice seating outside as well, which is great for a warm evening (warm for San Francisco anyways).

As soon as we were seated, they gave us fresh hot chips with salsa that wasn't too spicy and that could fancy most people's tastes. They had a great selection of house specialty cocktails and a bar with more of the regular drinks as well. Considering the name of the place, we of course had to try their tacos! They have a taco-of-the-week thing where they switch out the main ingredient for the each week. This week's was a shrimp and cilantro taco. This taco wasn't bad, but it wasn't as particular as I imagined it. What hit the spot was their traditional carnitas taco. The meat was very well seasoned, hot off the stove, and tender to the bite. In addition, their guacamole was delicious! It's only made to order so you don't have to worry about the guacamole having been sitting there too long. Fresh, rich, and creamy.
author: Kerri L.

description:
Tacos double the price of tacos at an Mexican place in the mission. However, authentic places don't have a liquor licence and make strong margaritas, nor do they have such friendly waitstaff, clean bathrooms, and outside seating WITH heat lamps. 

I would not call this place authentic, but the food is decent and the ambiance is something that I haven't been able to find at any reasonably priced Mexican place. 

Oh yeah, PS. I shared the grilled squid and had the shrimp tacos of the day.
author: Skye W.

description:
Took a special person out on their bday and was a little bit disappointed.

The bartender was pretty friendly but over charged me for drinks. The menu said $9 and they ended up being $10 a pop. I think he might've said that there was a tax, but i'm not really sure. 

The hostess and wait staff seemed a bit frazzled and not super friendly. I get that when its pretty busy one can be stressed out, but I can't say I was impressed with the service.

However, the ambiance was great and I enjoyed my food. Nothing super spectacular but I appreciated the inventiveness of the banh mi tacos, which were the tacos of the week.

I was glad that the prices for food didn't break the bank, tho!

I really wish you could give half points for restaurants because this experience left me a little bit on the fence. I might give it another try sometime with a pal.
author: Yvonne Q.

description: Vibrant and fun place to enjoy margaritas. The tacos are great always keep an eye on the taco of the day. No reservations so plan to enjoy a margarita while you wait. Marina Girl Salad is usually on the menu for a lighter meal. Guacamole and salsa excellent. Chips good. Regular margarita and specialty margarita excellent.
author: Valerie F.

description:
I think I actually fell in the love with the queso. But now I'm getting ahead of myself. After impatiently waiting and eating stupid healthy in order to justify this meal, I finally went to Tacolicious. I ordered a mere four tacos (two fried cod, one butternut squash and one short rib), when really I probably only needed two. But I just couldn't care. They were just plain and simple delicious tacos (ha! I think that's where they got the name) and not overdone at all. 

The queso, described on the menu as, "sustainable? no. local? nope. delicious? yep." pretty much blew my mind. Growing up in Texas, I became quite fond of this semi-fake spicy cheese dip and since moving to California, a bit of a healthier state, queso has made very few appearances in my life. But anyways, it really was perfect in every way: the consistency, the chunks of vegetables and peppers in it, the right amount of spice... plus I discovered that dipping the tacos into the queso was a complete game-changer and a totally brilliant idea. 

The service was awesome. My friend and I sat at the bar and had a grand ole time chatting with the bar tender. The chips and salsa to start were amazing. The whole experience was just great. And I'm literally still dreaming about that queso.
author: Allie S.

description:
In honor of cinco de mayo, we just had to head out to the mission to get our "mexican" fix and some margaritas and tequila shots! It was way way crowded on this blessed holiday, but we headed to the bar and grabbed a few drinks while we waited.

It was about 11:30 when the host came up to us and apologized saying that we probably won't be able to get a seat because people are probably going to just stay until closing (we came in at around 11?). So we finished our drinks to head out somewhere else, but wait! As we were about to leave, we got a table.

I had no expectations from tacolicious, especially with my south bay taco truck filled spoiled life...We just wanted to be in a fun setting with food and drink. So we got the 10 taco platter for $31 and got one of each. We also got the guac which was kind of pricey for what it was. $7 and it was really plain, just avocado no onions or tomatoes. We get complimentary chips and salsa to start. The salsa was zesty and pretty tasty.

Overall, tacolicious is ok...I wouldn't come here too often. The spicy habanero margarita was really weird. I love spicy, but not in my drink. And my favorite taco was the chorizo one.
author: Stine H.

description:
The guac was like a party in my mouth! So rich and creamy and delicious. 

The tacos were pretty good! Be careful for the innocuous looking yellow salsa...its super spicy habanero. caliente!

Nice spot to grab a casual dinner and drinks with some friends.
author: T. C.

description: Had an awesome, albeit casual, business lunch here with a long time colleague. The taco dishes were excellent.  The outdoor seating was very pleasant.  Service was very good.  Great all around package.   AND, across the street are two crazy bakeries with awesome chocolates.  Hmmmmmmm.
author: Ray S.

description: Came here after a night of partying, again real good food.  I've been to one in the Marina so decided to visist the Mission.  Nice location, service is great.  Wasn't packed for a Friday night, which was good for us.  ordered about 20 tacos: carnitas, rock-cod, braised short rib.  along with the chips and salsa, which is also good.  I look forward to visiting again.....
author: Nic C.

description: This place was awesome. Definitely the best bar I've been in in a loooong time. I didn't like the fruity Sangria, and they took it back! I went on to have more than my fair share of food and other drinks; we both loooooove this place! Oh, good luck parking!
author: Kevin F.

description: Excellente, suck thumb curl up in corner food coma, mi mami...beef ribs, ribs, get in my belly...flavors flavors...salsas, like mi casa...nurturing vs profiting niiice balance, solid.
author: Burger B.

description: Creative tacos - happy to see options for vegetarians! We were fortunate to be seated with zero wait during the world series. Fun atmosphere (maybe amplified by the game being on the big screens?). Good food, good service. The fried plantains were definitely a fave.
author: Katrina H.

description:
Best tacos ever !! very tasty delicious and inexpensive !  One of my friends recommend a cocktail: pasion cocktail. He told us that it was a veery good cocktail, so I haven't even  glance at ingredients. well I should have done it !! One of the spiciest cocktail that I 've ever tasted!! sooo hoot!! it really surprised me. After my first sip, he told me that he forgot to mention, this cocktail is very spicy! 
But it was a good cocktail though ;) 
You should try it ;)
author: Ornella G.

description:
I was skeptical when my friends dragged me from my groovy Haight home all the way to the swanky Marina District to have a taco. I mean how good can they be to, A. Drive and deal with parking and 2. We have a Taco Bell on the way home from our favorite bar! Dang, was I surprised. Not only were the flavors tacolicious, they were inventive in the way you ordered them. Doesn't matter how many people you have you can order in odd combinations and everyone leaves satisfied.

So now I dream of them and just found out that the taco gods put a new location just a hop, skip from me in the Mission. Now that's my kinda place! 

Tacolicious indeed!
author: CB R.

description: Fried fish tacos and carnitas are amazing. Great place for quick dinner. Will eat there again and again.
author: Balu V.

description: Short rib tacos are sooo good. Double corn tortillas wrap a huge helping.of super flavorful and tender short rib brisket. Simple but totally craving worthy. Chips and salsa + fresh guacamole are also delish. And the churros with chocolate dipping sauce are fun to share.
author: Becca S.

description: Definitely returning here next time I am in SF.  Sadly I didn't get to try their margaritas, but their tequila selection was on point.  Beer selection had Mexico's finest on tap.  They start you off with complimentary chips with assorted salsas.  We ordered multiple tacos (have lunch at the bar), pleased with everyone.  Nice atmosphere, no complaints on service, wish we had this place in Miami.  Also super laid back.  This quality food in Miami would be at a higher end/possibly pretentious restaurant.
author: Carlos P.

description:
This is where the yelp 1-5 scale hurts. This place is a 3.5 to me. The food was good but a bit overly salty. There were a lot of salsas to dress things up which I love. The margaritas were slightly above average.

That it is Marina tacos in the Mission is a bit of an anathema but who cares if you're looking for something a bit more attractive than El Toro. The decor is nice enough but is pretty standard "semi-upscale restaurant". It was packed when I went and we ended up eating at the bar (preferred IMO). The bartender took good care of us though I thought it was funny that she made fun of hipsters while flashing her half sleeve tats and a piercing or two.
author: Raj T.

description: I'm updating my review since I've posted before my wedding. The food was delivered and was exceptional is was soo yummy! It was my wedding day and they sent the entire wrong pan of food a substituted with veggies instead of my ribs, no big deal I mean there was plenty of food and everyone was very pleased with the quality of the food and our delivery guy helping set up. After the wedding it was easy to price adjust and the catering dept. was on top of their stuff! Thanks all
author: K M.

description:
I've had to convince peeps to come here.
When you say TACO, one easily pictures one of the many awesome taquerias in SF.
But this isnt just tacos, this is tacolicious tacos.  
It is about hanging out, drinking a margarita,
enjoying a taco worth 4 and feeling like you've landed somewhere interesting in the city.

I love TACOLICIOUS
author: StudioCollette M.

description: The holy grail of all Mexican food in the United States.  This place is where I would like to call heaven someday...
author: Courtney S.

description:
As a taco enthusiast, I was super excited to try this place, but ... was a little disappointed.  First of all, due to the music being played too loud so that everyone had to yell their conversations, the restaurant was almost unbearably loud inside!  My friend and I wanted to sit outside to avoid the noise, but when I asked about a table outside, the hostess shortly told me "All the tables outside are taken, if there were any empty ones I would have asked you if you wanted to sit out there."  Apart from the noise and the less than friendly hostess, the food was just not worth the price.  The best part of the meal was the yummy rice and beans, but for a place that's famous for tacos, that may not be a good thing.  I got the "shot and a beer braised chicken" taco, and the chorizo and potato taco.  The chorizo taco was ok, but the chicken taco was not so good ... I took one bite and handed it over to my friend.  For dessert, we got a "chocolicious taco" which is basically one of those ChocoTaco ice cream treats that you can buy at 7-11 for $1, only this one was $7.  We also got a couple of cocktails, the Mucho Gusto was pretty good, and the Berry Good was ok.  

All in all, I'd say the food is decent, but I probably won't be back - it's too overpriced and I didn't enjoy the atmosphere.
author: Lauren S.

description: I came here with a couple of friends. We sat in the back room where it seemed quieter but still lively. The tacos were decent. I also tried some tequila (don't remember the type)...it was strong and smooth. If you are a tequila lover, you def should come here.
author: Margaret R.

description: Yum! I love me some tacos! I usually order the spare ribs tacos but the others are also great as well. Can't forget to mention their chips and salsa. This place gets really busy during dinner time so it's sometimes a hit or miss if you want something quick.
author: Jamie L.

description:
I hate when people ding a place because of waiting in line. The most popular places that do not take reservations will almost always have a long line. But...

We showed up on a busy Saturday night and were told it would be about a 1 hour wait. After an hour and fifteen minutes and a couple of margs, I checked in with the front desk. They said it would be another 35-45 minutes. This seemed crazy to me, but I went back to the bar. Behind me, I overheard someone being introduced as the GM of the restaurant. Hmmmmm, what an opportunity? So, I introduced myself and explained the situation. The GM was super cool about it. While they were not able to instantly seat us at a table, they were able to help get another chair for the bar. They also provided a free round of shots, and our food came right out. The service staff remained very friendly, and the food was great. I won't complain about the long wait time, only the unrealistic anticipated wait time. if it is going to be 2 hours, that is ok. Just be sure to give people the heads up in the first place. Aside from that, everything was great. Five stars goes for recognizing the issue, correcting it and never making me feel like a jerk for voicing my opinion. Will definitely come back to this place - just not on a jam packed Saturday night.
author: Ryan M.

description:
This place is so consistently good - no wonder there's a wait of 1+ hour on any given night. 

Their margaritas are STRONG, their food is really good (from ceviche, to tacos, to dessert!!).  I have not gotten one thing on the menu I have not liked yet.

The only reason I ding'ed them a star is because if you're really craving some serious tacos, this place is really good (especially if you want tacos plus...), but not the best.  And in an area where you can get tacos for $2, this place is a littlleee overpriced.
author: Megha A.

description:
Good tacos (not mind blowing, but for the price, it was pretty good). I love that you can get a different variety, especially good for a group setting. 

Drinks were definitely delicious.

Service was friendly enough, but a little on the hipster/elitist side. 

I'll be back, and I'd recommend it to friends.
author: Elin M.

description:
Good place to kick it with friends, wouldn't really hit it on my own with all the local taquerias and burrito joints there are.  

Great selection of tequila, though I am not a fan of this type of spirit.  Their carne asada is delicious, really some of the best I have had. 

Prices are eh, somewhat on the high side, but it is a nice place to eat and enjoy your company.  

Beer selection kinda sucks.  I understand they want to emphasize the Mexican ambience, but please provide more than just Mexican beer.  Personally, Mexican beer taste like butt to me, thats just IMO.

I give it a 3.5 and would recommend
author: Tom L.

description: After a great visit last week, I returned with my boyfriend excited to show him how I liked it so much.  I regret to say the hostesses was extremely rude and refused to seat us at the empty table in a already full place that sat there for over 10 minutes.  I guess two people isn't enough for them. We walked out, never to return.  Profit apparently is more important than customer service.  Get a clue!
author: Jocie H.

description:
same awesome tacos, chips and salsa as the the marina.  substitute hipsters for douchebags, throw in an outdoor patio and a tequila bar next and, voila, you have Tacolicious in the mission!

i had four tacos.  all of them were excellent.  i really, really liked the fried cod taco.  and of course there is the good ole standby, the guajillo braised short rib taco.  i got to try the carnitas taco which was exceptional and the beer and a shot chicken taco was surprisingly flavorful and delicious

the people next to us got some squid dish that i could not stop salivating over.  it looked and smelled so good!  they also got this mussel dish which smelled deliciously smokey.  i dont like mussels but i would be willing to try those.  i have no idea what either of these dishes were, but those alone are enough to make me want to come back.
author: Christian C.

description: I was on the fence about Tacolicous for a while, but it has since won me over. My initial hesitation was personal: why would I go to an Americanized taco place when I live in the Mission surrounded by authentic taquerias galore? Well, the bottom line is Tacolicious serves up damn good tacos, reasonable prices, lively atmosphere & an unbelievably extensive tequila menu. My only wish is that they diversify their vegetarian taco options. See you soon Tacolicious.
author: Lynn m.

description: Carnitas and short rib tacos are a must try! Delicious mixed {tequila}drinks! Cool crowd! Awesome service!
author: Shelley M.

description:
Visited December 2012. 
Had a variety of tacos (10 for $31),  albacore tostada appetizer, grilled brussel sprouts, and margaritas.
Food - 5 stars
Ambience - 5 stars
Service - 2 stars (We had to wait over an hour to get seated as the hostess gave our table to a different party--we had specifically said we wanted an table inside and she must have forgot and offered us a table outside when it became available, but it was way too cold to sit outside)
author: Loe M.

description:
Horrible!horrible! 0 stars if I could give it to this horrible fascist place .
I waited for 20 minutes to order 
I was waiting for my order and was told to get up for people dining I was there a extra 10 minutes no one even sat down!
Hostess and bartender where too busy chatting up to care, when I finally grab a seat at the bar the lady ask me what I wanted in a rude matter and I told her politely I am waiting for my order she said they where already ready.... Ugh last time I go here!
author: Ricky G.

description: Braised short rib taco was so yummy in my tummy! Loves, loves, loves the three different sauces. Went to Outside Lands this weekend and they were cranking out these mini tacos which were the perfect concert snack. When I go to the Mission street location for lunch three tacos hits the spot.
author: Kelly C.

description:
3.5 stars

When they quote you a two hour wait time, they aren't kidding.  We got there at 7 pm on a Friday night, were seated at 9 pm!  Luckily we were able to grab snacks and drinks at the tequila bar, Mosto, next door.  The food was good, although not consistent.  Some  dishes were flavorful and good, while others were bland.  A really cute place though.
author: K V.

description: This place is SO good. I asked my friends where we could eat some authentic Mexican and they suggested here. I ordered two tacos and they were perfect! The chips were also very good and served warm with some delicious green and red salsas. Definitely recommend!
author: Katie L.

description:
My husband and I really like this place and keep coming back. The reason...no so much the tacos, but the salsa, the guacamole, the ceviche and the albacore tostadas. 
Even thought we love the place, they lose one start because it is really really loud! Every body is screaming over the loud music. 
Plus don't bother making reservations. Tacolicious only takes reservations for parties over 12. So be prepare to wait.
author: Ana M.

description: The staff was very friendly! My friend and I were quickly seated and greeted with a smile when we first walked in. No wait! I was surprised to see some delicious chips and salsa put on our table as a free appetizer. I didn't order a drink so I got some cold water. I wished they had some ice since it was such a warm day and the water turned into room temperature. My friend and I ordered the 4 for $14 taco deal. We ordered 2 tacos with cod, 1 taco with traditional carnitas, and 1 taco with the chicken. Our food came pretty quickly! The cod was both our favorites. It tasted super good with the yellow colored hot sauce and some lemon juice squeezed on top. I had the traditional carnitas and it was alright. The texture was kind of dry. My friend had the chicken and she also said it was alright. We couldn't believe how filling 2 small looking tacos were! We left satisfied and super filled up. :-)
author: Angel H.

description: This place is awesome. I love their plantain presentation over refried beans, and their carnitas tacos are on point. Try the passion margaritas, they have a hint of spice but are perfect if you like mangos. Their regular margaritas are just as good, they're not chinchy with the tequila so that's nice. Their list of tacos is a little bit short of my expectations considering the restaurant has "TACO" in its name, but whatevs. If you're going for dinner be prepared to wait a little while because its a popular spot. Mosto is a tequila bar that is attached next door that can keep you entertained in the meantime. Cheers!
author: Danielle L.

description:
I came here on a Sat. night (3/10) with some girlfriends. We got there after 8:00 PM and since they don't take reservations there was a 2 hour wait! We scored seats at the bar while we waited. Fortunately, others probably got discouraged with the long wait so we probably got seated after 45 minutes to an hour.

The drinks menu looked amazing but I was unsure about what to try. The bartender suggested one of the House Cocktails: El Rey (brugal rum, manzano peppers, guava, lime, pom juice...$9.50). It was very good, but I was disappointed by the fact it was served in a small glass with too much ice. I feel like I paid more for the ice than for the yummy concoction! I later ordered the T-lish Spicy Beer (Tecate, chili vinegar, lime, salt...$4). This was a very good twist on the Chavela/Michelada type of drink. BTW, although not on the menu they serve complimentary chips and salsa.

When we were seated for our late night dinner, we settled on an order of the tacos...10 for $31. This allowed the five of us to order two tacos each. Unfortunately, after devouring those two tacos we still felt hungry. Thus, another round of 10 tacos were ordered. I chose two "shot-and-a-beer braised chicken" (good) and later two "bistec adobado with pickled onions (amazing...$1 extra each). The tacos are served with three types of salsas, which I liked.

I enjoyed my first time here, not so much for the drinks and food, but more for the fun experience with friends. The place seems kind of small and overpriced. Cause even for the 10 tacos special, you're paying $3-$4 per taco. Being a San Jose native where there's taquerias everywhere with really good tacos, that is a pretty absurd price for tacos. It's obvious you're also paying for the ambiance and location.

I suggest a one time visit will suffice.
author: Perla A.

description:
Super delicious tacos, chips and salsas but the margaritas are very small and not that great for $9.50.  

After we had our tacos and one margarita, we left and went to Puerto Allegre.

I probably won't be going back.
author: Dinora G.

description: I come here for the fish tacos.  Not as good as San Diego, but I close my eyes and pretend. The other tacos are pretty good as well.  Usually packed, but worth dealing with the crowd.
author: Click C.

description:
Guacamole literally tasted like mashed up avocado. We got a pitcher of sangria which was mostly just orange juice with some random sour apple slices in it. The bartender was so busy hitting on the drunk chicks sitting next to us (taking shots with them in clear hopes to get it in) that he forgot to charge us for our $10 mashed up avocado. Yeah, go elsewhere. 

The music was kinda good though.
author: Shahde T.

description:
Cactus juice cocktails and margaritas that put a big ol' smile on your face. Love coming here after work. They dish out a generous portion of free warm chips and flavorful salsa. The bartenders are super sweet and the food is really good. I'm also in love with the decor. Granted, it's easy to rack up a big bill here but you'll probably be very satisfied with your experience. Be sure to arrive early, this place gets packed later. 

They also have a tequila bar next door that's super cool and quite popular at night.
author: Shara H.

description:
Despite being surrounded by taquerias, Tacolicious is a nice addition to the Mission food landscape.  The key here seems to be better quality ingredients.  This means you don't have to eat here at 1 in the morning  after 5+ drinks to find delicious it delicious (I'm pointing at you El Faralito).  They definitely don't neglect your desire to get drunk and eat tacos though.  They have probably the best selection of Tequila in the city (state too?), good margaritas, as well as offering a few traditional cheap hipster beers.  Further reinforcement of this mission is provided by the Prix Fix menu of 1 taco, 1 tecate, and 1 shot of tequila (el jimador) for $10.

Though we were lucky and got a quick table we did wait probably 20-30 minutes before our waitress showed up.  She was friendly and attentive once she found us but still this seems a long time to wait.  During this wait time we ate our way through 2 baskets of chips and a couple or rounds of water, so it wasn't like we were completely ignored.  

Their salsas were interesting and slightly unique.  It seems like there might be mint in the salsa they serve with their chips, which was actually quite delicious.  The three salsas served with the tacos were all good, though I wish there "hot" salsa had a bit more kick.  The braised short-rib tacos were succulent and well flavored.  Rock fish was fried to perfection in those tacos. They even have nice vegetarian tacos.  Despite being a sit down place, with a much cleaner and classier vibe then other taquerias, a meal here doesn't have to break the bank either.  I'd definitely be back for sober day-time taco eating but who knows where I'd end up if I had a few more drinks in me.
author: Paul T.

description: Love this place. I used to work in the Marina and would always attend Taco Tuesday after work and absolutely love their margaritas and carne asada tacos. Heavenly.
author: Stephanie F.

description: I went to Tacolicious on a Monday night and sat at the bar; the place was packed. My guacamole was super yummy. I also really liked the kale salad with quinoa and grapefruit sections and the grilled fish tacos (which isn't on the menu, but I am going gluten-free, so the helpful and smart waiter suggested the grilled fish). Yum! I think my waiter must be a mind reader because he also put the salad dressing on the side without my requesting it. I should come here more often.
author: Eva G.

description: Great prompt service at the bar- fun bartender...and a killer simple but flavorful carnitas taco.  Salsas are distinct and great.  Worth dropping by.
author: Kate R.

description: Foods just mediocre & over priced. both times I've been here they charge my card more than my bill was. Starting to think it's not an accident. I don't like over paying for tacos, let alone shitty ones. Id rather  go to pancho villa .
author: sam l.

description:
Overview:

This place was great for a late lunch/early dinner on a Saturday.  It would have been fun to sit and drink margs outside and eat our food, but the inside was a lot of fun as well.  One of the best aspects of this dining and drinking experience was that the service was on top of it, yet didn't rush us to get out of our seats once the dinner rush started.  We had a leisurely margarita fest.  I'll definitely be going back.

Suggestions:

SIP on the margarita fresca
SNACK on the tuna tostadas (absolutely beyond my expectations).

300 TEQUILAS!!!
author: Anna S.

description: The fish tacos are my absolute favorites. Good food. Friendly staff. There is a bit of a wait but it's definitely worth it.
author: Mimi S.

description:
I've always been a fan of Tacolicious but the Mission location turned me into an evangelist. You can't go wrong with tacos and tequila!

First off, the restaurant is connected to the tequila bar, so starting the night off with a drink is time well spent.  The hostess was great about checking in with us and we were seated well before the end of our 45 min wait time.

Second off, the food is pretty damn delicious.  My go-tos are the Queso to share, and Carnitas and Cod tacos.  I tried the guacamole this time, but it looks better than it tastes. Sure, you can find a better deal for tacos a block away but I appreciate Tacolicious' commitment to hormone free meats and sustainable foods.   

And finally, you can't beat the atmosphere.  Every once in a while, it's nice to go to a restaurant where you have to use your outdoor voice to talk to the people around you.  It's so rowdy here, you can surely let loose after a long work week.  I already told my best friend I'm planning her birthday here! Can't wait!    

TEQUILA!
author: Helen V.

description: So.   My boyfriends wallet was stolen here tonight. Shock and awe. Now we are stuck. This place sucks. Take a body guard.aweful
author: Phillipa U.

description:
Nice big space (it doesn't seem so at first, but there's a big additional room in the back they can use if it gets busy, or for private events), and it'll be even bigger once they start using the patio.  The dark earth-toned walls are sparsely decorated with a selection of old-school juicers.  There are a couple TVs, but they were turned off while we were there, not sure how often they're in use.
The open kitchen in the middle is wonderfully tempting to walk past and drool over all the tubs of deliciousness - the albondigas meatballs, the pulled pork, the short ribs...

Anyway, the main reason you're here is because you want Mexican food with margaritas - a combination the Mission is in frightfully short supply of.  So let's get to it.
Yeah... we didn't get any margaritas on our first trip, heh.  But the 4 cocktails we tried were all quite tasty!
The roasted butternut squash appetizer is cold, so don't be startled by this like we were, but it's a nice combination of flavors & textures.
Of the tacos, the real winners are the short rib (which is just wonderful), the mole colorado chicken (which isn't strongly mole-flavored, but is juicy and tender), and the carnitas.  The shot & a beer chicken was a little dry.

But let's be honest - they're not really trying to compete with traditional tacos.  There are a million other places within 5 blocks that will do those better.  So order the things you can't get in a taqueria, and enjoy being able to drink margaritas, cocktails, and tequila (from their wonderfully large selection) with your Mexican food.

And they're open until midnight!
author: Don H.

description:
After a busy day moving boxes into my new apartment, I wanted something tasty, quick and nearby.  I called up the Valencia Tacolicious and placed an order for the pork/beef meatballs, the rock cod taco, and a braised short rib taco.  The girl taking my order said all three were excellent choices and said the order would be up in about 15 minutes.  
It was loud and packed inside Tacolicious but the hostess, Alex, greeted me with a warm smile and directed me to the bar for my takeout.  
The chips and salsa were amazing, the salsa beats Papalote's hands down.  The meatballs were yummy and the sauce slightly spicy but not overwhelming.  The tacos were the best tacos I've had in SF.  I'll be back for more and already put the number on my speed dial.
author: Eugene X.

description: I was bringing dinner to a friend who was just released from the hospital. He had a craving for tacos and churros from Tacolicious. The lovely hostess took the order over the phone, I picked it up 15 minutes later, and was off to my friend's house. Got there, looked in the bag and saw that the churros were missing. The hostess (Leyland?) dispatched the chef Chris, who was getting off work, to personally deliver a double order of churros. Thank you so much for literally going the extra mile.
author: Dave M.

description:
The tacos are good. The meat is very good quality.

The salsa that comes with the chips is really good. It has a fire-roasted tomato taste to it. I'm a fan.

If you go on a Tuesday, be prepared to wait a long time.
author: Andrew M.

description:
I love love love tacolicious in the mission. Some of the most generous wine pours in the city, brilliant fish taco and the two pork tacos (carnitas and cochinita pibil) are sensational. They are very consistent, I've never had something sub-par. A must order is the fresh tuna on crispy tortilla on the starter menu. The guacamole is generous and saves on those shared guac fights at the table.

Only reason not to go is if you have people in the group who are a bit hard of hearing. It's often hell noisy.
author: Rachel H.

description: Hey  everybody got to try this place on Sunday and the margaritas were perfect.  Good tequila and the juice was not to sweet, freshly squeezed.  The chips and salsa were yummy. I have to say the tacos just so good, heaping portion of meat. I will come back again soon with my friend Melanie. We so enjoyed the evening together for dinner  and drinks
author: Fred W.

description: Headed up the coast yesterday to the Mission District for lunch with some old buddies on a sunny and warm January day.  Tacolicious was a pleasant surprise.  We shared the 10 taco plate, very yummy.  I will let others hit the food.  Had my boy and they had a $7 lunch for kids which included a drink AND an ice cream sundae.  My little guy very happy. Wait staff solid, my ONLY issue is not with the restaurant..I dropped $2 in quarters in the meter and got 25 minutes or so.. couldnt believe it, then read the meter and it is $4.75 PER HOUR !!! holy crap.. city of San Francisco merciless these days..
author: Jeff R.

description: The wait was long, the order was messed up, the seats are uncomfortable, this place is full of Mission hipsters and it's all totally worth worth it.  These are some good tacos. Best I've ever had really. Do yourself a favor and get the short rib tacos.
author: Wes W.

description:
If you go sit at the br, and Sunday brunch is much more mellow that a Saturday pm. Wow they pack them in and I see why with there carnitas, and chicken tacos. Plus coconut h
Water margarita hydrate and tastes great bonus includes a kick.
author: Roxy H.

description:
I'm updating to 4 stars because the Tuna Tartare Tostadas are really pretty delicious.

My stance on the food is the same. It's definitely been watered down for an American palate.  This time, even though I don't really eat chicken, I tried the chicken mole colorado taco at the recommendation of Telmo, just to prove I'm not high-maintenance! It was pretty good, but seemed watered down (not a thick, rich, smoky mole at all, and yes, I know there are other kinds, but it did leave me wishing it was a little richer). The saving grace was the queso, and I'm pretty sure that was imported, at least as far as from La Palma... 

I also ordered the guacamole, which, while made with nice ripe avocados, was basically avocado and cilantro. I loaded on some of the habañero salsa (which, incidentally, isn't super spicy, so don't be shy trying it even if you don't normally like spicy stuff) to perk it up a bit and it was tasty that way. 

Also, no self-respecting Mission chick is going to order the "Marina Girl Salad" (well actually my friend did, but she lives in Oakland so it doesn't count). I highly suggest re-naming that one "Hipster Greens" or some such. Apparently it's pretty yummers.

My other friend ordered the special Chile Verde taco of the month, and that was good enough. Again, high quality fresh-tasting ingredients, just lacking that extra kick.

Now let's move on to the drinks. We all ordered margaritas. They were a little sweeter than a typical Mexican margarita, but they went down EASY and they were potent. Waitstaff was good about asking our subsequent margaritas to be made with less sweetener. 5 stars. Looking forward to trying out some of the other variations and Tequilas. Really looking forward. Buying stock in Tylenol. 

Anddd last but not least, Churros y chocolate. The churros were truly as they should be. Piping hot fresh from the fryer, liberally sprinkled with azucar y canela. They were still tender in the middle, as they should be. The chocolate dipping sauce was also a bit watered down compared to the thick richness I've encountered in Spain and parts of Mexico, but it was flavorful. I pretty much annihilated those churros. Sharing is overrated. Aww yeah, I'll have to run double-time tomorrow. Ouch.

I'll be back, and still really hoping to upgrade to 4 stars. I want to love the food MOAR. You can do it!! Soooo close, just a couple of little tweaks and it's THERE.
author: Darcy V.

description:
I love this place. Gorgeous interior, great food, and lots of fun drinks. Went with a big group and ordered a variety of tacos. They were all great but the marinated short rib was SO GOOD. We also got 12 chupitos which are like giant mixed shots and there are all different flavors. The pasion flavor was fun and interesting I think it was mango juice and habanero. 

Mosto was great too, the El Mosto which is just a basic margarita was fabulous!

The back room is really nice as well, I wonder if they rent it out to private parties?
author: Claire b.

description: Warning: I'm basic and did not order a taco, so this review only applies to the chilaquiles, but they sucked. First, this dish was about 95% chips and about 5% egg, so it was more like eating soggy chips and salsa verde than anything else. Considering the lack of egg, you'd think they'd at least cook the whites all the way through, but no, there they were, all mucus-y between some chips. I might come back here and try a taco, since that is apparently their A-game, but will avoid any and all breakfast dishes on the menu.
author: Nan H.

description: suchhh good food I highly recommend going here if you're in the city! my friends and I were at Dolores park and walked about 8 minutes here. we each got different tacos and we all loved them!
author: Mia S.

description: Great food! Nice patrons! Helpful attentive staff !
author: Lauren R.

description: Yes, it's one of those hipster spots on Valencia, and yes, it's rather expensive for tacos, but Tacolicious redeems itself by offering what is essentially gourmet street food for all tastes. The vegetarian tacos are flavorful, and the tableside guacamole is not to be missed. The alleyway feel of the outdoor dining is very Mexico City DF.
author: Marie F.

description:
Beautiful restaurant! Tacos are good not great. The filling is better than the taco itself. The white wine is beyond mediocre and for $12.... a shame!
This place has free Wifi, which is good since there is usually a long wait. It's also very, very loud, which makes it hard to have a conversation. The staff is great and beyond nice.
author: Lucky S.

description: So delicious.  Love the fried cod and the short rib tacos.  I love them all though.  Seriously good.
author: David P.

description:
Pros
Great Atmosphere
Pretty good fish tacos
Excellent Guacamole

Cons
Wasn't crazy about the Marina girl salad - Loved the shrimp but was underwhelmed with the rest of it.
Wasn't crazy about the short rib taco either. I thought it was too spicy.
Watermelon margarita was ok but a bit too sour for my taste.
author: Kari M.

description: Ten tacos, 1 kale salad, 1 squid, two glasses of Malbec, two tequila, two new tattoos, and three bar stools and three girls. Yep, this is heavy for three girls. And we ate them all. I cried, earlier, and I was happy that my girlfriends were there with me. Really, no magic needed. I wanted sincerity, trust and love but not deception or lies or manufactured emotions. That was the topic of our conversation this evening. I am good with that. I've said goodbye. I have given it an earnest try. I have failed but when I fell, my girlfriends were right there to pick me up and make me whole again. How was I this lucky? Why was I this lucky? How could I deserve so much goodness in my life? I don't know, but Tacolicious was delicious and this is a pivotal point of my life. A turning point anyway.I raise my glass and say "Salute." I promise myself that I won't cry any more. I won't cry because the world is going to be a beautiful place full of delicious tacos and wonderful friends to share them with. And if food would have such an effect, then the restaurant has succeeded. I shall be back.
author: Victoria E.

description:
Really  freaking delicious!! Came here for cinco-de-mayo with a group of friends. The wait was like 30 minutes to and hour, but totally worth it. Such a  great variety of tacos, and if you are in a group, definitely opt for the 30 taco platter and try all the different taco varieties. 

Margaritas were on point, literally started feeling a lil tipsy after a few sips. 

Good service, really nice atmosphere.

I definitely would go back and recommend to friends!
author: R A.

description: This is by far over all the best taste, value and ambience for a Mexican Restaurant. All the staff is great. The management is always on the floor and hands on. Great place! The name says it all.
author: Armando M.

description:
Loved it!!!  We had the tuna tartare tostado and it was out of this world tasty!!!  I wish we had ordered more.  I loved the vibe and ambiance of Tacolicious.  We tried the chicken, beef short rib, and pork tacos.  All were equally delicious.  I will definitely be coming back 

The only thing I find ODD is that there were tons of kids running around.  This doesn't really seem like the type of place where bringing your high-chair aged child would be appropriate.  There's blasting music, hoards of people crowded around the full bar, and toddlers two feet away.  People were standing there with their beers and cocktails in hand and there were at least 3 little children running around right below.  Doesn't make a whole lot of sense to me but... to each his own!
author: Suzie M.

description: Very cool place, great food, incredibly hectic! the delicious tacos make up for any craziness!
author: Erik P.

description:
I went as a third wheel with two of my close friends to dine here on a Sunday night around 7pm. 

Place was packed and was given a choice between dining at a 2 person table with an extra chair or wait 45 minutes? Hmmm...we took the table and hilariously, there was a picture of Obama eating some tacos. So my friend made a comment as if we were dining with him. 

All that being said, their chips and salsa verde was awesome. The salsa had a cilantro-y/basil-y flavor. 

We had their albacore tosdadas...which were soo good. We shared 10 tacos between the 3 of us. I really recommend the FRIED COD, CARNITAS, and ADOBADO. 

Loses a star for being cramped during dinner and the hole in my wallet. Somewhat pricey...so the chips and salsa are a major factor for us being full. Atmosphere was relaxing and they played random beats in the background. 

Overall a great find.
author: Kenny T.

description: The tacos served here are creative and upscale.  They are delicious, as are the drinks.  Music is blasting and bassy.  Be prepared to wait.  If you want authentic tacos, hit a taco truck or go to 24th and Mission.
author: John K.

description: I went here for a birthday event in the back room and it was organized very poorly. They basically had an open bar flowing without informing my friend about the cost in advance.  They did not inform him that they were going to be pouring pitchers and "topping people off" while charging $40 for each pitcher. It ended up costing over $4000 when my friend was only told about a 1500 minimum. This ruined the birthday event. Please be careful when having events there and ask about all the costs upfront.
author: Reena P.

description: This place is awesome.., great drinks and the bartenders are so nice and friendly .. Manny is great at the bar .. So friendly and will make you a great drink . Perfect laid back spot in the Mission if your willing to wait or sit at the bar and order a few cocktails and tacos
author: L D.

description:
Pretty good GD tacos!  They are a little pricey and it's pretty hipster but good nonetheless.  I recommend the fish tacos, veggie tacos are not all that.  The salsa with mint is definitely worth going back for.  Not the most authentic place in the Mission but definitely California style.  There are also funny pictures in the bathroom which don't make the food better just make your wait in line more enjoyable.

Did I mention they have amazing salsa with mint?

Tons of cocktails too!  I had a spicy one that was interesting but I'll probably get something else next time.  Go to the toy store across the street after, it's pretty sweet.
author: Maggie M.

description:
Oh my Tacolicious you have really outdone yourselves. I am already a huge fan but the new space WOW! from the layout to the warm inviting atmosphere to that unbelievable mural on the wall. You guys have made a piece of heaven in the Mission.
   I have to say I am addicted to the carnitas so that was a given on this visit but I noticed a handful of new items on the menu so I went with the shrimp a la diabla they had just the right amount of spice and being mixed with those potatoes forget about it so damn good. If you have not tried Tacolicious do so now, like right now go!       
    Thank you for creating an amazing restaurant with a warm welcoming atmosphere and amazing food and drinks.
author: Jeni Z.

description:
Slightweight Fail.

Heard about this place and was excited until I got there.

Parking was slightly challenging.  I mean, it is the Mission area, right?  The wait was what it was, a wait.  The place is a decent size and offered a small outdoor area and of course indoor.  Uniquely was connected to another bar which was convenient for waiting purposes.

We were seated at the bar.  Bartender/server was peculiar in character but again, we are in San Francisco! As first timers, we were excited and eager to try everything.  We decided to get 10 tacos for $31.  We had the cod, the carnitas, the vegetarian selection, braised beef and the chicken en mole all x2. along with the plantains. Plantains were a disappointment.  Tacos were good but only fell in love with the braised beef and lusted over the cod.

Ambiance was pleasant but goodness was it loud in there!  Certainly not a place for an intimate dinner.

On a final note, I know I made mention the bartender/server was peculiar but he did take the beer and sangria (which wasn't all that good either) off our tab as he felt he should've warned us that the 10 tacos was a large order.

Wouldn't really come back unless forced.  Sorry?
author: Patricia G.

description: Hot Hostess, long hair with bangs. Thumbs up.
author: Chi L.

description: Delicious! And worth the wait! Great service. Amazing selection of salsas/ dips
author: Becca F.

description: Killer fish tacos. Fresh guac. Great atmosphere. It's one my favorite spots in the Mission. If only there wasn't always such a long wait....
author: Natasha P.

description:
MARY KATE, MARY KATE, MARY KATE....was awesome....and the food was great too. 

My waitress, MARY KATE smiled, was friendly and attentive to all my dining needs. I am as high maintenance as a customer can get and she passed all of my tests with flying colors. For instance, I ordered a drink that turned out to be too sour (for me). When I asked for sweetener, she offered agave syrup (which this high maintenance diner hates). Apparently, since they don't serve coffee here, that was the only choice of sweetener available to customers....so she offered to bring me another drink. When I said that I would be happiest with just some plain sugar to add to my drink, she went into the kitchen, asked the cook for some and brought a small dish of sugar...which did the trick. My satisfaction was her primary goal...and I was satisfied. 

Besides for bringing the sugar for my drink, she took our order promptly, the food arrived quickly and she checked back with us several times, joking-around and conversing with us just enough to be simply DELIGHTFUL! I will remember my server's name and will ask for her the next time I dine there....and did I mention that the food was great too?
author: Art B.

description: The guacamole doesn't have flavor, every time that I order it, is the same thing!!!! The rest is awesome!!! I love the soup there!!!!
author: Gloria T.

description:
The Mission spot has a great atmosphere inside, at the bar and the patio.  A+  on the shrimp diablo, cod tacos, and short rib tacos.  Pork dishes are a little bland, and the queso a bit boring as well.  

Overall, fun place for a quick mexican fix where the Negro is on tap!
author: Merritt K.

description: I'm a big fan of Mexican food, and this place did not disappoint. I would call this place a "bougey" taco place. The food is great, and there is so much to choose from. The price is a little steep for tacos, but you definitely get what you paid for. My biggest advice is to come here and try it for yourself. You will not be disappointed!
author: Jeffrey C.

description:
WASTE of fifty bucks.

Went here on a Monday night, in hopes of having their pozole. Were seated immediately in a packed restaurant, but it's really not a restaurant - it's a BAR with some table tops crowded together on a wall. The servers, are not servers. It's difficult to tell what anyone is, the customer service was terrible. Dozens of "food runners" ? Just walking around in a tizzy shoving plates on your table. After being seated, we waited for several minutes before finally being approached by a very thin twenty-something that didn't crack a smile and spoke to us in whispers (in an extremely loud bar setting). They were out of pozole (the dish we drove there for), so we settled on a salad, a shrimp dish, and some tacos. Despite the full bar behind us, we were not asked if we'd like to drink anything, instead our little waif rushed off and avoided eye contact with us for the rest of our dinner. We ended up with some lousy romaine and brown avocado salad, pretty decent tacos, and an AWFUL dish that was some concoction of shrimp in bad marinara sauce. The worst part of it all was that no one tried to make up for the lack of service, not even our "server". In total, four different people brought plates to our tiny table and shoved them in front of us without a word, we spent half our meal arranging things on the table so it would all fit. 
Have no idea what the other locations are like, but if this one on Valencia is any indication, I will never return to Tacolicious.
author: Desiree R.

description:
I used to think tacoliscious was a great place to go for some tacos and a margarita until I setup a birthday event in their back room.  I set it up so there would be enough drinks for the entire night but they said we hit our limit right after we ate. I find this hard to believe as the amount of money I put down means everyone at the party drank there own pitcher of margaritas. Also they charged 5% for using the back room that wasn't exclusively ours.  Swindling people for a little money is pretty low. 

Food was standard tacoliscious but $30 per person for three tacos, guac and some burnt churros is too much. The pitchers of margaritas are mainly ice which for $40 a pitcher is ridiculous.  I didn't know ice was that expensive.  After the whole thing the girl serving us asked for a bigger tip...really...I guess pouring margaritas is harder than it looks.
author: Greg S.

description: I've been eating lunch there just about everyday for the last month. The people there are friendly, the service is quick, and the food! They have a new taco of the week every Thursday and everything I've tried has been delicious. It's worth mentioning that  these aren't tacos like you would get down south, I think my first taco was braised chicken and mango chutney, they have some really creative combinations.
author: Raquel L.

description:
Tacos, queso, chupitos and Tecate in a tall boy... what could be better!? Best tacos EVER!   Love the original Tacolicious in the Marina but love love love the new Mission location!  The wait is 1/2 that of the Marina, its bigger and its connected to the tequilla bar! 

You can't go wrong with the carnitas and chicken mole but I just ask that you puh-lease bring back the calamari tacos!
author: Jacqueline M.

description: This restaurant is amazing! The tacos are absolutely amazing, drinks are just as good! The Mission location has much better service than the location in the Marina.
author: Sheryl P.

description: Carnitas, carnitas, carnitas! I got 2 carnitas tacos but I probably could have eaten 10. I am so in love with their tacos that I went to the ferry building 2 days later to get one from the farmers market. I'm smitten. I don't think we'll ever break up.
author: Julia D.

description: Tacolicious had a stand at the 2014 SF Street Food Festival and was serving up delicious fried fish tacos. Two for $8. The fish was fried perfectly and there was a good size piece of fish on each taco.  The red cabbage slaw that topped the fish was flavorful without overpowering the fish. I would definitely order the fish tacos again.
author: D B.

description: Best tacos that have ever touched my lips.  Great ambiance.  Fantastic tequila selection.
author: Pete D.

description: Great tacos. Great atmosphere. Service was good on a busy night. We ordered the guacamole dip, which was good. It was more creamy than chunky. I ordered three tacos: "baja-style" pacific cod, chicken en mole colorado, and house-made chorizo and potatoes. All were very good with unique seasonings. The tacos were accompanied by a selection of three salsas. For me, this is as good as it gets for an upscale taco joint.
author: Roy C.

description: Fun night! Wanted to have a date night but heard this location was super loud. Went anyway and was seated outside under a heat lamp, away from the noise inside but still a part of the fun atmosphere. Both the margarita fresca (has strawberries) and margarita bruma (has ginger) were awesome, and the fried pacific cod taco was my favorite of those we got!
author: Kimberly S.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here for dinner on Friday night. We Were greeted by a friendly hostess and we agreed to sit on the "heated" patio. Only half the tables on the patio actually get heat from the heaters which are attached to the wall. We moved ourselves to a table closer to the heater.
We ordered a delicious empanada appetizer made with butternut squash and lots of cheese. After taking our appetizer order our waitress disappeared. Eventually another waitress noticed us waiting and asked if we wanted to order more food.
We ordered two chicken tacos, one fish taco, and one carnitas taco, as well as a margarita. 
The tacos and margarita were delivered quickly. The carnitas taco was absolutely delicious and kind of sweet. The chicken taco was alright but a little spicy. My boyfriend said the fish tasted very fresh.
The margarita was alright, but kind of small and not as sweet as I like my margaritas. 
I found the prices to be rather expensive for the small amount of food we got. the empanadas were $10 for two small empanadas. The margarita was $11. The tacos were 4 for $16, but it was really just some meat on a tortilla with chopped onion and cilantro. 
Overall I think you end up paying for the atmosphere, not the food. Service was mediocre at best.
author: Aniek V.

description:
Went on a Mondy at 3pm and place was packed
Awesome staff including manager  Jordana 
From the staff who run the food to you to everyone involved
it was a great experience

Love a lunch special though  :-)
author: kavin m.

description: I wish I could tell you how the food tasted.  I checked in at 6:55 pm on a Thursday and was told it would be 30 min, maybe 40.  At 8:20 pm my party was seated but that's when I left.  Plenty of taquerias in the neighborhood serving tasty $8 burritos - no need to give them $30+ for a meal I had to wait that long for.  Save yourself the effort and just go next door to Mosto for drinks and nibbles.
author: Lisa B.

description: Best tacos EVER!  Fairly priced, extremely tasty and worth the wait!  Hard to choose but I'd have to say my favorite is the Rock Cod taco :)  Love the Jamaica tea as well!
author: Alicia F.

description: I was underwhelmed by the tacos here, mostly because this place is always packed so I was expecting something amazing.  The tacos came out "luke warm" and the flavors were nothing spectacular.   The sauces they give you with it was a nice little presentation but you really needed the sauce to give the tacos some flavor.   I had a drink which was nice but also nothing out of the ordinary.  The noise level here is nuts so bring some earplugs :)  I'm willing to give it another shot but not holding my hopes up.
author: Mitch A.

description:
I'm going to echo the sentiments of a few of the other reviewers on the actual food.  But first, the good news...

Service and ambience at this place are second to none.  Most of the time, when I go out in La Mission, servers and bartenders, and sometimes even the owners, act like I should be grateful they are letting me eat or drink in their establishment (similar to the Soup Nazi from Seinfeld).   

But at Tacolicious, I was treated like someone special from the moment I opened the door to the way out after our extended meal.  These people know how to treat customers in every way.  They act like they WANT you there and are excited that you picked their place.  It feels good.

The ambience and physical space are cozy and inviting; it makes you want to stay and order more and more drinks, even after you've finished your meal.

The food is okay.  Actually, I had the Marina Girl salad last night, and it was excellent.  The lettuce was crisp and it wasn't overloaded with unneeded ingredients -- just romaine lettuce (again, only the crispy parts, not the hard-to-get-your-mouth-around enormous leaves), pepitas, some kind of queso, jicama, and a bit of avocado.  And it wasn't overly dressed, just a touch of something nice, I don't even remember what.

On a different visit, I had the squash and the fish tacos, and while they were good, they seemed to lack some kind of flavor.  I couldn't put my finger on it.  I mean, food tastes good to us depending on what we're used to, and I am used to places like Pancho Villa, where I can really taste what I like to call "traditional Mexican Mission food."

Either way, I'll be back to this place.  It's a wonderful spot for lunch or a nice relaxed dinner.
author: Janie A.

description:
Congratulations on a job well done ! Fun new location with Tequila bar next to it.
We came after a dinner that left us slightly hungry and decided to check this new place out for  a drink and some guacamole .  It was pretty crowded but we found 2 seats at the bar. Our margaritas came fast with chips and salsa,great. After a while we wondered what happened to the guacamole . The bartender noticed and asked us. We said it never came and he inquired. They must have forgotten but after that it came fast.
It was delicious and it was very classy of him not to charge us either for it. I will be back, also like this locale better than Marina.
author: Maria C.

description:
First  of all to all the haters, I really liked this place.  This place is not a mexican taqueria but instead more of an upscale taco place.  I mean would a mexican restaurant serve short ribs?  My favorite dish by far was the the tuna costada.  In terms of tacos I actually liked  the pastor the best from the bar next door.  


My only problem with this  place is the lack of identity.  At tacko in cow hollow  you  know the deal, you order up front get a number and then get your  tacos.  This place, for a two person table was a 45 minute wait. There was also no place to wait so I asked to leave my number and the hostess said no.  She then suggested we sit at the bar.  What she did not tell us was that the bar was completely separate from the restaurant.  For example, Sangria was served in the restaurant but not bar and menu was completely different. As a result, my party and I were kind of forced to have drinks we were not into and get appetizers that were not our first choice.  By the time our hostess called us we were already full.  My other major complaint was that at the restaurant there were no real seats.  We had short bar stools and I had to hold my coat in my lap as I ate.  So I go back to my original  question what is the identity?  Good quality restaurant food however this place does not have its own bar, waiting area, hostess that calls you, coat check, or anything near comfortable seating. If they can fix this  I think this would be an amazing place.  As a result  I would have to give the edge to  Tacko in cow hollow.

Finally the chicken sirachi cole slaw taco was okay but not great.  The rest were great.

Food 4 Stars
Value 3 Stars
Atmosphere 2 Stars
Service 4 Stars
author: Christopher T.

description: Camarones al diablo for starters - yumm. We ordered pacific cod,shot and beer braised chicken,guajillo braised beef short rib tacos and taco of the week - amaaazzzingg. My personal fav - shot and beer braised chicken. Second time here and definitely not the last.
author: I Love Good Foo D.

description: Great tacos, but a little pricey. And the ceviche is nice and spicy! I've been lucky enough to not have to wait too long both times i've come here for dinner but most of the time when I walk by, the place is packed. Still, I love that there is a Tacolicious so close to my apartment!
author: Stephanie A.

description:
Best chips and salsa ever!! And margaritas to die for!! Great service, great atmosphere.  High high quality Mexican food!! Yum!!!

If I could give it 4 1/2 or 4 3/4 stars I would!!
author: Chali J.

description:
the margaritas were awesome
the atmosphere was pretty cool
the serveice was good

the tacos were alright. a little over rated. we tried a 9 item combo and they were all good but none of them blew me away. they were creative,but for the price i'd rather have authentic mexican food from a divey place or a taco truck.
author: Mellissa B.

description: Tacolicious has become a little bridge and tunnel. The margaritas are okay and for a place like that they should knock them out of the ballpark. The tacos are okay too. They just don't hit the spot with flavor. I give it high marks for being a great place to go with friends and hang out. The service can be spotty from time to time but I guess that is kind of what you get in San Francisco
author: Sigorney S.

description:
The best place for drinks, food, and to meet up with friends!!! Also great for date night.
Dale
author: Dale M.

description: I've tried some yummy, well prepared tacos: carnitas, short rib, beer chicken, rock cod, bistec, chorizo. The drinks are pretty tasty, and go down too easy (flor de jamaica!) Sometimes I notice a lack of love and attention from the kitchen and go home with greasy tummy. My Sister from the same Mister rented the back room for a very large party, and I thought the staff was very accommodating under the, uh, circumstances.
author: J. R.

description: Tried this place out this week because my friend and I walked by it once and saw it had a patio so we figured we should check it out!  We ended up not being able to sit on the patio because we didn't want to wait for tables to open, but it was a windy day so it was ok :) Overall this place was good.  It wasn't really anything special.  But it was good.  I wasn't a big fan of the veggie taco, and the rock cod taco was so thickly breaded that i couldn't really taste the fish, but the pork and the chorizo tacos were super good!  I definitely recommend those.  They also have a ton of tequila, so if that's your thing I think you would probably enjoy this place a lot more than I did, because they have a big assortment as well as tons of fancy drinks they make with different kinds.  My friend had the Passion, made with habanero tequila, and loved it!  It was very spicy, she says.  But yeah, overall this place is a-ok.  It didn't wow me, but if you're in the mood for street tacos and you're in the area, there you go!
author: Allison R.

description: Excellent and nice ambiance.  Tacos are great and salsa is fabulous.  Has variety of tequilas and staff are friendly.
author: Anthony N.

description: Great carnitas tacos and Margaritas Server was very accommodating when I couldn't handle the spicy margarita
author: elizabeth t.

description: Loved this spot! The carnitas tacos were straight street style (and I'm from la I've bad some great tacos in my day). The vegetarian taco was surprisingly delicious too! Such bomb food and they kept refilling your chips and salsa which is always a plus. Sangria was super sweet, but for 26$ the pitcher was chill for 4 people. I got the michelada beer drink and that was good, little salty for my taste though. Great for groups, and the service was legit for it being close to closing time. Definitely going back for the tacos!!
author: Julie H.

description: Oh, really. This must be the place. Better than the myth. I'm already experiencing withdrawal and I'm still at the table. If there was a vomitorium I'd still be eating. Superior carnitas, top-notch gaucamole. Service, perfect. Love the lighting and layout. I'll be back.
author: Vincent C.

description: This review is for the drinks only, as I didn't have the opportunity to try the food. I had a pineapple and coconut water cocktail which was absolutely to die for!
