Hands down, one of the better cocktails I've had in SF. Jeremy was our bartender and he did a fabulous job of making recommendations after I described what sort of drinks I liked. What really stood out about him was that he didn't have that "I'm too busy to be bothered" attitude of many bartenders at popular locations. If you get Jeremy as your bartender, you are in luck, and if you get the pineapple and coconut water cocktail, you are in for a treat!
author: Kristin H.

description:
I got the fried cod and shot-and-a-beer-braised-chicken tacos. Both were pretty good, the cod had a little too much batter on them but I didn't mind too much but the chicken was SO good, I'll probably get that next time I come back
The salsas served with the tacos were extremely good
Make sure to order the guacamole, it's really fresh and delicious!
author: Katherine M.

description: If u like tacos... You'll love this place. I go on Tuesday nights and enjoy my weekly fix. If you want to step outside the box..then come here! Yum!
author: Karen S.

description: Tacos and food are amazing!!!!!  Service was good when we had it. It was pretty busy so can't be too upset. Recommend the chorizo and potato taco or the bistec adobado tacos. The house margarita and the margarita picante are both really good too.
author: Chuck C.

description: Love tacolicious!! We stop at one of the restaurants any chance we get when visiting SF!  Passion drink or shooters are the best!! Everything on their menu is delicious! If the wait is long because its a small venue it's worth the wait!!! Sit at bar and have a passion drink or just eat at the bar like we do;))
author: Katrina C.

description:
Yummy yummy in my tummy!! Loved loved the...

Kale salad-my favorite
Marina girl salad-delicious dressing
Tilapia ceviche-outstanding 
Brussels sprouts-mixed feelings...really liked then the first time but second time fell short
Plantains-you can skip these
Tuna- my hubs liked these...I thought it was too salty
Guac- delicious
Tacos-of course a must esp the vegetarian and cod

Chips and Salsa- oohhweeee! Wowza salsa!!! 

Service- two thumbs up

This is our new favorites Mexican joint!
author: Candace D.

description: The calamari taco was delish! The short rib taco was even MORE delish! BUT  their free chips and salsa are enough to keep me coming back for more!
author: Beverly T.

description: How is hipster a category?  Anyway, don't let that designation fool/scare you, the food is pretty solid here.  It's packed like a truck full of Mexicans sneaking over the border (too much?  Had to throw it in there), but worth it.  The drinks are really good, and the tacos will fill you up...10 for $30 and we only plowed through 8 (The bartender then proceeded to mock our manliness, which always brings a smile to my face...something about staff not feeling obligated to act proper makes me feel like I'm hanging out with friends).  The flavors are dead on, sauces are great, and it's not over the top.  Call it a higher end taco joint and take it for what it is.
author: A A.

description: Great little hip place for a good meal at a good price. Get a bunch of different tacos for the table to share. Each one was delicious! Service was a little slow.
author: Maria C.

description:
Definitely a fun place to meet up and go out for some tasty, high quality bites!

I ate here last Sunday with two friends from school and really enjoyed the experience. The restaurant was trendy and lively, even for a Sunday night. My friend who had arrived there before me, put our name in and still had to wait for about 45 minutes to be seated, so I can imagine that on a regular weeknight it might take even longer to be seated.

My friend and I split the plate of 4 tacos which ended up being the perfect amount with chips (and a large, late lunch). All of the fillings were super tasty and fresh! I also enjoyed the fresh salsa and hot sauces. To drink I had a Paloma cocktail with grapefruit and elderflower which was also very lovely. Overall, this evening might have been a little bit spendy for my budget (the cocktail was $10 and 4 tacos was $13), but splitting it with my friend made it alright for a once and a while kind of thing.
author: Brittany T.

description: delicou stacos, little bit pricey though.  theyre small but theyre really packed with flavor
author: Ankur P.

description: I had a great birthday dinner here. The 4 taco plate is awesome. The classic carnitas tacos were bomb, but the best by far is the braised short rib. The dos XX's and Victoria beers compliment the tacos very well. And you can't leave without trying the chili con queso dip for the torilla chips; the cheese is where its at. The staff is helpful, and I recommend sitting at the bar because its so crowded.
author: Taylor G.

description: I found this place on accident - but then realized it had been on my list of places to try from stalking people on instagram.... So happy to finally give it a try. Came for lunch on a weekday, love the atmosphere. I can't get over the tile on the floors and the painting on the walls is so cool. Food was really great, my friend was vegan at the time and enjoyed her food as well!
author: Kindsey P.

description: I can truly say they have the best tacos I've ever had! Their cocktails are really great too! I loved the Pasion cocktail with habanero and as far as tacos, my favorites are the beef short rib and the chorizo! If you ever are craving tacos, hit this spot!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
In general, I am a BIG fan of Tacolicious. The food is delicious-- especially the carnitas tacos, the mussels, and the salads-- and the drinks are yummy. 

My husband, son (4.5 years old) and I eat lunch here most Saturdays, and as a parent, I also appreciate how family friendly they USUALLY are, without going into crazy-suburbia-kidville.

My son is well behaved, and I've noticed that all the other kids (there are usually 1-2 other tables with kids at lunch time are too, and none of the kids are being ipad/iphone babysat, either- just good kids eating normal, non-fried/kid-ized food. 

The kid menu (that ISN'T full of fried crap), doubles as a coloring book (for a taco truck! so cute). The kid's fare is quesadillas, chicken tacos, or fish tacos, all served with small sides of rice and refried beans, plus and agua fresco-- my son eats EVERYTHING, every time. And his food always comes first, almost immediately. And on Monday nights they donate a portion of the till to local mission schools. 

But, the last 2 times we've been there, the waitress has tried to put us in the back (with the LOUD music, and no nice mural to look at)-- even though there was room in the front. This Saturday She let us stay in the front, after we commented on the music-- she had given us some lame "I'm running low on two tops" excuse, even tho there were 3 open and no line. After a while we realized she was seating every single family with kids in the back (2 others came in)-- even though there was plenty of room up front. 

Our service was terrible, too-- usually it is great. I couldn't figure out if the reason out tacos didn't come until my son WAS DONE WITH HIS WHOLE LUNCH was because the waitresses were stretched running to the back room (usually no one is in there)..... or another reason.  Did no one offer me a drink refill because they were too busy (the restaurant was half full)? Try to clear my plate (I'll box that up for you!) when I hadn't  even eaten 1 taco just because they were that confused? Or are families no longer welcome here? No problem, it's off my list for a while. Families, be forewarned.

Still giving it a 2 'cause the food is a 4.5.
author: kate h.

description: Two of us ate there June 28. Both sick as a dog two days later. Food poisoning.
author: Marilyn N.

description:
This could have been a great review- 
the foreshadowing was already in place by the number of stars, so you know what's coming. 
Post -tattoo and zeitgeist three ladies saunter into a new place to check it out.  Ordering beer at the bar, we are laughing and enjoying the late night beer inspired witticisms when boom- a tumbler lands on our glasses, sending beer flying, glasses shattering to the floor.  This happens, ok so we got some beer on us, whatever.  That bartender was cute and apologetic.  I ask the other bartender to replace my friend's beer that was splattered into oblivion and he does immediately and asks if we need anything else.  I say a gin and ginger, what my friend was drinking.  The one who made the mistakes also treats us to some shots, which is appropriate.  
Until the bill comes.  I just handed them my card thinking i was paying for the tacos I ordered later, but nope, the beer and gin drink were there as well.  We had already paid for the beer they spilled all over us, and now we were paying for the replacement?  
So I should check bills before just paying for them, yep, got it. 
Still, we were super chill and nice about everything, and you can't even replace what you spilled.  Bad manners.
author: Candace B.

description:
I planned a birthday party for ten people at Tacolicious at 7:30 PM.  

Given that Tacolicious is popular and getting space for ten people is tricky, I called two days in advance asking them if it was likely to be possible to accommodate ten people.  

The receptionist said,

(a) there are reservations but that 
(b) they could accommodate our group if one member arrived "around 5 PM", we could put our names on a list and reduce the wait time to "around 15 minutes, up to 30."

So, I re-arranged by day to get there early, arriving at 5:07 PM, eager to put my name on the list.  We were then told,

(a') there are in fact reservations, and a large chuck of the restaurant had been reserved by investors
(b') they could not accommodate our group, and even if we wanted to split up, the wait would be more than an hour.

Very frustrating.  

The frustration was compounded by the fact that we did not get a substantive apology from the manager -- no "we will give you a reservation to the other location if you want", no "we will give you a reservation another night", no "we are so sorry.  Please have a drink on us."
author: William W.

description: I've been here twice now, both for large parties and the food has been good each time. We've tried their chicken enchiladas, rock cod, chicken and veggie taco's. All really good. Their guacamole is bland but their habanero salsa is real good. Not too hot for those scared to try. Chips sometimes can taste stale but the rest of the food is good that those can be easily skipped. The strawberry margarita seemed to be a favorite among all the guest. The regular margarita was super strong and the sangria was nice and sweet. I'd like to go back in a smaller group so I can try other items on their menu that are not fixed. Good for large groups and service was on key.
author: Kavita B.

description: Love their tacos, cheap and good.  Drinks aren't bad.  Good place to go with a group.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
If only they took reservations.... Long waits are worth it for the Chicken Mole Tacos. Best ever. Completely addicting. One of a kind. The only Tacolicious location with Chicken Mole every day. 

Delicious salsa trio and chips, also.

Try it!
author: Nicki S.

description: Good trendy Mexican food.  I like to get a platter of 10 tacos with some friends and enjoy the ambiance and people watching.  There is a guy with 2 mature iguanas who just hangs out in the entry way sometimes.  Tequila shots are huge, beware.
author: M S.

description: They have pozole, zopes con nopales, real tacos, and an amazing selection of drinks!!! Loved it.
author: Tina N.

description: A group of 6 of us had drinks and dinner here for the 1st time on Friday night.  Although they take no reservations, I was surprised we got a table as quickly as we did so kudos to the hostess.  We started off with a mixture of the house shots and after that stuck with pitchers of margaritas.  After a brief discussion with him, we decided to just let our server, Brad, determine our food orders for dinner and he did a fantastic job.  The guacamole, tacos and bean dishes were ended up getting were all awesome!  Near the end of our meal the chef came out to say hello to our party which was a nice touch.  We can't wait to go back and it was definitely a reasonable price at $40/person (including tip).
author: Luke L.

description: Great food - great drinks - excellent service.  Real Mexican food with a flare is how I would describe it.  Can't go wrong with any of the taco dishes - we pretty much had them all.  Fish is the best.  Chorizo and carnitas tied for 2nd.
author: Nick M.

description: I had big expectations for this place but it was pretty mediocre. Of the few that I tried, the short rib taco was the best. The sangria with salsa in it was just weird.
author: Steph B.

description: Almost $18.00 for 4 tacos plus taxes and tips. I feel some of the best tacos, not only from the price range but flavor perspective as well, are still served in the food trucks of the Bay Area.
author: Random E.

description: Came here last thursday for the SF Chef's event.  The tacolicious crew put on an amazing event!  The food, drinks, service was outstanding.   The meal we had was different than what's on the normal menu, however the quality and the execution is the same across the board.  Always a great place for a meal.
author: Dilly M.

description: Ok so maybe I just don't get it. I held off reviewing tacolicious until I had a few more than my first visit. So I will give them 2 stars for location, patio and being a fun place to grab a drink in the evening.  Moreover, if you are looking at this place purely from a restaurant standpoint, keep walking. Everything I have had in my 3 visits have all been either greasy, overpriced or just bland. Some all three. Again, maybe I just don't get it but I think this place always remains packed due to a good location. And how about a happy hour guys!!! I went there with the room mate for a couple beers, chips and salsa and an appetizer. $50 later I was not impressed. Moving on...
author: Mark N.

description: Great margaritas, decent tacos, mediocre clientele.  It can get ridiculously busy on weekends (~2-hour waits) so try going a bit later on a weekday.  Pretty good creativity when it comes to their tacos (the fish taco is awesome) and the 3 salsas they serve with any tacos are excellent.  Housemade guacamole is superb.
author: Steve K.

description: We had a private event here in their back room with about 30 people and they did an amazing job. The margaritas were delicious. The guacamole was made fresh and we had an assortment of appetizers and tacos. The service was great and I would highly recommend it for hosting events in the city. When we came out, the restaurant was still packed so I imagine the wait might be long for a regular table.
author: Sarah K.

description: Chorizo potatoes tacos droooool. Roasted beets and the guacamole are my go to. Only reason I don't give it 5 stars is the wait is usually forever, but worth it!
author: Julie S.

description: Great margaritas and tacos. Very good atmosphere as well. Definitely recommend the shot and a beer braised chicken. Pasion margarita: spicy, and a great way to get your night started.
author: Alec B.

description: I've lived in the Bay Area for only 5 months and I've eaten here twice.  The margaritas are great.  The tacos are amazing.  Excellent place to meet friends for lunch.
author: Jacob J.

description: The name does not lie--they have daaamn delicious tacos. And it makes me happy that they have a special menu for the little ones to enjoy while I sip on a nice 'n strong margarita with the Mission crowd . Hard to find a place that's not cheesy but still good times for children as well as adults. The kids & I give Tacolicious our seal of awesomeness.
author: nancy s.

description: You can't beat the price and the ambiance of Tacolicious.  I come here all the time with family, friends, clients.  The service is good, the atmosphere is relaxed, and their food is delicious.  I went today with a friend and the Grilled Squid Veracruz was outstanding.
author: Oliver B.

description: This place is delicious!!!  My favorite tacos.  They have a ten taco deal, so I chose almost every kind of taco and all were amazing.  The watermelon margarita was also very good!!!  I would definitely come back and look forward to it.
author: Stevy S.

description: Very difficult to get a seat in here. The food was pretty good and the service was too. Don't feel a strong need to go back though.
author: Lauren E.

description:
Don't get me wrong, the food is great here. But my boyfriend and I walked in on Monday night thinking it wouldn't be too hard to get a seat. We got to the restaurant at 8pm, were quoted an hour wait, and decided to go have a drink at the bar next door. 45 minutes later, we finished our first drink and went into Tacolicious to check on our table. 

The hostess preceded to seat 5 other parties ahead of us because they were larger. We waited another 50 minutes, and were finally sat almost two hours later. Under quoted by an hour? I could have another drink and maybe I wouldn't be so pissed off. 

Update: The server gave us two free shots for waiting so long. Now I'm happy.
author: Brenna M.

description: Loved everything about the place. Great for large groups for sure. Youmcan order a single tacos, mix and match and for large groups they are served on large platters family style. I tried about 5 different tacos and loved them all. I started with the special which was a tacos of your choice, a beer and shot of taquila (which was given SOMA friend...no shots for me). The staff was wonderful. They made sure the party was all seated and they were on top of the order and service for a group of 15 which collectively have the attention span of a four year old...me included. We all loved it.
author: Carl C.

description: Tasty margarita picantes - margaritas with red chile are so wonderful.  Along with the fancy pants tacos.  And more margaritas and then how did I get home?  Whatever, I had a great time.  I recommend you have a great time there as well.
author: Tia B.

description: Solid food. Service was friendly but slow. Consistently long waits for a table.
author: Jo W.

description: A friend and I went in tonight (Sunday) for the first time. I have to say everything was great. The food was amazing, I ordered the 4 tacos rock cod, shot and chicken thing, and beef short ribs. I almost couldn't finish my meal because of the size of the tacos. HUGE!  What I was most impressed with was our service the server knew her Tequila  very well. She knew everything from how it was made, where it was made, even at what elevation etc etc. The food came out quick and was hot and delicious. All over great night
author: Mike D.

description: We came here for a food tour, so we only had a tasting of the taco and tequila- but they were VERY good. the tacos were juicy and flavorful. the chips and salsa were addictive. great, modern vibe. Will definitely be back for dinner
author: Jocelyn L.

description: The food was good, service poor and I left my sunglasses there and they were not returned so their wait staff is dishonest.
author: Party P.

description: Overpriced Yuppie tacos. Save your money and go to a taco truck, or taqueria. These tacos are mediocre at best.
author: Jane S.

description: Now I get what the fuss is about! Gourmet tacos at a decent price with good service. Great beers too.
author: Nicole O.

description: Had take-out from Tacolicious this weekend.  The fish tacos were outstanding.  The service was fast and complete.
author: James W.

description: A very fun, new american-ish type of mexican food. Great for cocktails and late-er dinners with friends. Very close to cha-cha-cha, that serves a GREAT sangria... so if you want to go tapas hopping... I definitely recommend getting something small and strolling up and down this street. The open window/seating area is great when its semi-cold outside because its just warm enough. you HAVE to try the mango salsa... I could eat it FOREVER :) I gave it a minus one star because the food took forever... literally, FOREVER hehe. otherwise ... two thumbs up.
author: Mish L.

description: We come here every so often, it's a great spot for healthy, vegetarian-friendly tacos. Love the atmosphere.
author: Bruce H.

description: Tacolicious does have tasty food and drinks, but neither has blown me away. It definitely can be busy and take a while to get a table. Also, I always come out feeling like a rolly-polly version of myself (probably because of lack of self control around the endless tasty chips and salsa). So if you go, go light on the chips otherwise you may regret it!
author: Erin H.

description:
I love this place. Delicious. Good atmosphere. 

Only thing is it's hard to get a table on the weekend. I usually go for lunch to avoid the rush. Also like the tequila bar next door.
author: AM M.

description: YUMMY! Went there with a bunch of colleagues. We ordered a bunch of tacos and shared- and of course Margaritas! YUM! Nothing bad about the place. Fun, hip, clean, food delicious. The carnitas tacos were my favorite, or maybe the cod. I dunno! ALL yum! Margarita YUM! Chips YUM! Really. Price was great- 10 yummy, hearty tacos for 33 bucks! AWESOME. I will def. be back!
author: negar s.

description: Great staff, food and design. Love this place!
author: Christopher N.

description: Food seems to a be hit-and-miss. Service was not so great during my last visit.
author: Mel S.

description: Come here for tequila; the staff is knowledgeable on what they have and enjoy serving it. Also there selection of tequila may be considered small in comparison with other tequila bars; but that's OK because they got it figured it; the tequila they have is delicious and at an affordable price vs other places with $$$$$ tequila and overwhelming choices that tequila tasting no longer becomes fun. The tacos taste fresh but if you're Mexican or have any idea of what tacos taste like and you just happen to be craving genuine Mexican food then don't eat here. Other then that the place is great.
author: michael h.

description:
I really like the food here. As long as you don't mind the wait, the spot is awesome. The carnitas and chorizo tacos are delicious. I also got the cod tacos, and while good, they aren't as delicious as the pork counterparts.

While waiting, you should either check out the bar and order drinks, or head to another bar nearby.

We had 6 of us, and we split two pitchers of margaritas as well, which were good, though they assumed everyone wanted salt on their cups. I'm good with salt, but others prefer it without.
author: C S.

description: Saturday afternoon, sometime after 3pm...8/23/14...Our waitress took our order on the patio, and then NEVER returned. The tacos, queso, chips and dip, and margaritas were delicious, but she never returned to ask us about our meal, fill our water, ask us if we wanted another drink, or clear our plates. I've never had a bad experience here, but this was the WORST! She even charged us for a side of beans we never received. We had to flag down the busser for our tab, and then another waitress took our cards. I had to ask her to take off the beans. Just really lacking in any service, and I'm a bartender/waiter myself. My friend will never come  here again, but I'll give it another shot, just not with her! I can't believe I gave her a 20% tip. I just can't bring myself to stiff my server. I should have.
author: Daniel G W.

description: Love your Tacos! Hate the wait! I've tried to come in three times in the past few months and always the 2 hour plus wait! Great drinks! The sangria is divine :)
author: Adri H.

description:
great carnitas .... and best habanero salsa around !! 
but a little expensive
author: Micah W.

description:
"I don't even like Mexican food but I LOVE Tacolicious!"
-says sorority girls who don't know Mexican food. 

Nothing against the restaurant, just not good relative to what you can easily get close by for half the price. The best thing was the bussers who were great at continually bringing more water, chips, and salsa, which was much appreciated. 

Not sure if waitress herself was clueless, or accustomed to serving clueless customers, but she warned us for like 2 minutes about the "spiciness" of the squid (with barely any jalapenos and not spicy at all), and then after everyone but me had ordered, she recommended we change to family style since "2-3 tacos typically fill people up." Um, what? Half our group were guys who comfortably ate 5 tacos each. 

Atmosphere was pretty solid though, and while I felt like I was paying for it, the prices were still reasonable. Essentially it's a slightly hipper PF Chang's for tacos.
author: David H.

description:
I had the SAME experience as Scott G.: stupidity and poor customer service.  I walked in with a friend, there were two open tables.  Actually, it was four tables: they just pushed them together to make two four-tops. Refused to seat us at these, because she was holding them for a group of four -- not any particular group, it was just in case one happened to walk in.  Shortly, two other groups finished their meals and left, so now there are four four-seaters -- which if you pushed them 5 inches apart, gives you EIGHT two-seaters.  Still the Head Bimbo refused to seat us, because she was still holding these tables for the Magical Mythical Four-Tops.  Meanwhile, there are now three groups of two waiting and she turned away another three.  People with money in hand, offering them business but NO -- a group of four just MAY WALK IN ANY MINUTE, AND OMG THEN WHAT WOULD WE DO?  Did any finally show up? Perhaps, I'll never know: my buddy and I walked the eff out, stumbled on to Curry Up Now a block away and had a wonderful meal served by a happy, friendly, business owner.  

Get real, people: we're talking about *tacos.* Step outside of this joint and you'll see probably five authentic taquerias, where the tacos are prepared by actual Mexicans instead of white hipsters in skinny jeans.  Or you could spend your money at a place that actually wants your business and understands the concept of customer service. That's the beauty of the SF restaurant scene: plenty of choices, you don't need to put up with BS served up by places like Tacolicious.
author: Jeff N.

description: HOLY SHiT LOUD!  I can hang in loud places, but we were literally screaming at each other to hear each other.  My friend lost it and we ended up leaving after two dishes.
author: Melanie C.

description: IF YOU LIKE TACOS you need tacolicious in your life .... BUT we are current visitors here and we have received poor quality service numerous times
author: Covered In Cheese N.

description: I have to echo the comments about the chips and salsa . . . the salsa is so good that you almost don't want to order anything else.  We also got the queso, which also contributed to our inability to finish our meals.  Fish and short rib tacos, both great.  But the salsa was really what rocked my dinner experience!!
author: Leah G.

description: This place is awesome on so many levels. The food is great. The drinks are great. The tile floor imported from Mexico is great. The ambiance is great. The manager is awesome. Seriously, she's a super nice lady. They are doing just about everything right at Tacolicous which is why you'll probably have to wait a little bit for a table. It's worth it.
author: Kelly S.

description:
Me and my boyfriend eat out at least 3-4 times per week in the mission.  Last night is the last time we'll be eating at tacolicious, due to the rude staff, sub par food, and long wait.  With so many great places (and great MEXICAN) places to eat within 2 blocks, this place needs a serious overhaul.  

As a party of 3 we were told we had a 30 min wait.  Okay.  We went to the bar to have a drink.  The bartender was nice enough, but the drinks were bad (paloma and margarita).  For the next 1.5 hours, as we sip our weird drinks, we watch as table after table of parties of 2 are seated.  Really, how hard would it be to pull up another chair to a 2 top?  When my boyfriend complained after 3 times the amount of time that he had been told we would wait (hi, we're still here...), the hostess literally decompensated, yelled at him, and then threatened HIM with the manager!  Great, I'm sure that the manager is doing an excellent job here when that's your go-to as a threat.  Immediately we get seated, and the manager hounds us to the table (should we feel like guilty students?).

The manager is really the worst part here.  I'm sure your job is stressful and busy.  But your JOB is to at least listen to the complaints of your customers and try to be sympathetic and accommodating, if not to try to change things for future customers and the viability of the place that employs you.  Its clear that she and the hostess are BFFs, and everything we were saying was falling on deaf ears.  She had clearly already decided that we were entirely in the wrong.  She made an incredibly fake apology for the wait time while in the same breath basically refuting the apology by defending the hostess and the restaurant seating policy.  Then she got this threatening tone in her voice and said "you still sound unhappy".  At this point, we just wanted to eat, and leave.  Obviously the enjoyability of the night was a little bruised.  We didn't catch her name, but she had a piercing through her lower lip and tattoos down her right arm, with brown hair.  

The food was fine, but really, its not amazing, and if you have to fend off the snide service staff to get it, it quickly looses its appeal.  The poor waitress had clearly been told we were trouble makers and went to defense mode with waitressing 101 (hi my name is... and I'll be serving you tonight"  "please let me repeat your order to you").  She was actually fine, but its clear that there is a huge problem with over reacting, knee jerk judgements, and poor quality service leading up to telling the waitress to handle us with kid gloves, when all we asked is why we were still sitting around 3x past when we were supposed to be seated.  

Any comp? No.  Real apology? No.  Do I think anything made it through, or will be changed for other customers?  No.  Just a snide sideways look as we were exiting the restaurant from the manager.
author: Mara M.

description: They seated me within 10 minutes on a Sat. night about 6:00pm . It was already in full swing & I was excited about trying their food. They have indoor & outdoor patio seating. If your a party is more than 4 it seems like you might want to make a reservation. I also noticed that they have a room in the rear of the restaurant that is nice & could be reserved for a private party or intimate setting. This place is rocking & rolling. I watched the crew as i ate my insanely scrumptious short rib tacos. They seem to do a lot of togo orders. The counter tops were lined with brown paper bags with handles waiting to be claimed by Tacolicious fans . The area where the line cooks are is very organized. When the food comes to the counter it is immediately dressed by someone & served. Even if there is something on your plate that you don't want ( for me , dairy ) they don't make a fuss . They just fix it. The chips that you receive on the table with a bowl of salsa are really good. But , VERY SALTY ! Everyone seemed happy and the place is ran like a well oiled machine. There are handsome men in jeans and colorful shirts floating amongst the sea of black shirted staff & Tacolicious fans overseeing everything that transpires. I felt as if in a dream as i devoured those tacos & sipped on a Mia . I didn't even care as the sauce dripped down my chin. The food bill was $18.00 , but with city mandate charge for staff medical & taxes & tip it was $22.36 . See you there next time !
author: Angela G.

description: I wanted to hate this place. I really did. I'm a fan of taquerias and taco trucks. The whole idea of upselling tacos struck me as trendy hipster nonsense. However.... Their queso and chips rocked. The tacos were huge and tasty. The drinks were good and the service was great. Will I return? Probably not.... I still prefer to find a nice $1.25 taco. But was it good? Yes it was.
author: Da Wei S.

description: Addictive steak taco that makes partial vegan like me forget about veganism for one night. Delicious tequila mixed drinks with awesome dipping sauces for your chips. Hands down the best pretentious taco in the city.
author: Fred F.

description:
A fun place with a hit and miss selection of tacos. The taco of the week was my favorite, but it was last week's so why bother telling you about it? It's gone. 

Chorizo burnt, chicken mole good, shot and a beer braised chicken good, conchita pibil good, rock cod greasy and not-so-good, carnitas ok, bistec abodado and short rib made my significant person very happy but not so much me. Which earned me points for letting her finish them both. 

We sat in the alley. There is a mural of the city with little sentences on it. I take exception to one bit of advice the mural had to offer: "Never tell someone you don't trust that you mistrust them." Who tells ANYONE "I mistrust you"?
author: Will R.

description:
Great atmosphere.  And the food is excellent.  My favs: fish tacos (though too expensive), kale salad (terrific dressing with cumin), grilled calamari salad (delish),
jamaica drink (perfect).  Chips and dip - the salsa is sooo addictive and so good.

It's a little on the expensive side. My only other complaint - the waiters, not too friendly, kind of have an attitude.  I speak as someone who's not under 45.  I work in the food and hospitality industry for many years.  Customer service is important. 

Will I be back, yeah, I live in the neighborhood and been there a couple of times. The food is so tasty. Very creative flavorings.
author: Eleanor L.

description: Wow what a fizzle.   I really wanted to like this place because I like the taco idea conceptually.  Also like their attention to sustainability.  Tried the tacos including short rib (dripping in oil), rock cod (dry and heavy batter), and chicken mole (egad).  So disappointing.   The chips and salsa were excellent, but it didn't make up for the mediocre service and the lackluster tacos.
author: Julie T.

description: Super rad, I am a fan.  Personally I prefer this one to the one in the Marina.  Ambiance and people are way better and it is like 10 times bigger.  Love the bar, and i loveeeeeee the ceiling next door at Mosto, so cool:)  Food is great, I would go back in a heart beat.
author: Nicole F.

description: Loved the menu. The service, the people, and the price... not so much. I'm still giving this place a solid 4 because the food was that good.
author: Amber K.

description: Great tacos.  Nice stafff.  I recommend sticking with the carnitas and braised shortrib.  Both were fantastic.  The others were good, but not particularly memorable.
author: Jeffrey H.

description: This place is very fast paced and modern atmosphere.  The food is delicious and served quickly.  The waiters are very friendly and personable.
author: David F.

description: Carintas tacos were soooo bomb, service was so NOT the bomb...its the type of place u will have to ask several times for something as simple as ice, or your check...love the vibe and decor, very hipster
author: Robert Q.

description: Best bar staff ever!  Harrison and Jeff were very attentive and both did a good job of providing excellent service and friendly conversation.  If you are from San Diego, Harrison will pick up on your So Cal accent!   For drinks, I had the "pasion"  It was perfect; the right amount of spicy with habanero infused tequila and tart with passion fruit juice.  I've ordered spicy margaritas before at other venues as well as jalapeno infused drinks but usually they aren't spicy enough. This one was perfect.  and free chips and salsa!  For food, many recommend the guajillo short rib tacos and for good reason.  The meat was tender and flavorful and they don't skimp on the amount in the taco.  If you wanted to share with a friend, you could easily divide the taco in two since they give you two corn tortillas.  Having lived in Mexico, I would say that these tacos are fairly authentic.  They may be a little artisan, but the flavors are traditional Mexican.  The rice was delightful; with a little chutney on top to give it a kick.  It tasted more like Indian green chutney than salsa.  The refried beans were okay; they were served lukewarm and were a little too thick for me.  I personally like Rubio's style refried beans which are different.  The fish taco was tasty, with a nice cumin seasoned cabbage on top.  Again, service at the bar was great so if you can't get a table you might have a better experience sitting at the bar.
author: SanJoseSun D.

description: Yes, it's a bit expensive for a taco place. But their cocktails are great, the fish tacos are to die for and the salsa for the chips is just the best. Strongly recommended.
author: Francesca C.

description: walking to get a burrito last night I mentioned to my hubby that a new place was opening called tacolicious and BAM it was open - first night!! WooHOO! I gotta say that it was special, super yummy and all the liciousness that I wanted it to be. I could eat a giant vat of that queso alone. Tacos were delicious and a great value. Hubby loved the empanadas. Had the rice and the plaintains and left super stuffed. Oh and the margaritas aren't too shabby either. Wanted to go next door and try the tequila bar (can you say CARAFES of tequila!?!) but just couldn't cram in another drop or morsel. We will be back, oh yes. El Toro I love you but I am going to have to cheat on you with this great new neighborhood joint!
author: holly B.

description: I go to tacolicious for the same 3 things every time, so take my review with a grain of salt. Despite the fact that this place is always busy, and I always have to sit at the, bar it is one of my favorites in the mission. I almost always order the same thing, the grilled squid is one of my favorite things to eat ever, and the cod tacos make my mouth happy, wash it down with a tecate and I am one happy girl.
author: Angela O.

description: Great food as always and super speedy service. Make sure to try some new types of margaritas that you wouldn't otherwise order. They're all delicious!
author: Zach K.

description: Service was good but when you go a Mexican Restaurant you expect flavor, spice & amazing salsa we were very disappointed! Everything was bland & of need of a punch of something! Yellow habanero sauce needed the most help!So if you want flavorless bland food this is your place!
author: Nancy C.

description: If I could give this place no stars I would. I went to this place after a Giants game. We happened to sit at a table right next to the owner who was having dinner with two friends. I was shocked with how big of a prick this guy was. He told a story to one of his buddies, I'm assuming catching up on old times, and must have said he N word 5 or 6 times. And no, not ending in igga either. This guy is a racist piece of trash and I'll never go back to this dumb again.
author: M P.

description: Over priced Mexican food....while in the mission you have so many more option's. Here you have to spend more to get less and that is not really my ideal place. my suggestion before you come here is to eat first and just have some drinks. I had the tacos and they were yummy but I won't spend more than a dollar (i had a special so I spent a dollar on each taco) but if they were full priced I wouldn't buy them.
author: E S.

description: Tacos were okay. There are much better, much more authentic street tacos within a block. 3 stars because the staff was friendly and the place was clean/comfortable.
author: Frankie S.

description: Phenomenal.  Visited twice in less than a week. Can't WAIT to go back.  Worth trying to find a parking spot for.  Both locations are fun, but this one was bigger and better and has a cool Paul Madonna mural and watercolors. Impress your friends...this is a very cool spot that is off the radar.
author: Amy m.

description: Okay, so I've eaten a lot of tacos in my time.  I'd like to say that I was let down by an overpriced, hipster spot like Tacolicious, but the truth is, those were the most delicious tacos I've had in San Francisco... possibly in my eight years in California.  In fact everything from the decor, to the friendly servers, to my perfectly balanced margarita, was excellent.  But the tacos and delicious trio of salsas were what made me swoon - I had 4 of them (yes, 4) - the short rib, the cochinita pibil, the chicken mole colorado, and the veggie taco (with butternut squash and many other yummy things I can't remember).  Oh dear lord!  Epic deliciousness.  Trust me, you want to try these tacos.
author: Kate S.

description: Love this place. Good chips, great salsa, terrific tacos. The beer-braised chicken tacos are out-of-this-world good. The guacamole here is really, really good, too. This is kind of boring, since I don't have anything bad to say, but there it is.
author: Jenn S.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in SF hands down, and now with the location in the Mission, it's double the fun! The Carnitas tacos are fantastic! Margaritas (by the pitcher) hit the spot every time. Love the atmosphere and always have a great time at Tacolicious.  Definitely a five star!
author: Katie M.

description: Tried to go with a buddy for lunch...several open tables up front but the hostess was saving for a lager party. Then, even more tables opened up...several pairs of people could have been seated, but instead left. Including us. What a greedy foolish policy. We went to an Indian street food place a block away. Had a very good meal. Tacolicious isn't so special that's it's worth being made to wait.
author: Scott G.

description: The food gets 5 stars but they lost 2 stars by me because I had to shout to the waiter and my date to be heard.  What is this trend to make restaurants into "scenes" playing music so loud you would think you were in a club?  I cannot go back just for that reason alone.
author: molly m.

description: Love the kale salad... shocked me too... plus the taco's were yummy!! Love this place!!
author: Kim D.

description: So similar to Nopalito and yet so different and so much better. Similar cool, similar prices (although actually probably lower) but the food is delicious. In soccer terms Tacolicious - Nopalito : 4-1.
author: Fred A.

description: I was SO impressed with the carnitas taco here.  I also tried the fish taco -- delicious, although I think I will always prefer pork to fish.  And the price is right! $13 for 4 tacos -- I split them with my bestie and it was just the right amount for a small/medium sized meal.  Plus the salsa that comes with bottomless chips is AMAZING -- there is some mint in there.... YUMMY! i highly recommend tacolicious!!!
author: Toby B.

description:
In terms of meat, there's a lot of it here.  Especially from the Marina.  Or Pac Heights.  Or Hayes Valley.  I can't tell the difference, and every dish look pretty good, smells nice, sure...

Anyway, I'll come back, but would never suggest, because it doesn't really punch the flavors.  For example, the al pastor tacos really aren't that bad, they're just not real tacos (you need to have a lime slice nearby, a piece of pineapple, etc.).  Albondigas are okay, especially if you've never had them before.  The small plates...

There's nothing that isn't fair, good..  The servers are all very nice.  It's just that this is for the American palate, and the reason it does brisk business--is because it has a full bar, and a slick environment (really, there are only a handful of urbanite spots in SF where you can get a good shot of whiskey and a taco...)

So, go check it out.  It's a serious destination spot for folks, and the bar can make some people feel claustrophobic.  But the vibe is just fine, the food is, well, just what it is (and you Angelenos, Chicagoans and folks from D.F. will know what I mean the minute you see the menu, try the pozole...)
author: King E.

description: Great tacos and atmosphere, come hungry and ready to share!
author: Sean D.

description: Great tacos!  We had dinner catered by them last night and it was so good.  Everything was freshly made. Nothing tasted tired or stale.
author: Myoung K.

description: Not my favorite tacos or salsa in the Mission but it's a cool ambiance. Great place to meet with friends after work. I recommend going for the drinks. I liked the spicey margarita!
author: T S.

description: I love this place!  It was walking distance from my apartment ( loved living in Bernal Heights)  I love the vibe, drinks, and of course their savory and flavorful tacos!  I also love the fact that they have an open kitchen and you could see the chefs make the food that is going to be on your table.  Their tequila mix drinks are tasty and has definitely a kick of flavors to it.  While waiting for our food, I watched the kitchen team kick ass and execute orders that were coming in on a busy sunday afternoon.  I gotta to give it up to them and the servers.  They were fast and very consistent. I would definitely come back for more :)
author: Vanessa E.

description: Arrived for brunch at open this past Saturday and had an amazing time. Enjoyed the pozole and chorizo dishes!!  I would definitely go back!
author: Gabe B.

description: I am not sure how I feel about Tacolicious.  Why enter the land of delicious and cheap taquerias?  I definitely think that 'liciious has something different to offer, namely an array of small tacos filled with a variety of interesting meats and cilantro.  The mild, medium and hot salsas that accompany each order of tacos are nice additions.  Their main salsa that comes with the complimentary chips had some interesting flavor to it and while I can't identify it, I do appreciate it.  I am not sold on the additional dollar per taco that I think I am paying for because of the trendiness, but I suppose that's what to be expected on the Valencia corridor.
author: Jeremy G.

description: one of my favorite spots in the city - mezcal & guacamole, those are pretty much my only needs in life.
author: diana m.

description: Great tacos. Even better atmosphere. They have a ceiling that is made of mason jars. Excellent for stashing items for that future savager hunt.  Don't touch my five dollar bill above the left side of the back bar!
author: Adam S.

description: So delicious! Went out for a business lunch today and was delighted by Tacolicious! Great outdoor seating and excellent selection of food items that covered a wide array of dietary restrictions. Even indulged in dessert - SUPERB!
author: suzi m.

description: I love the tacos, salsa and iron skillet mussels and I appreciate the complimentary chips and salsa that are constantly replenished.  Glad to hear they're opening a North Beach location.
author: Mizzy J.

description: This place was pretty tasty but the service was not great. We waited 20 minutes before even getting a menu. It's also a little fancy and overpriced, but hey, it's Valencia. That aside, the sangrias were worth it. Also the grilled fish tacos were delicious, and we will definitely be going back (maybe at a less busy time).
author: Kelley B.

description:
heard a lot of really great things about this place and wanted to see the paul madonna artwork on the patio, so made dinner plans to check it all out. there was an hour wait, so we grabbed a drink next door and ended up only waiting for about 20 mins so that was awesome...soooo hungry!! lol!! we had albondigas, tuna tostadas, carnitas taco and short rib taco:
albondigas: good portions, good flavor
tuna tostadas: pretty good, but not as mind blowing as i'd been hearing
carnitas taco: dry
short rib taco: bland
new restaurant, new staff, new kinks........understood;0)
not a bad experience, but not chompin at the bit to head back any time soon;0)
author: Veronika O.

description: really good tacos and soup here. the sauces r spicy. love the salsa.  good service. fast and friendly.  haven't tried all the shots/cocktails, but just lunch.  probably better for groups since u can share most of the food.   the beet salad is really good too.  definitely worth a visit on the 'valencia strip'.
author: Roy N.

description: This place is awesome! Great food, maragaritas and the bartender was friendly even though it was crazy busy.
author: Steve P.

description: Tacolicious catered our wedding and were absolutely amazing to work with. The food was spectacular and a huge hit. Kory and his crew could not have been any more helpful or great to work with. Highest recommendation!
author: Tim H.

description: The beef short rib taco was one of the best tacos I have ever tasted! Awesome bar staff and killer margaritas poured a little heavy-handed :) Free chips and salsa. Super fast service if you're looking for something quick.  Only downside is people come and sit a while so it can be hard to snag a table. I didn't want to wait and grabbed a seat at the bar which turned out to be just as good a place for dinner
author: Catherine P.

description: You must go here! I tried it last week for lunch and I would definitely go back again. They were very generous with the portions of meat in the tacos and the flavors amazing. The drinks were very tasty too. Go and check it out! Platanos yummy.
author: A L.

description: Went here for brunch during their grand opening week. Place was spacious and inviting. My gf and I sat at the bar. The bartender recommended to my gf their chicken taco (which definitely amused her). She also had the carnitas and the other beer marinated taco. I, on, the other, had their tacos with butternut squash and other veggies, a side of platains, and a generous side of on-the-house chips and salsa. I paired that with the Pasion cocktail - clean, crisp, and spicy.
author: Claude C.

description: Saturday lunch outside was enjoyable.  Tacos taste good, but pretty oily.  Good value for what's offered.  Would eat here again.  Seems fun for dinner with tequila tasting.
author: T D.

description: I was full off the chip and dip appetizer before my tacos even came. I literally inhaled the nacho cheese bowl before you could even say "tacolicious". I guess that says a lot about the food.. or me.. or both? But I digress and the food was amazing visually and taste-wise. So go and pig out like I did, I'm sure I can't be the only person who does this.
author: Karen H.

description: Sat at the bar and had a great time learning about tequila and enjoying their butternut squash tacos. Great presentation of food, interior, and attitude.
author: Nic M.

description: DELISH! I came here with a friend who was visiting from New York. She liked it so much that she went back twice during her trip! They make incredible drinks of course, but the food is what we were hooked on. The kale salad was wonderful and the tacos are out of this world. You gotta try the carnitas taco. YUM. Our server, Brent, was fabulous. He told us when we were ordering too much and all of his recommendations were spot on. He was very professional and very kind - great combo. People here are nice - not the hipster attitude that Mission sometimes boasts. Just good food in a fun atmosphere. Yes, there will be a wait, but it so worth it.
author: H M.

description: Nice patio, great food, enjoyed the margarita.
author: Derek J.

description: Staff is friendly, menu is good, not too many options for vegetarians but the food is fresh and tasty.
author: Cody H.

description: I love the idea of a trendy, upscale, fresh, organic, delicious, etc taco place and this fits the bill! I accidentally discovered Tacolicious via yelp on a trip to SF and now we visit there every time we go back! I have had every taco on the menu and I have to say that their carnitas, fish and beer chicken are to die for! Go go go!
author: Rachael R.

description: We freakin' love this place! More so now that we don't have to trek to the Marina to get a taco fix. We really can't pick favorites here but we seem to order the fish, carnitas and short rib tacos often. Everything we've tried is fresh and flavorful.  There's a cute little outdoor space and service is great.
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description: I am so excited that Tacolicious opened up in the Mission! Now I don't have to go out to the scary straight-ville Marina anymore! This place is definitely a favorite!
author: Colleen J.

description: Great service.  This place was so busy but our waiters were wonderful.
author: Julia Q.

description: Although a fun, cute place to go out for drinks and dinner, the tacos were not impressive. My boyfriend and I came on Friday night and the wait was about 45 minutes. The chips taste really fresh and the salsa was deliciously tangy. We ordered five different kinds of tacos, not really certain of the names. They were all extremely meaty, as in the amount of meat per taco would've been plenty for another. I guess that's a part of the price justification. The only me memorable taco was the short rib. All the others tasted really dry. I would probably only be back to try other appetizers. Overall, nice little place.
author: Alison L.

description: A great Vibe, the tasty braised beef tacos, perfectly cooked mussels and the best smoked salsa any on eat the table can remember.
author: Cole R.

description: This place is delicious! There wasn't a long wait for the food at all, service was fast, and the veggie tacos that I got with a friend were so good and filling! It was a pretty decent price too to share with one other. I really enjoy the variety of sauce they have to put on your tacos. The chips and salsa were yummy as well! I'll definitely come back soon. The only con I'd say is that it is a tad bit too loud in the restaurant, and I felt like I had to yell at my friend to have a conversation. Overall, a nice place for some mexican food!
author: Danielle M.

description: Everyone has been talking about this place so I finally checked it out.  The ally is most comfortable seating.  Stools are inside.  The short rib taco was awesome.  The pork and fish were just blah.  No flavor or spice.  I was disappointed with all the rave.  The ahi tostadas were awesome too.  I would like to see more local microbrews on tap besides Sierra Nevada.  I will try you again for other menu selections.
author: Julia M.

description: Fish taco was good, salsas were delicious, refried beans/rice were fantastic, and the mucho gusto was out of this world.  This place can get pricey with drinks so lunch here is a mega splurge.  Atmosphere was nice with really appealing outdoor seating that I'll have to  to try out next time.  They take amex too!
author: K W.

description: I have been to both locations, but I prefer the Valencia space and the fact that every girl is not blonde and looks exactly the same!  The patio on a nice day is great for sunshine and people watching.  I like to try the different drinks they make depending on what is in season.  The El Camino Burrito is my favorite and I could sit there for days sipping on drinks and eating the chips and salsa...which can be a problem!
author: Maureen R.

description: Delicious! Very accommodating with the kids - and they loved the tacos and guac as much as we did. Fantastic margaritas for the grown ups. The plantains were delicious - well - all of it was delicious actually!
author: Jo S.

description: Great food. A modern take on the tacos concept. Drinks are great, too. Too bad that the place is so incredibly loud.
author: Ruben K.

description: order a MUCHO GUSTO and share a bunch of tacos with your peeps and finish it all off with the biggest shot of Herradura silver on earth and it's GOOD TIMES ALL AROUND. Hands down best taco? Short ribs...DO IT
author: Lauren V.

description: Excellent food, but a bit pricey for a Mission taco restaurant. Really enjoyed the steak tacos and the chicken enchiladas.
author: Captain B.

description: Delicious food and juices. Fresh ingredients. Yum! Two thumbs up!
author: Beatriz M.

description: If I could give this place no stars I would !!went out with the girls for a night out on the town the server was rude !! Food was ordered separately they put a party of 5 tacos mind you we ordered more than one each all on the same plate and food runner speed thru which was was which we all got confused no water refills no chip refills and there was a mix up with the pay I put it on my card the girls gave me cash we had drinks flowing and I thought the other girls lefts a tip I leave a two filler tip thinking it was cash on the table we went to the bath room and the chef bolted and attacked our group saying was there something wrong I said uh no didn't I pay she said yeah but you didn't tip well  It was a misunderstand and she felt the need to attack me for a tip mind you the girls and I were talking in the bathroom about coming back again despise the horrible service and was willing to give it another try so since she was so thirsty N but hurt I threw 10 at her and went on because it wasnt about the money it was a misunderstand and I give this place a F oh and btw your chicken is dry so you might want to make sure your servers are watching for refills you don't want it to get stuck on someone throat because of the dryness
author: Serina S.

description: I thought the food here was delicious, more along the lines of gourmet Mexican; not your typical house mexican food. We ordered the chicken enchiladas and four different tacos. The enchiladas were okay, but the tacos were amazing. The tacos were very flavorful, especially, the pork rib and traditional carnitas. The environment was fun and the drinks went along well with the meal.
author: Devika A.

description: Warm night so I dined outdoors in San Francisco...I think I was in Heaven. Delicious food, freshest quality ingredients, great service, and reasonable prices. I had the Marina Girl salad followed by five different types of tacos which I'm guessing most Marina girls won't put away. My only regret is that the chips are so good and perfectly salted which means my diet was shot that night. The good news was that isince it was shot already, I crossed the street for dessert at Craftsman and Wolves, which deserves 5 stars too.
author: Jeanne M.

description: It should be 5 star but because you cant do an advance reservation and slow service by the hostess/waitress it's a big MINUS 1 Star! I have been eating and drinking in tacolicious once a week. I LOVE THE FOOD and DRINKS here. They just need to change the seating system, reservation system and I suggest go to the bar instead of the table. The bartender is fast, charming and better than the wait-staff.
author: Aemar E.

description: Fantastic food, good service, good prices. Authentic with a slight twist that makes it all that much more interesting.
author: Jose Maria A.

description: Love it! Tuna tostada and cochinita pibil are my favorites.
author: Peter S.

description: This was the first of four great meals during our 24 hour stay in SF. Located in an Alley in the Mission, the space itself is really cool.  We ordered the pibil, carnitas, chicken, short rib, and steak tacos.  The chicken was a bit dry, but the rest were amazing.
author: Erica L.

description:
sometimes you want a fancy taco.

so there's tacolicious.

three of us came on a sunny sunday (is that redundant?) for lunch during sunday streets. was (of course) expecting a 30 minute wait but got a table outside right away.

had the fish taco and the veggie (mushroom, asparagus, etc.) taco. both were delicious with red salsa on top.

the sangria was sweet and t-lish (their word, not mine) as well. more fruit would have been nice.

follow this with a soft-serve cone from bi-rite and there you go, but that's another review.
author: Shawn C.

description: I love the tacos, especially the carnitas. Did you know they do to-go orders? It's the perfect way to avoid the lines and get some good food.
author: Martin E.

description: Went here for a post-boozy lunch booze session with Becky P and had some lip-smacking margaritas. It does look like it belongs in the Marina, but I guess that's what's happening to Valencia these days. Regardless, the space was bright and mellow, and the tacos were tempting. Had I not just inhaled a burger from Slow Club, I'd have partaken. Will be back to give 'em a whirl.
author: Christina S.

description: I mean who wouldn't love a place called "tacolious" I know I was def. intrigued by it so what did I do? Gave in and tried it!  Place is super cute and has a nice bar and menu is simple but what you get for the price is a steal!! The tacos were really yummy and they give you chips and salsa with a variety of yummy salsas!
author: Kell S.

description: Went here for a date night on Friday and had a fabulous time.  Had the chili con queso, tacos (carnitas, braised beef short ribs, and chicken mole), and a pitcher of some very strong margaritas.  So delish - heading back tonight.  Very reasonable for the quality of food.  Great neighborhood addition!
author: Jennifer N.

description: 4 stars just for albondigos , meatballs with tomato sauce , that sauce is a winner , amazinggggggggggggg...
author: NAEL K.

description:
Their menu refers to Healthy San Francisco as "SF Employer Mandate." I don't appreciate a political commentary on a menu.

Ha Ha, I doubt they will appreciate my political commentary in their yelp review.
author: V M.

description: I wasn't impressed by the tacos but the tuna tostata, chips, and their salsa were awesome. It's pretty loud and bustling inside, there is an outdoor patio with heaters. Our table was very small for all the food we got: 4-taco plate, tuna and plantains. I wouldn't come here for dinner but can see it as a great place to grab small bites with a group of friends before heading somewhere else.
author: Tatyana K.

description: I fuckin love this place. I've lived in the Mission for ten years, and this place is the best new addition I've seen in a while. Food is top notch, crowd is a nice mix of people who actually live in the hood (as opposed to bridge and tunnel posers), and the margaritas are the best anywhere.  The haters of gentrification may not be happy about Tacolicious, but I'm happy the junkies have one less doorway to defecate in and I have one more place to enjoy!
author: C. W.

description:
Last night, 1/27 I had the pleasure of sharing a meal with my good friend Curtis at Tacolicious. Neither of us had been before so we looked forward to this experience. When we arrived most of the tables were full but we were seated immediately, menus were already on the table and within a few minutes our charming server introduced herself and asked us for our drink order. I was expecting the typical Mexican beer list, margaritas/ wine etc but was surprised to see the extensive Margarita list with unique items on it like the "Pasion" Margarita which turned out to be our servers fave drink. If you want a taste, they have a series of 4 small drinks  called "Chupitos" which are samples of the Margaritas, we decided to order one and split it. The first drink got my attention, very smooth and warming, almost like when eat spicy chili but more soothing, a very different margarita experience to say the least.

Our server also told us that it's all about the tacos so I decided to have the Butternut squash and the rock cod. All four of our tacos were beautiful works of culinary art. The tacos are a good size, they fit perfectly in the palm of your hand. I loved the multiple layers of flavor's that each bite brought. You can order just 1, or 4 or 10. 

We finished up by sharing the Churro's with chocolate which were authentic, for a few moments I was back in Spain !

Our bill for two came to $36 so for under $20 each with tax and tip, Tacolicious is a great start to a fun Friday night.

I would absolutely come here again and can't wait to bring my friends for a round of pasion margaritas and tacos!

Thank's Tacolicious for an awesome dining experience!
author: David P.

description: Love this place, the modern wood decor, the mission mural in the patio. The tacos are delicious, everything tastes so fresh, great servers! Highly recommend!
author: Fashionista M.

description: The food here is great. some interesting twists on traditional mexican food.  The fish tacos were really good, not overly breaded.  the short rib taco was a bit greasy but everything else was really good.
author: Joseph K.

description: Bomb food, good vibes. But they get super sour when you leave a tab! Came back to pay the next day and we were all good.... Great place to go any night of the week.
author: Great W.

description: I love the side garden action - it's rare to find outdoor dining in the Mission albeit a pretty small bit of outdoor dining. The tacos are a little pricy but tasty. They need a few more side options.
author: Mark C.

description: These have to be some of the best tacos I have tried thus far! I love tacos and have been to many taco places. These are full of flavor and the salsa trio is perfect. The Bistec tacos were absolutely delicious as well as the chorizo tacos!!! A must try for everyone!!!
author: Stefani C.

description: Solid, especially enjoyed the short rib taco. Drinks were good and the wait staff nice.
author: Eric F.

description: I love this restaurant!  It's one of my go-tos in the Mission.  The carnitas tacos, plantains, and chips w/ house salsa are all outstanding.
author: Carrie P.

description: love their margaritas! great place to get mexican food thats no crazy filling.
author: Linzy G.

description: A belated birthday dinner for me and this place was on hit! I love the fact that it's a taco place with a bar full of tequila! ha! We sat at the bar and the bartender was so knowledgeable that he helped me decide in what to order for my food and drink.  We ordered the grilled squid veracruz to start and 5 tacos.  The rock cod, carnitas and pollo were magnifique!  The tacos you'd think would be so small and skimpy but they weren't.  by the time i had my 3rd taco, i had to take the last one home.  To wash it all down, i had the la flor dolce....tequila and champagne with lemoncello y lime..hahahaha perfection! love this drink.  I would go here again and try the rest of the yummy offerings on the menu!
author: Ann P.

description: Get the tuna tostadas with crispy leeks.  And the chips and guacamole.  House salsa and margarita are also excellent.  There have been a few misses on larger plates, but the small bites and appetizers are consistently good.  It's a great place to sit at the bar and enjoy a football game on a Sunday afternoon.  They also have a cozy patio that allows dogs.
author: Stacey K.

description: I'm surprised at what a good spot this is! Guacamole is my favorite! Tacolicious is a good spot for a quick, easy meal, with a nice Latin flavor! I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Pat Y.

description: Always a long wait and quite loud BUT they have a great tequila menu and their margaritas are usually on point. The food good be great but it just never is, sometimes its dry and sometimes too salty. I mean if you're going to charge those prices for tacos it has to be bomb...especially in the mission and they're just ok. But ill be back for the drinks!
author: Gina D.

description:
I went to this place for lunch along with two coworkers. For some reason, the waiter wanted to seat the three of us at a tiny table which could barely fit two people. I had to insist on a bigger table, which the waiter finally agreed to reluctantly. We then ordered drinks and tacos. The drinks never arrived.

The food was ok. But then again, we had tacos. Expensive tacos.
author: Emanuele A.

description:
Excellent cocktails and tacos. I'm a huge fan. Only complaint is over the excessive noise.

Try the Pasion cocktail- habanero infused tequila with passion fruit juice and lime- YUM! Drinks are stiff, maybe that's why everyone is screaming??

The tacos are great, they're not cheap but are an excellent value in terms of quality and quantity. I've been surprised by how reasonable the dinner bill was each visit. 

The cochinita pibil and fried rock cod tacos are my favorites. I also recommend the chicken mole and the veggie tacos. Friends ordered the mussels and tuna tostadas, both were solid. 

Short one star due to excessive noise levels in both bar and restaurant. The tables are cramped and tiny yet it's impossible to hear the person sitting across from you. I'm not a fan of screaming through my dinner. Due to the small table size I think they need to be more attentive to bussing the tables especially clearing out empty glasses and refreshing water.

They have a huge back room and it should be better utilized to spread people out a little bit. The food is good enough that the buzz will spread even without a line of patrons outside the door. I recommend bundling up and asking to sit outside under the heat lamps if you want to have a conversation.
author: Bianca H.

description:
The food and cocktails here are very good, and just unique enough that you don't feel bad for paying twice what you would for a taco down the street. The space is quite large but has a nice warm atmosphere, which is great for those times when you want sit-down mexican food without the fluorescent lighting.

Good for lunch, or an early dinner. Until the fervor dies down a bit, I would stay away at peak times (8-10pm Fri/Sat), unless you like waiting for 1-1.5 hours.
author: Spikes T.

description: Can't recall a service staff so hateful and angry and eager to clock out. It was almost amusing, and sad, to be treated so terribly at last call. I feel bad for the kitchen staff that the black-clad servers are the dregs. We'll never return to this place. And I'll be telling this to every Missionite foodie I can. Tacovicious.
author: Stephen C.

description: Tacolicious is a very good mexican restaurant choice. Their chips and guac are very high quality. I think this location may be a little bit better than their location in North Beach
author: Scoot S.

description: I went by myself on my way to another event and sat at the bar. I had a cold draft beer and a delicious guajillo braised beef short rib taco that came with 3 different sauces. They served me a big basket of chips and salsa, too. All around me people were devouring the chips and being asked if they wanted more. The service was prompt and friendly.
author: Michele H.

description: I love tacolicous, I feel like theres so many people who hate on tacolicous for no reason. I go often and the hostesses are always cheerful and try their hardest to get me sat. The servers also are friendly and attentive every time ive been there. The only downfall is the wait but that comes with being a popular restaurant on valencia. Tacos are delicious and so is the queso! This is definitely my favorite of the 3 locations.
author: Chelsea R.

description: Delicious food, nice atmosphere, and friendly staff.  Francesca, our waitress was fantastic!
author: Morgan W.

description:
The space is beautiful and the drinks are delicious.  This is a great option if you're looking for late night tacos and tasty cocktails in the Mission.  I think that the service is going through a few kinks; we were brought the wrong food and drinks and our server was pretty spacey.  

The carnitas tacos were very good; you can skip on the queso though; it is just okay...
author: Cheryl E.

description: Didn't think La Mission needed another taco joint but it sure needed this place. Yes there are still plenty of cheap places around and you will pay a couple bucks more but the food and atmosphere is worth it. Plus with a full bar and incredible selection of Tequilas how can you go wrong.
author: Mattew W.

description: I really want to like this place bc the ambiance is so fun and fresh and just all around a place I wanna be.  But, the food here really needs some help.  I ordered the Marina Girl salad, and I don't think they put dressing on it at all.  The radishes were limp, and the chicken I paid extra for tasted like the canola oil it was cooked in.  Not to mention I got all thigh meat.  I'm paying $3.75 extra on top of a crappy $8.00 ( or so ) salad, at least give me half a seasoned chicken breast.  The service was efficient and kind, and she was busy at that.  Better food please, this is the second time I go, until it gets better Ill be hitting up your margarita list instead.
author: Sallie J.

description:
I got dinner and drinks with my friend at Tacolicious in the Mission last night.  We had such a great time!  It was super crowded with a very long wait, but they were able to seat us outside immediately thanks to the very nice hostess going into the back to find us some chairs.  Although it was a fairly freezing night, their heat lamps are strong and we were both wearing jackets so it was actually quite comfortable.

The food here was tasty and the drinks were also delicious, but the factor that really put our experience over the edge and into "amazing" territory would have to be our waitress, Jackie.  I have never had such an awesome waitress.  She made us laugh until we cried, she was quick and attentive, she gave us great recommendations for activities to try in San Francisco, and I felt like I left Tacolicious with a new friend.  She gave us plenty of personal attention and also talked to us about which drinks/tacos she thought were best on the menu.  I would advise the manager to set up a time where she can give tips to everyone else on staff on how to deliver grade-A+ customer service.  

My friend and I wil be returning to Tacolicious soon and will definitely wait any amount of time if it means we can get seated in Jackie's section once again.  I can't imagine enjoying our experience any more than we did last night, but if anyone has the ability to make that possibility a reality, Jackie is definitely the girl!
author: Jen B.

description: I don't know what happened but I thought I had reviewed this place already. Guess Yelp! gremlins must have messed with my check-in list..nonetheless, I'll quickly speak my piece: this place serves some of the best tacos EVER!! The location and actual restaurant is very cool. Just a hip joint. Server was super friendly too. We sampled all sorts of their tacos (since it was a number of months ago, I don't remember which ones) but I do remember raving about each one as we polished them off. Plus their margy's are pretty tasty too. My mexican rule of thumb: if the chips and dip that preceed a meal are good- then the food is more than likely going to be tasty!  I want to go back again! 'till next time- ENJOY!! (ps-I had also seen an interview with Lincecum and he had spoken highly about the one in the marina plus he had a Tacolicious hat on..this had something with me wanting to try this place. Pretty good endorsement.)
author: Steven D.

description: Another disgruntled SF native review: 1.5 hour wait time no problem, except the hostess was much more cherry and eager to greet the 3 frat boys that walked in before me ( they walked right past her and didn't even acknowledge her). My BFF and I basically sat ourselves outside as the hostess was too busy to walk us to our table, again no big deal I like a casual eatery. We waited about 10 minutes before we were greeted by our sever, we will call her B for so many reasons. B made sure the food runner brought water and chips & salsa at the same time so we couldn't be to bothered by her tardiness. I guess at that point "thank you for your patience" or "sorry for the delay" would have been nice but no "do you know what you want?" Was her first words out of her mouth. Ok fine...B is having a long day I guess. The chips were stale. Salsa ok. But whatever they're free right. Margie's ehhh Ceviche ehhh. Cheesy dip yum! I will miss that but I guess I can make the velveta micro version because that what it taste like. Street Taco's great, just like the taco truck but for double the price. I can deal, I am paying for the ambience and service. Back to that service: no "how is everything?" No "can I get you something else?" No suggestions No smile No service! This is my first bad review I have ever had to give. I love the gentrification hipster takeover of the mission but no wonder people still prefer Puerto Allegre it's been here and hasn't changed a bit. But this restaurant can go! How about a Burmese restaurant or a soul food place?? Shit give me another gastropub...
author: Tyler F.

description: I didn't love the food. I usually am fairly forgiving when it comes to restaurant food, but I left disappointed with my meal. The tacos were flavorless, while the brussels sprouts were drenched in lime juice. The drunken beans had an odd aftertaste, leaving me munching on the chips. As there are so many restaurants in this area, I would advise going somewhere else.
author: Diana F.

description: I'm addicted to their Ahi tuna tostadas, the marina girl salad is great too, and you can't beat their dollar+beer+shot combo for $10.
author: Kari G.

description:
Went to Tacolicious on Wednesday night. Very busy place.  My wife and I had a wonder meal. Margaritas were delicious, the tacos, guacamole and salads were the best every. The general manager, head chef and the owner all came to our table at different times to make sure thing were going well.  With these three people and the rest of the staff this place will be a BIG BIG success. 

Steve
author: Steve C.

description: I don't want to review this place because of what it represents in restaurants for the Googly, Dotcom Mission invasion. But the food is very good and the tacos are 'taco truck' size but packed with high end interestingly seasoned  fillings- so that 2 tacos do the trick at $8. But I often have 3 and a fancy tequila plus the thick, crispy not too salty or greasy free bowls of chips. and fresh salsa. The elote/corn is the best I have ever had. I don't know what they add to an ear of corn to make it taste so psychedelic. It kills me to admit all this when I believe in supporting original establishments like La Cumbre and Pancho Villa but once in a while.... I enjoy some delicious gourmet  gringo versions of mexican food.  BUT they don't need my praise and the only reason I am yelping this is because their staff are good considerate hard working people who have to deal with douchebags sometimes. So if you are not a douchebag I encourage you to pop in there (hopefully the wait is not too too long) and give their hosts and servers some love- especially JULIA, one of the managers, who will visit your table and make you feel great.
author: Marga G.

description: Always one of my favorite places in the city.  Def recommend the short rib and the chicken.
author: laurel f.

description: Terrible.  This place is pretentious and overpriced, and the quality of their food is extremely low compared to so many of the other mexican food joints in the immediate area.  Avoid it.
author: Tod G.

description: Sooooo good. Portions aren't too huge if you're not looking to gorge but can always get more. Margheritas are phenomenal with their vast selection of tequilas. Meat choices are exceptional, any one will please you. A little more expensive than your average Mexican place but not ridiculously so. Completely worth the price for the quality you get.
author: Kelsey C.
