description: this place is the hipster chevy's .... but they have an excellent selection of tequilla .. so 3 stars
author: Jerome, Jerome T.

description: Amazing tacos and pork with a great selection of tequila. Expect to wait, but the adjacent bar has great appetizers.
author: Justin S.

description: Generous portions, service not at all rushed, diverse menu and good and filling food.
author: Peg W.

description: T-licious! Very lively vibe - a fun place to end the week. Although the wait was incredibly long (to be expected on a Friday night) - service was great when we finally sat down. After perusing a very lengthy cocktail menu, our server recommended the Nopal (prickly pear, tequila & citrus, $30/pitcher - good for 4). An excellent choice. My bf and I ordered 10 tacos for $31 thinking the tacos were small. Much to our surprise (and our stomachs' dismay), the tacos were loaded with meat so it was way too much food - and we're big eaters! It didn't help that prior to receiving our tacos, we devoured large quantities of their fresh tortilla chips and salsa and shared an ahi tuna tostada and plaintains with friends. My fave tacos were the bistec adobado, chicken en mole colorado and rock cod. I would pass on the cochinitas and carnitas next time - a little on the dry side. The bill was hefty, but I'd come back again. YUM.
author: Lisa H.

description: First of all, I have to say I really like the Tacolicious in Marina but our experience in the Mission fell way short-- we will not be back.  We get to the restaurant and there was no one in front of us.  We ask to sit on the patio, the hostess says ' sure, hold on'  then after about five minutes comes and says 'follow me' and leads us to a table inside.  Ummm... to which I say, we want to sit outside.  She proceeds to tell me there is only one two top table outside and the other people (that came after us) have a dog and they must sit outside... Um okay, but didn't I get here first and I love dogs (I have one) but couldn't they wait for the next table.  I mean, isn't that the price you know you might have to pay when you bring your dog with you?  So, I say, we want to sit outside, I guess we will wait.  Long story short, she sat us outside at the next table and it was downhill from there.  They don't have the same drinks at the Mission (no Frozens) and the service was mediocre and the food wasn't on par with other places.  It doesn't help when you start off with a clueless hostess.
author: Jill b.

description: I love tacolicious in the Marina and was so excited to go to the one on Valencia. We were stuck in a tiny table for 3 people next to the kitchen so the atmosphere there kinda sucked having to choke on the chile smoke coming out of the kitchen. The place was dark at night dim lights then pow bright kitchen right next to us! no bueno. Also thank god I had my purse hook, where the heck do you put your purse and jackets? ended up sitting on the jacket. I think we just got the shitty table, the other seats looked pretty comfy. Moving on to the food, we got a pitcher of my favorite Nepal Margarita and also tried the Fresca Margarita, both yummy! The tuna tostada, tacos, guacamole, all good! Oh and I noticed the salsa and chips taste a lot better here than the one at Marina, weird. Food= 4 stars! Now Service..hmm...Our first waiter this guy was really attentive and we loved him. Then he left and a woman took over and she was very nice when she was around BUT service kind of sucked! I was trying to get her attention for an extra plate and I was waving like a freak but she was busy talking to her buddy and drinking her coffee she didn't see me for a good 4 minutes. Then when I finally got her eye contact, I would think she would come right away, uh nope! She continued talking to her friend and then came over. Then later in the night we ordered 2 more tacos, waited..waited..45minutes passed..then we asked did they mess up our order?? She said oops I forgot to put it in, sorry! What the heck? One of my friends waited so long she ended up canceling her taco order. Well besides that they do have an amazing private room in the back and I would go back and ask to be seated in a different section.
author: Karen T.

description: This place is the shit.  Seriously, why are you still reading this review, go eat at Tacolicious!
author: Fallon B.

description: Looks like it's cool to diss this place, but don't be a fool, the tuna tostado is perfect!! Probably best to go here early when it's not so busy. I also booked them for catering once and they were awesome. They did a taco bar- super friendly staff, very fun food.
author: teddy w.

description: These guys have balls.  They move into the Mission and open a taco place called tacoLICIOUS.  I mean, that's like trying to sell sand at the beach. Maybe not the wisest move, but it's gutsy. So, with that in mind,  I just had to check this place out for myself.  We ordered a number of tacos from the little box in the center of the menu.  Each were good, but nothing was orgasmically awesome or potentially "licious" as the name implies.  That said, the carnitas, nopales and the filet mignon tacos were good, not to mention they have a very nice selection of Tequilas and the owner is quite nice.  So, what to make out of this place.  I think Tacolicious created a new nitch: its the "first date taqueria" (assuming your looking for such things).  Yup, decent tacos in a safe, clean place where your date will not feel funny if they are dressed nicely.  However, if things go well with that date, you and your now new significant other will no doubt return to your other favorite local taqueria.
author: david c.

description: Awesome tequilla and tacos at reasonable prices (for SF).  Wait is crazy long on weekends.
author: C S.

description: i haven't had a chance to keep up with my foodie ways so did not know tacolicious had opened in the mission. we stumbled upon this by chance, when the lively bar (with the  meat grilling on a stick) caught our attention. a quick scan of the menu and we were seated inside, awaiting our passion fruit margaritas finished with pepper, refreshing avocado, radish and pumpkin seed salad, and assortment of tacos. the vibe is far from taquería and i can't say whether or not the tacos are authentic..but this place definitely makes a perfect friday!
author: Dee C.

description:
Terrible Service. Good food and very cheap.

They told us the wait was 45 mins. To be expected as they just opened up, don't take reservations and it was a Friday night. We left our phone number, waited at the bar and checked with the waitress after 20 mins to let her know where we were standing. We discovered after 50 mins they had thrown away the page where our names were listed. They finally found a table for us in 10 mins and made us believe they were doing us a favor in seating us asap because it was close enough to the window they had told us without apologizing for their oversight. A waitress came over. She said she wasn't our waitress but saw us waiting for a while so was going to help us out. She took our order, she was sweet but one of the dishes never arrived (it had been left at the counter and was cold. They reheated it and brought it out. We had asked for no sauce and it came doused with it). She was genuinely apologetic about it and it must be hard when a restaurant opens. The food was good and really affordable.
The place has great music albeit a bit loud. Young late teens/early twenties crowd.
author: Natalie m.

description: So good! Margaritas are my favorite here and short rib tacos are SO delicious
author: Ellen M.

description: mmmm.....mucho gusto....I think about that drink and their fish tacos....so good!
author: Casper D.

description: great value. its a bit hip, true also modern and pricy but the food is definitely worth it.  profesional service too. great tasty and strong margaritas. wonderful  snacks and tacos, interesting salsas, amazing ceviche. recommended. try it at least once when you are in the mission. 5 stars from me, absolutely no complains.
author: Jm J.

description: Love the tacos. Came in from Los Angeles and this was our first stop! Staff is friendly and tequila savvy, always a good time!
author: Angela A.

description: Having lived in the Mission for the past 12 years I was skeptical about a marina taco joint opening up a place here. But, i have to say they have a great concept, reasonably inexpensive food, good drinks and kid friendly (yes i got some). Also, it works for the neighborhood which has seen so many fancy and expensive restaurants open in the last couple of years that seem to cater mainly to people not from the neighborhood.
author: Peter M.

description: Had dinner here - awesome stuff. Great appetizers (the tuna tostadas especially) and the carnitas tacos were great. The spicy habanero margaritas were also good - the first one burns the living hell out of your throat, but once your oropharyngeal membranes necrose, then you can enjoy the 2nd 3rd and 4th ones afterwards in their full glory.
author: A I.

description: haven't been to the restaurant (now i know they have one will have to check it out) but the stand at the ferry building is SO GOOD and I have never been disappointed. the salsas are quite tasty and the carnitas taco is STUFFED with meat. Sure $3.50 a taco (3 for $9.00) may be a bit pricey but they some with yummy condiments. the flavor is worth it, and considering the price of some of the other stands (a lamb bueger for $11, really?) they're worth every penny.
author: r m.

description: The tacos are amazing. I first tried it at the Ferry Building and was blown away with how great they were. Unique, rich ingredients, definitely an indulgence, but loads of meat. Then we attended an engagement party at the Mission location and they were just as great as I remembered. My husband even liked the vegetarian tacos which i didn't dare try. The carnitas and short rib are my favorite, even though the latter gets pretty greasy. I didn't find the apps to be amazing, but the tacos are really what to go for. Good margs too.
author: Lauren M.

description: My friend and I had a delicious lunch here today.The food was fantastic.We had the tuna tostada.We had the carnitas taco and the chicken tacos.The chips and salsa were tasty.The churros with chocolate sauce was a perfect finish.The drinks were top rate.Our service was exceptional and we loved our server,Brett.He was extreamly helpful and completed our experience.Will definitely return!!
author: Dee O.

description: OK taco snobs, I know this isn't your typical Mission taqueria food - but damn is it good. A bit of a scene like the Marina hot spot, but seemingly more grown up. We arrived on a Monday night for a late dinner, and though the place looked packed, got a seat on the alleyway patio almost immediately. It has a great ambience, with heat lamps, big bulb lights, and is dog friendly. The food was delicious, even the complimentary chips and salsa. We had the chicken taco of the week, cod taco and a citrus pork taco. All were equally delicious but very hefty in size. 2 seem to be enough per person.
author: Katie R.

description: Great vibe, service and food.  Recommend the tuna tostado.
author: Jeffrey M.

description: My wife and I had our rehearsal dinner in the back space of Mosto. It was overall a spectacular little venue and it held 50 people without any problems. The food was great and never-ending, even with the smaller dinner package. The service was prompt. We especially liked the motif. In fact, many people commented about the art they had back there. The glass ceiling  let in a lot of great light and the room was still very comfortable. Most importantly, the restaurant itself is pretty rockin' place and we did not feel like it in any way affected our private party. We worked with Megan and she did a great job of holding our spot and not hassling us as we braved the wedding planning process. I would highly recommend private parties there in the future.
author: Uncle M.

description: This is by far the best taco spot in SF. Street style tacos that are fresh and SO tasty! My favorite is the carnitas. But you can't go wrong with chicken, short rib or whichever meat you chose! Chips and salsa are served with your meals. Expect to wait when you eat there and it is usually VERY loud - but the tacos are worth it! They also have delish margaritas, my favorite is the one made with coconut water and pineapple. Great spot for a date or girls night out!
author: Kelsey G.

description: Came here once on a Saturday afternoon during my first visit to San Francisco and it was packed! I knew there was going to be a wait but I got a little irritated that we saw people who got there after us get seated before we did. After confronting the waitress about it, we finally got a table in this kinda noisy restaurant. Being Mexican, I am a huge fan of authentic tacos. While these tacos were okay, I wouldn't call them authentic. I was hungry, so they did the job. My favorite part about this place was the drinks. Their margaritas were really good and I enjoyed them more than the food. After a few, they also helped mellow me out about the service and having to wait about an hour to be seated. All in all, it was a decent experience. I would go back for drinks and a couple tacos if I were in the area with some time to kill, but I think I'll stick to the taco trucks I already know to fulfill my AUTHENTIC taco cravings.
author: Omar L.

description:
ok ok so... my friend just had his car towed, his cousin just bombed his test and i was just fuckin bored so we were like yo lets just drink and forget about this bs day....then we decided to check this place out and the wait was more than an hour, then the waitress gave the table away to some other ppl evn tho it was us who got there earlier AND she mispronounced my name (it was shaokaan but she kept saying shoe-kang), then they took us to the private dining area after waiting for another 10mins then i looked at the menu and i was like...TIS SOME BULLSHIT! 10 tacos for $31?!? u kidding me? wuh they sprinkle diamonds on those tacos?!? so i was just skeptical the whole time then those tacos came....they were DELICIOUS, i mean that adabado meat was ON POINT! plus that green hot sauce...we asked for an extra BOWL of that hot sauce and she brought out a free appetizer cause she felt bad for making us wait, i killed my 24 oz PBR with those tacos
i wish they had more beer selection but overall great place to eat and hangout!

4 stars
author: Michael K.

description: Super fun restaurant & great for gluten free (not everything on the menu is ok, but our waiter pointed out the ones that were ok to eat). For the gluten-eaters, the battered rock cod tacos are fantastic.
author: R F.

description: Food quality is 4 stars.  Price for food/portion size is 3.5.  Margaritas (we went Tues, Dec 27th, 2011 not sure who the bartender was) were extremely weak.  Not too sweet, which I like, but I'm 120 and a lightweight and I had two margaritas in quick succession which were both heavy on the ice and *very* light on the tequila.  Would not order a margarita there again.  The vegetarian options were very yummy but a bit limited.  My friend had a chicken and a cod taco and said both were delicious.  The salsas were great (4 or 4.5 stars) but I left a bit disappointed.  Too expensive for the quality of the drinks/portions of food.
author: Bianca G.

description:
well... I almost gave it 3 stars... 
DO not try their Margarita with "tamarindo'... it tastes like medicine. Does not taste like tamarindo at all... and I'm Mexican...although the waiter said it was the "Mezcal" which I had never tried...so that could be it. Anyhow our group went for the "Tamarindo"  flavor and it was nothing like it... if it had tasted "good" then it would not matter but it was a bad taste. We asked the waiter to switch our drinks but he refused..so ..we just drank it (good thing we had had a regular margarita before!).
Otherwise, we had a great time, our food was great and so was the service... !... 
great ambiance, great place... careful with the drinks... they sure use some GOOD TEQUILA...because you'll think you're having a smooth soft drink and when you get home...oh..gosh... A REALLY GOOD TEQUILA... gets you without you even knowing!.. (in a good way!... doesn't make you sick... good expensive Tequila).  Nice people (its Mission afterall :-))... so I recommended it... 

Now that I remember the waiter was pretty sharp...came to our table making some friendly funny comments about us not finishing our pitcher!.. fast enough... jajaja.. it sure worked... nice job!... that friendliness sure made us buy dessert and more drinks!..
author: Geena T.

description:
one more nail in the coffin of La Mission viejo but I'm ok with it. i got over my change fear and have accepted that this is not the mission i grew up in anymore and its not exactly a horrible thing.
on to Tacolicious. this place is killer. i think one of the first places to try and bring taqueria style tacos upscale was Pedro's across from the ballpark. that is a sad sad mess. Tacolicious on the other hand hit the pinata out of the park. they have a fresh yet simple selection of tacos, some tasty entrees and an excellent little salsa trio to spice up your selection.
i have been waiting for Mezcal to take off big time and this place is doing its best to help that along. with one of the biggest selections i have ever seen (beating Nopalito out) people can get a great idea on why i feel this delectable liquor is right up there with some of the better Scotches. 
The service is incredible, the interior is beautiful and the location, well as stated this hood just keeps getting trendier and trendier so accept it and walk, bus, bike or cab cause parking is as bad as North Beach ever is. Oh and although not as cheap as your fav taco truck or a little old school taqueria its still pretty cheap. you pay a bit more for a bit more. a bit more culinary creativity, a bit more freshness, a bit more cleanliness and of course atmosphere.
author: Jorge E.

description: This place was good. Its not really Mexican food, its kind of trndy fusion or something. My husband and I tried this place on a Friday night. I liked it but it was nothing to rave over. I really liked the butter nut squash and nopal taco; I also really liked the spicy salsa; I really didnt like either the mild or medium salsa, I cant remember which, it had lots of cumin, which I wasnt fond of in this application. The salsa they bring to your table was fine but I think it had nopal or something it had some distinctly wierd flavor, it wad edible, just not my fav. In the chefs defense, my husband liked both of the salsas I have just complained about. :) i also got the cod taco, it was fine but it was battered and I found the batter a little greasy for my taste. The guacamole tasted basically like plain avocado; everything needed salt by my taste, but then I really luv my salt. The ambiance was a little loud and trendy for me; it was pretty loud and is attatched to the bar next door, mosto. I liked the food, it was good, but not good enough to elicit a five. I would get food here if I was in the area.
author: Guapa A.

description: This is a good restaurant.  I had the "taco of the week", which was a shrimp taco, and it was excellent.  Don't waste your time on the queso, but the margaritas were so amazing, they more than make up for it.  Overall, it's kind of a hip vibe, not at all going for "authentic Mexican food" but delicious and fun.  I'll definitely be going back.
author: Brittany S.

description: I was skeptical of a taco restaurant called "tacolilcious" and coming into the mission via the marina, but wow.  The tacos were outstanding and the salsas were among the best I've had recently.
author: J M.

description: Delicious Salsa and tacos.  I recommend the Beer chicken taco and the fish taco. House salsa with chips is awesome and the medium and hot chipotle salsa are great as well.
author: D n.

description: Taco-delicious!!! Finally we have found a place that reminds me of sitting by the lagoon at La Isla, Cancun. This place is the real deal. Had micheladas at the adjacent bar while we waited for a table, which were also the most authentic we've had in SF.  Thank you 741 for all that you are, don't change a thing.
author: T G.

description: the food is amazing, but the drinks are a bit pricey.  i'd give it 5 stars but i really hate waiting 2-3 hours to eat a taco in the mission.
author: Mike F.

description: Yummie little tasty tacos, beautiful decor, and if you want tequila... it's just next door!
author: P C.

description: Some of the best tequila drinks in the city. Started the night at Mosto while waiting for our table. The small bites are all tasty and reasonably priced. Bar tenders know their tequilas and do a great job of keeping everyone's glasses full. Every one who works here seems to be paying attention to the customers. The chef made the rounds, approaching every table to talk about their food. I was really impressed with the staff and the dining experience they're creating here. Exceeded my expectations! Will be back often!
author: lori f.

description: Late-night. We were heading to Grub across the street to get food (already closed). Limited menu late night but just what we needed - beers and some great cactus tacos (we liked them better than the pork). Yum.
author: Megan H.

description: Very disappointing. My friend ordered the Chilaquiles. It was supposed to be chicken with tortilla strips in a Colorado mole sauce. Imagine our surprise when it turned out to be scrambled eggs! There was no chicken we could find. When we asked if they'd made a mistake, we were told: "It was listed under the Brunch menu and all those items include eggs" (there was NO mention of eggs, we went back and checked!). We said: "But there was supposed to be chicken," our waitress said: "It doesn't normally come with chicken but I can bring you some." We sent it back and ordered something else. This took a LONG time and all the other guests' food went cold while we waited for the replacement. The other dishes we got were mediocre and the beans (in a stale beer sauce?) had an awful flavor. The service was friendly, and to their credit they did not charge us for the Chilaquiles disaster. This restaurant might fly in the Marina, but there is no reason to have bad Mexican food in the Mission. Skip this place and go to your favorite taqueria instead. The food will be WAY better, at 1/3 the cost.
author: Tom H.

description: decent. the bartender didn't know how to mix a tom collins. but they had some other foo-foo drinks that would probably appeal to a more neon-tolerant palette. in any case, solid tacos and clean, if expected, decor.
author: paul b.

description: the tacos and drinks were delish!! Good service, we like it and plan to come back! my friends and i thought it was everything and more.
author: Joanne A.

description: good tacos and guacamole. left something to be had though
author: Sachin T.

description: i really love this place!  there's always a crowd, but right from the moment you walk through the door, the service is terrific.  i've been there many times now and the hostess is always attentive, jacob at the bar is the best and the servers are on it!  the guacamole and veggie tacos are delicious as is the marina girl salad.  overall, a super fun place to hang while being catered to by an attentive staff!
author: Mindy R.

description: awesome!!! our waitress rocked. try the carne adobada taco.
author: Peter N.
